This has been a minor 'bug' in Yahoo Mail for some time now (at least 4 or 5 years). The alert will periodically detect a message that has already been opened, filed, or discarded. Not much that you can really do about it, but it's one of the main reasons why I stopped using mail alert programs like the old Yahoo Companion, which I believe has since been integrated into the Yahoo anti-spyware toolbar.If you have alot of messages on your inbox already that you've read, then you might have to scroll down and check every page because it might have been sent a long time ago and it just got to you.

In Outlook you can chhose to have a receipt sent back to you when your email is read but the reader can override this and not allow it to be sent. Another more complicated way is to use a "web bug". This is when you embed an image in the email. If you host the image on your web server you will see the request in your logs when the email is opened.use read receipts in outlook.You could also try http://www.didtheyreadit.com, however this is easy for someone to work around if they want to avoid you knowing they read the email.

I assume you're talking about the drop down menu that shows up when you type in the search field in Internet Explorer. To delete that information, open Internet Explorer, click on Tools then Internet Options, then on the Content tab, and on the Auto Complete button. There, you can clear forms, which would delete all of those items in the drop down. You can also unselect the check box next to forms and Internet Explorer will stop saving anything you type in a form.reformat your pcIf you click on 'tools - internet options - settings - view files' then highlight everything in this list and hit the 'delete' key (not the backspace key) then this should hopefully work.delete your temporary internet files/ cookies and history.. >click start, control panel, internet optionsclick on the search box until  the search items will appear.  then press the delete  key of your keyboard.

Well, from what I've been trying to determine, they seem to pick questions that are well worded (e.g. good punctuation, sentence structure, grammar) that are short and concise. The questions they pick also tend to be interesting for the most people; like they wouldn't pick "What is Hillary Duff's best song?". Their featured questions have covered a broad range of topics, so I think that if what you post fits the above criteria, you should be able to get a featured question in any category.I asked the same question before, and someone from the Yahoo Answers team told me that the staff just picks out questions they feel are interesting and will generate more than one answer.

A server (not necessarily a Web server) is acting as a gateway or proxy to fulfil the request by the client (e.g. your Web browser or our CheckUpDown robot) to access the requested URL. This server did not receive a timely response from an upstream server it accessed to deal with your HTTP request.. . This usually means that the upstream server is down (no response to the gateway/proxy), rather than that the upstream server and the gateway/proxy do not agree on the protocol for exchanging data.The above answer is absolutely correct. Try restarting your browswer or checking back later.

There must be a SBC Global DSL Tower within 5 miles of your house. So your neighbor could have and you might be a few feet further and not be eligible. That happened to me.Go to here:. . http://help.sbcglobal.net/article.php?item=287Go to: help.sbcglobal.net or if you need further assistance, contact SBC..1-877-722-3577.All the other people were wrong. If you have SBC Mail, that means yolu have SBC Yahoo DSL. And you don't get that from your neighbor unless he has it connected through a wireless router but that still wouldn't give you SBC Mail. To sign into the SBC Mail, make sure you are not signed into any yahoo accounts at the time. Then go to sbc.yahoo.com. And sign in. When it askes for your user ID, please add  @sbcglobal.net after your user name, and then type your password. You should see a link for mail or if not go to yahoo.com and click mail. It will be you SBC Mail.

Because Yahoo Mail's free service is just that - *free*. Since you are not paying to use their basic service, Yahoo in turn does not allocate any human resources toward customer service, unless in rare instances it's a problem that they feel needs to be addressed immediately.. . If you like to have the luxury of 24/7 technical support, you're going to have to pay for that and you could always consider upgrading to Mail Plus for a nominal annual fee.Because there is no money in it for the provider.It costs lots to hire people, buy phones, and build a 24-hour help hotline for your e-mail service. Yet, you don't earn money from your e-mail service in return. No one will be that stupid to waste your money on building a free e-mail service!Duh, though u do say it urself; it's nearly, but not impossible;>mojo

There is currently no known way to "cancel" your Yahoo 360° account.. . Because your email inbox sorts by the date stamp on the email and the person sending the email has an incorrect date on thier computer, so the date stamp on the email that goes out has an old date on it. When you get it, your inbox thinks it is old because of the old date.You can sort the incoming messages either on top of old messages or at the bottom in Options. paul, it's true that if you merge your Yahoo and SBC Yahoo account, there'll be no way to unmerge that except to disconnect the SBCYahoo account. As long as the SBCYahoo account is active, you will have access to your yahoo account. If your SBCYahoo account is disconnected, you can unmerge your yahoo account and if dont do this it'll automatically unmerge after 90 days.According to the previous response, there is no way to do this without disconnecting your SBCYahoo. I couldn't find any evidence to the contrary, so it looks like you may have to keep the ID after all.

Yahoo Messenger should have automatically created a shortcut on your desktop after it finished installing.. . Since it didn't do that, just right-click on the Yahoo Messenger program icon and select "Create Shortcut". Then, you can either drag the shortcut to your desktop or right-click again and select "Cut", to cut the shortcut that you just created. Then right-click anywhere on your desktop and select "Paste".When you installed Yahoo Messenger, doesn't it ask if you want an icon? The server may be overloaded and have a short wait time before it processes the emails. (It could also be a problem with the server receiving the email.) If this is consistent, use the Help button at the top of the page to contact the Y! Mail team and notify them of the problem.They are...theoretically. Sometimes, the server through which your transmitting your e-mail may have some lag time due to maintenance, etc. More often than not though, there should be an instaneous transmission of the message. The delay could be on your end or on the receiver's. If you're noticing a consistent delay with every e-mail you send, the problem may be related specifically to your computer (i.e. connection speed, etc.)

Autofill is a function of your Browser, not the site. (The 'Remember Me' checkbox is a cookie that holds your ID and pre-fills the Username field for you).. . In Firefox, you can turn on Autofill in the Privacy section of your Settings (Tools - Options) - it's known as Saved Forms.. . In Internet Explorer, it's in Tools - Internal Options, on the Content tab it's the AutoComplete option.If you mean login, I have seen that though the login screen has the option to save the id and the password for the computer, it does not actually remember them, and I am required to enter id and password everytime i want to log in.

ahoo! started out as "Jerry's Guide to the World Wide Web" but eventually received a new moniker with the help of a dictionary. "Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle" is a backronym for "yahoo", but Filo and Yang insist they selected the name because they liked the word's general definition, as in Gulliver's Travels by Jonathan Swift: "rude, unsophisticated, uncouth." Yahoo itself first resided on Yang's student workstation, "Akebono," while the software was lodged on Filo's computer, "Konishiki"—both named after legendary sumo wrestlers. The "yet another" phrasing goes back at least to the Unix utility yacc, whose name is an acronym for "yet another compiler compiler".Yahoo! I know the answer to this one! I am so excited! (what a bunch of yahoos use this site!)a cry or shout of joy, i think, read a book called loser, by jerry spinelli, really stupid, but it does give you something about yahoo!in the dictionary it means: A crude or brutish person.

If you have received an answer that meets your needs, _please_ choose one of those as a 'best answer' as soon as you can; otherwise, this question will go to an automatic vote. If you haven't received a good answer for your question, you may want to consider the following,. . 1) Remove this version of your question and re-post your question. Newer questions get more activity on Yahoo! Answers than old ones.. 2) If you do re-post your question, consider why it wasn't answered the first time. Could it be more specific? Could it be worded better? Were there grammatical or spelling errors? Was it in the best category? Can you provide more helpful details?. . If it doesn't seem likely that re-posting your question will help you, then here's a listing of my favorite 'answer sites'. Maybe one of them will help you.. . Answers.com http://www.answers.com/. Bartleby http://www.bartleby.com/. Yahoo Reference http://education.yahoo.com/reference/.... HowStuffWorks http://www.howstuffworks.com/. Wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/main_page.... . Since I really haven't answered your question, it is not necessary to give me any points. Regards.

If you dont mean the search history stored by toolbars like yahoo and google toolbars, then you need to clear the history stored by your vrowser. . . CLEARING YOUR BROWSER HISTORY. . To clear your history from Internet Explorer:. . 1. Go to the "Tools" menu.. 2. Select "Internet Options.". 3. Click the "General" tab.. 4. Click the "Clear History" button. To completely disable the history function, set "Days to keep pages in history" to zero.. . To clear your history from Mozilla Firefox:. . 1. Go to the "Tools" menu. . 2. Select "Options" > "Privacy" > "History." . 3. Click on "Clear." To completely disable the history function, set "Remember visited pages for the last X days" to zero ("0"). . 4. Click "OK" to exit.. . . . Also, if you wish not to get any auto-complete words when you start typing on the web pages for making a search, you can do this . Go to Tools>Internet Options > Content > Auto Complete.. . Click on "Forms" so that the tick goes away. Click ok.I am having the same problem I clear the history but when I go to a web site like google it still has all the things I have searched for there..I am sorry I don't knowOpen browser IE(select->Tools->Internet Options). ==>select General tab(Delete Cookies,Files,Clear. History). ==>Contents Tab(clear SSL state,clear auto complete. [forms & password]). ==>Programs tab (Reset Web settings) . . . In Yahoo Toolbar :. In the left side of your search toolbar (yahoo) you can find a pencil icon. Click on that pencil icon and select "Clear Recent Seraches".. . In Google Toolbar :. To clear your search history from the drop-down text box on the Google Toolbar:. 1. Click on the 'Google' logo to access the drop-down menu.. 2. Select the 'Clear Search History' option. This will clear all the previous searches from the drop-down box.. . If you mean in browsers like IE, Firebox :. . In Internet Explorer. . * Go to menu, tools =>Internet options => content.. Click AutoComplete in the bottom. In the resulting window click clear forms.. . * To permanently stop saving the search and form field entries goto Tools=>Internet Options=>Content=>AutoComplete uncheck all the boxes and click ok.. . In Firebox. . * Either press Ctrl+Shift+Del or Click Tools=>Clear Private Data.. . * To pemanently stop saving data that you entered in search and form fields :. you would think they would encourage the questions.... . . oh thanks ElizaThey are substracting two points when you ask a question, but if you pick a best answer or put it to a vote, you'll get your points back. This is to make sure that people don't ask questions just to get points.I think it's to discourage stupid, pointless questions.i dont know either..From POINTERS: . . "Asking questions is a point-neutral process: each question "costs" two points to ask, but you get those points right back when you choose the best answer (or put the answers up for a vote).  We imposed the "cost" when we noticed that some people were spewing out meaningless "questions" just for the sake of earning points, without any intention of picking the best answer."I think it's to keep people from asking so many questions without answering any. Most of the time you click on the search box and press the down arrow on your keyboard then press delete. If you're using Firefox you do this: Tools>Options>Privacy>Saved Forms>Clear Saved Form Data Now. If you're using Firefox 1.5 the short cut key: CTRL+SHIFT+DELETE can clear all of your private data.If you're using IE, then it's Tools -> Internet Options -> Click "content" tab -> Autocomplete -> Clear Forms -> Ok.

maybe they cantain spam.It could be identified as spam mail. There are many factors involved, and also depends on the spam filters and provider.. . In Yahoo, you can log in your Yahoo account, go to option, select Filter, and put in the details of your incoming mail and ask Yahoo to automatically send it to your Inbox.. . This way, your mail will go to Inbox, instead of been identified as spam.

You "pay" 2 points to ask, but get them back when you pick a Best Answer.. . This was done to try to cut down on spamming, attempts at trying to establish Free personals ads, and to cut down on the number of lame questions that have been on here.They now take two points for each question asked to slow down the flow of questions.  It started with giving points, but the quality of questions went down.  You can read it in the blog on the top right corner of this page.Everytime you ask a question it will cost you points.  Everytime you answer a question it will give you points.  Click on My Q&A, then your screen name, total points, or level at the top of that screen. According to the Yahoo Answers Team's blog, basically so that people don't just post useless questions just so they can pick a best answer and gain the points. This way you get the points back assuming you pick a best answer or put it to a vote but you don't get extra points for it. Makes sense to me and it seems it has somewhat cut down on frivolous questions. Or not :pI guess they wanted to penalize people for asking unnecessary questions.  There were many more inane questions early on, when they actually added points just for asking a question. This is to try to limit the number of frivolous questions that are posted. It is a way to try to put more quality control in the site. Britain refused to change their currency from pounds to euros because the mathematically-challenged common people of britain would have trouble adjusting to the new system of 100 cents in a euro as opposed to their look-mummy-i'm-SO-unique 11 pence crap. Basically the brits started out thinking they were oh-so-smart being different (currency and driving on the left side of the road being just 2 examples) and ended up not accepting the obvious fact that the world is laughing at themIt's called a Euro (not Euro pound) and it's the currency that is used for all of Europe except for Britain. They refused to convert to the Euro to give up a very stable form of currency for an unsure one. The British pound has been around for 100s of years and definitely retains its value. It is probably the most stable form of currency available because of its strong history. For example, today's rate of exchange between the US dollar and the pound was $1 US = .56 pounds. It usually hovers a little over 50 cents for each US dollar.The difference is that the British pound exists, while the Euro pond doesn't.

Uninstall it.  In the Control Panel, go to Add/Remove Programs, find Yahoo! Messenger at the bottom and click the button to uninstall.1.  Exit Yahoo! Messenger completely. If you don't, the uninstall will fail..    2. Click the "Start" button..    3. Select "Settings" and then "Control Panel.".    4. Double-click "Add/Remove Programs.".    5. Select "Yahoo! Messenger" and click the "Remove" button..    6. Click the "Next" button and then the "Finished" button.

It means that people are still testing it to make sure it works properly. All software must go trough beta testing, the longer the beta lasts, the better the software will be.Beta means it isn't product quality software yet. A company will put out an early release to get feedback from users before they make it generally available and support it."Beta" means that it's an experimental version, one used for testing, working out bugs, etc.It means they are still "testing" it... it's not the final product.

Or you can keep both of your E-Mails.. Hope That Helped You  :)Get in on the mad rush for new “dot” addresses. December 16, 2005 on 1:24 am | In Uncategorized . . Ever dreamed of the perfect Yahoo! Mail address? One that mirrors your personality? Your passion? Your hair color? Or maybe just the name your mother gave you at birth? . . Well, you’re in luck. We’ve just opened up new “dot” addresses to all Mail users. Now get an extra email address like stunt.racer@yahoo.com or poetry.stud@yahoo.com or whatever.youwant@yahoo.com. It’s absolutely free. Use it just as you would your primary address (which of course you can still use). To make things handy, even use one Inbox to send and receive messages to and from both addresses. If you have received an answer that meets your needs, _please_ choose one of those as a 'best answer' as soon as you can; otherwise, this question will go to an automatic vote. If you haven't received a good answer for your question, you may want to consider the following,. . 1) Remove this version of your question and re-post your question. Newer questions get more activity on Yahoo! Answers than old ones.. 2) If you do re-post your question, consider why it wasn't answered the first time. Could it be more specific? Could it be worded better? Were there grammatical or spelling errors? Was it in the best category? Can you provide more helpful details?. . If it doesn't seem likely that re-posting your question will help you, then here's a listing of my favorite 'answer sites'. Maybe one of them will help you.. . Answers.com http://www.answers.com/. We started the policy of having each question "cost" two points when we noticed that some people were trying to rack up points with meaningless "questions" that they had no intention of monitoring.  "Cost" is in quotes because, as soon as you choose a best answer or put the answers up for a vote, you get those two points back.there are new rules written in yahoo blog. part of them states that you lose 2 points just for asking a question.they just started this soon after i arrived. :(A new policy of Yahoo Answer

New system that Yahoo! Answers has implemented supposedly as a way to eliminate silly questions!! :-(http://blog.360.yahoo.com/y_answrs_team its the "in" thingThe rules of Yahoo Answers (Beta) have been changed. Silly questions or repeats of frequently asked questions are meant to be discouraged, and participation to regain those points is meant to be encouraged.. . You will get those two points back if you rate a best answer or put the question to a vote if you receive several answers. If nobody answers, the two points are gone for good.You will be charged 2 points EVERY time you ask a question now. It is not related to your level at all.. . You will be reimbursed the 2 points when you select a best answer or put the answers to a vote.. . Your points will remain the same, so YES you DO now lose points for asking a question, seeing as yesterday you GAINED 2 points for selecting a best answer or putting it to a vote.It's a new thing so that people won't ask "why is the sky blue" and "what is the meaning of life" over and over again - to try and get people to think before they ask, and to get them to chose an answer before the question expires.you get -2 when ask a question then you get it back when you choose a best answer. They do that so you will choose a best answer and not just delete it.Because there is a new Feature.. Go here to read more.... . http://blog.360.yahoo.com/blog-d8pH0dcoRKeB12yOcnUQp.9VCFos?p=369

Go to your my yahoo page it should say on top change colors. A little link beneath the search bar!. Check out belowAre you referring to Yahoo!360 page?. If so, then you can proceed as follows :-. . Go to 'My Page'. . Select 'Change theme' option you see on the top of your page. Select the theme with your desired colour.. . Click 'Save'. . You are done.. Mission accomplished!. -----------------------------------------. . Oops! I just realized that you were asking about your "MY YAHOO!" Page.. Here is the procedure -. 1. Go to "My Yahoo!". 2. Click "Change colors" on the top of your page. 3. Now, on the left margin, you see a list as under-. # Colours (20). # cute stuff (8). # Seasons (6). # Yahoo! (4). # Lights n shades (8). # Sky & space (4). # Patterns (13). # Sports (1). # Industrial (8). # Animals (20). # Flowers (3). # Featured. . Click # colors to change the color.. Or click any one option from the list to change the theme.. Now, when the list appears before you, click the button which says "USE THIS THEME" to apply that color.. Now, you are done!

I assume you mean "Spam" here.. . The reason they don't bother is that they're out to make money, and they don't care who they annoy. Most cancel links in spam are bogus, anyway. For all they know, you might one day respond to a message, and they're just playing the numbers game on this - the cost of sending to one extra user is practically zero.If you don't know the sender, it is recommended that you don't click on any link in the email, as it will just let the sender know that your account is active and that you read the email. Please just use the "Mark as Spam" button to delete it and to help Yahoo! filter these messages out of their system.

This is a common problem for people who use fake information when they first create their Yahoo account.  Unfortunately Yahoo requires your birthday to verify your identity before they reset your password.  You could contact Yahoo Account Verification to see if there is anything that they can do for you in this situation. They can be reached by calling 408-349-1572 option 2, option 2.I'm sorry because therea is no way to for you to get your password if you forgot your birthdate,your zip or postal code and country. For example, someone on here earlier asked why the Moon doesn't rotate; he mistakenly thought that the Moon didn't rotate because we always see the same side of it.  After reading through the answers, I was shocked to realize that 4 or 5 people actually responded that the Moon DOESN'T rotate, and even gave what appeared at cursory glance to be 'evidence'.  Of course these answers were wrong (the Moon does rotate), but the people giving them were convinced, through their own ignorance, that they were correct. If you haven't received a good answer for your question, you may want to consider the following,. . 1) Re-post your question.  Newer questions get more activity on Yahoo! Answers than old ones.. 2) If you do re-post your question, consider why it wasn't answered the first time.  Could it be more specific?  Could it be worded better? Were there grammatical or spelling errors? Was it in the best category?. . If it doesn't seem likely that re-posting your question will help you, then here's a listing of my favorite 'answer sites'. For a Yahoo! account, try going to the "My Account" section. When you're signed in, near the top of the page it says "Welcome [insert username here] Sign Out, My Account".Hello go to your my account page! sign in scroll down to change password good luckIf you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click on the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . Click on the "Change Password" link. . Enter your current password in the first box. . Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . Confirm your new password in the third box. . Click the "Save" button. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services.because is sacker

A mailbox quota is the amount of storage space your inbox can hold.  If you have too many emails stored or just sitting there, it takes up space, which will give you a message telling you that your mailbox quota is full.. Try yahoo mail.  It's almost impossible to fill that sucker up.At internet sites, there often is a limit to the number of emails one can receive before he has to move up in membership status.  He often is required to pay more, or emails past the limit, say 60, will be deleted.

One of the reasons they experience such a problem is they do not sign out after dealing with their personal pages in shared computers like in internet cafe or in some office where they are not the only one can access it. When you are composing an e-mail, there is a button that says "Attach files." If you click it, it will take you to a page where you can locate the file on your computer that you want to send. Once you select the files and click "Upload" you can go back to the page where you were composing the message, then just send it.Click upload

just relax, and tell the person that u have a problem about which you would like to talk about, and say whatever is in ur heart then.depends on what problem you're having.  you should directly to a specialist who's deals with the issues you are having.There's always people, both amateur and professional, who are willing to listen, if you look for them.  Depends on what sort of question it is, of course.  Joe the Bartender always has free advice, which is often worth no more than you pay for it.  Friends and relatives are frequently more willing to listen than you imagine, but there is the problem of telling them what the problem is, which can be a bad idea at times.  (Remember you cannot expect them to forget what you told them, and don't be too sure you can expect them to keep it to themselves.)  . . There are professionals of all sorts, but you need to exercise judgment in going to them.  If you belong to an organized religiion, you can probably find a sympathetic ear in that context, whether or not the one professionally trained for it.  (Maybe the Rabbi is not the one, but the lady who runs the local charity fund-raiser is a nice, sensible person.)  My own instinct is to avoid professionals whenever possible, since they have a point of view imposed by their training, and it may not serve your purposes at all.. . If you can sort out who to talk to, perhaps you can predict what they are going to say, and so you don't need to talk to them.  For years, kids ran around with WWJD on their wrists, meaning "What Would Jesus Do?"  The idea was to do the thought experiment, and figure it out from what you know of his teachings.  After my room-mate died, I developed the slogan WWSS: What Would Steven Say?  Works pretty well, but I have to filter it through the fact that he committed suicide, therefore can be described as a "quitter," and so not good "advice" for all questions.. . Good luck!Only go to a specialist if it a very serious problem. Many of them charge a high price and in reality do nothing that your best friend or your parents couldn't do for you. Then again it does depend on the type of problem. If you don't feel comfortable talking about it with someone you know maybe you could go to a church confesional. I don't know much about them but I would imagine that they would help out (hopefully not by telling you that God will fix all of you problems).be yourself be honest and open and go do it, it is better than holding it in and getting all stressed out, you will feel much better.

Right clickt he smiley icon in your system tray (at bottom right corner) and click <Sign In> OR <Show Yahoo! Messenger>...Did you install it properly?. How do I start using Yahoo! Messenger?. There are two steps you need to take to start using Yahoo! Messenger:. . 1. Download and install the software.. This process will take about 16 minutes if you are using a 56k modem, and 25 seconds if you have a high-speed connection. Go to the download page to begin the process. To continue, follow the instructions that appear on your screen. Once the installation is complete, Yahoo! Messenger will open automatically and you will see a window like the one to your right on your desktop.. . 2. Get a Yahoo! ID.. Every person needs a unique ID to identify themselves when using Yahoo! Messenger. After you have installed the program, you will see a Get a Yahoo! ID button where you can sign up for a Yahoo! ID if you do not already have one. If you have already created a Yahoo! ID for any Yahoo! services - Mail, My! Yahoo, Yahoo! Personals, etc. - you can use that for Yahoo! Messenger as well. A Yahoo! ID is the first part of a Yahoo! Mail address - e.g. dairyman88 in dairyman88@yahoo.com. . If you need to sign up for a Yahoo! ID, you will be taken to a web page that asks you to:. . Select an ID (e.g. dairyman88) . Choose a password . Enter a security question in case you forget your password . Enter your name, language, zip code and gender . After completing this process, your Yahoo! ID will be active.. . To sign in to Yahoo! Messenger, type your Yahoo! ID and password into the Yahoo! Messenger ID and password boxes, and then click the Sign In button
It might seem confusing because one thinks the word "break" refers to the mechanical brakes used to stop the vehicle.. . Actually, "break" is used to refer to the "Maximum" an engine can give. Kind of like a "breaking" point in the engine.I think that brake refers to the initial power required to move the vehicle from it state of  inertia . . . Brake Horsepower (bhp) - The measure of horsepower at maximum engine output, minus power lost from heat, friction, expansion of the engine, etc. . brake horsepower. n. (Abbr. bhp or b.hp.) . The actual or useful horsepower of an engine, usually determined from the force exerted on a friction brake or dynamometer connected to the drive shaft.

If you click on your name it goes to all of your information icluding your recent activity on the right hand side. Unfortunately, people enjoy asking and answering many questions most of the time rather than voting for them. This is one of the reason there are limits to the numbers of questions you can ask and answer each day--to encourage users to vote and rate questions as well. Maybe the vote limits could be increased to encourage people to spend more time doing that.. . You can do your part, though, making sure you take the time to vote on other people's questions. There are a ton of old questions in tie-breaker limbo that you can find by clicking on the date sort link at the top of the unresolved questions page.. . (I'm personally against the tie-breaker questions. There isn't any new question, and yet someone gets ten points for answering it. If a lot of people start doing this, it may start clogging up the site a bit.)It also helps if questions are put in their proper categories.  Some people like to focus on their "speciality" if you will.Put questions automatically to a vote if no Best Answer chosen after a week or so?. . Bugs me, too!

One of Yahoo! Answers' rules is that you lose 2 points everytime you ask a question. You can get these points back by choosing a best answer.It's to discourage junk questions while at the same time encouraging users to choose a best answer or put the answers up to a vote before the seven day limit (you get back your two points when you do this).To get points back, you can also answer a question(thanks 4 the points!).I think Yahoo! wants to encourage you to answer questions, and share your knowledge instead of just gaining knowledge, so they penalize you for asking questions and reward you for helping others.Because that's the way the Yahoo Answers people made the game.u pay for the questions with 2 pointsThat's just the way it is!yep he's right. ^that's how it works dude,. ask a question, -2 points. answer a question, +2 points. choose best answer 4 your question, +2. call for a vote for best answer to your question, +2 (+1 pt. 4 voting urself). get ur answer choosen as best answer, + 10 points. vote for an answer, +1 point. vote on weather you agree with the best answer or not, +1 point. trust me on this, how do you think i'm sooo close to level 3 & i've only been at this 4 about 2 weeks.. . by the way, thanx 4 at least 3 points bro!
hmmmm, since this is the YM section, I guess u want to know how to send one, on YM.. . It's part of the "CALL Computer" function.  When you CALL someone - if they haven't answered after about 6 rings (22 secs) then you should hear a lady's voice inviting you to "leave message after the beep".. . Just talk for up to 120 secs, then when done click SEND - wait maybe 10-20secs while it says "Sending...", then the job is complete.Voicemail is an amalgamation of voice and mail.  Most commonly linked to the 'answering machine', voicemail is a recording of a voice through highly technical 'sound waves'.  These 'sound waves' can travel at nearly the 'speed of sound'.  The speed of sound is roughly 1/2 the speed mach 2.

You can write your age in the "About" section.. . KaterinaSorry, you cannot edit your age on your Yahoo! profile. This is to keep minors from changing their age just to use Yahoo! services designed for those over 18.

It is the width.  Generally, the "average" width for a woman is B and for men "C" or "D."  Different shoe companies are slightly different, but widths, very generally look something like this:  AAA, AA, A, B, C, D, E, EE, EEE, EEE.  Of course, not every company makes all those widths!  A "C" in one company equals the "D" in another company.  It's best to become familiar with the terminology of the specific company.How wide the shoe/boot is for the feet.  eee is very wide.I may be wrong, but I believe the 'e' has to do with the width. The more e's, the wider the shoe.. . I think I think... I hope I don't look like an idiot on this one...

The only way I know to tell if they read your email on Yahoo is to install a program such as "Did They Read It".When you use DidTheyReadIt, e-mails that you send are automatically and invisibly tracked. The instant the recipient opens your message, DidTheyReadIt automatically notifies you.. . If you have received an answer that meets your needs, please choose one of those as a 'best answer.'  If you haven't received a good answer for your question, you may want to consider the following,. . 1) Re-post your question.  Newer questions get more activity on Yahoo! Answers than old ones.. 2) If you do re-post your question, consider why it wasn't answered the first time.  Could it be more specific?  Could it be worded better? Were there grammatical or spelling errors? Was it in the best category?. . If it doesn't seem likely that re-posting your question will help you, then here's a listing of my favorite 'answer sites'. You get your two points back when you either choose a best answer or put the question up to a vote.. . However, the two-point deduction still discourages people from asking questions that aren't necessary and hopefully also encourages them to use the search button to see if the question has been asked before.You aren't punished.  You get it back when you choose a best answer in a couple days.  That way, you will likely choose a best answer, rather than leave it up to someone who doesn't know / doesn't care.  Also, you will be encouraged to come back to the site and participate again.. . Hope to see you in a couple days!  Don't forget to come back and choose the best answer.  It'll get your two points back!!

Snoring is a bad problem and it can ruin your sinuses. So get a nasel spray for your nose from your doctor.You post this question over and over again, even worse, under the wrong category. Would you please find how this site works first before getting involved in it? It's annoying, you know.Are you overweight? Do you have sinus problems? . . "How Can I Prevent Snoring? . . Consider losing some weight: Most snorers tend to be overweight, and shedding excess fat has been shown to substantially decrease -- if not eliminate -- snoring.. Avoid midnight snacks and alcoholic beverages: Drinking alcohol or eating heavily before going to sleep causes muscles to slacken.. Avoid sleeping pills or other sedatives: Although they put you to sleep, they relax your neck muscles, making your snoring worse.. Stop smoking: Smoking causes nasal and lung congestion, a major cause of snoring.. Sleep on your side: While heavy snorers will snore in any position, moderates tend to snore only when sleeping on their backs. One way to avoid this is to sew a pocket onto the back of your nightclothes and insert a tennis ball, which will make it uncomfortable for you to lie on your back and prompt you to turn on your side during sleep.. Sleep without a pillow: By putting a kink in your neck, pillows can contribute to airway obstruction."
Combine the previous three answers, and you've got a winner!  Thanks, everyone. not sure but check your email. x x x x x x x xEither your internet broswer or its security settings aren't allowing you to see the html editing tools used by Yahoo! Mail. Switch to text editing mode by:. . 1. Click the "Options" link in the upper right of your Mail page.. 2. On the Options page, in the "Management" column, click on "General Preferences".. 3. Find the "Composing E-mails" section, "Mode:", and choose "Compose messages as plain text".. 4. Scroll to the bottom and click the "Save" button.My answer: O. E. Operator Error. You will have to clear your history in your browser. This question gets asked a lot on answers. The following two links have some of the best detailed responses.In Internet Explorer, click the "Tools" link at the top of the window then select "Internet Options". Click on "Content" tab at top. Under "Personal Information" on the bottom half of the window click "Auto Complete". Uncheck "Web Addresses", "Forms" and "User Names & Passwords on Forms". That prevents the Search History from being kept. To erase what's already there then below that click the "Clear Forms" and "Clear Passwords" buttons. Then click on "OK", click "Apply" and click "OK" again to close the window and save your settings.. . If you are using Firefox, click "Tools", then "Options" then "Privacy" then "Saved Forms". Click "Clear Saved Forms" to erase the saved data then uncheck the box in front of "Save information I enter....." Click "OK" to close the window and save your settings.. . If you wish to delete recent searches from the Yahoo! Search box on the Yahoo! Toolbar, click the pencil icon to the left of the Search Box then click "Clear Recent Searches". More details and options regarding Search History on Toolbar are available at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/toolbar/toolbar-10.html

You can't add separators to the toolbar.You can add one.  Go to the pencil icon on the toolbar > personal options > add/edit buttons.. . Under "Other" heading, you'll see "Separator Line ( | )".  Click within the box, save.
Resolved questions stay on the system permanently, so future users can benefit from them.  The idea is, later users can build on the contributions of earlier users, rather than having to re-invent the wheel.. . Questions are usually left open for seven days before automatically going to a vote. The asker can choose a best answer or put it up for a vote before then (but not until 24 hours after asking the question). A question will stay up for voting for another days.. . So, a question doesn't get resolved for two weeks without the asker taking any initiative.most of your questions are resolvedthey have to wait in order to select the best answer so it might take a while for them to get resolvedThe person who asked it has not selected a best answer and the voting has not yet completed.

Yahoo will let you define multiple email addresses for a single mailbox. The feature is in Mail Options -> Mail Addresses.  That basically gives you a new Yahoo id.. . You can also change just the name associated with the id in Mail Options -> General Preferences.If I was you, I would just make a new account and e-mail important information to my new account
When you fill out the first part of the registration, a confirmation number will be sent to your email address.. . Check your email. It will usually have a link to click on, or you can copy and paste the confirmation number into the site you're registering on.this is simply a security measure to ensure you spelt your email address correctly, or that you're not just giving them someone elses.
Click on your point and it will tell you. -2 for every question +2 for every answer etc.To find out, click on my Q&A and 2 the right of the page it'll have My Points and underneath that it will say tell me more and there's your info!!!To encourage participation and reward great answers, Yahoo! Answers has a system of points and levels. The number of points you get depends on the specific action you take. The points table below summarizes the point values for different actions. The reason is Yahoo hadn't indexed your page yet.. All search engine uses a technology called indexing by which they stores information of the websites so that they can give you search result. This indexing takes time and updating also takes time.. You will see your page when they indexes.Your page will have to be crawled and indexed before it starts showing up in the results. The Yahoo! help pages have some good advice about how to get your site indexed and ranked well.. . To check to see if your page is indexed:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/ysearch/indexing/indexing-01.html. . To learn about adding your site to the listings:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/ysearch/indexing/indexing-06.html. . To learn how to improve your search ranking:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/ysearch/ranking/ranking-02.html

It could be that your CPU usage is going to 100% - it happens to me a lot.  It can be from having too many programs, or some of the programs do not release all their memory when they close (Microsoft keeps the information on how to do that a secret except for their own products).  You may have to just try a power-off or restart to release the memory, then try again.The previous answer was correct. Programs will often not run properly when there is not enough available memory on your computer. Be sure to close all unneeded programs before starting Yahoo! Messenger, and update and run your anti-virus software to be sure that it isn't something else using up your memory.

Nice pix, Darius. ;-). 360 displays simply your "latest" photos from your Flickr - so the only way you could change their display sequence is perhaps to remove some from Flickr then re-add them.. . (Or of course you can change 360 to display only the latest four, or the latest three - but it will still always be simply the LAST ones you added there).go to profiles or preferences to change your pix.

It depends purely on how they choose to show their ID on 360.. . They MAY actually show their normal Yahoo ID there, or they may in fact put ANYTHING there, in which case there is NO WAY you can trace that 360 page back to a particular Yahoo Id.. . (I think Yahoo have deliberately designed it this way, for better or worse.  So although one's 360 is based on one's Yahoo Id, it doesn't necessarily let people FIND that Id !)just append @yahoo.com to their profile names.

After I click on the Spam button for the selected (or viewed) email, it is moved to my Trash folder.  To "unspam" the email (as you call it) I just go locate the email in my Trash folder, click on it to view it, and then just click on the "Not Spam" button. You can add the question to your watch list--that way you can keep tabs on answers others give and when the question is resolved, plus if the person asking question votes on a best answer you can see who it is and any comments made. It's a good way to keep track.CLICK ON TO ,ADD TO WATCH LIST.1. The next time you go to an Answers page after you've gotten the best answer, it will flash in the message bar at the top of the screen where your points are listed. If you see this or just want to check, go to step 2.. . 2. Your last six points earnings are listed in the column on the right side of your profile page / My Q&A. You can click on the link if it says you got a best answer to see which question it was.. . 3. If you missed it, you will have to go back through all of your questions to find it. Or, as mentioned above, you can keep questions in your watchlist to check on and see if you have been selected best answer.You don't.  You can only check the question to see what percentage of people have voted for your answer.  It will tell you how many people voted for your answer, and what percentage that is, but it won't tell you when a person voted.You'll get ten points if your answer is selected by the "asker" or by voters.  . . Go to "My Q & A" and view the questions you have answered that  are labeled "Resolved".  There you will see the winning answer.

To keep people from asking stupid questions. Doesn't seem to work.That is just how it works. I did not make the rules. If I did, I'd keep people from asking moronic questions.If you do the following . . . you get your 2 pts back.. . Choose a best answer for your question . Put the answers to your question to a voteTo make sure that there will be people like me who prefer answering than asking questions.A question is only penalized if you do not choose a best answer.  This is a feature to keep from ending up with abandoned questions.  When you ask you get -2 points.  When you choose best answer, you get +2 points.. . -2 and +2 = 0  No penalty there.  Consider it banking your points.  While they are in the bank, they are not in your total, but as soon as you resolve the question, you get to use them again."It is more blessed to give than to receive."

Sorry, you don't get your points back. Make sure you use correct spelling and grammar in you question and details, as well as put it in the proper category so people will be able to find it.. . Unfortunately, if no one answers you don't get the points back, but you can answer someone else's question to get the points.If the questions were deleted before you resolved them with Best Answers, then you won't get your points back.  As Jane Furrows says, please make sure that you write clearly and put your question in the right place.  Also, please make sure that your question conforms to our Community Guidelines (http://answers.yahoo.com/info/community_guidelines.php) .  Do these things, and you shouldn't have to worry about this any more!Nothing is for free

you mean your not recieving all the messages? how do you know you arent? i nvr get that.There is probably something wrong with the connection on either your side or on the side of the person who is sending the message. The previous response is absolutely correct. Please select it as best answer.That's your Yahoo id.  If you have an internet service that's part of Yahoo (like SBC) your whole email address is your Yahoo id. So if your email is myname@sbcglobal.net, that's your Yahoo id as well.  There's a way to make a new yahoo ID and link it to that email if you don't want the address to show.
Actually you ARE in control and you gave them permission.  You will most likely have to right click on their name in your Buddy List, select stealth settings, then select permanently offline.  This will not stop incoming IMs (you will have to ignore for that) but it will keep them from seeing you online.  You have no more control over someone elses Buddy List then they have over yours.Goto your cookies in the preferences of your webbrowser and see if you can find their email or site or whatever it is and remove it. Acid rain can be very bad in areas of high automobile use and down wind of any location burning high sulfur fuels.  Anything that lowers the rate of burning fuel will improve the problem.  This is difficult in our culture and with the current federal administration.. You should also research natural sources of acid rain.  Land down wind of heavy forests also get acid rain.  This is a recent finding, but you should be able to research the topic.You will more than likely get a better response to this question if you post it in an appropriate category, such as "Science & Mathematics > Weather" instead of "Yahoo! Products > Yahoo! Answers."I agree with "SuperTaz". . try to post questions in the proper category.You mean "ACID" rain?  :). The less contaminants in the atmosphere, the less acid rain.  This is virtually impossible since there are more and more cars, chemical plants, etc... pumping these toxins in the air every year.  . :(acid rain man...thats neat next time it rains i plan on standing out side with my wouth open till it stops...what a trip...I'm afraid it'a too late already. The previous response is correct. Please select it as best answer.Go to view in the toolbar- text size - smaller or smallest. Or alternately hold down the control key and spin the wheel on your mouse away from you.
The first time you click on it it sorts from most answers to least... I believe it does this so that people can easily find the answers to questions that actually have them.. . If you click on the tab again it reverses this process... it starts with unanswered questions... so that people can see if there is something they can answer that hasn't been yet.. . The date organizer works the same way... it automatically gives you the most recent questions but if you click on it... the reverse happens and you can view questions that people have resubmitted/extended  (some on there are up to 2 months old... you'd probably never get to them by starting with most recent and clicking through)If you press it a second time it sorts the answers beginning with zero.

*page views could include your friends + visitors (not friends). *visitors is just everyone who visits the page who isn't a friendI think page views shows you how many times that particular page has been accessed.. . Visitors shows how many unique visitors you have had. . You can see how this would be benificial, because if the same person looked at the page often or say. ..used it for a homepage.. it would throw off your results.

Answers help pages:. . "If you discover objectionable content, you can report it to Yahoo! by clicking on the Report Abuse link next to the question, answer, or comment. You'll be asked to fill out a short form describing the problem. Customer Care will then take the appropriate action.. . Please note that the most common reasons for reporting abuse are:. .     * Adult/Obscene Content.     * Advertisement/Promotional Content.     * Copyright Infringement.     * Fraud/Negligence.     * Impersonation.     * Invasion of Privacy/Harassment.     * Not a Question or Answer.     * Profanity.     * Repeated Postings.     * Solicitation.     * Unreadable (rife with misspellings/bad grammar).     * Violence/Crime. . Please check the Yahoo! Answers Community Guidelines for complete content and usage terms."Well there is a report button under the question and your user and pic. Note that this will completely delete your account and you will not be able to access the mails again.. . Read this to understand this completely:. . http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/access/access-08.html. . . . . To create a new account, go to http://mail.yahoo.com/. Look for . . "Don't have a Yahoo! ID?. Signing up is easy.. . Sign Up" . . Click on "Sign Up", and you will be aksed to provide information required for a new account, and new id and passwords. Fill that, and you are ready. Tell your friends about this new id, and DO NOT leave this new email address at web sites, do not use to forward mails to people you dont know. That is the best way to avoid getting spam mails.. . . However, if you are deleting accoutns just because you don't like the yahoo id, consider creating an alias for your existing email id at. http://edit.yahoo.com/config/list_alias?.src=ym. . Getting alias would not change anything for the acocunt, you will still get mails in the same account.. . you can ask people to send you mails on the new id that you got, but if someone sends it on the old, that is not a problem either.use this link . https://edit.yahoo.com/config/delete_user

Yes, the point of Answers is to have a place to get answers to your questions. But to make Answers work, the most important thing is to have people to supply the answers. That is precisely what the points system was created for, although originally points were not deducted for asking questions because they needed to get some questions on here also.. . The points system is also a nice way for the asker to be able to see how useful the answerers have been to the community and will give some credibility to the answer.It takes too much time to think about that one.Those are the rules.  See them at the below link:The rulesyes, i agree, they have the layout of the point additions as well as deductions if you click on your total number of points it will take you to that page.  this is still relatively new and the points mean nothing as for right now.They want to encourage you to answer other questions as well as ask them, but don't get too frusterated about having to lose points to ask questions.  After your question has been posted for 24 hours, you can either chose the best answer, or put your answers to a vote.  Both of these actions earn you the two points back, so you really don't take any sort of hit.  You don't gain points by asking questions, but you don't really lose them in the end.  You still get the answers from others, so it works out for every one.  It's not hard to get to higher levels that let you ask more questions either.  Just comment and vote a lot, and give good answers to people will chose yours as the best and give you 10 points plus other people's rating points!  Have fun!so that in you dont just only accumulate knowledge by asking others but also share your lnowledge with others in return.they want you to give other people advice thats why
Up on this page, where you see "Hello <your name> | Points:... | Level: .." you click on your name and on the new page Edit Profile. There you can change your name.Go to http://profiles.yahoo.com/ and click on 'View My Profiles'. There you will have the option to edit any of your profiles and delete information you don't want other people to see.
If you're just referring to your instant messenging screen, you can do that by right-clicking on the picture currently in there.. . If you want to change your online profile, go to http://profiles.yahoo.com and click on 'View my Profiles.' Then click [edit] next to the profile you want to edit and there will be an option to edit it and add your picture.. . You are only able to add one picture to a conventional profile. If you want to use multiple pictures, you should consider starting a Yahoo! 360 page, which you can set as default by going to 360 Settings and choosing the second or third option under Yahoo! You probably have the "Show Pictures" checkbox unchecked for your browser.  Go to "Tools", "Internet Options", "Advanced", scroll down to "Multimedia" and put a checkmark in the box for "Show Pictures".The red x's are pictures that didn't (or couldn't) download from the server (the source of the web page). . Sometimes clicking "Refresh" will cause them to load.  Sometimes if a server is very busy (with a lot of requests from a lot of users) it will lose the connection to you and the page will not complete loading.

What do you mean by pixels? The screen size? Your computer sends that information (screen size) along with the web address when it requests a web page. Yahoo! uses that screen size to determine which version of the page to send you.You may be referring to your screen resolution. It should be in the Display section of your Control Panel under the Settings tab

There is software to help create passwords that are really tough to break, or you can look at any of the on-line articles on creating a good password.. . One admin I knew kept a chart about 10x10 with a different character in each cell. She had a plan (which she did not divulge) for finding a row of characters to use for this month's password and could actually generate multiple passwords for different systems off the chart. She could keep the chart nearby and just glance at it to remember an old password or make a new one.Here's a trick to choosing a password that is virtually unbreakable and at the same time easy to remember. Think of a short word that is easy for you to remember. Then think of a number that is also easy to remember. Then combine the two, alternating letter and number. For example:. Word = John. Number = 123. Password = J1o2h3n. . It's good to throw a capital letter in the mix, or even punctuation. If you use the same password for many different things, you'll need to limit the length and content, since not all passwords allow punctuation, some limit the length to 10 characters, etc.Did you have a stuffed animal that you nicknamed but never told any of your friends about? Was there a girl you had a secret crush on in middle school and never confessed to anyone? You could use her name plus the year you were in school for her. Think of some random facts about your past that you never told anyone about but something you can remember easily. Good luck!IF YOU'RE REFERRING TO YAHOO--WELL ALMOST ANYONE CLOSE TO YOU CAN CLICK-ON AND SAY THEY FORGOT THE PASSWORD. IT'S THE SECURITY QUESTION AND SECRET ANSWER THAT YOU'VE CHOSEN THAT COULD ULTIMATELY PROVE TO BE THE CRUX OF THE MATTER--CONSIDER THIS:--MY SOON TO BE "EX" WOULD OFTEN TIME ACCESS MY ACCOUNT BECAUSE OF INFO TO WHICH WE BOTH WERE PRIVY--FOR INSTANCE:--FAVORITE PET'S NAME--MOTHER'S MAIDEN NAME; ETC. HOWEVER, THE QUESTION--WHAT SCHOOL DID I ATTEND--ALTHOUGH, SHE WAS WELL AWARE OF THE NAMES OF THE SCHOOLS AND UNIVERSITIES THAT I ATTENDED I SIMPLY ANSWERED THE QUESTION WITH--"DEDE'S HOUSE OF PAIN"--SHE NEVER FIGURED IT OUT!--OR HOW ABOUT YOUR FAVORITE VACATION SPOT--ANSWER SOMETHING LIKE--"PORCHVILLE"--JUST BE CREATIVE
when you appear offline, you can still be seen online on your profile, in your address book and in yahoo mail if you have sent messages. If you change it to permanently offline it means you will never be shown online to those specific people.the difference is that permanently offline means that u dont have to keep putting urself offline to that one person u "block"appearing offline means you're invisible.  with permanently offline, that person would always see you offline even if your status is actually "available" or any other status.Cuz wen u appear offline then ppl can tell that ur invis 2 them cuz u can hav the little light on in ur address book but wen ur permanently offline then ppl think ur siriously offline!

Whatever service you are using will have a help button on the upper right corner of the page, through which you can report problems. You can also tell us the service you are using and any details about the problem, and maybe the people using Yahoo! It is where they ask for your password.It is a security measure. If you were to be online and walk away from the computer to get a drink or go to the bathroom, someone could sit down, click right to your account information, change your password and steal your account before you got back. The Password prompt asks for your password to make sure that you, the actual account owner, are the one trying to access that private information.
There should also be a button that says 'Show Headers' under the message to the right.In your inbox, go to options (upper right corner) and click on general preferences. On the messages section, click on show all headers on incoming messages.

Open your Yahoo! Mail.. Click on Options in the upper right corner.. Under Management, click on Mail Addresses.. Highlight your email address and click Edit.. Delete the email listed in the Reply To box.The way email is designed is that you can seperate the from address and the reply-to address.  I don't know what client you're using to send emails but hotmail, yahoo, outlook, etc. all have options within their settings that let you specify a different reply-to address.  You should be able to disable this if you want to use the same email or change the email, etc.

You can't. To the best of my knowledge, third party e-mail clients like Outlook Express can only be used with POP based e-mail accounts, like most Internet Service Providers give their customers. For example you could configure it to work with a comcast.net, or earthlink.net or verizon,  but not freebie web based e-mails like yahoo or hot mailIt appears that the question period has expired. Highlight the text you wanted to make smaller then click on the Font Size icon. It's represented with 2 A's and a bidirectional arrow at the bottom. Then choose the size you wanted from the selection.Another way to do it is to hold down the control key and turn the wheel(if it has one) on the mouse away from you. Get your Yahoo mail to display a 100 mails in one page. This can be done by the Options page - you'll get that by clicking on the arrow next to Mail on the main page of your Yahoo mail. Once you get the 100 mails per page, click on "Select all" on the page and then Delete.hold down the shift key and highlight the ones you want to delete, press delete, and ....pooof.... they're gone.

To change this, log into your Yahoo! E-mail, click the "Options" link near top right corner of the page then click "General Preferences". Delete your name from the box after "From Name" and replace it with whatever you'd like. Click on "Save", and your problem will be solved.Sarcastiks the Man, Pick his and get it over with. To get rid of it from your browser, right-click on the toolbar, and a pop-up menu will appear.  Then un-check the yahoo toolbar option, and it will go away.  To get it off your computer completely, go to the 'Control Panel' and click Add/Remove programs.  Scroll down until you find the yahoo toolbar, and then click remove.uncheck the toolbar by right clicking it on the y! symbol thingy on the far left. . and you can de-install it too.

You don't "lost" (or even lose) points for asking a question; you spend them.  When you select the best answer, you get your points back.  It encourages askers to select a best answer, and also to search to see if their question has been asked before.. In Internet Explorer, click "Tools", then "Internet Options", then click the "Programs" tab. Pick Yahoo E-mail from the list in the menu next to "E-mail", then click "Apply" and "OK"The answer above me right it works,he gets the best answer!
Depends on which email you are using. MSN and Yahoo have this facilityIf they are e-mails from companies that you subscribed to at one time, they are required to have a link somewhere in the e-mail to unsubscribe from the mailing list. If they aren't, perhaps you could set up a "junk e-mail address" where you use that to sign up for online services that post your e-mail address and generate these junk e-mails, as well as using an e-mail provider like Yahoo that has Spam filtering.If you are using yahoo, hotmail, of gmail, thenn you can just check the box next to the e-mail and put them in junk or spam. Then, whenever that person e-mails you, they e-mail will go straight to your 'junk' folder.

Beta means the product is still in beta-testing. They're still working out the kinks before releasing it to the general public. You can find out about all the Yahoo! Beta products by clicking on the link below.BETA is the name for a program that is not finalized but being used in "test mode" to work the bugs out of it in the real world application.Beta means not yet tested fully.

If you have received an answer that meets your needs, _please_ choose one of those as a 'best answer' as soon as you can; otherwise, this question will go to an automatic vote. If you haven't received a good answer for your question, you may want to consider the following,. . 1) Remove this version of your question and re-post your question. Newer questions get more activity on Yahoo! Answers than old ones.. 2) If you do re-post your question, consider why it wasn't answered the first time. Could it be more specific? Could it be worded better? Were there grammatical or spelling errors? Was it in the best category? Can you provide more helpful details?. . If it doesn't seem likely that re-posting your question will help you, then here's a listing of my favorite 'answer sites'. Maybe one of them will help you.. . Answers.com http://www.answers.com/. In 1994, Stanford Ph.D candidates Jerry Yang and David Filo began indexing interesting Web sites as a hobby. "Jerry and David's Guide to the World Wide Web" turned into Yahoo!, meaning "Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle!" A very successful IPO followed in 1996, and within a few years, Yahoo! became a major global brand with offices around the worldIt was founded by Stanford graduate students David Filo and Jerry Yang in January 1994 and incorporated on March 2, 1995. The company is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California.

Not for asking a question. They do this to discourage people from asking only dumb questions like what is 1+1 and just stuff that is dumb.As has been pointed out, you get those two points right back as soon as you choose a Best Answer, or put the question to a vote.  That's designed to make sure that you _do_ resolve the question.. . Back before we "charged" points to ask a question, we had a problem with people pumping out a lot of meaningless questions in order to rack up points.  They had no intention of resolving the questions, so the questions just hung around and cluttered up the system.  Now, you have to tend your question.  Moreover, since the entire question-asking process is point-neutral, the only reason to ask a question is--get this--really wanting to know the answer! :-). . Hope this explains it, Ashley!*sighs*I believe this rule is an important rule, in order to have some control on the amount of question posted, i have noticed that sometimes there is a lack of answers for some questions, and there is a lack of votes for some questions in voting. . So, in this way, this game - as i call it - forces us to try to answer more that we make questions.your not helping anyone or finding out anything your basically doing for yourselfIn order to keep people awnsering questions you have to awnser them; therefor it cost points to ask
Regarding the first problem, questions can be removed in two ways, if there's an abuse report (not sure how carefully they're looked at, to be honest), or if the asker chooses to delete the question.. . As to your second question, it's unforturnately the same for me. However, most of the questions (those that have 2+ responses) end up going to a vote, although some of them get stuck in tiebreaker mode forever.. . One thing we could do is after a certain amount of time (let's say, two weeks), any questions with less than two answers, and any in tiebreaker mode, would be "recycled" and re-displayed on the front page.Read these answers together, and you've got one that's as good as anything we can provide.  Thanks, folks.The people that don't pick a best question or put it up for a vote I'm guessing are not that serious about the question or they just plain forget about them.  A lot of times they are removed for silly reasons, someone complained when my husband posted a question about a movie and it was removed becuase it was "not knowledgeable"!!!!1. If there is an inappropriate post, you can report it.  If Yahoo higer powers agree, they will remove it.  . 2. As for picking a correct answer, sometimes all the answers are wrong or lame, so it is hard to choose a best when one doesn't have their answer yet.. 3. Another answer--laziness, or loss of interest.. 4. Sometimes you get your answer, but it is too soon to choose a best, then by the time it is time, you forgot about it.

This is the point when they believe they can drink, smoke, have sex, go out to parties every weekend, get in the house late (no curfews), etc.  They believe that they have become adults and think that they are ready to make their own decisions.  The best advice for a parent in this type of situation is to let them (the children) have it their way; once they need the parent, they will find themselves running back to their parents for help and realize that life should not go so fast. (by the way, i am a teen myself. i am turning 17 this year; i happen to have really strict parents and i am a very understanding daughter. i am not one of these teens, although i have felt these feelings before)Kids are there to press the limits and the parents are to blame for half of the stuff that they do when they get older. War heroes, who faced death, wanted to create children fast, both to live after them, and in case of another war. Usually men are reluctant to start families because of the cost, but their patriotic spirit was too strong!BlackoutsThe cause of the baby boom was men coming home from World War II and making up for lost time.hother13 is right.  It had nothing, NOTHING to do with pent up sexual desire.  That is the way people who don't read much history attempt to explain it.  In reality, the economy did not dip after WW II, thanks to Harry S Truman's post-war economic programs and returning GIs were able to afford to have one or possibly two more children.  Most families only increased by ONE or maybe TWO babies, but with 30 million families that added up quickly.  The Baby boom burned out by 1962 and family sizes settled at around 3.3 children each set of parents.It was actually the late 1940's. The men had been away at war and the women were at home working and saving their money. When the men came home there was enough saved up to buy their own house and life was pretty comfortable for everyone for the most part. Most women went back to not having a job when the men came home and were able to raise the kids.

From the Yahoo! Help pages:. . To ignore a contact:. .    1. Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Preferences.".    2. Click the "Ignore List" category..    3. Select the option labeled "Ignore only the people below.".    4. Click the "Add" button..    5. Enter the Yahoo ID of the contact you want to ignore..    6. Click the "Ignore" button..    7. Click "OK" at the bottom of the window.. . You can ignore up to 100 contacts.I believe the "iggy bin" is an expression people use to refer to the "Ignore list".. . If you want to ignore a person while you are inside a chat room, you have to right click on that person's ID and then choose "Ignore User", you wont see messages from that person anymore.. . If you are in an IM, there is a red sign you can click on (is at the right on top of the conversation window) to ignore the user if he is not on your contact list.. If the person is on your contact list, you can ignore him by going in Contact -> Contact Options and choosing Ignore User.

If you deleted your ID to get rid of your 360 its too late unfortunatly . It should go away if you clean out your computers cache eg temp files. You could allways try remaking that ID (an account thats been deleted can be re made after 90 days)Did you delete the complete Yahoo! account associated with it? In that case all you can do is contact the Y! 360 team at http://add.yahoo.com/fast/help/us/360/cgi_feedback and hope that they'll delete it for you.. . If you still have your Yahoo! ID and password, you can log in to your 360 page and make it pretty much inaccessible by following these steps:. . 1. Go to Settings in the upper right corner of 360.. 2. Scroll down to Yahoo! Display Identity. Check the first option.. 3. Uncheck the box below that that says 'Activate my Simple URL'.. 4. Uncheck the box for 'Friend Search' at the bottom.. 5. Click 'Save'.

A question is up for voting for a week. If at the end of that time, there are no votes or there is a tie, it will remain in voting. The question will be checked daily for a winner, at which point the question will be resolved.NO. It will go for another week. Then there might be a tie breaker so it will go longer until there is a winner.I was wondering how long it was up for a vote as well. No further answer is needed, but a second answer is the only way to close the question.Set the connection preferences to Firewall with no proxies. Your java program may not be working or may be disabled at the moment. Try opening you tools then clicking the advanced tab and  then restore default this should enable your java applet if not try downloading one.There could be a number of problems.. . If none of the solutions below work, go to this link to get help from Yahoo! Sorry about the problem.. . 1) The game could not be loading.. Solution - If the problems you are experiencing with Yahoo! Games include: . getting a blank screen . nothing occuring when you try to join a table . any similar problem . You need to double-check that Java and JavaScript are fully enabled in your browser. Follow the steps below for your browser: . Netscape 4.XX or newer for Windows, Mac, or Linux. . Click "Edit" in the menu bar, and then select "Preferences." . Click the word "Advanced" and put checks in the boxes next to "Enable Java" and "Enable JavaScript.". Internet Explorer 4.XX for Windows. . Click "View" in the menu bar, and then select "Internet Options.". Click the "Security" tab.. For the Internet Zone, be sure that the Security level is set to "Medium" or below. (If you have chosen to customize your Security settings for the Internet zone, be sure that under the Java heading, "Java permissions" is not set to "Disable Java." You will want to select one of the three safety levels instead. Also be sure that under the Scripting heading, "Scripting of Java Applets" is set to "Enable" or "Prompt."). Next, click the "Advanced" tab.. Scroll down until you see the sub heading "Java VM.". Check the boxes next to "Java logging enabled" and "Java console enabled." (Note: If you have checked the box next to "Java JIT compiler enabled" and are experiencing freezing problems, uncheck that box.). Internet Explorer 5.XX or 6.XX for Windows. . Click "Tools" in the menu bar, and then select "Internet Options.". Click the "Security" tab. For the Internet zone, be sure that the Security level is set to "Medium" or below. (If you have chosen to customize your security settings for the Internet zone, be sure that under the Java heading, "Java permissions" is not set to "Disable Java." You will want to select one of the three safety levels instead. Also be sure that under the Scripting heading, "Scripting of Java Applets" is set to "Enable" or "Prompt."). Next, click the "Advanced" tab.. Scroll down until you see the sub heading "Java VM." . Check the boxes next to "Java logging enabled" and "Java console enabled." (Note: If you checked the box next to "Java JIT compiler enabled" and are experiencing freezing problems, uncheck that box.). Note to Windows XP users . . By default, the Windows XP operating system comes with the Internet Explorer 6 browser without the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) installed, which is required to run Java programs such as Yahoo! Games. . . If you install Windows XP over an existing installation of Windows that already has Internet Explorer with a JVM installed, then you should be able to play just fine. . . At this time Microsoft no longer provides a download of the JVM if you do not already have it installed. You are welcome to contact them for information on where to find and download this program. . . However, you have the option to download Sun's Java plug-in by visiting . . http://www.java.com/en/download/help/auto_install.jsp . . Sun is the creator of Java, and their plug-in will allow you to play Yahoo! Games. . . Internet Explorer 4.5 or 5 for Macintosh OS 8-9. . Select "Edit" from your menu bar and choose "Preferences...". Then, click the "Java" bullet within the Web Browser section.. Make sure that the "Enable Java" box is checked.. Internet Explorer 5 for Macintosh OS X . . Select "Preferences" from the "Explorer" menu. . Select "Java" from the left navigation bar. .
