(sM@r+1 !! )...This is to you.... We have spell check now right in front of you when answering these.... Use it please, it doesn't take a second...cool. 5 entries found for cool.. To select an entry, click on it. .   cool[1,adjective]cool[2,verb]cool[3,noun]cool[4,adverb]blow[1,verb]   . . Main Entry: 1cool . Pronunciation: 'k?l. Function: adjective. Etymology: Middle English col, from Old English cOl; akin to Old High German kuoli cool, Old English ceald cold -- more at COLD. 1 : moderately cold : lacking in warmth. 2 a : marked by steady dispassionate calmness and self-control <a cool and calculating administrator -- Current Biography> b : lacking ardor or friendliness <a cool impersonal manner> c of jazz : marked by restrained emotion and the frequent use of counterpoint d : free from tensions or violence <meeting with minority groups in an attempt to keep the city cool>. 3 -- used as an intensive <a cool million dollars>. 4 : marked by deliberate effrontery or lack of due respect or discretion <a cool reply>. 5 : facilitating or suggesting relief from heat <a cool dress>. 6 a of a color : producing an impression of being cool; specifically : of a hue in the range violet through blue to green b of a musical tone : relatively lacking in timbre or resonance. 7 slang a : very good : EXCELLENT; also : ALL RIGHT b : FASHIONABLE 1 <not happy with the new shoes... because they were not cool -- Celestine Sibley>. - cool·ish  /'k?-lish/ adjective. - cool·ly also cooly  /'k?(l)-lE/ adverb. - cool·ness  /'k?l-n&s/ noun. synonyms COOL, COMPOSED, COLLECTED, UNRUFFLED, IMPERTURBABLE, NONCHALANT mean free from agitation or excitement. COOL may imply calmness, deliberateness, or dispassionateness <kept a cool head>. COMPOSED implies freedom from agitation as a result of self-discipline or a sedate disposition <the composed pianist gave a flawless concert>. COLLECTED implies a concentration of mind that eliminates distractions especially in moments of crisis <the nurse stayed calm and collected>. UNRUFFLED suggests apparent serenity and poise in the face of setbacks or in the midst of excitement <harried but unruffled>. IMPERTURBABLE implies coolness or assurance even under severe provocation <the speaker remained imperturbable despite the heckling>. NONCHALANT stresses an easy coolness of manner or casualness that suggests indifference or unconcern <a nonchalant driver>.1.  coldish: somewhat cold, usually pleasantly so  . 2.  staying calm: staying calm or not showing emotions, especially nervousness or fear  . 3.  fashionable: fashionable and sophisticated . looking cool .  . 4.  unfriendly: unfriendly or unenthusiastic . They gave us a somewhat cool reception. .  . 5.  music having relaxed rhythm: used to describe a style of jazz, popular in the mid-20th century, characterized by a relaxed rhythm  . 6.  emphasizing sum of money: used to emphasize how large a sum of money is (informal) . a cool $3.2 million .  . 7.  excellent: very good (slang) . a cool idea .  . 8.  OK: acceptable, untroubling (slang) . That’s cool, no problem. .  . 9.  seeming cold: giving an impression of coldness . a cool mint green .  . 10.  keeping temperature low: made of fabric that keeps the body at a pleasant temperature in hot conditions  . . . vti (past cooled, past participle cooled, present participle cool·ing, 3rd person present singular cools) . 1.  make or become less warm: to become or cause somebody or something to become less warm . Rolling 5 dice and getting the same number on all 5 dice in less than 3 rolls.The player must roll at least three of a kind of all six die face values to achieve a bonus, and must further attain certain Poker hands such as four of a kind, full house, and straight. A Yahtzee is five of a kind.. . YAHTZEE!!do not know do not careIt was originally called "The Yacht Game".Well, it is derived from the Celtic word yaht which means..............how should I know? sorry!!!According to Hasbro, the game was invented in 1954 by an anonymous Canadian couple, and called "The Yacht Game" because they played it on their yacht with their friends. Two years later they asked toy and game entrepreneur Edwin S. Lowe if he would make up some sets to be given as gifts to their friends who enjoyed the game. Lowe perceived the possibility of marketing the game, and acquired the rights to the game from the couple in exchange for 1,000 gift sets.

Hard work has no alternative for success, but a sense of mind does a lot help in saving time.. Carefully read and follow the techniques Given below.... --------------------------------------------------------. People always score more marks at the beginning of answering a question that at the end - so make sure you don't spend ages on trying to get the last possible mark out of one question when you could be scoring a dozen more easily in the same time by doing the next one.. . Read the questions carefully - many marks are lost because people do not read the questions with enough care. Note that words like 'List', 'Explain', 'Discuss' and 'Give' are not identical (the middel two are asking for more detail than the other two).. . The marks associated with each question give an indication as to the depth required.. . Divine the number of marks available by the total time (e.g. 100 marks, 2 hours = 1.2 mins/mark). Round it down to make life easier - 1 minute per mark, leaving 20 mins at the end to complete stuff. Then stick to that approach - spend no more than one minute per mark on a question - this maximises your scoring.. . Read the paper before you start writing. This does 3 things. Firstly, it allows you to see some questions you will be able to do and so calms you. Secondly, it allows you to have some idea of the questions you will choose. Thirdly, it allows your brain to start questions subconsciously, so that when you come to answer them you will already be a few steps ahead.. . If it all goes wrong and it all looks too hard, simply address each part in turn and try to answer whatever you can as well as you can, to pick up as many odd marks as possible. Show any working.. . If you run out of time, answer the remaining parts in note form, getting the key words, concepts or numbers down in as short a time as possible.. --------------------------------------------------------. Best of luck!! :). Give me a good news soon!!Study more. Be genuinely interested in learning. It'll make things more fun and challenging.

The Venus Flytrap does it to Trap, and Eat Flies! No Other Plant does it! The Rest just Grow slow!It depends on what kind of "moving" do you have in mind. . The most ordinary is of course the movement of trees and leaves in the wind. It is caused by moving air. . . Also, some plants like, for example, strawberry bushes, will sprout long tendrils that touch the ground on the other side and root. This way, the plant slowly "moves" around to spread and search new, better ground for growing and also to make new plants. Also some fungi are know to spread like that.. . Some plants float around on water ad root when they hit the shore. It is all means of procreation and spreading to new and better grounds.. . On the other hand, plants like sunflower will turn their "heads" so that they face the sun all the time. They do that so that the surface of their leaves is in the right angle with the incoming sun rays. This way, they absorb the most heat and light.

But what's the "point" to all of this anyway. The "point" is, there is NO "point", except of course my "Point" Pleasant "point". Yes, the answer will go to a vote if the asker does not choose.  If there is only one answer, and the asker doesn't extend the answer period, Yahoo Answers will leave the question open until someone else answers, or until the asker selects that answer as best.Fuzzy_Zoeller and Jane_Furrows, are right about this. The question will remain unresolved until somebody else answers it, or the asker picks the best answer. Hope this answers your question!well it does only if you pick it to go to the vote thing u know.The question goes to a vote automatically after 7 days have passed and there are at least two answers. If you look back in the unresolved questions, you will find many from months ago even that have only one answer. If you can provide a better answer than the first one, you can easily get the ten points for best answer. They will go to a vote usually within a day after you post your answer.

The leaderboard is updated every Monday morning. A trick is to subract your points earned this week from your total points, in this case giving you 474.The leaderboard is updated once a week on Monday mornings.  So even if you have earned points since then, you will not see yourself at your current point level.  If you know how many points you've earned in the last few days, you still might be able to find yourself on the leaderboard by going back a few more pages.

they changed it a couple days ago so it cost 5 points now to ask a question probably to make poeple stop asking dumb questions like "Who am I?" good luckThe powers that be seem to be forgetting that this is not a chicken and egg situation.  There is no doubt that the questions definitely need to come before the answers.  Are they reaching a point where they are inhibiting question-asking too much?Costing more points to ask questions:. . Previously, it cost two points to ask a question, and you received two points for resolving it, making it a point-neutral exercise. Now, it will cost five points to ask a question, and you will receive three points for resolving it. Simply answer one question (for an additional two points), and it becomes point-neutral as well. We hope this change will encourage question askers to look around and see if you can answer other people’s questions.it is because yahoo answers changed it.  and my personal opinion is so that people are encouraged to stop asking stupid meaningless questions.  also think of this:. . when you join you get 100 points.  at 2 pts a question you can ask 50 questions that are meaningless.  at 5 pts a question you can ask only 20 quesitons that are meaningless.  also  you only get three pts back.. if you didnt know that..part of the BETA in yahoo answers. . product updates. http://blog.360.yahoo.com/blog-d8pH0dcoRKeB12yOcnUQp.9VCFos?p=1302Yes, Answ3r3r.  5 for a question.  3 for choosing a Best Answer.  But... only two for putting the question up for a vote!  Now, that is just wrong.  What about a question that deserves a fair vote? Do you get any kinda of error message? Some times Yahoo takes its own time to log you on!. . UjjUIs this a new installation of Messenger? If so, are you able to get the sign in window to open, then type in your ID and password but when you click "Sign In" nothing happens?. If that's the case, do you have a firewall or are you using Windows XP with it's own firewall? If so, open Messenger, close the sign in screen and click "Messenger" at top left of the main Messenger window. Click "Connection Preferences" then choose "Firewall with no proxies". Also make sure your type of connection and your location are correct, click "Apply" then "OK". You should be able to sign in after that.. . If you've had Messenger installed and have been using it for a while and have not changed any settings then the following advice I learned from fellow answerer Missy Angel may help. Go to C:&#92; Program Files&#92; Yahoo!&#92; Messenger&#92; cache. In this folder you will see many XML documents with a series of gibberish letters and numbers as file names. These are temporary files, delete them, then try signing in.. Do not empty your Recycle Bin until you are certain that everything still works. If deleting these files screws something up you can always restore them back to their original location from your Recycle Bin.

No, you do not get points if someone answers your questions.  If you are interested in getting points then give the most accurate and detailed answers you can to other people's questions and it will increase your chances of being chosen as the best answer gaining you 10 points.You only get points for answering questions, voting, and giving a rating, and then casting a vote for your question or picking th ebest answer to your questionGive good answers. "Best" answers are awarded 10 points. Also, choose best answers to your questions or put questions to a vote, you get points for that as well. Voting also gets you points.Be good at answering questions and get chose as the best answer.  Rate people's answers and vote for best answers.  That's about it.Why are you in a hurry to get points?  Why not just try to help some people out by answering their questions or voting or rating answers?  This is the best way to increase your knowledge.. . Answers team post on the forum and leave your feedback on this category.It probably wasn't used very much or used for the wrong reasons.  Let's face it, many on this list can't read. We put it up to gather some data, and needed to take it down to analyze how to best implement some of things we've learned about the category. We're trying to make it a better category with user friendly features. We hear you guys loud and clear, you like this type of category. Now, we are going to do some work to make it the best it can be before we possibly return it. Hope this helps explain things.. I guess to make sure that you're better at answering questions than asking them.  I think it's a bit annoying, but who am I to complain? :)It now is -5 to ask a question but if you come back and choose your own BEST ANSWER you get 3 points back.  Go to the top of the page and click on What's going on in Answers to find out more.It's this new thing the Yahoo! Answers team did to stop people from asking unintelligent questions. You can get three of those 5 points back if you select a best answer.Akwrew, you've noticed one of our new features! Previously you would ask a question for 2 points, and get the 2 points back when you resolved the question. Now when you ask a question is cost 5 points. However, you get 3 points back when you pick a best answer or put it to a vote. To get the additional 2 points, answer another question. We did this to encourage people to answer more questions. For more info on the new features, visit our blog. (http://blog.360.yahoo.com/y_answrs_team ). Hope this clears things up!. -KatieWhy do so many people ask this question??Incentive to answer other questions as well as ask your own.that's the way it is.....it cost to get answers....!!!so you don't ask questions as much so you don't just always ask stupid questionsi dont know, but it only -2 from me when i ask a question...maybe since im level 2?. ~BrendonIt is only minus two for me and i am level 1 the reason they subtract points is you are supposed to answer questions and they want to encourage you to answer questionsIt encourages you to answer some then, and participate some more.  ;)
Where you see that RED  "Y" next to that is a little pencil. Click on that and it will show where you can clear recent searches.Hope that does it for you.In Internet Explorer, click the "Tools" link at the top of the window then select "Internet Options". Click on "Content" tab at top. Under "Personal Information" on the bottom half of the window click "Auto Complete". Uncheck "Web Addresses", "Forms" and "User Names & Passwords on Forms". That prevents the Search History from being kept. To erase what's already there then below that click the "Clear Forms" and "Clear Passwords" buttons. Then click on "OK", click "Apply" and click "OK" again to close the window and save your settings.. . If you are using Firefox, click "Tools", then "Options" then "Privacy" then "Saved Forms". Click "Clear Saved Forms" to erase the saved data then uncheck the box in front of "Save information I enter....." Click "OK" to close the window and save your settings.. . If you wish to delete recent searches from the Yahoo! Search box on the Yahoo! Toolbar, click the pencil icon to the left of the Search Box then click "Clear Recent Searches". More details and options regarding Search History on Toolbar are available at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/toolbar/toolbar-10.htmlIf your talking about the toolbar searches hit the pencil lookin button and then select "clear search history".  Then click the pencil again and choose "toolbar options".  Then uncheck the box that says "enable search history".

That order is decided by the person who's page has updated recently or maybe who visited your page most recently.  All you can do is put them in categories.Your friends are arranged on your main profile page in the order that they update thier 360's ,. Click on addresses in Yahoo mail, and on the upper right side of the screen, you'll see a button to export them. Export to a .csv file, then you can save that file and import it to MS Outlook.Have you tried the instructions in the Help for Address Book? It may help:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/plus/ab/impexp/impexp-02.htmlGo to Yahoo Mail, Then Go to Options and then To Address Book and click on Import/Export & in Export click on Export for Microsoft Outlook.. And in Microsoft Outlook, go to File -> Import / Export -> Import For Another Program / File -> Comma Seperated Values(Windows) and Specify the file name you saved with yahoo.. All your address will be imported to MS Outlook

Hope i helped.replace your avatar pic with your pic .. press on your nickname on the top of the page .. and then press on "edit my info"You HAVE to create Yahoo 360 in order to post your picture in Yahoo answer.If you have a digital camera and a USB cord, just download your pic on your computer, save it to any folder you like.  I usually go to 'my documents', select 'my pictures' and save it under there.  Once you've done that, the page where you have your recent avatar there should be something like 'change avatar' or something to that effect.  There's a URL box with the word 'browse' next to it.  Click on the 'browse' button and it will open up where you want to browse.  Click on where ever you have your picture saved, double click on it and it will copy it to the URL box.  Once that's done it should be a 'upload' button below or it will probably automatically put it where your old avatar is.  Make sure you save your pic under *jpg* format.  Anything else will claim to be too big.  Or if you have a webcam that can take pics like mine you can do the same.  Click your pic, save and then upload it. . "ClimaCool" is the brand name for Adidas cloths.  It is a synthetic material that keeps you cool in warm weather by whisking the sweat away from your body and to the outside of the cloth where it evaporates. The bulk folder IS your unwanted messages, it's there to collect all the junk that would normally collect in your inbox. Ever heard of delete? You can also set it so that the messages are automatically deleted. Look in your Options1-many spam emails have an unsubscribe link at the bottom.these emails are from websites that added your email address in their list.you can remove your address from their list by unsubscribing.. 2-another spam emails are emails from a special email address that you can go to email options (top right of your page)and block that address,and it wont come in bulk folder.. 3-the last thing that you can do is going to email option,then filter,and filter emails with specific sender,subjects,containing some word and .... and select moving those emails directly too trashTo the right of either your bulk or trash folders, merely click on 'Empty'........Wallah, they're gone!

The more points you have, the higher levels you become. The higher the level, the more answers you can post, and the more questions you can answer, and what not. You lose five points by asking a question, but gain 3 back when you select one of the answers you recieved as the best. You also gain 2 points by answering questions, and one point each for voting for a best answer.opinions are like blackholes. They stop time.Well you pay 5 points for the question. However, when you pick the best answer you get 3 pts back. Since you left it open so long. You will get no points back. Yahoo used to give you 2 points when you put something to a vote, but then questions would get 3 months old.The following page has details of the points system. . http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system;_ylt=AnEgKeTWsWrNC_8tP3HZEi4ezKIX. Hope this helps.

(there will be blank space)You should have read the information more carefully when you posted your personal information. It clearly states that if you add the ability to let people IM you with Messenger people WILL see your Yahoo! ID. Letting them contact you via e-mail however does NOT give them any personal contact information. I suggest you remove the link to your Messenger from your Answers profile and just stick to the more anonymous e-mail communication. Of course there are idiots out there who will still abuse that but it's not that big of a hassle to just delete their e-mails. Do NOT report those as spam by the way, you will be reporting Yahoo! Answers as the spammer, not the idiot who is harassing you. . There is no place on the e-mails you receive to report abuse from such a person (HINT HINT to the Y! Answers Team) however you can use the feedback form at http://add.yahoo.com/fast/help/us/answers/cgi_feedback to report them, or just do it from the offender's profile by clicking their name in the e-mail you receive. Keep the e-mails if you are reporting them, you may need them to support your claim.

The points system changed a couple days ago and i personally think for the better because if people want their 3 points back they need to come back and vote for their own best answer to their question.  It will I hope eliminate a lot of questions going to a vote and being on here for 3 months without a best answer being chosen yet!  You can read more about it on the top of your page in What's new in Yahoo!This is one of the new features we have added to Yahoo! Answers. It used to cost 2 points to answer a question. Then you would get the 2 points back when you picked the best answer or put it to a vote. Now it costs 5 points to answer a question, but you get 3 points back when you resolve it. To get the final 2 points, answer a question. We are trying to encourage people to answer more questions. For more info about all the new features, visit our blog.(http://blog.360.yahoo.com/y_answrs_team )point system has been changed by yahoo. Now it costs 5 points for asking a question. Do u get it?Because the points system has changed.. http://blog.360.yahoo.com/y_answrs_teaminflation.They changed it in the last 48 hours to 5 points.  I like the idea because there end up with many questions unanswered.They changed the point system.  You can get almost all (if not all) back if you rate answers and pick the best one.

You can only if you are trying to recall a sent email within a closed Outlook email system - many companies would use this kind of "closed system".  If it's one of those, then you would got to your sent folder, open the email in question, then under tools you would see an option for "Recall sent message" and that would recall the email only from computers in that closed system, and only emails that hadn't been read yet and only if that computer is on.(I'm going by memory on that exact phrasing). But email to the rest of the world... nope, can't do it.If your work is using outlook exchange, an email server, you can recall a message. But it doesn't really delete it and usually tends to focus the receiver more on the ill-posted original message.  Use it if you wrote the wrong date for a meeting, don't use it if you just called your boss a monster and forgot that you cc'd him.You can't recall it after it is sent.I checked the web: It can be done in some cases using Outlook, but not with Yahoo mail at all. :(. . Make sure auto complete is set to work on your computer.  . Go to tools->internet options->content->auto complete->then check the boxes for the items you would like auto complete to work for.Its turned off.. . To enable it:. . 1. Select Tools... Internet Options from the menu.. 2. Click the advanced tab.. 3. Scroll down and find "Use Inline Autocomplete" in Browsing section.. 4. Check it and click OK.. . Autocomplete is enabled from this point onwards.i don't know but i sure would love to find out too, i couldn't get the answer even from yahoo team

What blocker do you use? There are ways to circumvent popup blockers, though browser-integrated blockers are best (then come blockers made by security software producers).You have spyware installed on your system.  The pop ups are not coming from the site your visiting but rather being called upon the spyware installed on your system.  Some spyware programs can avoid detection.  Pandasoftware has a great spyware finder and virus finder that I have found other virus protection companies have not detected.  Adaware and spy bot work for most but not all.. . Pandasoftware: (recommend)  you can do an online scan or download the 30 day trial offer.  http://www.pandasoftware.com/products/ActiveScan.htm. . Adaware:  http://www.lavasoftusa.com/software/adaware/. . Spybot:  http://www.safer-networking.org/en/download/index.htmlNo popup blocker is 100% effective, a few will always slip through, you should at least be getting fewer popups than with it off, if not you might want to get a new one.  There are many which you can download for free.maybe your computer have a virusits warns of viruses,spyware etc.in other words it tells u that the computer doesnt knw where da heck u r exploring & its warnin u about it....The popups are probably spyware, popup blockers block a javascript code in the page, and not actuall pages popping up, so the pages that are popping up are either spyware ( adware ) or the pops you are experience are created through code that someone has re-designed.

Go to your groups page, click on Members link on the navigation on the left. Pick the Moderators tab and edit from there.You have to go through a few pages, but it's easy once you find the way:. . 1. Click on Management on the menu of your group page.. 2. Click on Messages (under Group Settings).. 3. Click on [edit] next to Posting & Archives.. 4. Set Moderation to Unmoderated.. 5. Save Changes.. . It may sometimes take a little bit before the members page is updated to show your new settings. You can still set specific members to moderated by editing that member's membership settings.

FYI: There's an STD section under Health & Beauty. . Aids can be transmited by having unprotective sex.. Dirty needles.. Blood transfusions.. And if you're born with a mother who has AIDS.. Although they have the technology to prevent the last one. It's mostly unprotected sex right now. They can test the blood for AIDS during transfusions.Having random sex. . sharing needles. . blood transfusion. . having different sex partnersAIDS is a sexually transmitted disease (STD). It's transmitted during sexual intercourse from an infected person to a healthy person. A person can also be infected with this disease when the blood of the infected person gets into the blood of another person through a cut or opening in the skin, for example, sharing unsterilised needles and shaver.In the eighties it was by computer keyboards, toilet seats, cough's and sneezes and holding hands.. . Now its just by email.AIDS (Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome) is caused by a virus that decreases the the immune system, this virus is called HIV (human immunodeficiency virus). This Virus may be transmitted sexually, it may also be transmitted to you if a doctor injects you with infected blood. Another way AIDS may be transmitted to you is through your parents, if your parents has AIDS most probably you'd have them, or your children may have AIDS if the virus remains dormant through a generations.

By asking a question, letting people answer it and then after 24 hours you can vote their answer as the best, that will give them 10 points. Also voting for a best answer that someone else has chosen... other then that there's not really another way. You can't 'send' points to anyone only through the ways I've explained.By giving as best answers as possible.The only way you can give points to another user is by chosing them as the best answer to your question. This will give them an aditional 10 points to the 2 they already earned by answering your question. Other than that there is no way to give points out. For more info, visit our Points & Levels page. (http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system;_ylt=AvikSNGe8x8Njq9xvbDvwo0_zKIX ). Hope this explains things a little better!. KatieWhy would you wanna do that for? You should try to make the points yourself. There's a grand prize for those who earn the most points you know . . . not really, but hell it sounded good when I said it.If you choose a best answer for one of your questions that person gets 10 points and you only get 3.

It depends on which instant messenger service you have. Each one has different way to determine whether your friend is offline or online. With YIM and MSN, if the person is offline, hiss/her name is not highlighted. With AIM, the person's screenname wont so up on your list until they come online.If you are using Yahoo with voice messenger, when you have them in your address book and you go to leave them a message, it will tell you if they are on or off line.if u have them in address book then u must im them saying that i know u r onlne. if they replied then say that i got u, if dont then write that u were kidding. i have done it a lot of time.IM them and ask them!with YIM's "stealth settings" you can't know if they are on or offline. In Internet Explorer, click the "Tools" link at the top of the window then select "Internet Options". Click on "Content" tab at top. Under "Personal Information" on the bottom half of the window click "Auto Complete". Uncheck "Web Addresses", "Forms" and "User Names & Passwords on Forms". That prevents the Search History from being kept. To erase what's already there then below that click the "Clear Forms" and "Clear Passwords" buttons. Then click on "OK", click "Apply" and click "OK" again to close the window and save your settings.. . If you are using Firefox, click "Tools", then "Options" then "Privacy" then "Saved Forms". Click "Clear Saved Forms" to erase the saved data then uncheck the box in front of "Save information I enter....." Click "OK" to close the window and save your settings.. . If you wish to delete recent searches from the Yahoo! Search box on the Yahoo! Toolbar, click the pencil icon to the left of the Search Box then click "Clear Recent Searches". More details and options regarding Search History on Toolbar are available at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/toolbar/toolbar-10.htmllol@ask ur parents.. . Yeah... these answers pretty much work.go to the tools menu, select internet options, under the general tab, on the bottom there is a button that says clear history, press it.tools> internet options> content> auto complete> clear forms.You have to uncheck the box for 'Use inline AutoComplete' it is under Tools, Internet Options, Advanced tab!  Also you might want to clear your cookies and history as well!ASK YR PARENTS ROFL

It looks as though your IM service was linked to open in Netscape 4.8 and by deleting that and not setting a new browser within the IM program it will not function. It works the same as you creating a file in my documents and then putting a shortcut onto your desktop. If you then delete the original document your desktop shortcut will no longer work and the only way to remedy this is to put in a new file with the same name or set up a new shortcut to a new document.It could be either you disabled that feature or it could be your firewall software causing the problem
As long as they have the same number of votes, the question will remain in tiebreaker mode.  As sarcastik said, it's a rounding problem.  But the questions actually go by the number of votes, not the percents.  So the question just remains tied until someone else votes to break the tie.This is because not all percentages work out to an exact even number, there are often remainders involved so some are rounded up, others are rounded down. For example if there were three Answers, and each had one vote, that would be 33.333333% for each Answer. That would get rounded down to 33%. Two of those would make 66%. This leaves 34% remaining, which probably goes to the last Answer getting a vote so that the total adds up to 100%.May be the yahoo answers Computers gone mad.....

But so far, I like Yahoo! Answers.  It's only a matter of identifying what is right and what is not.I have to hope that the extreme ones like your severed finger example are fake. If someone is really that stupid, I hope they can't figure out how a modem works.. . As for the homework questions, I think they deserve any wrong answers they're given and I have to wonder why others go to the trouble to type out long posts to answer them.My personal pet peeve is when somebody posts a math homework problem that requires basic computation, or a question that can be answered easily using any major search engine--and especially when the answerers baby them! I don't mind helping somebody develop their skills, but I'm not going to give away the answer completely, and neither should anybody else. If anything, there should be some kind of way to discourage the coddling answerers in particular, since kids will be kids and, unfortunately, will not challenge themselves the way they should--I didn't when I was a kid! (though I would never have had anybody else do my homework, because it was a pride issue and partly because it was easy--I didn't always choose classes that challenged me) If these people really think school is that useless, they're sure making their own assessment come true.. . Another problem, I've noticed, is that a lot of people weigh in with their personal opinions rather than contributing well-documented facts--this can be a hard trap to avoid, I've been guilty, and I think it's because I'm too used to answering math questions, where due to my educational background I can often answer confidently from my own knowledge without feeling the need to cite sources (and since my subject is based far more on logic than on documented facts). Unfortunately, there are several superficially accessible subjects--esp. politics, philosophy, and psychology--where many of us too easily THINK we know what we're talking about. I think 2 points for every crap answer somebody posts is still too much--it penalizes me for not weighing in unless I feel I have something to say.. . There are also a few cases of people posting nonsense. Besides heavier monitoring, it would be interesting to experiment with negative ratings of questions and answers, like on sites such as Digg. But, of course, that would probably backfire due to all the trolls that no doubt lurk about.. . Perhaps we could have "layers", like inner circles that grant membership to the serious users. But no matter what implementation you try, something will go wrong. (sigh) What's the use? Might as well just try to exercise discretion and discriminating taste.. . I, too, like Yahoo! Answers for the times when it works right: when somebody wonders something I, or any other thinking person not specializing in a particular field might wonder, and people with more expertise weigh in. At least, I figure that's what it's for. I'm sure it's different things to different people.i hope not, if that the case I will never on here againYou seem to enjoy it. The points required to achieve the next level increase expotentially. It takes more points to go from level 2 to level 3 than it did to go from level 1 to level 2. Wait until you get to level 6 and are trying to make it to level 7; that's when you have to get a lot of "Best Answers" and "Thumbs Up" ratings to help you out. Not sure about the Yahoo ones, but Flickr anyway shows only the LATEST 3 (or 4, or 6) photos you've added to your Flickr.. So the only way to change which particular ones show would be to delete an old one from Flickr entirely, then readd it, so it is the "latest".. . Go to your "My Friends" link find the person you want to remove click on the edit link(pencil icon) and press where it says remove this person ( you have the option to remove them from your Y Mail address book too) . If you do not want any contact from that person at all I sugest putting them in ignore first and then removing them. the ignore this person link is on their 360 profileGo to your Yahoo 360 home page and click on "My Friends" at the top of the page. This will give you a list of your friends. Click the link "Edit Settings" on the right for the line with the friend you want to remove. In that page is a link to remove him/her from your friend list.

DONT DO ITwell...you probably wouldn't wanna do that but, I'm not gonna tell you what's right for you or not.  Anyway you can stick your finger or a toothbrush up your throat (but not all the way) you might choke or throw-up but I'm not sure.. If you throw-up without being sick you probably don't eat healthy or just haven't been eating at the right time.Don't try it. Once you start down that path it is hard to get back on the right path. Bulimia is not the way to accomplish anything. Here are some of the changes that occur when you binge and purge:. · Fatigue and lack of energy . · Amenorrhea(loss of menstruation) and irregular menstruation . · Dizziness . · Headaches . · Dehydration . · Constipation and diarrhea . · Shortness of breath . · Irregular heartbeats . · Depression . · Tears of esophagus . · Hair loss . · Stomach pain and bloating. · Erosion of teeth enamel . · Chronic sore throat . · Kidney and liver damage . · Parotid gland enlargement . · Electrolyte imbalances . · Cathartic colon (caused from laxative abuse) . · Edema (swelling of hands and feet) . · Low blood pressure . · Chest pains . · Development of peptic ulcers and pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas) . · Gastric dilation and rupture . · Abrasions on back of hands and knuckles . · Anemia . · Cardiac arrest and death. . . . Going without food is not the answer either. Anorexia can cause:. · Fatigue and lack of energy . · Amenorrhea(loss of menstruation) . · Skin problems . · Dizziness and headaches . · Dehydration . · Shortness of breath . · Irregular heartbeats . · Cold hands and feet . · Bloating . · Constipation . · Hair loss . · Stomach pains . · Decreased metabolic rate . · Edema (water retention) . · Lanugo(fine downy hair) . · Loss of bone mass . · Kidney and liver damage. · Electrolyte imbalances . · Osteoporosis . · Insomnia . · Anemias . · Infertility . · Depression . · Cathartic colon(caused from laxative abuse) . · Low potassium (most common cause of nocturnal cardiac arrest) . · Cardiac arrest and death . . You may remember Terri Schiavo and the debate between her husband and family about whether or not to take her off life support. She had been living in a nursing home for a  long time and was practically a vegetable. The way she ended up there was because she had been suffering from eating disorders for some time. She collapsed one day and ended up in the nursing home.. What ever you hope to accomplish by purging will NOT be worth the consequences! Even a short time of this will take a toll on your body. It is also very addictive. You may start with the intention of stopping as soon as you reach your goal, but by the time you get there your body will be accustomed to purging and you will feel like you need to.. Please, do not try this!

Go to options on top of yahoo. Then you will see forward account. Click on it and it will walk you through.As explained at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/pop/pop-40.html you can not use Outlook Express or any other third party e-mail clients with the free, web-based version of Yahoo! Mail. If you need to be able to do this you will have to upgrade to the paid Yahoo! Mail Plus service, it offers the POP requirements necessary to use programs like Outlook Express and Thunderbird. It costs about $20 per year, you can enroll at the bottom of the following information page. http://mailplus.mail.yahoo.com/. . If you already subscribe to a premium Yahoo! e-mail plan, check http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/pop/index.html to find POP settings.Stick with yahoo its better
You are in the wrong category. The Yahoo! Answers category is for questions about Yahoo! Answers ONLY. The History category under the Arts & Humanities section might be a better place to ask your question. http://answers.yahoo.com/dir/;_ylt=AmAKg7E3LLm2WNHh2dMzvJXpy6IX?link=list&sid=396545012 (Or maybe Homework Help, under Education & Reference) You'll get more & better answers in that category from people who actually know about the subject.What is now the modern state of Louisiana became part of the US as part of the Louisiana Purchase from Napoleon in 1803. There were two sections the Orleans Territory which is the basis of the modern state of Louisiana and the District of Louisiana which became surrounding states. Louisiana became a state in 1812 because it qualified under the guidelines for statehood and it is better to be a state than a territory.

Do your best.  You get two points for each answer.  You get 10 points when your answer is chosen as a Best Answer.  . . So, click on Home ( http://answers.yahoo.com/;_ylt=AhK8GXI5v.wWlR2At4vJEmMazKIX ), check out the questions, find something that you know about, answer the question the best that you can, check for spelling, preview your question, and submit. . . When you have answered all the questions that you can, scroll down the page and rate other people's answers.  You get one point for rating.  . . Then scroll down again and help choose a best answer by voting for those answers that you feel are best.  Choose those questions that you KNOW something about.. . Here is a list of the point system:. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system;_ylt=AsYX9Vb7DjG_Tmc7yQeRIPLsy6IX. . Good luck! To delete the critera that you actually "searched" for in the "search box" you double click in the "search bar" and there will be a list of things you searched for. Highlight the ones you dont want and hit the "delete" key on your keybaord.In Internet Explorer, click the "Tools" link at the top of the window then select "Internet Options". Click on "Content" tab at top. Under "Personal Information" on the bottom half of the window click "Auto Complete". Uncheck "Web Addresses", "Forms" and "User Names & Passwords on Forms". That prevents the Search History from being kept. To erase what's already there then below that click the "Clear Forms" and "Clear Passwords" buttons. Then click on "OK", click "Apply" and click "OK" again to close the window and save your settings.. . If you are using Firefox, click "Tools", then "Options" then "Privacy" then "Saved Forms". Click "Clear Saved Forms" to erase the saved data then uncheck the box in front of "Save information I enter....." Click "OK" to close the window and save your settings.. . If you wish to delete recent searches from the Yahoo! Search box on the Yahoo! Toolbar, click the pencil icon to the left of the Search Box then click "Clear Recent Searches". More details and options regarding Search History on Toolbar are available at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/toolbar/toolbar-10.htmlYou go into the icon that is next to the favorites icon it is like a clock with a green arrow click it andd you view the history then delete it that is one way.
You can select Uninstall from the pencil menu in Yahoo! Toolbar. (or go to Add/Remove Programs)In windows, go to Control Panel, Add/Remove Programs, and uninstall Yahoo Toolbar.

You also may have successfully downloaded it but not know where it went. This happens all the time. I reccommend using firefox, because it just puts everything on the desktop (by the way, I downloaded messenger fine with firefox). . There's also the problem of being able to download the file, and then once you open it, it won't do anything. To remedy this, right click on the file and click Run As, select the different user option, and run it under Administrator, I learned this after about five months of beating my head against the wall. It's generally the same way with all yahoo software.

In Internet Explorer go to the top menu and click on "tools", go to "Internet options" at the bottom, this should bring up a window, choose the "privacy" tabbed menu. at the bottom you'll see a check box to turn on and off pop-ups. You also have an settings option where you can add sites that you do not want the pop-up blocker to work on.. . The above is identical for the most part for Mozilla Firefox as well, instead of "internet options" you'll have just "options", and on the tabbed menu it's "web features" instead of "privacy".each blocker has it's own instructionsgo to tools. go to pop up blocker. then to pop up blocker settings. should be stuff there or. . when its blocked there is a square with an x in the bottom bar. right click on it and allow popup blocker to be turned off temporary.in your tool bar at the top it probably looks like a box with an arrow next to it click it or you can drag your mouse across all of the functions at the top tool bar and see what each of them say.hey stupit listen to me first you click on the tools button then you click on pop up blockers then youll know what to do.If you have Yahoo! toolbar click on the popup blocker logo and un check enable popup blocker.

A couple of weeks ago the scoring system was changed increasing the points deduction to 5 for asking a question. In compensation, the points earned by selecting a best answer has increased to 3. You already have 132 points so now you need 118 more points to get to level two.  And the only way you can move up a level is to keep answering questions and voting on answers etc.  In level two you get to answer and ask more questions then you get to answer in level one. If you are using Internet Explorer, Mozilla, or Opera it could be that they need to be updated or you may have some spyware or something in your computer. I found that after I updated everything and ran spybot it seemed to work alot better. If you do not have spyboy I would recommend getting it, it is free to download here is the download link to the site. just try these things and see if that works for you.. . http://www.safer-networking.org/en/mirrors/index.htmlYou could have a problem with a corrupted file in the program too..or maybe a virus/Trojan highjacked it and is closing off certain functions.  If all else fails try uninstalling it and reinstalling it.  Sometimes its that easy, especially if all else fails.  There are other avenues besides spybot....I like to run the Trend "Free Housecall" every now and then or I may download the free version of AVG (You can either keep it or delete it when you are done running - It's actually a very good free anti virus/spyware program).  I had problems before and both of these programs found problems that my other "protection" did not.

If you click on my profile and go to my 360 I have a tutorial on how to do a back ground in a blog post . I cant give you the code here as Y Answers eats the code. . If you are wanting to add your own background as a Theme sorry  you cant do that but there are over 60+ Themes I am sure at least one is suitableYou can add a background image to a blog entry by using HTML.. . After you have your background image uploaded somewhere on the web, you can compose a new blog entry.  . . Then, you'll need to click on the "View HTML Source" checkbox in bottom left-hand corner of the blog editor.  This will let you enter the needed html.. . You can then add the following code to your blog:. . <-- Start of code. . <table background="http://YOUR_PICTURE_URL">. <tr>. <td>. ENTER BLOG TEXT. </td>. </tr>. </table>. . <-- End of code. . Replace "http://YOUR_PICTURE_URL" with the location of where you uploaded the image you want to use as your background.  . . Out of consideration of others, please remember to keep your web images small.

I don't think you can delete the old one.  Just start a new one and don't go to the old one.http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/edit/edit-23.html here to cancel. Then just sign up a new one.According to http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/access/access-04.html if you wish to delete an account you can simply wait several months and hope Yahoo! does it for you. Or .... . If you want to terminate a Yahoo! account immediately, follow these three steps.. First, cancel any and all paid services you have with that account. . Second, delete ALL personal information anywhere on Yahoo!. . Third, go to http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/edit/edit-23.html and follow the instructions on the page. Read the entire page and be sure you understand everything, including the reasons for the first two steps that I outlined above. A link for the Yahoo "Account Deletion" page is there. There is no way of reversing the process once you've finished.. . Once you've finished, be sure you are logged out of Yahoo! then go to https://edit.yahoo.com/config/eval_registerJust don't log into your account for 90 days & it will automatically delete itself.  To get a new account, sign completely out of Yahoo, & go to mail.yahoo.com.  Instead of signing in like you normally do, click on the button asking you to sign up for an account.

you're not being hijacked. it happened to me once, and i figured how to get back in mi user.Just type in the URL link to the page that you WANT to go to....your home page...then once you are there go to the top of your screen above your toolbar of your browser and find the word TOOLS...click on that and then on INTERNET OPTIONS...the box that pops up will have at the top of it an address bar for you to put in the URL for the page that you want to use as your home page...check to see what URL is in there...if it is the correct one then just click on the USE CURRENT button...if it is NOT the correct URL...type in the correct one and then click on USE CURRENT....then at the bottom of that box click on APPLY. I had the same problem by the way Kodak imaging wants to save as it's own file extension not as a jpeg you have to make it save it as a jpeg. 360 only accepts jpegs on the "browse" option in the blog compose and in your personal pictures. but you can place multiple pictures on your blog entry of any type look at this tutorial http://blog.360.yahoo.com/blog-yhchwiM5cqHhPNgOYmmEm6cL5.gKaJ0h?p=16open them, then save them as jpg. If you are talking about your work email, talk to your company's Helpdesk or IT staff since many companies make backups of their company data either nightly or weekly. If you're talking about your personal or ISP account, you are probably out of luck. Sounds like your asking about alerts within Yahoo Messenger.  If so, click on the "Messenger" menu in the main Messenger window, then choose "Preferences" and then click the "Alerts & Sounds" category. It's basically their way of saying "I'll choose your answer as the best answer".. . Most people say "The first person to give the right answer gets 10 points". Someone may answer a question correctly, but with more detail later, so they would expect to get the 10 points for giving the "best answer". Saying "The first person to give the right answer gets 10 points" means that they asker will choose (not letting it go for a public vote) and they will choose the first one, regardless of additional information or sources.Because they are dumb. Create different categories for all your friends.  Put the person you don't want to have access to your blog into a separate category (ex. Uncatagorized).  When you choose which categories can access your 360? blog, leave his/her category unchecked.  This person will be the only one who can't access your blog.  Any other people put into that same category won't have access either.

Toolbar, click on the little pencil image on right of the big red Y. You should see a menu open with a list of options. And different opinions are always good...you can take advice from several to solve your problem/get your answer, or just go with the one that suits  you best!To put their two cents in. Sometimes it's because the question is too difficult or specific, like you said.  Other times it's because the person asking the question wants a real person's opinion, or they want a bunch of different answers, so in a way, they get to pick the one they like best.  I think people post on here for opinions, like you did. =)Either they don't know how to do an internet search (idiots) or they want someone else to do the legwork for them (lazy bums).    I think answering them is an opportunity to practice my reference librarian skills.The first answer is of course Yes, using a web search engine is easier and very effective in many cases. . . However, I meet lots of people everyday, in "real life", who don't know how to search. Some are not aware of the special search tools, and some are like my mum, who expects to get exactly what she needs just by typing a word in the search box :-P and of course, gets easily discouraged when she doesn't.. . In addition, I guess Yahoo Answers is about more than just data. When I give an answer, even if it is for a fact-based question, I try to include some personal input, a link to related concepts, or just an opinion. That makes the contents of the answer richer than what wikipedia or google could provide. . How many people does it take to answer "42."  In math, we can add how we arrived at it, but that's probably going to be done early on.  . . Then, too, in the purely factual, who's going to bother to vote on it unless they know they answer?  Only a point-grabber who is only doing it for points. . . And points is really far secondary to the quality of answers we get to the questions we really want answered.. . Then, too, probably a lot of people sign on, don't really get interested, and never sign on again to see the answer.  I'm sure this is true of people who get questions rejected for obscenity or obvious solicitation.  Those, too, are not what this site is about.. . This site is about what a magical tool communication can be when it is done with good manners.  That's really all "Community Guidelines" says; have good manners, and ask any question you want. you can't, yahoo feels that, to get the best answers and give others a chance to answer, you should keep the question open for a day or more (just try to, it will give you a message similar to this). if you want people to stop answering, you could delete the question, but then the question is gone, so, just wait a few hours and you can choose a best answer or send it to a voteYou cannot. Once a question has been asked it must remain open for a full 24 hours before it can be closed. This allows more people an opportunity to answer your question, and gives you more answers.

A Widget, in the context of Yahoo Widgets, is a software plug-in that adds a new feature to your Windows desktop. You can display several Widgets on your desktop at once.. . Examples of Widgets are clocks, calendars, sticky notes, etc.A widget is a small, single tasked Java based applet that runs on Yahoo! Widget Engine. They are designed to make your life easier.. . Widgets provide you with information on a variety of subjects, based on what their purpose is. They can do things like link up with a news or weather feed via XML or RSS,  or tell you what time  it is. . . Some of the more interesting widgets I have downloaded allow me to post to my Yahoo! 360 blog (Yahoo! Notepad widget)  or send cool flickr pix to my personal or Live Journal blog (Picture  Frame widget).. . There is even syncronization with your calendar application available on your desktop via the Day Planner Widget.OMAC is right, . . BUT in simple words, Widget is a collection of desktop softwares which you can use without opening browsers. Its usefull when you want information right on your desktop without opening IE. . . You can see your yahoo notepad, addressbook, calender, photos, check your mail all on your desktop.. . Ofcourse you can go to browser for detailed description of them on clicking them.Widget is a "placeholder" name for any small device.  It's not any specific thing, but a name used to decribe any small machine or device.Check out this site.. . Will tell you everything about the Yahoo! Widgets.. . http://widgets.yahoo.com/Widget is a small mechanical device or control.Dictionary definition is :. 1.  unnamed device: any little device or mechanism, especially one whose name is unknown or forgotten (humorous)  . 2.  object: a hypothetical manufactured object, considered to represent the typical product of a manufacturerA certain beer company here in the UK named a device in their beer cans as a Widget. The thing that allows the can to pour like a real beer pump...or so they thought.A small Glaswegian person of low intelligence.It's in the bottom of cans of beer and it froths it. In Guinnes and John Smiths. Stuff like that1. A meta-thing. Used to stand for a real object in didactic. examples (especially database tutorials). Legend has it that. the original widgets were holders for buggy whips. "But. suppose the parts list for a widget has 52 entries...". . 2. [possibly evoking "window gadget"] In graphical user. interfaces, a combination of a graphic symbol and some program. code to perform a specific function. E.g. a scroll-bar or. button. Windowing systems usually provide widget libraries. containing commonly used widgets drawn in a certain style and. with consistent behaviour.. . n. 1. A meta-thing. Used to stand for a real object in. didactic examples (especially database tutorials). Legend has it. that the original widgets were holders for buggy whips. "But. suppose the parts list for a widget has 52 entries...." 2. [poss.. evoking `window gadget'] A user interface object in {X} graphical. user interfaces.

After messenger has opened goto. FILE - SIGN OUT . then sign in with your other handle - this new handle MUST already exist. Oh, here's a tip for free, you can also use WINDOWS MESSENGER at the same time so have 2 handles active at onceThe good thing is, you can actually be on both at the same time!!!!  You can use your downloaded messenger to log on 1 ID and use web messenger like www.e-messenger.com to log in another ID.    . . There's another way that you can be on by being online on 1 messenger.  And that is incorporate 1 of your id to the other one.  The disadvantage of this is that, you will only have 1 email address but two IDs.  So, it's like you have 2 profiles in 1 account.  That's what I did.  If for example your friend will send you an email using your secondary id, you won't be able to get it since it only recognize the primary email address.  But your friends can send instant mesages on both IDs though.  If you choose this, you will lose the emails that you had on the secondary id since you need to close the account and then make a new profile on the other ID.  . . Just think it over what's best for you.  . . 1.) is 2 ids with 2 emails using 2 messengers (downloaded and the web messenger).. 2.) 1 email address with 2 or even more IDs and be online at the same time on 1 messenger.  you can even choose to make 1 profile inactive at any time. . . If you don't mind switching from one ID to another, Make sure you sign-out first before you sign-in to the other ID.  . . Hope this helps!You should be  able to sign out from one ID and then sign back in w/ your other ID and password. We have 3 ID's that use messenger on our pc. Different people are sensitive to different subjects.. . Some do not like discussions about religion. Some do not like discussions about sex. Some do not like personal questions from strangers (unless they are interested in persuing a relationship). . Then there are those that will answer any question you pose just because they want to feel special.. . Pretty much, if you feel comfortable asking then ask.  If you do not get an answer to your satisfaction, either ask another question to draw it out, or realize that person did not want to answer.If you ask yourself if it's too personal, it probably is.  If you'd be even slightly uncomfortable answering, it probably is too.
log into email, at the top(or bottom) of each email their should be a "forward button" click that.  Then the screen changes and you enter in the information such as email address you are sending it to, subject, etc. Then click sendWhen forwarding a message, you can forward either as an attachment or as inline text. If you forward as an attachment, your recipient will need to save or open the attachment in order to view the message. If you forward as inline text, the text of the message will appear quoted within the body of the message that you send, set off by ">" characters on the left margin. . To forward a message which itself includes an attachment, choose the "Attachment" option rather than "Inline Text." Forwarding as an attachment will preserve the whole of the original message, including all of its attachments. . . To forward a message, begin by opening the message on your screen. When you have the message open: . . Choose whether you would like to forward the message as an attachment or as inline text by clicking the down arrow on the "Forward" button and selecting "As Inline Text" or "As Attachment". . . Click the "Forward" button. This will open a Compose Mail window. If you have chosen to forward as an attachment, the Compose Mail window will be blank. If you have chosen "Inline Text," the Compose Mail window will contain the text of the forwarded message. . . In the To:, Cc:, and Bcc: fields, enter the email addresses of your intended recipients. . . In the message window, type any additional text you would like to include. . . Click the "Send" button. . *If you would like to set inline text as your default rather than attachment, click the Click the "Mail Options" link located on the top-right side of the mail main page, choose "General Preferences" scroll down to the Forwarding header, and select "Inline Text." Be sure to click the "Save" button at the bottom of the Preferences window to put your new settings into effect.

If you did not enter it then you did not win.  I'd say there is about a 99.999% chance that it is an outright fraud. Don't even reply to it, that only confirms your address.  Delete that thing as fast as you can.Here's some signs of a lotto scam:. . *You never paid money or bought a ticket to enter.. *Your "winning" notification is probably not personalized.. *Your "winning" notification came by email, probably from a free email address such as yahoo.com or msn.com.. . If you answer the email, after one or two email exchanges with the so-called "lottery officials" or "claims agent," perhaps accompianied by some official looking but fake documents, you'll be asked to pay fees for "taxes" or "handling" or some other reason. This is the scam - you pay the fees and never see any winnings, mainly because there are none to see.They are all frauds. If you didn't enter the lottery, you can't win. This is a scam that takes people for all of their money. Ignore it. Go to www.snopes.com for more informationIf you didn't enter it, the contest is a fraud. Watch out for viruses! Usually I've found that the default setting has some notification sound, but you can got to Preferences in Messsenger and set it on. Even select the type of sound you prefer.From the Messenger Menu select preferences. Select Alerts & Sounds in the left pane. You will see a checkbox "Enable alert sounds", first make sure that is checked. . Secondly you will see a list of Messenger events, like "A messenger contact goes offline". Select each of these and then you can customize what happens for each event. You can display a dialog, play a sound or other things. For playing a sound you can use the pre-packaged sounds that come with messenger or use your own .wav files.In the main messenger window choose the "Messenger" menu and select "Preferences".  Click on the category "Alerts & Sounds" in the left side pane.  You can customize various audio alerts from there.

Compose your email and in body of the email (where you normally type what you want) Make sure the curser is in the body and then hit "Ctrl" & "V"  Then you will just have what you want to send to your friends and family without all the other "forwards."Delete the parts of the email that you don't want to forward.Copy the joke/message into a new email, then send it on.Click your left mouse key while scolling through unwanted text, so that it highlights info that you're wanting to delete.  With unwanted text highlighted, click "Delete".  That way your e-mail is cleaned-up, and all your left with is your own message and reply:)

dont use them for a month and they will go awaygo to your inbox, check off the ones you want to delete, then click delete. simple as that.https://edit.yahoo.com/config/delete_user. . this will delete your account. . . Oh, but make sure you're signed into the account you want to delete first.  I mean, if you want to keep this account you're using for Answers, sign out of it & sign into the account you want to get rid of & then click on that link & follow the directions.Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account. . . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in: . . Yahoo! Mail . Yahoo! Address Book . Yahoo! HotJobs . GeoCities . Yahoo! Briefcase . My Yahoo! . Yahoo! Groups . Finance Portfolio . Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account. . . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . If you are subscribed to any premium services, we recommend that you first cancel those premium services before you delete your account. There is no guarantee that deleting your Yahoo! account will immediately cancel the billing for any premium services you may be subscribed to. To cancel your current subscriptions, visit Yahoo! Billing Information for your account, choose the "My Services" tab, and click the "Cancel" link for each subscription. . . To remove your entire account, please visit our Account Deletion page. You will be asked to sign in to or verify your password for the account you wish to delete. Please be sure to read the next page carefully, as important information about your account is included. You can then confirm the deletion of your account. . . If you're having trouble signing in, you can get password help on the Sign-in and Registration Help page.. . Please complete the deletion process only if you are certain you would like to remove your entire Yahoo! account and any features you have personalized within the account. After the deletion process is initiated, your Yahoo! account can never be recovered.to delete your email address: leave it there for a few months and (hopefully) it will die. RESTART and all will be fine, Mr. WINDOWS !!!Is this the MSN Messenger? If there are a couple of things you should kknow. First MSN is a product of Microsoft. It is used for the .Net Passport, which is used for many differnat programs within the Microsoft network. For example, Hotmail, MSN Messenger, Microsoft Updade, Microsoft Help and Support, Microsoft Courses, and many other services are reached by the .Net Passport. Usually your Hotmail address is called your .Net Passport "Credentials" which allows you to sign in and have access to the many differant services the Microsoft Network provides. It also provides access to message boards. . . However, the is another messenger created by Microsoft and it is in your computer, connected to Outlook and/or Outlook Express. If you have Internet Explorer you have the Windows Messenger as well. Windows Messenger is a part of Outlook Express and comes bundled with the browser.. . While signing up for Hotmail it is possible to accidently activate Windows Messenger as well. I know as I did this with my last computer myself. I would consistantly get these messages that I was being signed out of MSN Messenger as I had been signed in at another location. The "other location" is another location on the Microsoft Network, and is specifically from Windows Messenger being activated in some manner.. . My problem occurred during my sign up for a .Net Passport while creating my account on my new computer. While signing up you are given an option of using an address you already own or have the exclusive use of. I had an account through my ISP which at that time was SBC. However, when I tried to use that address with the .Net Passport Wizard it gave me an error message stating that address was owned by somebody else and I could not use it. I spent a long time trying to get that address accepted but it never was. So, I then went and put in another address I created on the spot but I used a .net at the end of the Hotmail account when Hotmail uses .com. It eccepted the address, but when I went to sign in using that address to "authenticate" it, I was locked out of that account due to Hotmail not using .net at the end of addresses. Which I find strange as it is called the .Net Passport which leads one to believe you need a .net at the end of the address, right? . . I ended up creating another address using .com, I just changed the other address from .net to .com and it was accepted, I validated it as mine, got my Hotmail account, downloaded the MSN Messenger and thought everthing was fine. Untill I began having these messeges stating I had been signed out and back in somewhere else. . . This problem was never really resolved for me. I was instructed to just resign in with the credentials I regularly use each time this occurred. So, I would have to occassionly get disconnected a few moments while I reconnected again. I just worked with the situation untill I got a new computer and made sure to use my existing Hotmail credentials, and not activate Windows Messenger. So far so good.. . Hopefully somebody here will have the second part of this answer for you, and that is how to get Windows Messneger de-activated. Even the Dell Techs at the Dell Help Desk could not get this fixed for me, nor did Microsoft Knowlege base help either, or the techs at Microsoft return my e-mails in regard to this issue. . . Good luck in getting this fixed. If you can't just do what I did, quickly enter your regular address and click "connect" and you are reconnected.. . Hopefully Microsoft will address this issue at some point. If they have already addressed it, they should make the task of finding the answer much easier.It's a security feature, just log back on.Restart

Maybe they didn't like the answer they got.. . Hehe....I like how you have the point system figured out thoughThere are a few different reasons.. . One would be that the person who asked the question doesn't want it to show up in his/her profile, and the only way to get rid of it is to delete the question while it is still open.. . Another reason would be that the question got many poor answers also, and the asker is sick of receiving notification emails about them.. . Once I deleted a question simply because the answerer copied and pasted from Wikipedia without crediting it properly. In that case, I didn't want to give the person credit but realized the question probably wouldn't be answered any better.. . It's also possible that the asker found the answer on his/her own and didn't even bother to look at the good answers recieved but just deleted it.. . Some people don't know about the points system, and some aren't concerned about a measly five points. Different people have different reasons. I agree soda will not work on the rust, but I seriously doubt heating it up is safe. The best (and cheapest) way to go is with some common acid, like vinegar or pure lemon juice (not lemonade since it's diluted in water). The acid will react with the rust and decompose it.Use liquid wrench. Soak & let set overnight. If you don't have liquid wrench try WD-40. Not as good but it might do the trick.Wd-40 is a water displacer... liquid wrench ain't much better.... these do NOT work on rust.... nor soda.. try some pb blaster.. if that doesn't work then try heating it up and knocking it off...., some will melt a little wax down between there. Be careful to not burn the lower oil seal on the crank. other then that.... cutting and using a puller may have to be done.I've heard that coca cola removes rust.

Go to your Yahoo Mail account.  Click on the "Options" link in the upper right corner.  Click on the "Vacation Response" link in the Management column.  Finally, click the "Turn Auto-Response Off" button.Exactly HOW to do this is a widely diverse as all the different types of email software out there.  Generally speaking, however, the option to rescind an away message is in the same menu or list that gave you the option to leave the away message.

I find short and succinct is the way to go. Easier to read and understand. Depends on the question though. More detailed questions require more detailed answersThere are several reasons, starting with those who merely cut and paste from another site.  It takes no extra effort to cut 3 pages than it does 3 sentences.. Then there are the people who could not summarize or do not know the topic well enough.  They do not know when to stop.. And then there are the fanatics who believe that everyone is just hanging on every word and they must give 3 years of history behind every answer.. Lastly are the answers which must have a lengthy answer to do them justice.  No cut and paste, no misinformation, no extra BS, no fanatical ramblings – just a moderate to lengthy answer, honest and as much to the point as possible.I think a long answers is good if it shows that the person has really thought about your question. Unfortunately 9 times out of 10 a 'long answer' is simply a cut 'n' paste from Wikipedia.I'm one of the ones you mean, and I will defend myself on this.. . If you get a lot of short answers, there's a good chance you find what you needed to know there, and you don't have to read the long one.  But this question and its answer is also being archived for future reference.  So "category > resolved" questions, neatly arranged (we hope, eventually) by the index position, will result in a large body of useful knowledge.  And some people may want more detail than the original answerer did.  Since it's not always easy to say something in just a few words, I will take my time.  Whether you take your time to read it is of little concern, unless I'm playing just for points.Objective questions can be given objective answers. And objectionable (!) Questions will also receive brief tongue-in-cheek replies.. But others ?. Some answers will certainly not be fun for others to read, but will convey ALL that the Questioner NEEDS to know. . ...If you find these boring, just move on to the next, dear :. 'One person's food can seem another's poison' !True.Sometimes questions do require a long answer. Most times I agree it's over kill. Just like me answering this question.. It doesn't need all this just to get the point across.. The first sentence woulda been good enough.. LOLPeople like me give long answers because they believe that they are truly helping a person in need. I give long answers because the questioner often doesn't understand what they are asking. I explain the answer so that they won't have any follow up questions. Let's look at your case. You do not understand why people leave such long answers. The first person to answer your question said, "True". Which is hardly an answer to your question, he is simply stating his affirmation to your question in an attempt to grab at two points. Did it help your situation? No. My answer, however, goes in depth and explains a person's motives for answering a question in lengthy detail. Your question may not be of much significance, but somewhere, there is somebody who's father is dying of cancer and can't find any help because people are simply saying "true" to their questions. I and many other people like me are devoted to helping them find their answer. Does that answer your question?. . there isn't really a normal count when trying to concieve. during the "act", there can be anywhere between 7 and 30 million trying to fertilize the egg.400 million / cu cc.. . at 2-3 cu cc. / ejection.. . A sperm count 200 million!!!/cu cc. would be LOW. the reason being sperms need to support each other until one 'em makes it.A normal sperm count is between 20 million and 150 million sperm per millilitre. A sperm count below 20 million sperm per millilitre is low and may indicate a fertility problem. Men with low counts can still father children but their chances are lower.mouthful

   New questions are added to the list in chronological order, that means a new question goes to the top of the list. While you are looking at all the questions on a page 10 more questions might be asked, these would go in front of the list you are looking at pushing them farther back. Once you go to change pages that change in position shows up.Hit refresh on your screenBecause of the questions posted every single second, the list grows so fast that when you change to page page one has got so big it has been almost filled with new questions

microfiche are sumthing u can only physically use in a libry or sumthing that holds the records like a libry.. . u can use the internet to research ur family tree but it depends what ur actually lookin for cos there are thousands of websites.  i work in a genealogy centre in a libry in britain so if u want help for british records then i can help-click on my profile to contact me.  . . this help goes for any1A microfiche is a manual viewer where you put a slide (with pages greatly reduced on it) into a viewer and see the result on a big screen (the page is magnified greatly).. . On the net you will not use a microfiche itself but rather see pages that have been scanned.. . If you want to actually use a microfiche you need to go to the records hall in person.

When the Yahoo! Widget Engine (YWE) starts, it launches the Widgets that were running when the YWE was stopped. So, if the Weather Widget wasn't running when you stopped the YWE (perhaps you right-clicked on the Weather Widget and chose Close Widget?), then that explains why it does not appear when you start the YWEPossible explanation is you have closed weather widget.. All widget can be closed..
