To encourage participation and reward great answers, Yahoo! Answers has a system of points and levels. The number of points you get depends on the specific action you take. The points table below summarizes the point values for different actions. While you can't use points to buy or redeem anything, they do allow everyone to recognize how active and helpful you've been. (And they give you another excuse to brag to your friends.).     Points Table. Action Points. Begin participating on Yahoo! Answers One time: 100. Ask a question -5. Choose a best answer for your question 3. No Best Answer was selected by voters on your question Points Returned: 5. Answer a question 2. Log in to Yahoo! Answers Once daily: 1. Vote for a best answer 1. Rate a best answer 1. Have your answer selected as the best answer 10. Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote (up to 50 thumbs-up are counted) 1 per "thumbs-up".  .     Levels are another way to keep track of how active you (and others) have been. The more points you accumulate, the higher your level. Yahoo! Answers recognizes your level achievements with our special brand of thank you's!. Level Yahoo! Answers Thank Yous Points. 7 Be the first to find out! 25000+. 6 Be the first to find out! 10,000 - 24,999. 5 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the home page masthead. 5,000 - 9,999. 4 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the community manager editorial page. (coming soon) 2,500-4,999. 3 A super-special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 1,000-2,499. 2 A special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 250-999. 1 Full access to Yahoo! Answers! 1-249. 0 Limited access: you cannot ask a question but have level 1 privileges 0.  .     And finally, as you attain higher levels, you'll also be able to contribute more to Yahoo! Answers - you can ask, answer, vote and rate more frequently.. Level Questions Answers Comments Rates Votes. 6, 7 * unlimited * 100 100. 5 * unlimited * 100 100. 4 20 80 40 80 80. 3 15 60 30 60 60. 2 10 40 20 40 40. 1 5 20 10 20 20. . . . When you find out can you let me know?To my knowledge you must use a 360 account.  On your Answers profile page you only have 3 options for a pic.  1) no pic, 2) a 360 pic, 3) a Yahoo avatar.. . So, using a 360 picture is a 3 step process. . 1) you'll need to create your Yahoo! 360 account.  http://360.yahoo.com. . 2) you'll need to upload a couple of pictures to your 360 page.. On your 360 page, select "My Page" from the top. Select "Edit Personal Photos" on the left hand side. Browse to your saved photo(s) (assuming you have one or more ready) to upload it.. Select the "Set as Primary" button next to the photo want displayed on other sites (like Answers) and select "Save". . 3) you'll need to display your 360 picture on Answers. Go to your "My Q&A" page, select "Edit My Info". In the "Picture" section, select "Use my Yahoo! 360 Picture" . This link will get you to that page, http://answers.yahoo.com/my/my_edit. . That should do it.Go http:/avatars.yahoo.com! (exclamation mark must be there, I think)

It's 9 Karrat gold..... standard gold is 18K to 24K.... . . 9 is lesser number and I don't think it's worth any purchasing...The higher the count like 18ct 22ct 24ct the more gold you have, I think 9ct is standard.hummm.... . gold? Gold trinkets have long been valued by people of the world. As a rare metal, gold is one of the most desired substances around and products made from gold can make great gifts and great investments... gold forms have different significance that influence the variety of gold molded shapes created, but most agree that obtaining gold is a sign of wealth and affluence.. . The value of gold is determined by its purity as well as the color in relationship to the overall market prices for the substance. While most gold is yellow, there are also several shades that occur naturally or as alloys when mixed with other precious metals. Gold purity is measured in carats, 24 carats being the highest and most pure. . . Means.. the lower the carat. the lower its gold percentage...Pure gold is 24K. 9k gold is expressed as 9/24 or approx less that 33% pure gold. The rest of the metal may be made up of silver, copper, nickel or combinations of these.

In all honesty, no one really knows.  Childhood exposure, abuse, experimentation and discovery plays a very significant role in how we form our sexual identity and opinions as adults.. . Perhaps a same sex experiment/exposure may have triggered curiosity which is later explored.  Perhaps an early childhood abuse occured that later shaped and formed identity issues, sexual worth issues or just destroyed the individuals true liberty to express themselves sexually.. . Some say that it is a genetic code for some. Perhaps one is born that way and discovers it as their true sexual preference and not by environmental exposure but rather through true love for someone of the same sex.. . Which ever the case... be true to your self not influenced by friends, piers or music videos !I'm not sure it is so much that people "become" gay so much as it is that they just come to the realization that they are gay. Or it could be that they knew they were gay but were afraid to admit it because of the stigma placed on gay individuals. There's also that thing that they thought they were gay but were never really sure and now they are. Gay isn't something that people choose ~ you either are or you aren't or you're bi ~ it isn't something you "become". It is simply the way a person is and the whole "becoming" gay is just really admitting it to oneself and others.

The scammers use various means of finding email addresses that are published openly on the internet. Guestbooks is one source they use. You can do a Google search on your email address, and if you find it displayed somewhere, that's probably where the spammers got it from. Scammers use google and also email extractor tools to get email addresses.. . They also trade lists of email addresses with each other and within their gangs, and once you are on one of those, you will continue receiving emails from scammers. If you do not want to receive scam emails to your email address, be very careful where you publish it, and only give it out to people you know. You may want to consider making a private email address that you only give to friends and family.For Scams - use common sense... . . For Spam (which usually contains the scams):. . I have used MailWasher for a couple of years and it does a great job. You can black list senders, and then bounce their email back to them as a "bad address".. . . Another, newer approach is taken by Blue-Frog.  It makes you a part of a "do not email" group and if you report spam, the Blue Security Site posts complaints on spammers' sites.. . . Both are freeware ... make sure you download the correct versions (free one).Dont answer any emails for whom you dont recognise the sender. Never give out passwords or bank details. Apart from that theres not much else you can do!Make sure you have your spam filter turned on and delete (without opening) any emails from people you don't know.If you did not request that mail or information, its a scam. If its to good to be true, its a scam. If they request "Any" personal information from you, its a scam. Block and delete mail from SCAM mailers. Report SCAM mail to your service provider
To correct bbrown's incorrect statement... Yahoo! Widgets is based on a technology formerly known as Konfabulator.  Konfabulator 1.0 was released in February, 2003.  Apple released its version of Widgets (often believed to be "borrowed" from the Konfabulator model) in April, 2005.An idea Yahoo stole from Apple--basically short cuts to information with out going online-weather, stocks, news, webcams, you name it there are over a few thousands and growing by the day! Apple came out with a while back in their new OS, now its being stolen by yahoo!In terms of "Yahoo Widgets" a widget is the name for a small application created with The Yahoo Widget Engine

Its very annoying to find mails with all forwarded addresses.. . One way to avoid it is when forwarding click on the arrow icon beside Forward and choose "As Inline Text" and delete all the addresses.. . Also, you can go to Options->General Preferences->Message Actions->and click on Forward as inline text, so that whenever you click on Forward, it automatically includes the message where you can edit it.Pretty easy.  If you are forwarding the mail as inline text, then you just highlight and press delete.  If you are getting the message that says "forward message attached" then you are sending it as an attachment.  This can be selected/deselected by clicking on the little dropdown arrow on the forward button and selecting which optiopn that you want.. . Sending as an attachment will not allow you to modify/delete the previous addresses.i usually forward emails as inline text and edit the content (deleting email addresses listed) coz it's pretty annoying to see those emails addresses from people you don't knowForward the entire email as "intext" to a new message box. Superglue works by mixing with the small water molecules that are present on even the most apprarently dry object.  Without this water, the glue will not stick.  Thus, as long as the glue is put into the tube under super-dry conditions, it will not be sticky in the tube.  Once outside of the tube, it start to dry hard, either by drawing the water from the surface of the object you are sticking or just from moisture in the air (which is why you can sometimes get the cap stuck on the top of the tube if you spill some of the glue).cuz it was told not toGreat question maybe there is some type of coating that repeals it from sticking if you find out what it is let me know.its lined with turpentineWHAT ARE YOU 5?The air dries it when it leaves the bottle.I DUNNO.ITS A GUD QUESTION.NEVER GAVE IT A THOT THO.It doesnt work on the walls of the tube.

Catgut is the name applied to cord of great toughness and tenacity prepared from the intestines of sheep/goat, or occasionally from those of the hog, horse, mule, and donkey. Those of the cat are not employed, and therefore it is supposed that the word is properly kitgut ("violin string"), kit meaning "fiddle," and that the present form has arisen through confusion with kit = cat.literally, the dried intestines of an animal, usually sheep, which is used for stringing tennis racquets, and was also used in surgery for stitching.cat gut is sometimes used for tennis rackets for the part where you hit the ball with. it is made from the *ugh, shiver* intestines of a sheep, or sometimes from other animals, but not CATS! They can also be made for violin, viola, harp, or any other kind of stringed instrument strings. you can a bit more imformation from this site:. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CatgutA strong rope made from animal intestines....ironically, not CAT.

At that  time  you can click on a question in the section "unresolved questions" and next to each answer is a button label "vote as best answer", click on the button next to the question you think is the the best answer or vote "no best answer" which is at the bottom of the list of answer.Below the Discover Something New section which has resolved questions you'll find Pick the Best Answer, which is the listing of questions that are in voting. In the USA, archaeology is under anthropology. In Europe and most of the world archaeology is an independed discipline. Yahoo Answers is originated in the USA. So they didn't think we can visit it outside of the USA :)...Maybe archaeology is considered a subset of anthropology. It was at my college. I majored in archaeology, but graduated with a B.A. in Anthropology. The other two subsets were: Bio Anthro (monkeys and other primates than man) and Social Anthro (other human cultures like the Yanomamo Indians of the Amazon rain forest)Thank you for a great suggestions. go to any yahoo page, and look on the top most page to search for the MY ACCOUNT option. click it, you'll be asked again for your password for security purposes. once you hit enter, you'll be redirected to a page that contains your personal information, you can change your password there.log onto yahoo. (well, actually log into your yahoo mail). at the top of the page where it says "welcome" so-and-so, under it you should see "my account" click there. it will probably prompt you for your password again, and then when it opens you account info, click where it says "change password" it will ask for your old password, and then it will ask for your new password twice. enter it twice, and click "save".

Yahoo! is an acronym for Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle.My first thought was of the Yahoos in Guliver's Travels...lol.I think the people were having trouble deciding a name for a new place on the internet and I think someone got excited about something and said yahoo! Then I think they said hey that's a good name for this new website."Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle" is a backronym for "yahoo!", but the creators of Yahoo! say that they created the name because they liked the word's general definition, which came from "Gulliver's Travels" by Jonathan Swift: "rude, unsophisticated, uncouth.""Yet Another Hierarchical Officious Oracle" is a suggested acronym, but it's a word from Gulliver's Travels which means "rude, unsophisticated, uncouth"

I was born in October 1929. Nobody told me as I was not born. about 1920 and that was 76 plus nine years ago. I don't think they progressed very far.If rhey have not progressed by now and you have found out about it. Ask the new Pope check if he knows?. Tiger."In what did the Progressives believe? Some historians have argued that the Progressives’ context was political only on its surface—that at its core it was religious, an attempt by Americans from all social classes, but chiefly the middle class, to restore the proper balance among Protestant moral values, capitalistic competition, and democratic processes, which the expansion of business in the Gilded Age seems to have changed in alarming ways. Progressives wanted better and fairer competition and they wanted every citizen to participate in the polity. Such views can be either reactionary or enlightened, depending on context, and among themselves Progressives disagreed on practically every specific proposal. In other words, they agreed on the need to foster more morality in society, but disagreed about how to accomplish it. . . What methods did Progressives use to solve these problems? In dealing with nearly every cause, Progressive leaders began by organizing a voluntary association, investigating a problem, gathering relevant facts, and analyzing according to the precepts of one of the newer social sciences. From such an analysis a proposed solution would emerge, be popularized through campaigns of education and moral suasion, and—as often as not, if it seemed to work—be taken over by some level of government as a public function. The Progressives’ approach reflected both their confidence that social science could remedy the conflicts of an industrial society and their growing faith that government could be trusted to solve problems. . . These tactics were pioneered in many cases by women who had time to devote to activities outside the home—something experienced by more and more women in this era. These women had fewer children than their mothers and were increasingly freed from full-time housework by laborsaving devices and by society’s absorption of some of the family’s traditional economic and educational functions. They also had the inclination to do so. Women recognized that in an urban, industrial setting, care of the home and family—“their” sphere—was no longer just a private matter. Most men still gave them little encouragement to participate in public life, so they invented their own means to improve the world. Beginning before the high point of Progressivism but connected to this movement, women formed many single-sex associations, the largest and most important one being the Woman’s Christian Temperance Union (WCTU). Founded in 1874 and led by Frances Willard, the WCTU began by focusing on a range of problems including the welfare of children, but later narrowed its focus to the issue of temperance. In 1889, Jane Addams founded Hull House and thus began one of the most creative products of the women’s movement (and its male allies)—settlement houses. In taking roles on the stage of public life, Progressive women gained unprecedented experience in the hard work of shaping public choices, and this experience intensified their demand for the vote that they finally achieved in 1920. . . From outside the ranks of Progressivism, other men and women also presented programs for shaping social choices in industrial America. Sometimes they joined forces with the Progressives and adopted similar methods. One of these groups was industrial workers who, compared to the middle-class Progressives, suffered greater divisions among themselves and possessed less power over others. The Knights of Labor (1869-1890) and American Federation of Labor (that began in 1886) represent two different approaches to organizing workers, with the Knights accepting workers of all skill levels, both sexes and races, while the AFL organized only skilled workers who were male and white. Both groups shared the Progressives’ goals of abolishing child labor and establishing the eight-hour day for workers.. . The Progressive Era also had a negative and coercive side. This era saw the spread of disfranchisement and seThe Progressives were a political party that was also known as the People's party. They were formed in response to the two major political parties neglecting to pass legislation that would benefit farmers in the 1890's.. Mostly, they wanted to enforce an income tax, and wanted to coin silver.. . The extent of their success was nominating WIlliam Jennings Bryan as their presidential candidate at the turn of the century when he did actually win the votes of several states.

well leaving aside the obvious: WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD YOU DO THIS - have you seen all the problems gmail is having!?. . But to answer your question since this is about "answers!" ;-). . You can only do this by signing up for a "Mail Plus" account (do this under the Mail Options menu).  It's $20/ year and then you can forward all of your incoming mail yahoo.com email to any other email address - yes, even gmail!!. . My recommendation - get the new Y! Mail beta - it's way better than gmail anyway.  you can ask to get an invite here: http://surveylink.yahoo.com/wix/p0473306.aspxIt all depends on your mail host.  Some services let you forward incoming mail based on rules to another account.  With others you can't.  What service do you use?Yahoo! doesn't offer free forwarding, like some e-mail systems do.  If you get a Mail Plus Yahoo! account, for which they charge an extra $20/year, then you get forwarding.. . The story's the same for most e-mail providers.  My ISP gives me free forwarding; many others don't.

Not sure which SMx you are speaking of.  But one SMx is a type of antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections, bronchitis, ear infections (otitis), traveler's diarrhea, and Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia.SMX is a macro processing language originally shipped with the Internet Factory's Commerce Builder software. This was a relatively popular web server in the early days of the internet, due to the ease with which a developer could produce an e-commerce website.. . Rather than re-implement websites in more popular languages, like Perl or PHP, a small group of SMX fans decided to re-implement the language itself as an Apache module.. . SMX was designed to embed macros in HTML/XML pages.. . A good example of a macro is %counter(). This embeds a simple incremental counter on an HTML page. To include the results of a SQL query on a page, you can simply type %sql(<dsn>,<query>,%col(1)<br>) in the middle of an HTML page.. . Owing to the high-level nature of the language, SMX can greatly reduce the programming effort required to build dynamic or database-driven web sites.

ypager.exe is the main process belonging to the Yahoo Instant Messenger application, an Internet messaging program. This is a non-essential process. Disabling or enabling this is down to user preferenceYahoo Pager is a free messaging service that allows u to communicate instantly with friends, family, colleagues, and others. Talk with ur friends using instant messages and even find out when they come on- or go offline. . The Pager alerts you instantly when u have new mail in ur YMail and YPersonals accounts.  ^_^

Chrome plating is a finishing treatment utilizing the electrolytic deposition of chromium. The most common form of chrome plating is the thin, decorative bright chrome, which is typically a 10 µm layer over an underlying nickel plate. It imparts a mirror-like finish to items such as metal furniture frames and automotive trim. Thicker deposits, up to 1000 µm, are called hard chrome and are used in industrial equipment to reduce friction and wear and to restore the dimensions of equipment that has experienced wear.chrome is  chromioum alloy which is meatle that wont rustit's just really really really really really shiny silver. let's say that.

(if not you will have to click the ico in the system tray to connect) AND is the setting (automatically connect) in the three tick boxes enabled?. . * Firewall, needs to be set so there's a port for the messenger program to communicate from your machine to the rest of the world. Depending on what software you use, this could require a few attempts before you get it right.. . If you have an older version of the software (even if you don't) then it might be worth going to messenger.yahoo.com and downloading the very latest version of the software, installing and running that.. . That  there is one aspect of Pharmaceutical industries that no one has thought of... I use to work at a NBC TV station.  I was the secretary in charge "Availabilities." That is what times during the broadcast day that there are openings for TV commercials.  The cost of a TV commercial is pro-rated according to the number of audience that watch TV at a certain time, also the cost is pro-rated according to the program that the commercial is played on... the time that commercial is played... i.e. at the beginning... (cost more - more watchers... than end of program... watchers turn on something else... so cost of commercial is less at the end of the program)  The age of the audience is a factor in the cost of the commercial too.  So... with all these factors... the cost of the same commercial that will be aired will vary each time it runs... during the day.  NOW the important thing to consider is... the lowest cost for a 30 second commercial to run is $50,000.00 for ONE 30 second commercial airing... and the most a 30 second commercial could be is $3,000,000.00 for a 30 second commercial to run... like in the middle of the Super Bowl Game.  If you total up the costs of one drug... that is being advertised for one day on TV... and that drug is aired 10 to 15 time in a 24 hour period... at the lowest rate of cost that is 10 x $50,000.00 = $500,000.00 A DAY for that ONE drug.  Now the drug companies make many other drugs that they advertise on TV so if ONE DRUG COMPANY advertises 5 different drugs ... 10 times a day that is 50 aired advertisments... and at the LOWEST RATE of $50,000.00 per one TV ad... that would be 50 x $50,000.00 = $2,500,000.00 a day that that drug company pays for the ads of their drug on ONE TV STATION... NOW... who do you think pays for their advertising budget??????  And with Canada that has government funded TV and no commercials, why do you think that drugs are cheaper in Canada than in the USA??????  WE ARE PAYING FOR DRUG COMPANIES TO ADVERTISE THEIR DRUGS...AND THAT IS WHY THE DRUG COMPANIES HAVE SUCH A STRONG LOBBY AND UNDER THE TABLE BOUGHT CONGRESSMEN IN WASHINGTON DC.  Maybe we should start a grass-root boycott of US drugs and buy them all in Canada... Why do you think that the government is trying to put such doubts about the validity of Canadian drugs into the minds of the US citizens?  So the US drug companies can keep their profits... and pay for their advertising... THIS SITUATION REALLY GETS ME STEAMED UP... as the US citizen is being kept in the dark... and again used for large corporate profits.Of course it is the badgering of doctors, unnecessary prescriptions and a drugged/drug resistent society. . Remember all marketing is wasteful and hurts us all.. . Imagine how much less each car would cost if the car companies wouldnt spend millions advertising all the timepeople use more drugs, which can be good or bad. doing stuff like keeping cholesterol or blood pressure in check is a good effect, but everyone and their dog thinks they have stuff like major depression and need a pill for it which is bad. also, it keeps drug costs down bc more people use drugs so they dont need to charge as much to recoup research and development costs, since those costs are divided up amongst more people using the drug.. . another thing i forgot to add, health care is being used more heavily since people are more aware of conditions and there are more drugs to treat conditions, so that is part of the reason (though there are bigger ones) that the amount of money spent on health care by citizens, insurance, and the government is rising

It uses a dictionary of words and numbers, to use against the password. The process could be quick, or it could take hours and hours. . . Only other way you can do this is if you know the person fairly well. Well enough to know their date of birth (password recovery asks for this). Then you can ask them all the questions used for the secret question. Be patient, and you can fish the info out of them. Once you have that, then you can change their email. . . If your like me, I did this to an ex-girlfriend. She cheated on me and I got her back. Once I broke into her email, I was fortunate enough to find job applications and her bank account login information. I got her social security number, and drivers license number. I was then able to pull her credit reports and found out she has horrible credit, has major problems paying bills at all (collection accounts and delinquencies). I also used my ex's account to send threatening and lewd emails with nasty pictures to her friends and relatives. All the jobs she just applied for I sent lewd and nasty emails. She didn't get the jobs.  I ended up selling her info to someone I know, they said they ended up giving her info to a scam artist company who cleaned out her banking account. . . So hacking can be more than just reading their little love notes. You might even stumble upon personal information in the emails. . . She accused me of doing it, but I said "prove it". . She was too stupid to even know they could've traced me. . . Oh well, good luck with hacking.I certainly hope it is not possible.

Once your question has been open for 24 hours, you'll have the option to put the question to a vote. You'll be able to do so by going to 'My Q&A,' and clicking on the question you'de like to put to a vote. The option to put it to a vote should appear in the upper right hand corner.You can put a question up for a vote when there are two or more answers to your question. To let people start voting click: Call a Vote.

All you have to do is sign out of your account, and then sign up for another one as if you never had the first.yes just make up a new yahoo id and only give it out for buisness purposes.Yep, you can create another account.. . you actually have an option to use 2 email addresses under one account. . . here's what you do:. . 1. sign in to your yahoo mail (current). 2. click on options. 3. choose mail options. 4. under mail options, and under mail management, go to mail addresses. 5. you can add your business email address from there.. . after that, you'll be able to sign in to your account using either ID. you will recieve emails send to either address on one mailbox. when you compose an email, you will get an option to use either email address, depending on the circumstance.. . great, huh? i discovered this a couple of months ago. now i use one account for both business and personal email. and the people i email have no idea that i have the other address. :). . try it!Yes its possible, use mozilla firefox instead of internet explorer, there you can accessa as many yahoo accounts simultaneouslyI have six.  just sign up for another one as if you didn't have the first one.sign up another accountYes. Go to: Messenger -> Preferences -> Privacy -> Idle Status... change the minutes in the slider, then click 'Apply'. For example, if you 'Apply' 15 minutes to your Idle Status then you will automatically go "Idle" after 15 minutes. Hope this helps.you set the appear as idle time to 1 min. then dont move the mouse or the keybord for a minute.

You earn points by answering questions -2 points are given for every answer you give. If your answer is chosen as the best answer, you get 10 points. If you ask questions, each question costs you 5 points.  The goal of getting the "best answer" gives people the motivation of giving their BEST when answering the question. If you click on the "level" in the upper right hand corner here right after the word "discover", there is the explanation. After reaching certain levels, one gets to ask questions without any penalty, etc. There is a little surprise that is given for each level that you reach. Hope that helps you. Good Luck.You get points for answering questions and they are not used for anything except maybe prestige...Yahoo gives you free wallpapers and stuff but not much else.Answer questions, vote on answers. Itching is the cardinal sign of allergies.  You should see your eye doctor to determine how severe they are and what your best method of treatment is.  Visine isn't always the best treatment.Sounds like you may have allergies: try an antistamine, or eye drops such as Visine (follow the directions on the bottle).  I have allergy problems a lot.enucleation.u should buy some eye drops. it stop itchy eyes like urs. its cheap in a drugstore like rite-aid.dap some cold water on your eyejust leave it-.. dont touch it.. just leave it itching and after awhile it wont itch anymore.. i had the same problem a year ago... but i stopped scratching and itching it and now my eye is ok.. good luck! take care! :Pget eye drops that have an antihistamine in them.  they are more expensive, but well worth it.  check the label.I'm not a doctor, but I did stay at a Holiday Inn last night. But seriously, most itching is caused by histamine, which is usually released in response to outside stimuli such as an insect bite or an allergy. Since its the eye I would suspect an allergy to a pet or plants (it is that time of year when things bloom). Get a good antihistamine and QUIT scratching. You can damage your eyes doing that.

star 69 is the option you have on your telephone service to find out who called you. example ( your phone ring you pick it up and say hello and the party who called you starts saying bad things about you and hangs up) now you're upset and don't know who would say such a thing. so you hang up your phone and pick it up again and dial *69, your phone will now dial the number of the person who just called you. now you can let out that anger.*69 gives you the number of the last person who called, unless it is a unlisted number, It will tll you it was an unlisted number.that's when u want to call back the person who just called u.  so let's say the other party hung up, and u want to know who that party was.it tells you the number that just called you and can dial it for an additional fee.  This sometimes cost money.It is a special service you can get from your phone company that let's you see who called.Use it to trace who last rang your home phone. You can't replace your Yahoo Avatar with a photo completely. But on Answers, or Yahoo 360 you can use a photo of your choice. Just go into your Yahoo Answers preferneces (you should find a link on the Answers Homepage if you're logged in to Yahoo) and select which image to display. There should be a dialogue there, that allows you to upload a photo, and select it to display by your name in Yahoo answers.To use an actual photo you need to create a Yahoo! 360 page. Upload the desired photo, save in JPeg format. Select it as your main photo. Then return to your Yahoo! Answers 'My Q&A' page. Select edit my profile, and the option to select your Yahoo! 360 photo will be available. Select, save, and your done!I don't know!create a yahoo 360 account and follow the instructions from there
The more points you have the higher the Level you are on. As you rise through the levels you'll find that the limitations on your daily posts will be less and less. Eventually you'll reach Level 7 where you can ask, answer, and comment as many times as you want during the day.So you can ask more questions..and get more people interested in how YOU thinkPoints and Levels. .     To encourage participation and reward great answers, Yahoo! Answers has a system of points and levels. The number of points you get depends on the specific action you take. The points table below summarizes the point values for different actions. While you can't use points to buy or redeem anything, they do allow everyone to recognize how active and helpful you've been. (And they give you another excuse to brag to your friends.).     Points Table. Action Points. Begin participating on Yahoo! Answers One time: 100. Ask a question -5. Choose a best answer for your question 3. No Best Answer was selected by voters on your question Points Returned: 5. Answer a question 2. Log in to Yahoo! Answers Once daily: 1. Vote for a best answer 1. Rate a best answer 1. Have your answer selected as the best answer 10. Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote (up to 50 thumbs-up are counted) 1 per "thumbs-up".  .     Levels are another way to keep track of how active you (and others) have been. The more points you accumulate, the higher your level. Yahoo! Answers recognizes your level achievements with our special brand of thank you's!. Level Yahoo! Answers Thank Yous Points. 7 Be the first to find out! 25000+. 6 Be the first to find out! 10,000 - 24,999. 5 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the home page masthead. 5,000 - 9,999. 4 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the community manager editorial page. (coming soon) 2,500-4,999. 3 A super-special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 1,000-2,499. 2 A special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 250-999. 1 Full access to Yahoo! Answers! 1-249. 0 Limited access: you cannot ask a question but have level 1 privileges 0.  .     And finally, as you attain higher levels, you'll also be able to contribute more to Yahoo! Answers - you can ask, answer, vote and rate more frequently.. Level Questions Answers Comments Rates Votes. 6, 7 * unlimited * 100 100. 5 * unlimited * 100 100. 4 20 80 40 80 80. 3 15 60 30 60 60. 2 10 40 20 40 40. 1 5 20 10 20 20internation ranking among netizens, the users of yahoo answers.tell me...what are you doing here in the first place?Absolutely nothing. Unless the record is sealed (or if they were a juvenile when they were convicted) anyone can access those records. It's a lot more work than looking for it online, but if you look in the right county (make sure it's the county that the person was arrested/convicted in) you should be able to find results.. . Of course, it depends on the state, and some clerks may not be as cooperative as others. They may look at you funny, but if you really want to know, it's worth the trouble.This is just a tip, but, try going to your local probation office saying a person has applied for a job with you and you want to know if he or she has a criminal record ! yes you surely can!  when you signed in to yahoo messenger, make sure that the box for "Automatically sign in" is unchecked.  That way, when you open your computer, will be there at the background and will only connect when you click on it.Or...once you open it...go under Preferences...General...and make sure the box that says "log on at start up" is unchecked.

may b u havent added dare site address 2 block it. go 2 mail options den go 2 block address, then copy & paste all the sites u want deleted.not every e-mail you get in bulk is spam, at least not for everyone. and if it wasn't and you had read it and wanted to get rid of it you would have to move it to the inbox first or else you wouldn't be able to get e-mails from that person.The quickest way I have found to do this is to select the spam in your bulkmail folder and then select 'move..to inbox'. Once the spam is in your inbox select it again and press the 'spam' button. Then, as long as your SpamGuard is set-up to block spam addresses, the mail is deleted and added to your blocked address list.

Instructions: If you get gum on your clothes (leaving gum in your pocket when you wash it, sitting in it on the bus or something) you just. need to dampen a papertowl and put it on the gummy spot (but be sure to take the particle of clothing off first).Then, iron the spot (with medium or low heat or whatever the clothing requires, but high heat isn't necessary) and with no steam.After you're done ironing, slowly peal the paper towel off the clothing.The gum should've transferred from the clothing to the paper towel, and then you can just throw the paper towel away.This works, and it's better than getting grease spots all over your clothes. :D Good luck!. . ============================================================================. Yahoo just added the capability of adding 1 other email account to your principal account so you could receive the mail from both. the second one is color coded. I'm trying to do the same thing, but you first have to get the POP address. Then yahoo steps you thru the process.Unfortunately, this isn't possible even if you have a premium account for one of them. A premium account is required both to provide POP access and to receive POP messages.. . Other than registering the second account as a premium service, you may also want to consider just adding a second email address to your premium account so you can get them both in the same inbox. If you're talking about yahoo toolbar searches, click on the pencil & choose clear search history.. . if you're talking about from a website, double click in the typing box, all of your past searches will come up...point to one & hit delete on the keyboard...do this with each search term you want gone.If your using Yahoo toolbar for your search, go to the left of the search box and click on the pencil, . in the drop down menu, select: clear search history..  If your just talking the Yahoo home page, then go to your tools menu and select internet options. . Click on the content tab .  on the lower part, click on autocomplete..  Now you can uncheck all the boxes and it will stop recording your searches. Or. you can just clear your search history, forms, and passwords. . Hope this helps!

Yes, wrong Category but i will answer ur question.. In humans, all the different hair colors are due to just two types of pigment (melanin) called eumelanins and pheomelanins (European spelling, phaeomelanin). Eumelanins are the dark brown and black pigments while pheomelanins are the red and blonde pigments. The different colors of hair in different people are due to a combination of these two different basic biochemical structures.why is this question in THIS category?

   Adult content would be things considered inappropriate for children, like bloodshed and violence in a movie, a documentary about open heart surgery, autopsies, or life in a maximum security prison. Such images, while perhaps offensive by their graphic nature do not violate anyone's morals or sense of ethics but are subjects that a child would not understand, these topics would most likely be beyond their scope of comprehension but are not "dirty"..    Obscene or profane content on the other hand would be things like an Andrew Dice Clay performance, pornography, or anything else that a large percentage of people would find morally offensive. Unlike the examples cited in the first paragraph most people would admit that these are "dirty".or*l sex is adult content. . f*ck, sh*t, and d*ck is obscene and profane. . One is an entire theme.. The other is questionable language."Adult" is probably more along the lines of being purely sexual in nature, while "obscene/profane" could include scatological stuff as well as anything overtly sexual.can be one and the same, depends on the adult.I think obscene/profane content may be more of a reference to foul language, and adult content may target explicit sexual references.adult is dealing with s3x and profane is words like F---.Something with is obscene means it has no beneficial value whatsoever.I don't think sex is "dirty" unless you're on the beach or something.  I would consider sex and other related topics adult.  Obscene would be talking (writing) about adult content in a vulgar manner.  I think there is a difference.They both are dirty by the standards of society. Adult content means the same as sexual content. Obscene/profane content means vulgar language and/or gruesomely violent or disturbing scenes.cursing is obscene. sex and drugs are adultTo me adult is soft,romantic...but still porn (or alot of swearing,etc)Obscene to me would be the kinkier stuff.Semantics!!! My dear Watson!I would think "adult content" would be simply "mature" while "obscene" would be much more explicit.it's a silly pair of catagories.  adult content would include sex stuff, all of which could probably also be called obscene.  profane normally refers to swear words.  if they just took out the 'obscene' it would work.. . it also bugs me that the don't have a catagory for point-gaming since they've said it's not allowed.

In the U.K., Opel models are distributed under the Vauxhall brand.It's probably because its not well known. I've never heard of that car make. The new Yahoo! homepage is only in beta-testing so there's no way of switching to it. Only random viewers (using Internet Explorer only) are selected to see the new format and provide feedback. I found that words in Japanese taken from Chinese had different pronunciations according to when they we borrowed. Like China had different dynasties, you know, as in Ming, Han, so on...  The pronunciations were fossilised in Japanese but had moved on in Chinese. There is a very good book called "Search Engine optimisation for Dummies" (available on Amazon). It is a couple of hundred pages long, so I won't even attempt to summarise it for you. . I highly recommend it!Are you creating a web page? You can at least choose what searches you want by trying: <meta name="keywords" description="your keywords"> in your <title> section.  That way Yahoo or any other search engines will know what searches to put your web page in.

Once a question is no longer 'Open' then you do not have the ability to delete the question. The intent of the site is to build a repository of searchable knowledge, so Yahoo does not allow users to delete questions out of the database once they are either 'in voting' or 'resolved'. Otherwise, users could delete questions that other users might want the answer for.You cant delete the questionsI think that you can't delete it, and why would you want to delete it anyway???????I asked this one once and unfortunately we can't.You can't get rid of resolved questions, they are permanent.click where it says hello and your name and it will be there it does work so i better get the best answer for this oneAfter they are resolved, you cant delete them.You can't only Yahoo can do this.You can't, to my knowledge. If you are talking about actual mail that comes to your house everyday, I don't think you can stop that.  Just stop buying stuff out of catalogs so they don't send your address around.delete itIf all the mail going to your bulk or junk mail folder is spam, then you could try setting the spamgaurd to delete email upon receipt. To do this you go the the "options" link in the top right hand corner of your yahoo email account, click on spamgaurd, and choose the option to delete upon receipt. If you open the email and click on the unsubscribe button this will allow the companies to know that your account is active and they will send more spam. Best not to use that link.

The government email probably has a firewall that is blocking the incoming email. Check with the LAN administrator to see if you are allowed to send/forward from the email service you are using.It may depend on your goverment managed servers. Whether they use standard POP3 and SMTP ports or if they are firewalled. Also they may be useing Secure protocols. Talk to the network administrator to work out something that would work for both of you.The government site might be blocking the connections to its mail servers from Yahoo.Allot of times Government Firewalls will Block the automated forwarding process of emails.

just click on the word empty next to bulk. that would doInstead of clicking on the Bulk folder to open it, look beside Bulk and you will see Empty folder, click on that.. . To stop unwanted email, do the following:. . Log into your Email, go to Options (upper right hand side). Go through all your settings and don't forget to save them too.. . When you get to Block Address, type in spammer.com, this will stop all Spam that has been reported to Yahoo from ever entering your email. . . When you get to Bulk Mail, option to automatically delete all Bulk mail.. . If you get email from someone you don't know, NEVER open it (it may contain viruses) and report it as SPAM. This will automatically block it from your email account.. . This should slow down the Junk Mail considerably.. . Good Luck!for yahoo just click on (empty)next to Bulk

You don't need someone's email address to get your password back. If the usual signing in procedure doesn't work, go through the 'forgot password prompt' and fill in all the necessary information. If any of that information has been changed (unbeknownst to you) then you won't be able to get into the account. This will necessitate an email to Yahoo, but be forwarned..these days Yahoo is extremely slow or doesn't reply at all. Should this happen, all I can suggest to you is to open a new account and keep your password secure with only information known to you. NEVER share your password with anyone, and NEVER share your personal information.All you have to do is simply click on where it says forgot password and type in another e-mail address of yours.(It can be any screen name)thanks!

Please follow this path. Tools> internet options> content> auto complete> clear forms. To stop the generation of history in the yahoo search bar, uncheck the box of forms. Bouncing occurs when a group message or Yahoo! message is returned as undeliverable.  It is best to delete them from your members list so you maintain an active email list of members.If group messages sent to your email address are returned to Yahoo! Groups as undeliverable ("bouncing"), your Yahoo! Groups account may be temporarily disabled.

Answer lots of questions, this will get you 2 points per question.. . I think it's better to put a bit of thought into your answer though, as you are more likely to be voted as best answer and gain 10 points, if you click on my name, you should come up with my page, I've got some open questions you can answer if you want to. I only give the 10 points to the most interesting/funny or most appropriate answer.Points Table Action Points . You Should read this first:. . Begin participating on Yahoo! Answers One time: 100 . Ask a question  -5 . Choose a best answer for your question 3 . No Best Answer was selected by voters on your question Points Returned: 5 . Answer a question 2 . Deleting an answer -2 . Log in to Yahoo! Answers Once daily: 1 . Vote for a best answer 1 . Rate a best answer 1 . Have your answer selected as the best answer 10 . Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote (up to 50 thumbs-up are counted) 1 per "thumbs-up" . . An easy way: If you ask a question -5 Points. If you answer + 2 Points.. Suppose you ask 3 questions 3x5=15 You lost -15 points not good. Then you should answer at least 8 questions then you will get 8x2=+16 points. One point a head. Always keep + points.. . Now if you really answer a question in a best way then you will get not only two points but if some one will chose you will get 10 points (Read above table) means total +12 points.. . In short, Answer many questions ask few. If answer try to answer in a best possible way. And one more thing just getting one point easily vote you will get one point.. . It didn't arise in English with a sexual meaning until the 19th century, but prior to that it had been used to refer to women in general (16th century).  It has since also come to mean "effeminate, feeble, or homosexual men or boys" (20th century).

To make a new account, just click SIGN UP! on the main page.If you are talking about keep the same email box then there is no way to delete the original email address. but you can create another email address in the same box. Click on options in your email account then click on Mail Addresses. Down at the bottom, you should see Extra Email Address. Click on the create button and you will be able to send and receive from both addresses. If you want another email account all together. I would suggest saving your address book on your computer. Open a new email account. Upload your address book. If you want to keep any of the email, you will have to forward them, one by one, to the new account. Are you asking if a service can be in Beta? Of course. Yahoo! has many services in Beta right now. There's no rule or law that stipulates that only products can be beta-tested.This is a new service (about 5 months old), and they've put it out here for us to help them work out the kinks by reporting problems and making suggestions for improvement. There are some things you just can't learn from small-scale, in-house, product testing.. . Also, by testing the product in the real world, they can get a good indication of how much interest exists for this type of service. It would be a huge waste of time and resources to spend months and months on in-house development and testing for a product no one wants.

It's not the tonsils, I had mine removed as a kid, and I still snore.  I think the uvula might be the right answer since I have heard that removing the uvula stops the snoring.Snoring is the act of breathing through the open mouth in such a way as to cause a vibration of the uvula and soft palate, thus giving rise to a sound which may vary from a soft noise to a loud unpleasant sound. This most commonly occurs during sleep, or immediately after death.. . The cause of snoring is some kind of blockage in the breathing passage. Those blockages can be of many kinds—here are just a few:. . Tongue falling into the throat . Allergies . Throat weakness causing the throat to close during sleep . Mispositioned jaw, often caused by tension in muscles . Fat gathering in, and around, the throat . When the airflow in the breathing passage becomes irregular due to a blockage the soft palate may start flapping. This flapping of the soft palate is what makes the snoring sound.. . Numerical statistics on snoring are often contradictory, but at least 30% of the adult population and perhaps as many as 50% of people in some demographics snore. [1] [2]. . Most of the time snoring is not a health risk to the snorer, but snoring resulting from a significant obstruction of the breathing passage can be an indication of the potentially life-threatening disorder sleep apnea.. . Even if snoring may not be detrimental to the snorer, it can cause the snorer's bedmate to lose sleep. Being sleepy all day long can lead in some cases to life-threatening problems for the person and those around them. Also, studies have shown that there is a psychological component in snoring which causes discomfort in any listener, depending on the loudness, tone, frequency, and other auditorial attributes of the snore. Studies have shown that there is a direct inverse relationship between snoring and frequency of sexual activity between married partners, meaning that there is generally less sexual activity if one of the partners is a heavy snorer.. . Snoring is usually an involuntary act, but may also be produced voluntarily.. . According to Dr. William C Dement, of the Stanford Sleep Center, anyone who snores and has daytime drowsiness should be evaluated for sleep disorders.. . The loudest snore on record was 93 decibels.. . . . . [edit]. Cures. Snoring cures almost all revolve around clearing the blockage in the breathing passage. This is the reason snorers are advised to lose weight (to stop fat from pressing on the throat), to stop smoking (smoking weakens and clogs the throat), and to sleep on their side (to prevent the tongue from blocking the throat). But for many snorers those pieces of advice are not enough.. . Surgery is one option to cure snoring (for example a uvulopalatopharyngoplasty); dental appliances such as a mandibular advancement splint are another. There are many devices such as nose clips to keep the nose open and jaw mechanics to keep the jaw in the right position. Different aids work for different people.. . There is also a less known, but very effective way to stop snoring. It is to exercise the throat, the tongue, and the jaw muscles so the breathing passage will widen and stay open when you sleep.Snoring is the act of breathing through the open mouth in such a way as to cause a vibration of the uvula and soft palate, thus giving rise to a sound which may vary from a soft noise to a loud unpleasant sound. This most commonly occurs during sleep, or immediately after death.. . http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snoring. http://search.yahoo.com/search?p=Source+of+snoring&fr=FP-tab-web-t&toggle=1&cop=&ei=UTF-8i think its build up in your nose because you try to breath out of it and when your sinuses are clogged you make a noise known as snoringits your sinuses

This is called "auto-complete".  You can turn it off in Internet Explorer by clicking "tools", "internet options", "advanced" tab...then scroll down to "Use Inline Auto Complete" and uncheck the box.  Then click apply and ok.tools - internet options - clear history. . also ... tools - internet options - content - auto complete - clear forms

It probably derives from the preferred fighter tactic of positioning one's aircraft behind the enemy aircraft. From this position, a pilot could fire his guns on the enemy without having to lead the target, and the enemy aircraft could not effectively fire back. When two fighter aircraft circle each other trying to achieve this position, it resembles two dogs chasing each other's tails.Who knows? Not me~It is a 'dogged' and furious combat.. . Not all such confrontations are dog fights - just one of many termsDuring World War I, soldiers on the ground who witnessed combats among aircraft noticed it was very similar to dogs fighting, that is one trying to attack the other's tail. And somehow the name stuck.. . There have been relatively few dogfights in recent wars (Desert Storm, Balkans...), as beyond visual range (BVR) missiles are now quite good. So now most air victories are achieved without actually seeing the enemy (apart from on your radar scope).A dogfight or dog fight is a common term used to describe close-range aerial combat between military aircraft. The term originated during World War I, and probably derives from the preferred fighter tactic of positioning one's aircraft behind the enemy aircraft. From this position, a pilot could fire his guns on the enemy without having to lead the target, and the enemy aircraft could not effectively fire back. When two fighter aircraft circle each other trying to achieve this position, it resembles two dogs chasing each other's tails.. . http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog_fightThe early definition of the word 'dogfight' meant an aerial battle between two or more aircraft. As the First World War broke out not long after the aeroplane had been invented, there had not been time to develop guns which could be built into the body of a plane. The first fighter planes were only equipped with machine-guns which were fixed onto the top wing.. . These early fighter aircraft had two two seats, with a man sitting in the rear controlling the guns. Dogfights were extremely difficult because the pilot would have to dodge other enemy aircraft while listening to the commands of the gunner as to where to fly to get the enemy into his sights.

I'd suggest you continue with V 7.0 or upgrade your computer.Also, keep in mind that sometimes there is a glitch in the communication between programs when Yahoo is running. Answer questions, and answer them well in order to have them chosen as the best answer. Every time you answer a question you get two points and every time your answer is chosen as the best you get ten. You can also earn points by voting for best answers and rating best answers.When you reach your daily limit for answering questions, rate best answers, and vote on undecided questions.answer,rate and vote the max each day. don't ask questions. since you loose points. i am level 7 and haven't asked a single question.. . vote for yourself as best answer.Ask fewer questions, since these cost you points.  Answer more questions and give genuine answers that actually pertain to the question.  This will increase your chances of getting the 10 point award for Best Answer.  Also, you can vote on answers that are undecided or tied for best answer.ask less and answer moreask less and answer n rate as much as u can..if poss rate ur own answer as best..lol...hehehehe...luv u tiaCreate another ID were you rate you answers as best answers. Because were typing in on the internet. it doesn't need punctuatuon . . "Were"? Or "we're"? The lack of punctuation in that one changed the word completely.. . Just because it's the Internet, doesn't mean we get to omit punctuation. It's a written medium; a text-based way of communicating. Therefore, PUNCTUATION STILL APPLIES.. . I suspect much of it has to do with ignorance: people not understanding HOW to use punctuation - so they just don't use it at all. For those who *do* know how to use punctuation and don't, my guess is that it's sheer laziness on their part. Yahoo does not display the adult groups in the Yahoo Groups directory.  There is no setting that you can adjust to see them.  Setting your profile to adult does not affect Yahoo Groups.  Yahoo hid the adult groups a few years back under pressure from some family organization.If you are not listed as an adult in your Yahoo profile, then the adult sites are blocked from you. You do the Hokey Pokey and you give yourself a spin,. that's what it's all about.There are many forms of dance. You can use a self teaching program, a dance studio, or get a friend to teach you whom knows.I tought myself how to dance and can outdance anyone in Baltimore MD.  I've been to the clubs and litterally draw all the women to dance with me.. . How?  I got mad years ago when my girlfriend moved away and then started dating someone else.  I went to a dance club for the first time.  Got drunk and just watched people dance.  Didn't try it till I went home.  Turned on MTV and watched.  I noticed that in order to look good dancing, you have to move to the beats.  Every song has differnt beats.  You'll need to simply listen to the music, it flows in patterns.  With my feet I dance to one beat and my waist to another, with my arms I usually move them to the words in the song.  I mix it up a bit but always to the beat.  The beat slows down, I slow down.  When it kicks it hard, I kick it hard.  I suggest you watch MTV and pick up some fresh new moves.  Try to imitate them in front of a mirror. This voids a contract and someone really dropped the ball or she misrepresented her age. If the company failed to take precautions to protect itself it is not your concern and maybe considered harassment if they try to collect through coercive means.Here is what I think.. . It is true that children can simply lie on applications. unfortunately due to the size and nature of the internet, most times it simply is not feasable for a business to require faxed in copies of your information, and in some cases it can even be considered unethical.. . The other side is if they required more, think of how much personal information would end up floating around in cyberspace! Identity theft would skyrocket.. . So what can you do in this situation? Talk to her, like someone else said. Find out why she wanted a yahoo answers account. Maybe she was simply curious? Maybe it peaked her brain to think? I think that if you set aside some time, and maybe create a shared account for both of you, instead of making it something she feels the need to hide it could be a very educational and bonding experience for both of you. You could help her pick the questions she wants to answer and when she asks you questions you could go to yahoo answers and ask them together. THis way you are still in control of the content and can explain anything she may stumble across that seems.. *cough* a little unsavory.. . The other thing is to in this day and age, kids are going to find the internet, no matter how much you try to protect them. So again I say the best thing to do is to try and be with her and guide her on what is appropriate. Your doing a good job to be concerned!It probably happened when she signed up. Instead of putting her real age in the questionaire box, she put an older age. You can probably contact yahoo and see if you can get the account deleted or get some kind of spyware software if you really want to protect your daughter. . . But the honest to god truth, is that their might be something lacking the relationship you have with your daughter for her to go sneaking behind your back. You need to start communicating with her, I know it can be hard but you need to take the first steps. Maybe you can open it with Stuffit Expander (it's in Applications, Utilities)I don't know if this will help or not.. . Register SBC Yahoo! DSL with Mac OS X . For All Applications, Macintosh OS X 10.1-10.2, and All Domains. .  .   . .  . From the Apple menu (in the top-left corner of the screen), select System Preferences. . In the System Preferences window, select Network. . From the "Location" drop-down menu, select New Location. You will be asked to name your location. You should name it something simple that you will remember, like "SBCYahoo." . From the "Show" drop down menu, select Built-in Ethernet. . Next, click on the PPPoE tab and fill out the fields. . Check Connect Using PPPoE. . Under "Account Name," enter sbcyahooreg@sbcglobal.net. . In the "Password" field, enter sbcyahooreg (Please note that passwords are case sensitive. If you enter an incorrect password, OS X does not generate an error message.). Click PPPoE Options. . Under "Session Options," make sure Connect automatically when starting TCP/IP applications is checked. The other Session Options choices are optional. . Under "Advanced Options," Send PPP echo packets should be checked.. Click OK. . Click Apply Now and close the window. . Open Internet Explorer (included with OS X) and type the following URL in the Address field: https://sbcreg.sbcglobal.net . Follow the directions on screen. When you are finished, write your new account information down and keep it in a safe place.. Once registration is complete, you'll need to enter your new account information in the "Network" settings under "System Preferences." . . . From the Apple menu, select System Preferences > Network. . Select the location that you created in Step 3. . From the "Show" drop down menu, select Built-in Ethernet. . Click on the PPPoE tab. . Make sure Connect using PPPoE is checked. . In the "Account Name" field, Delete sbcyahooreg@sbcglobal.net. Enter your SBC Yahoo! Member ID (your entire email address, e.g. YourMemberID@sbcglobal.net) . In the "Password" field, replace sbcyahooreg with your own SBC Yahoo! password. OS X saves your password by default. (Please note that passwords are case sensitive.). Click Apply Now. . Close the window and open Internet Explorer to access the Internet. If your homepage doesn't automatically default to yahoo.sbc.com, you may set it to do so at this time.. If you cannot access the Registration Site while following the procedure above, take these additional steps: . . On your desktop, double-click the Macintosh HD icon. . Double-click the Applications folder. . Double-click the Internet Connect application. . In the "Configuration" drop-down menu, make sure that Built-in Ethernet is selected. . Ensure that sbcyahooreg@sbcglobal.net is displayed under the "Name" field. . Re-enter sbcyahooreg in the "Password" field (you must enter the password in lowercase). . Click Connect.. Once you are connected, open Internet Explorer and go to Step 9 above for registration instructions.

On Internet Explorer, go to Tools, Internet Option. The Options dialog box appears. On the General Tab at the bottom is the area for Fonts. Click on that and fix your font style and size. This exact same thing happened to me last year. I am still not sure why it changed, but I am suspecious of my kids who had their own accounts on my computer. I think they got into my internet options and played around in there. I don't know for sure that is what happened, but I know I did not change any settings there or else where on the computer. Then again they could have gotten into the desktop or file options too and changed fonts in there. If you change font style of size else where on your computer it will effect those else where like in e-mail and web pages.. . I only have IE, so if you have a differant browseer, sorry I can't help with that. However, any other browser should also have its own version of internet options. Check the tools tab or help tab or view tab or edit and see what you can find. A little detective work will often yeild great results!. . Good luck and I hope you get this fixed as soon as possible.. . p.s. there are good reasons to change font and size once in a while, but for various periods of time. If you have trouble seeing the words a larger size can help tremendously, or if you need to print out a page with too small or large print you can adjust for it temorarily and then reconfigure it back to the way it was.Copy and paste it on Word pad and change it from there... . Or, go on your browser, go to view, then text size and pick your size there...or tell your friends to stop using such small fonts when they Email!When you are in your email, click on the "view" menu on the top of your windows toolbar. Next, select "text size." I think there are 6 different size choices to choose from. That should fix your problem.Look up top on your tool bar (on internet explorer) and click on VIEW then click on TEXT SIZE and try changing it to either medium, larger, or largest. That may work.Hold the "Ctrl" button while scrolling using the wheel in the middle of your mouse.  This will change your font size.

Wikipedia (IPA: [/?w?ki?pi?di.?/] or [/?wiki-/]) is an international Web-based free-content encyclopedia. It exists as a wiki, a type of website that allows visitors to edit its content; the word Wikipedia itself is a portmanteau of wiki and encyclopedia. Wikipedia is written collaboratively by volunteers, allowing most articles to be changed by anyone with access to a computer, web browser and Internet connection.. . The project began on January 15, 2001 as a complement to the expert-written (and now defunct) Nupedia, and is now operated by the non-profit Wikimedia Foundation. Wikipedia has more than 3,800,000 articles in many languages, including more than 1,100,000 in the English-language version. Since its inception, Wikipedia has steadily risen in popularity[1] and has spawned several sister projects.. . Wikipedia's most notable style policy is that editors are required to uphold a "neutral point of view", under which notable perspectives are summarized without an attempt to determine an objective truth.. . Wikipedia's co-founder, Jimmy Wales, has called Wikipedia "an effort to create and distribute a multilingual free encyclopedia of the highest possible quality to every single person on the planet in their own language."[2] However, there has been controversy over Wikipedia's reliability and accuracy, with the site receiving criticism for its susceptibility to vandalism, uneven quality and inconsistency, systemic bias, and preference of consensus or popularity over credentials. Nevertheless, its free distribution, constant updates, diverse and detailed coverage, and numerous multilingual versions have made it one of the most-used reference resources available on the Internet.. . There are over 200 language editions of Wikipedia, around 130 of which are active. Fourteen editions have more than 50,000 articles each: English (the original), German, French, Polish, Japanese, Dutch, Italian, Swedish, Portuguese, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, Norwegian and Finnish. Its German-language edition has been distributed on DVD-ROM, and there are also proposals for an English DVD or paper edition. Many of its other editions are mirrored or have been forked by other websites.They want to get the points even they don´t know anything about this topic ...Why do people bother to spend their time churning out original knowledge and ideas for free?well i can't over here! just kiddin.!! i accept, there are lots over here!!FYI... not everything on the net is accurate.I agree. As the owner/moderator of a fairly active Group, the best thing is to introduce yourself and give the group members a little bit of the reason you joined.  From there, participate in the discussions and pretty soon your name will be recognized and people will be more open with you.  Don't expect this to happen right away.  It takes time for the Group members to open up to discuss personal things with a new member.Start by introducing yourself. Not your whole life history but who you are, why you joined the group, that sort of thing.. . Some of them will come back with welcomes and a bit about themselves.  The rest you will get to know by their postings.Just ask them about themselves. Many people are willing to share.

The same way you got it on your master account - sign up. Your sub accounts stand on their own in this case. They do not adopt anything from the master account.How do I create an additional Email account and access my Mail? . For All Applications, All Operating Systems, and All Domains. . .   .   . .  . . 1. To create an additional email account, you'll first need to create an SBC Yahoo! sub account. You may have up to 20 sub accounts (up to 10 active at one time) under your main SBC Yahoo! Dial or DSL account. Each sub account will have a unique Member ID/email address and password.. .  . .  View Audio-Visual Walkthrough about how to create a sub-account. (Requires Macromedia Flash 6.0 or higher.). . 2. Once you've created the sub account, you can access the new email account through web mail and/or client email. For more information on the different options, please see What is the difference between web mail and client email?. . Web Mail (SBC Yahoo! Mail). . You can simply sign in with your new Member ID/email address. If you are currently signed in, you will have to sign out and sign in with your new Member ID. See How to switch between SBC Yahoo! Mail accounts for additional information.. .  . . Client Email (i.e., Outlook 2000, Outlook Express, etc.). . Follow the step-by-step instructions in our Email Setup Tutorial to add the new email account to your email program

To block an e-mail address, log on to your mail account then on the top right you will Options and under Spam--> Block Addresses-->Enter email address (or domain) to block.. Also when they e-mail you check the box next to the e-mail and then click "spam".. The e-mail will start going to your bulk file which is your junk/spam file and empty it out.. To block it from your messenger put their address on your "ignore list".. Log on to your messenger and then click on "messenger". Messenger-->Preferences--> Ignore list.I am not sure that I understand your question. You want to block someone else's email address?  I just click around on things until I find something out.  Of course you can crash your computer with my method.
Put all addresses in the BCC field.use the bcc: option.  (blind carbon copy)well, you should e mail one person then blind copy (Bcc) the rest, this enables no one to know who has else has been e mailed as it is blind.If you don't want anybody to see the emails of anybody, you can send it to yourself (put your own address in the to:) and then put everybody else in bcc, blind carbon copy. That way everybody only sees your email, which they should know anyway.

However, when the criteria generally used to define femaleness and maleness are examined more closely, it becomes apparent that the assignment or determination of 'sex' occurs at multiple levels. Environmental, biological, social, psychological and other factors are all believed to have some role in this process, and the complex interaction of these factors is expressed in the diversity of biological and psychosocial 'states' or levels found amongst the human population. A significant fraction of the human population simply does not correspond exclusively to either 'female' or 'male' with regard to every level of definition expressed in the following table. I wondered this a while ago, so checked the old questions, and this was the only one to work. If it's the Yahoo search bar you want to erase the history from then click in the search bar so that it drops down with items you've searched for, then highlight an item with your mouse, and press delete (not backspace-the delete button above the cursor keys) and the highlighted item will be erased. Repeat for all items.In IE - Tools > Internet Options. On the General tab, click "Clear History"tools - internet options - clear history. or. tools - browser options - clear URLIn Mozilla, just in case: Edit > Preferences > History > Clear Location Bar

Having the dog in the picture is just an extra detail.The display of the Yahoo Avatar on Answers automatically defaults to the face of the avatar.  I do not think that can be changed.. . If you want to use some other pic or a photo, then this requires a 360 account and this is a 3 step process. . 1) you'll need to create your Yahoo! 360 account. http://360.yahoo.com. So far, this is the only option if you want to use some other picture or photo.. The only three options for pics you have on your Answers profile is no pic, Yahoo avatar, or 360 picture.. . 2) you'll need to upload a couple of pictures to your 360 page.. On your 360 page, select "My Page" from the top. Select "Edit Personal Photos" on the left hand side. Browse to your saved photo(s) (assuming you have one or more ready) to upload it.. Select the "Set as Primary" button next to the photo want displayed on other sites (like Answers) and select "Save". . 3) you'll need to display your 360 picture on Answers. Go to your "My Q&A" page, select "Edit My Info". In the "Picture" section, select "Use my Yahoo! 360 Picture" . This link will get you to that page, http://answers.yahoo.com/my/my_editGo to the avatars page, click on My Favorites icon. click on Favorite Avatars ,. 2click on your dog. you have to see it on Previewing Changes then click on Save changes buttongo to avatar to change your avatar to the dog.click the picture it should take you to browse and choose the pic from above where your avatar is.

to roll the ink over the paper while writin.To help move the pen on the paper in a more-smooth fashion.. . Otherwise the ink would be all over the place, and the pen would not move very smooth-likeThe ball spins as you write to release ink from the tube.  Otherwise it would all just leak out and/or you would scratch the paper instead of glide accross it. That is Yahoo's way of protecting our accounts. The character string is really designed with skewed letters and numbers so only humans can read it, not viruses trying to send mails out.. . Once you've got it right, it wont come back in the next months.What is Compose Verification? . For All Applications, All Operating Systems, and All Domains. .  .   . .  . By entering the word you see in the box, you help Yahoo! prevent abusers and spammers from using Yahoo! Mail. This reduces system loads and ensures better performance of Yahoo! services. . . If no image appears, please make sure your browser is set to display images and try again. If you are not sure what the word is, make your best guess. If you guess incorrectly, you will have an opportunity to enter a different word on the next screen.
click actions on ur messenger and select call set up. Here a new window will open and will guide u how to configure ur headset with yahoo messneger.I bet you are behind an HTTP proxy. Messenger has a problem with audio and video and some other services when behind certain firewalls like HTTP. If you have set up the firewall yourself, or if you have access to the person who has, ask them to reconfigure the proxy to be transparent if possible.Raju have a point ... but if ur headset doesn't work. go to messenger. click preferences. click "calling & Audio". set ur microphone, speaker & speaker type.. also the call setup. click apply & ok  ^_^If you have a Yahoo! Sounds like you need to switch to "plain text" mode for composing messages.  You can do this by clicking the "Options" link in the upper right corner of Yahoo Mail, then click the "General Preferences" link and choose the "plain text" option for Composing Emails. If you're getting a lot of messages with the same terms in the subject, you can try setting up a filter to block them. Check the Filters section on this page: http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/manage/. . It may also help to look over some of the tips provided for preventing spam on this page: http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/spam/spam-19.htmlGo to Messages in Your Email. Click on Block Sender. This will Send it All to the Deleted Folder. No More Emails.Most email clients such as Yahoo or Outlook have a SPAM or BULK button, this will usually put all marked messages into a special folder which is then deleted after a period.. . If it's your yahoo account that you want to cancel then just don't log into it for a while - it expires and the account is automatically closed for you. All email accounts do the same - the time you have to wait varies. (Yahoo is something like 6 - 8 weeks.)You can go to this page:. . https://login.yahoo.com/config/login?.slogin=&.intl=us&.src=&.bypass=&.partner=&.done=https%3a//edit.yahoo.com/config/delete_user&pkg=&owd=. . At this page, sign in to the account which you want to cancel using that account ID & password. Once you are in, then just delete it. But you will NOT be able to reactivate that account once you've deleted it, so be careful, that's all. GOOD LUCK
