How to tell if Internet Explorer has Service Pack 2 (SP2) . For Internet Explorer 6.x, All Operating Systems, and All Domains. .  .   . .  . Important: You may experience problems utilizing Online Chat if Internet Explorer Service Pack 2 is installed on your computer. See the steps below to verify the version of Internet Explorer installed on your computer. If SP2 is installed, see How do I stop pop-up blocker from blocking SBC Yahoo! Online Chat?. .  . . 1.       Open an Internet Explorer Browser window. . 2.       From the Help menu, select About Internet Explorer. . 3.       In the About Internet Explorer window, check the Version: field.  . .  . . Note: If you have version 6.x, continue to read the Update Versions: area. If SP2 is listed, Internet Explorer has Service Pack 2 installed.

As new questions come it, the older questions get pushed further down in the list and often go unnoticed. You can't post the same question twice (that's a violation), but if you don't get a response, delete the question, then ask it again. Also, be sure to put your question in the correct category. I think a lot of questions go unanswered because they aren't categorized correctly.because more people see ur question in the first few minutes && hours, because there showed ont he top of the "new qyestions" thing.i agree with what has been said pretty muchBecause the new questions show up on your page as an answerer.  As they get older, you have to look for them, so it's only if you come across them that you may answer them.Yea I hate when that happens. It matters what category it is in. If you want to connect the new email address to your account, all you have to do is go to your Yahoo! inbox and click on "Options" in the upper right corner. After clicking on "Mail Addresses" you will see the option to create your extra email address.. . You can also create a new email address by signing out and then creating a new account the same way you created this one, but you will not be able to connect the information with your other account.hi, dear! You just click SIGN UP and after that you  must make what they ask for your new address! Simple... Good luck!you can have two email addresses with only one yahoo! account... after signing in to your account in yahoo! mail, go to "options" in the upper right-hand corner of the page. under the management category, click "mail addresses". scroll down to "extra mail address" and click the [get started] options... then you can create a new email address for the same account.. . this is kind of cool because you can have two different email addresses but you would not have to go to the trouble of signing in or out every now and then... since you can use either one in sending messages, as well as view all messages sent to both address, in any of the address that you would open... hope this could be of help to you... ;p

Yahoo! does not necessarily have editorial control over the hundreds of thousands of questions posted daily - so it's not difficult to assume that some "inappropriate" questions escape the people working behind the scenes from time to time.  While they are not legally obligated to monitor/censor/delete material posted by third party users of the Yahoo!Answers site, they still have the right to do so and will exercise that right if it means creating a "nicer" atmosphere for more...hmm, critical users.Not every question is time sensitive. Cascading Style Sheet - A Technique thats used to specify how each element on your webpage should look. For example what font, what size, what color, how much margins etc..The correct answer is that the W3C saw that an easier way of implementing the formatting techniques in JavaScript was needed. JavaScript is difficult to learn so they made CSS which is much easier to learn and use.. . best html reference http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_reference.asp best style sheet reference http://www.w3schools.com/css/css_reference.asp html links http://www.websitetips.com/html/ style sheet links http://www.websitetips.com/css/  html dom http://www.w3schools.com/htmldom/dom_reference.asp
morezaidi, Once a question is no longer 'Open' then you do not have the ability to delete the question.  The intent of the site is to build a repository of searchable knowledge, so Yahoo does not allow users to delete questions out of the database once they are either 'in voting' or 'resolved'.  Otherwise, users could delete questions that other users might want the answer for.No you cannot delete completely.. You can only make it disabled for to make it not accept answers.... . Yahoo Messenger with Voice Beta has a built-in voicemail system to manage your missed calls. After 20 seconds of ringing, the caller is sent to your voicemail. The next time you log in to Yahoo Messenger, you'll be notified that a voicemail is waiting for you. Hope this help ^_^Using voicemail with Yahoo! Mail has nothing to do with your having a special kind of server. You don't have a server, Yahoo! has a server. For more information about using voicemail, see this help topic from Yahoo!:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/mailwithvoice/mailwithvoice-04.htmlU need a special machine for thati think you have to get a special kind of sever

if you are using yahoo mail, block the senders by domain rather than the individual email addresses.  you just don't want to block the major ones like yahoo or hotmail, etc.  but any domain you know that you would never receive legitimate email from, you can block.  this function is under block senders under options in your yahoo mailbox.Getting junk mail in your Bulk folder should not be a problem. That folder is set up specifically to make sure that junk gets filtered out. If you want it deleted automatically upon arrival, you can change the spam settings by clicking on "Options" in the upper right corner of your inbox.. . There are also some tips to prevent spam here:. http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/spam/spam-19.htmlThere are dozens of reasons why you get spam I suggest you read the article below to suit your situation.

In order to see deleted or previous instant messages, archiving of messages must be enabled.  This information is in the help pages:. . Question: How do I enable and view archives?. . Answer: You can automatically save a history of all your instant messages, alerts, conferences, and text messages.. . Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Preferences." . Click the "Archive" category. . You have three choices for archiving your messages. You can select one of the three options given, including selecting "No" to not save your messages. . You also have three choices for archiving your call history. You can select one of the three options given, including selecting "No" to not save your call history. . Click the "OK" button at the bottom of the window. . Note: Uncheck the "Enable Archiving" option to disable archiving.. . To view your archive:. . Click the "Contacts" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Message Archive." . A new window called "Message Archive for your ID" will appear. . Select the archive folder you want to review. . Note: Archives (".dat" files located on your system) are encrypted and can only be viewed by the Yahoo! ID that created them. These archives are stored locally on your system, so the conversations held on that specific computer are only accessible from that computer. After archives are deleted, they cannot be retrieved.I don't think this is possible. If it is, I'd be interested in learning how as well.You can't. Once you delete them they're gone forever unless you use some type of deleted file recovery software. . . http://www.winundelete.com/?rid=google&kid=wu0801

They give an incentive to answer questions, vote on best answers, and rate best answers.  As you accumulate points, you move up in the levels, and are granted additional privileges in the amount of activity that you are allowed to do on a daily basis.. . The three R's (readi'n, riti'n and rithmatic).. . Your question show how poor your education has been.. . The College(notice spelling) courses will teach you how to spell, use Caps and properly construct a sentence.. . Only people go to Colleges. It was not needed for you to use the word people.. . Until Colleges and Universities were established, the primary method of getting and advanced education was Apprenticeship. An Apprenticeship usually lasted 4 years. During this period the Apprentice is paid a low wage or room and board for his services.. . In order for Colleges to compete with the Apprenticeship they had to offer a better education in the same period of time.. . Since 4 yrs. was only an average Apprenticeship period, Colleges also did it the same way. The 4 yrs of College is only an average period. You can complete in as little as 2 yrs or longer than 4 yrs.. . One reason for the 4 yr. period of Apprenticeship was due to the Life Span of humans. Until the mid 1900's, the average male life span was 45-55yrs. The average female life span was 50-60yrs.. . This life span period meant that males(at that time period) needed to finish their advanced education in a short period of time. This would allow them to marry, establish a family and become successful before they died. This also allowed the children to be full grown, so the eldest male could take over the fathers business or job. This is the way it worked back then. When a man died, his son, usually, had the option of acquiring the fathers job.. . This is why the average College education period is 4 years.To specialize in what they study so as to perform well in their future endeavors/job encounters!you don't you only have to meet the credit requirements to recieve a diploma. i know people who have done it in like 2 1/2 years.they don't, a bachlors degree normally takes 4 years or 8 semsesters to complete. But its bassed on a number of credits, that are earned by passing a class. It's about the credits, not the number of semesters/quarters spent.its college ......stupidsome people have to go to college for 7 years... depends on the career you want to get into. There's currently no way of doing that unless you pay for Yahoo! Mail Plus on your old account. That would give you POP access, which would allow you to POP all of the mail out of your old account, into your new account. If you checked your emails, and it told you that you had been picked as best answer, then logged on to Answers and it said you'd earned 6 points, then this is normal. The bit with your profile on it that says 'You answered a question- 2 points' and 'you rated a best answer- 1 point' only goes by the recent history on your profile page when you log on. So if someone picked your answer as best 2 hours ago, then 7 people gave your answer a thumbs up rating, that's 17 points, but your history will only show 6 of the thumbs up ratings and that's what it tells you when you log in- 'Woah you've earned 6 points'. Don't worry, your full 10 points will have been credited to your account.Because you also asked a question and rated a question:. . 10-5+1=6. . Just guessing...Morningstar is right.Go to your Q/A and look over to the right hand column, under the little graph... it should list what activity has taken place (whether you ask, answer, get a "best" answer, or a "thumbs up" etc) and it will say how many points were used/given.........I think you only get 10 points if your answer gets chosen and you receive 5 stars for it.  I think you get 2 points per star when your answer is chosen.Well you just lost 5 points for making this question, so that would take your total down to 1 point.. . I think there's a limit on the number of answers to encourage new people to participate by not just answering questions, but also by asking questions, voting for Best Answers, and rating Best Answers. As you gain more points, you can answer more questions, until you reach 5,000 points -- then you can answer an unlimited number of questions.They don't want anyone to answer questions 24/7.they way you will become addicted and keep coming back for moreDamn them to hell!That's only per day. It is a glitch with Yahoo itself. Get a hold of Yahoo and they will fix it. It happened to me a couple of times.I found this in the help pages:. . Question:. . Can I switch between old and new Yahoo! Mail?. . Answer:. . For sure! We understand that it's not easy to switch away from a format that you're really comfortable with. So we made it super-easy to switch back whenever you want. You can switch up to the new and back to the old as often as you want. We hope you'll see how much the new Yahoo! Mail improves on the old version. But until you agree, here's how to switch back.. . Under where it says "Welcome, yourname" at the top of your Yahoo! Mail page, there's a "Switch Back" link. Click "Switch Back" to go back to the Yahoo! Mail version you're already familiar with.. . To come back to the new Yahoo! Mail, just click "Options" in the upper-right corner of your Yahoo! Mail page. On the Options page that opens, the message " Yahoo! Mail Beta has arrived! Try it now!" appears in the upper-right corner, just below the "Options" link. Click "Try it Now!" to get back to the new Yahoo! Mail.click yahoomail beta link in the yahoo mail options link to switch backAt the regular Mail Page, click Option (next to What's New, Mail For Mobile, Upgrades). When the new page come up, click "Try it now" and it will switch back to the Beta.If you want to switch back to the original "face" of yahoo mail, you simply click on the link that says, Switch Back (in line with Sign Out and My Account links at the top), then you're back to the original. But if you decide to switch back to Beta again, then you simply go to the Options tab (on the upper right corner), there would be a purple button there to Try Yahoo Beta again. This process is reversible and should not affect your email. So don't you worry about losing you emails.=DI have regular however should be same both open your mail acct. toward top right should be "new yahoo beta try it now" click on it (blue writing)

Please follow this path. Tools> internet options> content> auto complete> clear forms. To stop the generation of history in the yahoo search bar, uncheck the box of forms. It will solve ur problem.Internet Explorer. Go to tools>internet options. Delete cookies, delete files, delete history, set delete history to 1 day. Click the content tab, and go to AutoComplete option, then select clear forms.. Yahoo. Click the pencil and click clear history. Click the pencil again and click toolbar options. Uncheck remember recent searches and check IE clears history on close. If you don't have these options download the latest Yahoo toolbar or delete it by clicking start->settings->control panel-> add/remove programs.. Firefox. Go to tools>options>privacy. Delete cache and cookies. It's also under "clear private data" in newer versions with the quick key (ctrl+shift+delete).. Google. Click the google button and click clear searches. Click the google button again and go to options, then click the search tab.. Check out this link below, it's very informative.. http://www.jimmyr.com/searchhistory.php....Hi robd,. . Make a Yahoo 360 account.  Upload your jpeg there, and then go back to Answers.  Go to My Q&A.  Edit your profile, and choose to import your 360 image.I'm not sure which application you're trying to upload the picture to.  But in either scenario, where you can "load" (not the place where you choose WHAT your avatar is going to be...) you should see a choice of choosing an avatar or other picture.  There should also be a browse button.  Choose the browse button, and using the drop down arrow, locate and point exactly to the pic you want to upload off of your pc.  Once that's done, make sure you indicate that you want to use the uploaded picture and NOT the avatar.  Hope this helps.

Plus, G-Mail also sorts messages by a common subject and puts them together in "Conversation View". It is easy to switch to G-Mail. You can easily import all of your contacts out of your Yahoo! address book into your G-Mail address book.  G-Mail also has Google Talk (it is sort-of like Yahoo! IM) right in your in-box! You have to go to options and then General preferences, you can change your outgoing message name on there. If you want to change your name on this, you have to go to edit profile. To change your username on your email, you have to go to "My Account" and you can change all your details on there.On your messenger click the "Messenger" menu, then click "My Contact Details"  Now fill in what you want it to say, if you don't want you name on it take it out of the space where it says names and put something else there. That's how you get it to show up on your messenger how you want it.

Thanks.I think there is some way to skew the points in your favor by some means other than answering questions or getting best answers.  What I suspect is that there is a way to insert certain lines of code that cause your points total to jump up by thousands.  The top person on the leaderboard picked up 3,876 points in this week, and if you break that down it would be equivalent to answering 1,938 two-point questions.  To do this within seven days would mean answering one question every 5 minutes 24 hrs a day, for all seven days. Since we all have to sleep, reduce the working day to 16 hours means answering one question every three and a half minutes non-stop for 16 hours a day, every day, without stopping to eat, go to work, or anything.. . It becomes a little difficult to imagine how anyone can legitimately acquire so many points in such a short time.  if all the points were earned through best answers only, it would mean 387 best answers for the week, yet when I went back and counted the best answers for the top scorer there were only 26 best answers within the past week.  That adds up to 260 points for best answers for the week, which means that the other 3,616 points came from 1 or 2 point responses. In this case, if ALL the points came from answering questions, and figuring in the 260 best answers, that means this person answered a total of 2,606 questions in the past week. If ten hours a day were spent answering questions, that means each question required just over about 3 3/4 minutes to complete.  Try answering 16 questions an hour for ten hours non-stop each day of the week and see if you can do it.  Something clearly is not right here.. . I suppose I could analyze this further and come up with some more detailed breakdown, but it seems difficult if not impossible to score so many points in such a sort period of time without using some sort of software to cheat the numbers. There has GOT to be a lot of padding of the points going on here.. . So, what I think it the top scorers have found a way to beat the system and simply generate a lot of unearned points through a software and not through real answers.  You could take a look at all the answers of the top scorer and anaylyze that, and I bet if you did you would discover that the actual number of points earned through answering questions and best answers would be FAR SHORT of what is actually being shown.. . Nobody can spend that many hours a day doing this to get that many points legitimately.  It takes me a week to get the same number of points one of them gets in less than a day, and I am not about to spend 18-20 hours a day doing this, every day, for months.. . What I think is that most of the high scores are basically fradulent. They have found a way to add on thousands of extra points with just a few mouse clicks.Just keep answering questions, the more points you get the more questions you can answer.. . The higher the level the more rates and votes you also have.. . This will allow you to get more points every day. . . Good luck!!just answer the questions with best answersStop asking questions and just answer things. You must have accidentally clicked on switch back. Go to options and you should find a link for yahoo mail beta.go to the yahoo messenger site (messenger.yahoo.com) and click the "get it now" button and you will get the latest version of yahoo betaThe All New AT&T Yahoo! Mail will be released in two phases. Beginning April 18, 2006, 30% of the total AT&T Yahoo! primary accounts and sub accounts that are not under parental controls will be able to switch to the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail. The rollout will continue with the other 70% in the 2nd phase on May, until all Members that do not have parental controls enabled have the option to use the new version of AT&T Yahoo! Mail.. . You dont need any invites to be able to use the new Yahoo Beta email. You just need to at least meet the system requirements:. . *Browsers. IE 5.5 and higher (for Windows) . Firefox 1.0 or higher (for Mac and Windows) . Mozilla Suite 1.7 or higher (for Mac and Windows) . Netscape 7.2 (For Windows) . SBC Yahoo! Browser 3.3 . . *Operating Systems. Windows 2000, XP . Mac OSX . . . Entry points for the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail are the following:. . Trap page | Promo Module on the Mail Welcome Page | Link on the Mail Options Page . . *Trap Page*. When Members log in to email for the first time after being provisioned with access (30% on April 18) to the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail.. . *Promo module on the Mail Welcome Page*. . SBC Yahoo! Members using classic email will see the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail module on the Mail Welcome page, suggesting a switch to the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail. The Member needs only to click on the Try it today link to switch to the new AT&T Yahoo! email - provided they meet minimum system requirements.. . *Link on the Mail Options Page*. . The Try it now link will be displayed on the Mail Options page only for SBC Yahoo! Members who are provisioned, regardless if the Member has already switched to the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail. This link will allow the Member to switch to the new AT&T Yahoo! Mail by directing them to the landing page from which they can access the new Mail version.. . Now if you really cant wait to change your email to Beta and you're tired of waiting, then the easiest way to change to Beta is change your location to UK or any other location not US. You can go about this by going to My account and click on Edit and under General preferences, change you Preferred Content to UK or Canada for the moment.When you click finish you are gonna be given a TOS (terms of service), you click accept and then after that you would be asked if you want to try the new Yahoo Beta version then you email away and enjoy Yahoo Beta! . . And if you want to switch back to the original "face" of yahoo mail, you simply click on the link that says, Switch Back (in line with Sign Out and My Account links at the top), then you're back to the original. But if you decide to switch back to Beta again, then you simply go to the Options tab (on the upper right corner), there would be a purple button there to Try Yahoo Beta again. This process is reversible and should not affect your email. So don't you worry about losing you emails.=D

do you mean SBC Yahoo?. . SBC yahoo, like any other ISPs, can cancel account if you have not paid your internet bills, or you moved to a different address and they're unable to bill you on your old address. . . You have to call them to update your home address and your Credit card info so there'll be no interruptions in your account.There is a problem with some free Yahoo! mail accounts being cancelled without warning.  It looks as if this is only happening to persons who previously used Yahoo! SBC or Prodigy as their isp.   After some time I got thru to the Yahoo! billing dept who told me they are working on the problem.Yes, Yahoo is cancelling FREE accounts in error, thinking they are SBC Yahoo accounts. My girlfriend used the same user ID for her free yahoo account as she had used years ago as her Prodigy ID, then SBC bought Prodigy.  Now yahoo thinks the free account is the same as the old one.  Somehow they screwed up and killed off a free yahoo account simply because it had the same name as the old Prodigy/SBC account.Easy...They click cancel

There is a lot of differences between the two network types.:. . Cingular and T-Mobile uses GSM(current global standard, all-digital).. . Sprint PCS (not Nextel by Sprint) and Verizon Wireless use CDMA(digital/analog).. . GSM or Global System for Mobile Communication is a network that uses GSM850/GSM900/GSM1800/GSM1900. It is a network that uses SIM (Subscriber Identity Module) cards. Cingular uses both 850MHz and 900MHz, and so do all GSM carriers in North America. Other countries use either 1800MHz or 1900MHz. (3GSM uses sim cards too, but allows you to go to the internet at faster speeds, and can allow you to commence a video call.). . CDMA or Code Division Multiple Access, is an analog/digital technology for networks, that enables CDMA users to take advantage of analog roaming. CDMA phones do not have a SIM card door, so switching cellphones is completely network dependent.the name loooooolGSM: a network that uses a basic connection interface that comunicates with one phone tower at a time.. CDMA: will commuicate with 2 towers at a time and can change between analouge and Digital(GSM) stystems, which is why better in regional areas. . and for future reference 3G networks use 3 towers at once, hence why they called 3g and can send video phone calls etc

Right click on Start and choose Properties from the menu. A box will appear with two tabs one for the start menu and one for the task bar. Click the tab for the task bar. At the bottom of the screen click Customize. A box will appear with all the icons that sit by the notification area. Go and find the one which is the mail icon and click on the action box. Select Disable or always hide which ever it says. . . Now, go into Messenger Preferences and choose the Alerts and Sounds tab. There uncheck the "Enable Alert Sounds" check box. You will now no longer receive any alerts or sounds when new mail arrives.. . Good luck and have a nice day.Go to Yahoo Messenger Preferences (Go to Messenger Menu, select Preferences). Select Alerts & Sounds category and uncheck every checkbox for alert when "I receive a message in Yahoo! And be sociologically clinical when you want to ask things about race or gender identity, etc.  We can ask anything (well, OK, almost anything; you may have to fudge around a bit if you want to ask questions about illegal activities) as long as we are polite.. . As to how to "fudge around" about illegal activities, write your question from the point of view of someone who would never do that yourself. Next to the word "folder" you will see 2 options: add and edit, click on edit. now it shows a list of all your folders and next to each folder you see the options: rename or delete, click on the one you need.I'm assuming you're using Yahoo! Mail (classic).. . Click the "Edit" link next to Folders.  Then, simply click the "rename" link next to the folder you're using.First point to it, and right click on it.high light it and go to file and see if you can rename it like that"To rename a folder, follow these steps: . . Go to the SBC Yahoo! Notepad page. . Click the Notepad Options link on the right side of the page. . Click the Notepad Folders link. . Choose the folder you would like to rename from the pull-down menu in the Edit Folders section. . Click the "Change Name" button and a small pop-up window will appear. Type in the name of the new folder and click "OK." . Click "Done" to go back to the main SBC Yahoo! Notepad page.".  . Hope this helps!

Any time it says "Whoa!" that means multiple points activities have taken place. Just go to your Q&A and look at your recent activity to see it there. Each time your points badge is shown, it'll reflect all the activity that has taken place (up to six activities) since the last time your points badge was shown.Yes it is possible - while you were asking the question you got a thumbs up ... the score only updated when you exited asking the question - it totals all activity since it last updated

Do you mean the pop-up blocker on the Yahoo! Toolbar? If so, you can disable it, but not remove it. To disable it, click on the pop-up blocker on the toolbar and select Enable Pop-up Blocker, which will remove the checkmark in front of the command and disable it.You should be able to uninstall it.You can check under tools, options, and depending on your server the checkable boxes for pop up blocking will be right on the content page, which you can uncheck.

I think there's a limit on the number of answers to encourage new people to participate by not just answering questions, but also by asking questions, voting for Best Answers, and rating Best Answers. As you gain more points, you can answer more questions, until you reach 5,000 points -- then you can answer an unlimited number of questions.They do it because if there was not limit then it is possible to program a computer in such a way that the computer will answer the questions. You see that its not necessary to write something in here after thinking about it, you can just answer even if you like to put any random words. To make such bots or computers there are limits and other policies.Because they do not want us to act like know it alls!You have to earn the right to answer more.I think it's because they don't want you to burn yourself out on it and get sick of it.  Setting a limit makes it seem a little more special, don't you think?So that you won't be spending all of your free time answering questions and getting the points that can't really be used?yes, 10b/c otherwise everyone would just be asking questions and not answering them.
click tools. internet options. click use current. (when on that screen)A specific answer depends on your web browser software, as each have slightly different ways of controlling this.  But in general, first go to the my yahoo page (http://my.yahoo.com), then look for "preferences" in your drop-down menus, and look for a set home page option.  when you find it, if you are currently on the my yahoo page, you can simply click on "use current" (or some similarly worded option).  good luck.Go to http://www.yahoo.com and in the upper right hand corner of the page choose the icon that says My Yahoo.  Click on the boxes for the information you want displayed on the page and choose SAVE.  You'll most likely be asked to sign in.  Once you've signed in, and your new page comes up, in the top left hand corner of the page you'll see "Make My Yahoo! your home page".  You'll get a window prompt - Do you want to make yahoo your home page.  Just select Yes and you're set.Go to Control Panel(Either in your start menu or in the left hand side of My Computer). Go to Internet Options and click on the 'General' tab. There will be a section called 'Home page'. Fill in the blank beside it with the internet page you want to appear when you open your internet explorer. Click 'apply' and 'ok'. You're all set.

Poutine is a uniquely Canadian dish (and so am I).. French fries, cheese curd topped with gravy.. Heaven on a dish!. YUMMY!. :)Poutine is french fries with gravy and cheese.  Traditionally a pot cheese is used (think of firm cottage cheese), although it can be made with almost any cheese these days.  . . I think it's a marvelous dish.  My doctor does not approve :)

it is all in your mind. get rid of emotions and you will never be sad againthe worst feeling caused by the result of the unexpected or unpleasing action,...,....,Sadness:. . Sadness, the muse of artists and the cross of madmen, differs from depression, the cold, hard clinical turn of phrase for a "downturn in mood," which is, after all, itself mere metaphor. Under sadness's auspices, great works have been created, for it itself is a cousin of truth: the understanding that we are a prisoner of our environments, genetics, and fate.Being in the same room with a person that you truely love and can't act on your feelingssadness is having no money after all if you had money you would be happyopposite of happinessthings that make you feel unpleasure.Sadness is the things that hurt us, mistakes that cause other pain, the wrongs we can not right, unsaid apologies, things that make cry, things we try to forget or at least remember and try to make ourselves a better person.....but true sadness  is not wanting to make yourself happySadness is a feeling - it's one of the many normal human emotions, or moods, we all have. Sadness is the emotion people feel when they've lost something important, or when they have been disappointed about something, or when something sad has happened to them or to someone else. When they're lonely, people often feel sad.

if u use another computer . so u need to setup the archive again on that computer. ^_^Are you sure you were once able to view these archives on another computer? Because that would be really odd as the logs of your chats and calls is stored on your hard drive and not on the Yahoo mail server as e-mail is. . . The reason you can't view the archives is due to the fact they are stored on the hard drive of your computer with the program installed on it. While you can use somebody Else's messenger to chat and send e-mails, the archive on their computer would be of their chat and voice sessions, not yours. Now, it is possible that your chats while on that computer would be stored on that computer, but not the ones from your computer.. . Sorry to have to report this, but it just is not possible to view archives unless you are on a network and have your archives on a share to the computer you are now trying to access them from. That is a process I don't have time to walk you through, as it would be about setting up a network share between those two computers if they are on the same network.

If you don't choose and there is no  votes, then it is deleted. I think they are left up for 2-3 weeks and that is it.A question is open for answers for one week. During that time, the asker can select the best answer (resolve the question), put it up to a vote or extend the answering period for one week.. . If the asker does nothing, the question automatically goes to a vote after a week. The voting period lasts one week, though if there is a tie it will stay open for voting until the tie is broken.. . When a best answer has been chosen, the resolved question stays on Yahoo! Answers forever as part of the database so people can search to find answers rather than asking the same question that many other people have already asked.. . The only ways a question would not be in the database are:. - The asker deletes the question while it is still open for answers.. - The question receives no answers and is automatically deleted.. - The question goes to a vote and "No Best Answer" is selected.. - The question is removed for violations of the community guidelines.

Here's How: Go to your Settings in your Yahoo360 page, and click the first circle that says Identity Display... then click save. NOW if you no longer want to use the yahoo 360 page, then on every page while your on the settings page, click everything to private on each page and save it, then go back to the first page on the settings page, and uncheck the box that says Activate My Yahoo360 link, then click save on that page again, and you should have your regular yahoo profile back. Rather than forwarding the email, .   - highlight the part of the email you want to send, .   - ctrl C (to copy), .   - open a new email.   - ctrl V (to paste) into the text area of the new emailAfter you click onto forward, type in the name of the address you're sending to, then starting at the lowest address, hit the backspace until you've cleaned them all out.  I've found that they will come back again on the next email, so I either forward from my sent file, or send the reconstructed email to another of my emails, then forward from there.

That's to prevent spam and abuse. People new to the site sometimes haven't quite learned the rules. If there were no limits at the lower levels, then there would be even more silly, stupid, abusive questions than there are. So the points encourage people to participate, and the limits allow them to learn the ropes without getting too many opportunities for violations or suspensions.in that case people would just start putting any answer just to get there points up in a day they'd accumulate 2500 points.I'm on level 5 and can answer unlimited answers.I guess it's a way to encourage you to reach higher levels and gain that privilege.Maybe The answers team dosen't want you to answer questions 24/7.Points Table Action Points . Begin participating on Yahoo! Answers One time: 100 . Ask a question  -5 . Choose a best answer for your question 3 . No Best Answer was selected by voters on your question Points Returned: 5 . Answer a question 2 . Deleting an answer -2 . Log in to Yahoo! Answers Once daily: 1 . Vote for a best answer 1 . Rate a best answer 1 . Have your answer selected as the best answer 10 . Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote (up to 50 thumbs-up are counted) 1 per "thumbs-up" . .   . Levels are another way to keep track of how active you (and others) have been. The more points you accumulate, the higher your level. Yahoo! Answers recognizes your level achievements with our special brand of thank you's! Level Yahoo! Answers Thank Yous Points . 7 Be the first to find out! 25000+ . 6 Be the first to find out! 10,000 - 24,999 . 5 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the home page masthead. 5,000 - 9,999 . 4 Be eligible to be a Featured User on the community manager editorial page. (coming soon) 2,500-4,999 . 3 A super-special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 1,000-2,499 . 2 A special Yahoo! Answers thank you. (coming soon) 250-999 . 1 Full access to Yahoo! Answers! 1-249 . 0 Limited access: you cannot ask a question but have level 1 privileges 0 . .   . And finally, as you attain higher levels, you'll also be able to contribute more to Yahoo! Answers - you can ask, answer, vote and rate more frequently. Level Questions Answers Comments Rates Votes . 6, 7 * unlimited * 100 100 . 5 * unlimited * 100 100 . 4 20 80 40 80 80 . 3 15 60 30 60 60 . 2 10 40 20 40 40 . 1 5 20 10 20 20Er...when you are level 5 you have unlimited points and you can ask as many questions you want. However do NOT use it to promote your website on Yahoo! Answers, as it is a direct violation of the Community Guidelines;. . Content & Usage . Yahoo! Answers is a place where people can easily share facts, opinions and personal experiences to help others. It is up to each member of Yahoo! Answers to maintain the integrity of the community's content. When posting content, please follow these rules: . YOU MAY NOT POST CONTENT (or links to content, including photos):. . to exploit, solicit, or harm minors. . that is violent, racist, incendiary, or otherwise objectionable. . that are abusive, threatening, slanderous, or belligerent against any individual or groups of individuals for any reason. . that violates federal, state or local law. . that contains profane, obscene, vulgar or sexually explicit language. . that glorifies self-harm, suicide, anorexia, bulimia, or any other practice that is clearly unhealthy or harmful. . for commercial or advertising purposes, including classified ads. . to vent your frustrations, rant, make statements, or otherwise violate the question and answer format. . to post personal ads or your own or others' personal information. . that violates the Yahoo! Answers Community Guidelines or the Yahoo! Terms of Service in any manner. . AND:. . NO COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY: You may not post URLs for the purpose of directing commercial activity to a non-Yahoo! site.Who would want to go to yours every one knows you gay.

Even if it's some other messenger, there will be a similar kind of option.1. Select Preferences under the Messenger menu. 2. Select the General category. 3. Uncheck the box next to "Automatically start Yahoo! Messenger" underneath "When I start my computer". 4. Yahoo! Toolbar's search history is separate from IE's search history.  To delete Toolbar's search history, press the 'Toolbar Settings' button (pencil icon) and click 'Clear Search History'.. If you want Toolbar to always clear its history every time you exit IE, click 'Toolbar Options...' and select the 'Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE' checkbox.TOOLS -INTERNET OPTIONS-CONTENT-AUTO COMPLETE-CLEARFORMS. How do I close my account?. . Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account.. . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in:. .     * Yahoo! Mail.     * Yahoo! Address Book.     * Yahoo! HotJobs.     * GeoCities.     * Yahoo! Briefcase.     * My Yahoo!.     * Yahoo! Groups.     * Finance Portfolio.     * Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password. . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account.. . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself.. . If you are subscribed to any premium services, we recommend that you first cancel those premium services before you delete your account. There is no guarantee that deleting your Yahoo! account will immediately cancel the billing for any premium services you might be subscribed to. To cancel your current subscriptions, visit Yahoo! Billing Information for your account, choose the "My Services" tab, and click the "Cancel" link for each subscription.. . To remove your entire account, please visit our Account Deletion page. You will be asked to sign in to or verify your password for the account you wish to delete. Please be sure to read the next page carefully, as important information about your account is included. You can then confirm the deletion of your account.. . If you're having trouble signing in, you can get password help on the Sign-in and Registration Help page.. . Please complete the deletion process only if you are certain you would like to remove your entire Yahoo! account and any features you have personalized within the account. After the deletion process is initiated, your Yahoo! account can never be recovered.. . . . . . http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/changing_users/edit-23.htmlI am having the same problem, will not let me delete a profile......must be a problem with yahoo . i don't know how to let yahoo know.....

It depends on the manner by which you sent your message.  If you use MS Outlook on a MS Exchange Server, you could get a confirmation when a user has received or read a particular message.  If you use Web-based email accounts like Yahoo! Mail, there's really no way of confirming.. . As for the first issue of recalling a message, you could recall a message on an MS Exchange Server, but the recipient will be prompted about the recall.  Otherwise, there's no way of recalling a message except if you call your recipient's/recipients' ISP product support and have them delete the message that you sent... Good luck with that though.  There are privacy regulations that prevent them from tampering with correspondence.. . My suggestion is you apologize deeply for missent email instead... Good luck with that, too.Go to Sent Item folder, Open your sent out email. Go To Action Menu, there is menu of "Recall this mail".. . It able to recall that mail if the recipient not yet read it. Nothing can do if he/she already read it.The both are not possible, lets hope someone will come with a idea to do that in the future. If they can give a conformation that the mail saver has sent the e-mail to the recipient, I don't think why not someone can come up with a idea when the recipient opens the the mail(click on the mail) so the sender can get a notice to let know that the reader opened the mail?!That depends on what provider you have for sending mail. Outlook has a function that let you recall mail if it has not been . read and also can notify you if your mail has been read.. If you have another provider, I do not think you can do that. You. can purchase a service called "read notify" that will notify you when mail has been read, it gives the time it was read, how many times it is read, approximate location of the person when your mail was read. It cost about $19.95 annually, but you can download and use it free for about a month.You can't recall an e-mail. Once you send it, your boss will know what you truly think about him.

When is signs you on, click preferences and then uncheck the box that has you automatically sign in.set your preferences in messenger, so it doesn't pop up when you start up.. when you are logged into messenger, click on messenger at the top, then click on preferences, another window will open, on the left side click on general, and at top it will say . "When I start my computer" under that it will say . "Automatically start Yahoo Messenger" uncheck that box, then click OK at the bottom of that window, and it should stop Yahoo from starting when you start up your computer.you have to sign in...under the messenger tab...select preferences and under general, uncheck the box that says sign in when i start my computer...hit apply and you should be all set.Yahoo Messenger will only come up when you are on the internet. What you may be seeing is Windows Messenger, especially if you run XP. I found this to be a problem so I disabled the Messenger: Click on Start, Control Panel, Add/Remove Programs, and when this is loaded, on the left side click on Remove Windows components. That box sometimes hides behind the Add/Remove, so look for it. Scroll down until you find Messenger and remove the checkmark.

LOL. Somebody was searching naughty stufffffYou could probably just hit the history button up on your toolbar (it's the one that looks like a clock with a green arrow). A side bar will pop up, and you can just right-click and scroll down to the delete option.. Oh, and here's some other tips that my friend told me one day...If you have a Google drop-down toolbar, click the down arrow by the G and choose View History, then there's a clear history option in the bottom right hand corner of that history box to get rif of anything you've searched on Google.  Also, to get rid of the Temporary Internet files (images you may have picked up)  go to tools at the top when you open the internet, choose internet options at the botton, and select Delete Files of the buttons in the middle row.. . Hope this helps!

Click on My Account under your ID. Verify password and you will see where it says Change Password.You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.

Mail the default email application for your computer, click Tools > Internet Options > Programs tab > under E-mail click the down arrow and select Yahoo! Mail > click Apply. If Yahoo! Mail isn't listed as a default email option follow the directions below.. . Using Internet Explorer just click "Continue" on the link below to download a small 60K file that will enable Yahoo! Mail to be the default email application for your computer. Whenever you click on an email address on any web page or in any computer program, Yahoo! Mail will open for you in a new window.. . If Internet Explorer displays a yellow security bar at the top, click on it and select Install ActiveX Control from the menu. . If a security warning comes up with Yahoo! Inc. as the publisher, click Install. . . Now you can click on an email address anywhere and your computer will automatically open up Yahoo! Mail for you. . You can even send documents directly from Word, Excel, or other Windows applications. . . Requirements:. Windows 95 / 98 / ME / NT / 2000 / XP / Vista. Internet Explorer 4.0 or higher. . http://help.yahoo.com/help/uk/mail/ext/ext-11.html

If you have windows XP get Pak 2 installed in your computerSearch information is usually stored in cookies (client side) or a database (server side).  Might try trashing your cookies.  Most browsers let you look through your cookies.  They will be indexed by site URL.It's a good idea to erase your tracks when using a computer, especially if it's a public computer. There are a couple ways to do it. First, from Internet Explorer, go to Tools / Internet Options / General. From that tab, you can clear your history with the Clear History button. You can also delete cookies.. . But you have to understand that this doesn't completely erase your tracks. There are still temp files, tons of files in the /Temporary Internet Files/ path, etc. You may have to purchase a third party product like.... . http://watersaffl.evderaser.hop.clickbank.net?tid=YAHOOANS. . ... to purge all that stuff. A member assists other members in answering questions and posing thoughtful questions of your own. . . To answer a question, click the big green ANSWER at the top of the page, and select a question that you know the answer to. . . Click answer, and type in your reply. Open up your outlook express, create an account.  Then type in your pop, and your smtp settings.  which you can locate in your yahoo settings.  good luckBest Answer - Chosen by Asker. . You have to pay for Yahoo! Mail Plus. . . If you are a Mail Plus user, then follow the directions outlined below: . Outlook Express allows you to add a new email account to your existing profile. This means you do not have to replace your current settings in order to send and receive Yahoo! Mail messages. Here's how: . . 1.From the Tools menu, choose "Accounts." . 2.Select the "Mail" tab. . 3.Click the "Add" button. . 4.From the Add menu, click "Mail." . 5.In the text box labeled Display Name, type your name and click "Next." . 6.In the Email Address box, type your Yahoo! Mail address (be sure to include "@yahoo.com") and click "Next." . 7.Under "My incoming mail server is a..." select "POP3." . 8.Type "pop.mail.yahoo.com" in the Incoming Mail (POP3, IMAP, or HTTP) Server box. . 9.Type "smtp.mail.yahoo.com" in the Outgoing Mail (SMTP) Server box. . 10.Click "Next." . 11.In the Account Name box, type your Yahoo! Mail ID (your email address without the "@yahoo.com"). . 12.In the Password box, type your Yahoo! Mail password. . 13.If you want Outlook Express to remember your password, check the "Remember password" box. . 14.Do not check the boxes labeled "Log on using Secure..." . 15.Click "Next." . 16.Click "Finish."

It says this becuase u dont have full access rights to your comp, as i think you would be sharing your comp. There must be another person, who has full rights. SO u have to either ask that person to loggin from his windows id to install it, or ask him to give u full access rights on your own windows loggin.If you are on a created account , or a guest account under the administrators name.you would have to have them change your account to an account on the computer in which you are able to download. Sounds like you are on a limited account and they are usually restricted from downloading and any changes made to the computer.You need to ask the person who owns the computer if they mind you downloading stuff.  Tell them what you'd like and either they'll give you access or do it themselves.An administrative account is usually the person in charge of the computer or computer network. If you are on a personal computer, it would generally be the person who owns it. The administrator has more privileges such as downloads. If you are on a network of computers, such as at work/school, you would probably have to do some investigating to find the administrator. Generally, restrictions on downloads are put on accounts by administrators to protect their computer or system from viruses, etc.. . If you want to download messenger, you will have to find out who the administrator is and get them to do it.Hi,. I've got the same problem. I modify the target directory where I can write, but the installer try anyway to put a fill in "program files" where I can't write with this account.. . They don't use rounding -- they use truncation. Much easier. But I do agree with you that rounding is easy, too.no, they just screw us on about everything....Better to round down than up. . Also, in a lot of programming languages the default variables for an integer round down no matter what and adding .5 to everything would just make the code longer and more of a pain to work with.  It's not laziness, just efficiency?

Put your addresses in the bcc area.  This means blind carbon copy.If you're sending a message to a bunch of people, use BCC (blind carbon copy) instead of putting everyone in the To or CC box. When you are composing a message, look for a link that says Add BCC above the To box. That will add another box similar to the To box that you can place your addresses into. Putting addresses there sends your email to everyone, but it only shows each recipient's email address when they receive it, instead of showing the entire list of addresses you sent it to.

It is a weblog. Usually people use it as a place to write how the feel about things and their thoughts. Other have taken it to a different level and have news reports, video and opinons. Like a mini newspaper. But mostly just personal thoughts and views.is a website where entries are made in journal style and displayed in a reverse chronological order.. . Blogs often provide commentary or news on a particular subject, such as food, politics, or local news; some function as more personal online diaries. A typical blog combines text, images, and links to other blogs, web pages, and other media related to its topic. Most blogs are primarily textual although some focus on photographs (photoblog), videos (vlog), or audio (podcasting), and are part of a wider network of social media.Just like a diary...you can add pics and daily info about what you've done that day, photos, just anything you feel like puting on there that the other members might find interesting...you can have it visibal just for your friends or for public view. If you start one....don't put any information that might be risky or misused. You can always hide or delete your blog. Take a look at some of the other 360° pages of other members' that will give you an idea what it's all about.Its a collaboration of your thoughts and ideas or even experiences that you want to share with others or get feedback from.its a electronic diary to say what you did in the day or where you went etcIt's an online journal. The word comes from [web/log]... You can post about anything that's on your mind, your hobbies, politics, etc.
Seems to me that my buddies say no, it can't be done. I think they also say that it often depends on how soon you've added them to your collection, and if they have just updated their page and put something new on.You have no control over where your friends show up on your list. That is determined by who has updated their page the most recently. If they don't do anything with their page...they will stay towards the bottom of your list. If they update in any way..they move up. If someone is STAYING at the top of your page...then they most likely have Feeds on their page...and when working properly..Feeds update regularly.
right below your question is a bar. on it is things like grading the question up or down.  and email question.. on the far right is a thing that looks like a pencil, just hold your cursor over that, and you will see a box come up to chose what you want to do, chose extend question another 4 days.I  had the same question.  Here is how you do it.  Below your question there are several Icon...a thumbs up and thumbs down etc....there is an Icon that looks like a pencil..the last icon on the right.  It you click that one of the opens is to extend date so your question last another 4 days.  Do this and you will be all set.. . JTView your question. Underneath your question is a group of icons in a horizontal line. Hover your mouse cursor over the pencil icon until a menu appears. Choose the option that says "Extend expiration".

soft bouncing usually happens when a mailbox is full or something temporary made the email bounce.. . hard bouncing usually indicates that an email account has been closed.. . The group owner or moderator can send a "reactivation request" and usually receive back the reason the email is bouncing.Check the Bounce History of the Bouncing Member.  The last line on the page will give the reason the mail bounced back to Yahoo.  . . In my experience with bouncing members, hard bouncing is sometimes _but not always_ a permanent condition so do send reactivation notices and wait a while before unsubbing any members.. . Hope that helps!

Go to Control Panel > "Add/Remove Programs" >find Yahoo Messenger on the list and click  'remove.'Go to your control panel (hit start, then hit control panel) and click on "add or remove programs" and search for the yahoo instant messenger icon and click on it.  Follow the instructions and the computer will do the rest.First, you should be logged on to your computer as the "administrator", the go to "start" - "control panel" - "add/remove programs". Wait a minute for this list to fully appear on the screen, then scroll down to the bottom and click on "yahoo messenger" to high-lite it, then click on "remove". Do the same thing for "yahoo install manager". Then shut down your computer and 're-boot' to make the process complete. You always have to restart the computer to make it happen correctly.or if you have a MAC, just drag the icon from the applications folder into the trash... et voila.Go to Control Panel > Add/Remove Programs > find Yahoo Messenger on the list and click "remove".  Then thats about it.This instruction tells how to remove orphan files and registry keys which add/remove program uninstall leaves:. . 1.Remove all Yahoo programs (toolbar, Extras etc) from Control Panel >> Add/remove programs. 2.Manually delete folder C:/Program Files/Yahoo. 3.Delete two following registry keys (be extremely careful while making changes to PCs registry. Deleting incorrect keys can possible cause whole PC to stop working !!!) . a.Click: START >> RUN. b.In RUN type: regedit. c.In new window by extending tree find two following keys:. HKCU/Software/Yahoo. HKLM/Software/Yahoo. d.Right click name of each key and select export (this will create back up of deleted keys just in case). e.Specify location of some folder you want to export keys to (you can also make new one by right clicking on unused part of PC screen and selecting New >> Folder). f.After exporting of both keys is completed right click them and delete them both.. g.Should need arise you can restore deleted keys by clicking “File >> Import” in Registry Editor window. 4.Once all done restart PC

In the case of Yahoo Messenger:. You need to have a Yahoo ID to Sign In into the messenger service. Once you Sign In click on Add Contact icon and add your friends Yahoo ID. (In the latest version of Yahoo messenger you can add your friends MSN ID as well.) Once you add your friends ID, Yahoo will automatically send an invitaion to your friend to accept/reject your invitation. When your friend accepts your invitation you should be able to see his ID on your contacts section. Double click on his ID to start chatting with him.. . In the case of MSN messenger:. Its the same as Yahoo messenger. The only difference is that to Sign In into a MSN messenger you dont need to have a hotmail or MSN ID. You can sign up for Microsoft .NET Passport and use any of your email id as your MSN messenger id. (In MSN messenger 8.0 also known as Windows Live Messenger you can add your friends Yahoo ID as well.). . In the case of Google Talk:. Its the same as the other two messengers except that you can only add people having GMail IDs.. . Finally, in Yahoo messenger you can connect to any of the public chat rooms and chat with random people who have the same interests as you. The other messengers stated above dont have this feature.. . For more details visit: http://messenger.msn.com & http://messenger.yahoo.comif you have people on your contracts list and they have an yahoo id then just click on there name and send an im. but if they dont have yahoo im cou can only send an e-mail. invite them to get yahoo im
POP3 is the way to go. One thing to note though, there is a setting in outlook to have outlook leave copies of the mails on yahoo server. If you don't set it then all those emails would be downloaded to your local machine and removed from yahoo, and there is no way for you to access your emails from outside your machine.You cant download it, into outlook.  You can integrate it, and that's about it.  You have to set up your yahoo account as a pop3 account.  Then you can set up outlook, to download the emails out of your yahoo account, and allow you to view through it.I just did this pop thing for my husband last night, ... the link below should take you to everything you need to know.

While signed in look at the very top of the IE window where your S/N is and click on "My Account", then go to the section where you can change your password and follow instructions. It's very easy.. . For other types of passwords, it depends upon where they are, how and what they are used for. E.G: MSN password or Windows User Login password.however you wantHow do I change my password?. If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . 1.Click the "Change Password" link. . 2.Enter your current password in the first box. . 3.Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . 4.Confirm your new password in the third box. . 5.Click the "Save" button. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.Try a free product offered by Loginizer.com. to manage all your Passwords and User IDs.. It helps me a lot.. . http://www.Loginizer.com

If your email address is actually sending out SPAM, it's likely that you contracted a trojan virus that has taken over your email program (Outlook?).  If that's the case, you need to run a good virus scan.  Another trick to prevent future issues is to put an entry into your Contact list named "AAAAAA" (so that it's always the first) with no email address.  SOME viri will stop when the contact doesn't have a valid email address, thereby preventing it from sending to all of your contacts.. . However, if you're just seeing spam come into your account (and others') but there's nothing in your sent folder (assuming you have your software to save outgoing messages), it's more likely that your email address has been spoofed rather than actually hacked into and used to send SPAM.  If that's the case, not much you can do.  Sorry.What I think you are asking is how do you prevent someone from "spoofing" your email address as the sender on spam emails, even though they are not coming from your computer or your email account?. . You can't.Change your pass word often.. . I bet you use AOLget the virus or malware out of your computer maybe?don't spam anyone, and if it's a virus that's sending out the emails from your account, there is no way to stop it unless you get rid of the virus!

What you can do is stick them in your junk folder and you will still have all those messages.Create a folder with a special name that will allow you to know they're messages that you would have deleted but chose not to such as: For later review (or something like that).Once you delete e-mails or messages, they are dumped in your trash folder.  And yahoo is specific in stating, messages in trash folder are subject to deletion at any time.  . . The best way, if you want to save these wanted e-mails or messages, create a folder. Go to Yahoo Mail Page.  Locate the MOVE toolbar.  In here you 'll find folders.  Label them with creative names as I have, intimates, or stuff.  Forward these e-mails or messages over to that folder.  This way you're assured of their safekeeping.  . . When my computer had a virus and shut itself down automatically x3 weeks. I lost all my files and documents stored on the desktops.  But the folders were saved.If there is any doubt you want it, do NOT delete. Maybe have a folder marked "Maybe=maybe not" to look thru once a week.

To answer questions, just click the question, then click the "Answer Question" button under the question.. . To answer people's posts to your question, you need to click their avatar or name. This brings you to their profile page. There will be a blue link to the right of their face that says "Email <nickname>" or "IM <nickname>" if they allow IM or email. Click it to send a message.if they allow email, email them or via their 360 page. . to answer go to that question;. click the Answer This Question button . submit answer.. click ok. . /docWell, answering questions requires clicking the big blue button called "Answer this Question". You can't answer posting that people made to your questions. You can make a comment when you choose best answer though.You answer other peoples questions by clicking the big blue button that says Answer Question. Then go to "change password" and verify your old and new one where they tell you to.Click on My Account under your ID. Verify password and you will see where it will say Change Password.How do I change my password?. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . Click the "Change Password" link. . Enter your current password in the first box. . Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . Confirm your new password in the third box. . Click the "Save" button. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *. . . For additional information on choosing a strong password, please visit the Yahoo! Security Center.You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.Go to your profile and change it.

Because people who ask questions are too lazy to select a Best Answer. That means the rest of us have the chance. And if there's a tie, the question remains unresolved until the tie is broken. Which often doesn't happen, because if the question is more than a week old no one will bother to read it.~~~Sometimes someone may ask a question, but mabey is away from their computer for a couple days,,,,,or mabey they are waiting for more answers to their question.  I know for me personally,,if I ask a question,,,then mabey I am super busy at work and then dont go on computer for a couple days the questions I ask are still waiting for me to choose best answer,,,,,Questions can be resolved after four hours. Maybe after that time, the answer someone isn't looking for isn't there.  If they take longer to choose the best answer, maybe they were waiting until they saw their best answer appear before doing so, or they wanted to weigh up each answer and choose based on a criteria they selected.  . . Questions that go into voting can take longer, and I imagine this is what you're talking about. Voting initially lasts for two days, and the best answer is chosen as the answer with the most votes.  Sometimes though, there is more than one answer voted for, and more people need to come along to vote to give one answer the most votes. However, they don't come along frequent enough, or if they do, there's a tie breaker. Tie breakers last until one answer has a lead for 12 hours.Some questions are hard to answer, and some questions really don't earn an answer.. . If someone asks, "Why are ducks?". They won't get an answer, but if the same person asks, a microbiology question, it may take weeks to understand and solve the problem to supply an answer.. . Davesome askers ask for extensions on their expiration, some askers don't feel the need to pick their own best answers and leave it up to idiots like me who are level 2 or higher and can vote on which answer we find most informative.  Sometimes all of the answers suck.. After your question has been posted for four hours, you have the option of resolving your own question by picking a best answer yourself.

You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then:. .    1. Click the "Change Password" link..    2. Enter your current password in the first box..    3. Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box..    4. Confirm your new password in the third box..    5. Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! tools in outlook, go to E-Mail Accounts, add new account, choose pop3.. . then you will need to put in tour yahoo email address, username, password - that kind of stuff.. . also incoming & outgoing server addresses - thing the i/c one is pop.mail.yahoo.com. . check this anyway.... . http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/ext/ext-07.htmlE-Mail Stationery in Yahoo Mail with Outlook Express. . You can configure Yahoo Mail so that Outlook Express can be used to send and receive messages on your Yahoo Mail account. When you do this you are still also able to access your Yahoo Mail account online (via your web browser.). . Accessing a Yahoo Mail account through Outlook Express has a number of advantages:. . You can keep a large amount of e-mail without overflowing the storage available to you at Yahoo.. . You can read your messages "offline". I.e. you can read them while your computer is not connected to the Internet.. . E-Mail stationery will work. Most e-mail stationery uses "scripting", which is not supported by Yahoo Mail online (when you use Yahoo Mail in your web browser.) When you view the same messages in Outlook Express instead, you can see them as intended.. . If you already access your Yahoo Mail account this way, and you are not seeing received stationery correctly in Outlook Express, please click on one of the following links for more information about your version of Outlook Express:. . Outlook Express 5 and 5.5. . Outlook Express 6. . To set up your Yahoo Mail account for use in Outlook Express:. . Go to your Yahoo Mail account online in your web browser.. . Click Options. . Click Pop Access & Forwarding. . To Sign Up, you'll have to agree to accept e-mails of special offers from Yahoo. Select the categories of offers you are willing to receive, then click Finished.. . Use the defaults on the next screen ("Web and POP Access", and "HTML Messages") and click Submit.. . Now you will be at a page which is titled "Pop Configuration". You might want to bookmark this page and/or print it, in case you ever reinstall Outlook Express. Near the bottom of this page is a link titled "Configuring Microsoft Outlook Express". Click that link and follow the instructions there to finish the setup.. . After you finish the above setup you will be able to pick up and send Yahoo Mail messages using Outlook Express.U cannot do so, unless u subscribe to the premium paid account with yahoo.Don't do it! Stick with accessing yahoo direct and save yourself a stack of potential problems!

Click on My Account which is under your ID. Verify password and you will see where it says Change Password.Go to My Account on top of the page, and click on it. It will lead you to all your settings, including passwords changing.You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-13.html.. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . - Click the "Change Password" link. . - Enter your current password in the first box. . - Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . - Confirm your new password in the third box. . - Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.wut she saidI'm using LOGINizer to manage all my personal passwords.. I like it. It's FREE! Check it out: http://www.Loginizer.com

Hello,. How are you?. . Since you are talking about spam mails, i would like to share some information with you. Suppose someone sends you an e-mail anonymously, and you dont know who that person is, you can easily trace him out through his ip address.. . There are many people who try to send anonymous mails through SMTP servers, but they dont know that their IP address gets logged in the e-mail and they can be traced.. . For knowing the senders IP address, you need to open the headers of the mails, this can be views through clicking view on the above menu, and then view headers. This option is available on netscape browser and outlook express. Now if the mail is abusive you can complaint the cyber crime ofice and tell them the senders ip, he would be traced shortly!!. . If you ever notice anything "different" about the points that you earn, view your recent activity.  Click the "My Q&A" link, and click the "Activity details" tab. Cc: stands for "carbon copy." Anyone listed in the Cc: field of a message will receive a copy of that message when you send it. All other recipients of that message will be able to see that the person you designated as a Cc: recipient has received a copy of the message. To add an entry in the Cc: field, click the "Add CC" link above the To: field.CC means carbon copy. BCC means Blind carbon copy.IT MEANS CARBON COPYcarbon copyCarbon copy.. Mail sent to more than one person.Carbon copy.  It's a holdover term from the days where carbon paper was put between sheets of typing paper before a memo was typed, before Xeroxes and printers.Stands for carbon copy- which dates back to the days when typists used carbon paper to make duplicates of letters, for files, or for multiple copies being mailed, before copy machines were invented.  If names are inserted in the CC line, these people will also get copies of the email that you have written.  So if you send an email to Frank, for a lunch meeting, but want George and Harry to know you're contacting Frank, you'd put their names and addresses in the CC line and they'll get copies of the email you send to Frank.Back in the "Dark Ages" before computers letters were send by snail mail.  They were typed on a typewriter.  If a copy was to be sent to another person, the writer would type CC and then the name of that person at the bottom of the letter.  CC stands for carbon copy.  It's a hang-over from the days when carbon paper was used ... the days before photocopy machines.Carbon Copy.... if you type an email address in that line, that person will receive a copy of the email you are sending. . . BCC is Blind Carbon Copy meaning that if you type an address in the BCC line, that person will receive a copy of the email you are sending but their email address will not show to the others who received the email.Carbon Copy.. . This is a hang over from years ago when actual paper was used to communicate.  The CC said that a carbon copy of the letter (a duplicate) was sent to specific people.. . BCC denotes a Blind Carbon Copy.  This is used to send someone a copy of an email without letting the main receiptant (the TO: box name) know that they got one.. . Hope this helpscarbon copy......another person your sending it toCarbon Copy- this means that you sent it to the main recipient, but then you send a "copy" of the original to others either to show that an e-mail was sent or to make others aware of what was sent out.
