This refers to post that target a group of people in an abusive manner. This could be by threatening harm to them, spreading hateful messages about them, or in any other way insulting them on the site. This means that you cannot post racist, sexist, or any other hateful questions, answers, comments, or posts about a group of people. Also, you cannot use an avatar depicting anything of this nature. If a person uses a picture of a swastika it will be removed, because it is associated with anti-Semitic groups. . We understand that like in any community we are going to have a wide variety of people coming from various walks of life. Not all are going to agree on everything, but we ask that you show respect to fellow community members at all times. If you feel that you are being attacked or insulted in this manner you have the option to report the abuse to us. Please refrain from responding to these types of messages, we, as a team, are equipped to handle these types of post.. If you have any other questions or need more clarification you can email us at y_answers_team@yahoo.com. . Katie. Community Managerthis mean that just because you dont agree with certain groups that you are not allowed to be slanderous, threatening or abusive towards them or to any individual with links or photos, including the content of you answer or question.. . in other words, have respect for everyone or dont bother answering and move on to another topic.What is it, exactly, that you don't understand?. . You can't cuss people out, or call them names or in any way verbally abuse them; you can't threaten them (saying you're going to stomp their *ss or kill, main, or otherwise harm them); you can't slander (say that they are thieves or murderers or sluts, for example).. . What is it you don't understand about this? If you were more specific about what you're asking, we might be able to clarify.. . The concept is that, as a site whose purpose is providing information and advice, discourse should be civilized, not mindlessly brutish.well it means exactly what it says.  You may not post content that slanders, threatens or abuses any groups of individuals, which I take to mean, you should not post racist or religious slurs amongst other things.  it's self explanatoryDictionary.com Unabridged (v 1.0.1) . . a?bu?sive? /??byus?v/ Pronunciation Key - Show Spelled Pronunciation[uh-byoo-siv] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation . . –adjective 1. using, containing, or characterized by harshly or coarsely insulting language: an abusive author; abusive remarks.  . 2. treating badly or injuriously; mistreating, esp. physically: his abusive handling of the horse.  . 3. wrongly used; corrupt: an abusive exercise of power.  . . . . threat?en?ing? /??r?tn??/ Pronunciation Key - Show Spelled Pronunciation[thret-n-ing] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation . . –adjective 1. tending or intended to menace: threatening gestures.  . 2. causing alarm, as by being imminent; ominous; sinister: threatening clouds.  . . . --------------------------------------------------------------------------------. . Simply merge the photos into a single Gif or JPG woth paintbrush, photoshop. etc.Anywhere you want a picture, use this code:. . . <img src="URL of Image" alt="Caption for image" height="" width=""></img>. . . If your image did not appear, troubleshoot it below. --If the image is on your computer, you must first upload it to a website, a universal host. I use Photobucket.com, but there is also Flickr.com and I have heard that there is a Snapfish.com too I think. They are all free . . The reason for this is that if you link a picture from your computer, for example C:&#92;mypic.jpg, . Anyone else who goes to the page; their computer will look for C:&#92;mypic.jpg. and because their computer does not have said file, it will not show up. If you upload it to a universal host, it will read "http://mypic.jpg" and since both computers have access to it, they can both view it now. . --if your image ends in html, it's wrong. You're linking the PAGE it's on, not the image. Right click the picture, and click properties. then copy the url and use that. . --if you have not defined height and width, take it out. otherwise they will have neither. And if it's 0 high and 0 wide, you wont see it. . DONT FORGET TO PUT THE HEIGHT AND WIDTH IN BETWEEN THOSE QUOTATION MARKS UP THERE !!! AND YOU WILL HAVE TO SWITCH THEM AROUND OR YOUR PICTURE WILL COME OUT SHORT AND SQUATTY! SO WHEN YOU RIGHT CLICK ON THE PICTURE YOU'RE WANTING AND THEN CHOOSE "PROPERTIES"...DOWN WHERE IT SAYS THE HEIGHT AND WIDTH...SWITCH THEM AROUND BEFORE PUTTING THEM IN THE CODE. FOR EXAMPLE: IF IT SAYS IN THE PROPERTIES OF YOUR PICTURE THAT IT IS 162 x 227...............BEFORE PUTTING IT IN THE CODE ABOVE...CHANGE IT TO  227 x 162 AND YOUR PICTURE WILL COME OUT RIGHT!
Spam the address. The next time it tries to come through it will automatically be recognized as spam and be deleted instantly.You may have reached the maximum number of addresses you can block. Try just blocking the domain name (I.E. news.problemsolvers.com instead of news@news.problemsolvers.com).. . Check your blocked address list and see if you have a number of blocked addresses with the same domain name. If so, clear all the addys with the same domain name and enter just the domain name to block all mail from that domain.

Its grey because you can't rate your own answer.You just can't rate your own answers but everyone else canYou can't rate your answers; that's why they're greyed out. Other people's answers are greyed out for them as well because they can't rate them. But to other people, they won't be greyed out, and they will be able to be rated.

Anytime you visit a website (most times) data is mined from the cookies placed in your browser cache. From this data, information is compiled giving the asker such details as, what websites you visit, your geographical location, your IP, your email address. Also, filling out forms online will do this. And when you forward mail to someone and don't use the BCC line, all those email addresses are visible to those who want to use them for SPAM.This happens because when you forward your emails, your name appears on a list of email addresses through which that email has been sent. Anyone can take a random address from that list and start contacting you.You signed up for something. But that something was not anything at all. It was a spammer.Maybe someone gave them your email address to harrass you.Maybe it's spam..or someone might have used a random email address (yours) when signing up for things on the internetwhen you register with certain websites they can give away your E-mail address.
The points are just a way to encourage participation. There is no reward for getting points except for moving up levels. You lose points for every question that you ask and when you get a violation.You can trade your points in at Tesco's and Asda for vouchers !They go down when you ask a question, if you delete an answer, they go up when you answer, or when you select best answer, or if your answer is chosen as best.. Violations probably also knock your points down.If your points go down then you have had a violation and answer removed - you lose 12 points for each one.  Check your emails for violation notices .. The points are just for fun anyway xxxxYou get points as a reward for helping someone get their question answered as well as for the bragging rights.  . . Your points go down bc you posted a question like this vs. figuring it out on your own.Point go down for two reasons . . 1) You ask questions (-5). . 2) YOu received a violation notice (anything from -2 to -20). . And what do you get?. . Bragging rightsClick on yer points and level number.Well actually if you think for a minute, since it cost you 5 points to ask this question, if you are not running after points by any possible means, you will soon run out of it and then wont be able to ask questions anymore..Points encourage participation. You should loose points only for asking questions or receiving violations.

See the button that has the - on it?  The one right next to the 0?  Hit <shift> and - at the same time, and the result is _ .On your computer keyboard, locate the dash key.  It's before the plus sign(+). Shift as if to use upper case  and press that key and _.  There you are.. . Do you know how to do the tilde over the letter N in Spanish: ?  Press Alt key and while pressing down, punch in 164 or 0241 for lower case., on the num pad located way over to the right of the keyboard. ?   For upper case, it's Alt plus 165 or 0209.: ?    I know you didn't ask this .  I just learned this recently so I'm imparting to you my newly aquired knowledge.It's a "capital dash".. . Hold down the shift key while pressing the - button (between zero and = on the keyboard).

From no_life_louis. . That was bugging me too. I had like 485 attachments and there's no delete option. What you have to do is delete the actual email message which contains the attachment. Then it will be off the list. Worked for me. . Delete in inbox, sent, drafts, bulk & trash.If they were saved to a temp folder then you need to go to Start->Run and type %temp% and click enter. When the folder opens up go to Edit->Select All and then delete. . Otherwise all you need to do is find the folder you saved them to and select all and delete.
once you submit your answer, there is a little box at the bottom and it says send ansers to me, you check it and youll get your answers.Click on your avatar(or my Q&A) and scroll down to the my questions tab and click on it. Then click on the question that you want to look at the answers to.Actually, the best way to keep track is to use your watch list.  After you have posted your question, go to the right end of the action bar.  That's the bar that starts with thumbs up and down.  At the right end is a plus sign.  Click on it and then click on Add to watch list.  . . The watch list appears as a third tab next to the questions and answers tabs on the My Q&A page.   You can follow the progress of your questions and answers.  . . For me, one of the best parts of the watch list is that only you can remove items from the list.  If a question has been removed for whatever reason, it is taken out of the question and/or answers list.  It is not removed from the watch list.  You can't access the question itself since it's gone, but at least you will know that it did get deleted.go to q an ansClick the My Q&A link located underneath the Discover icon.. Scroll down the page until you see the My answers, my questions and my watchlist tab.. Click the My questions tab.. Click the link to view the desired question.Go to your Q&A page. there will be a tab for your questions. Highlight it and it will bring up that question. Click on the question and you can see all answersgo to My Q&A in the upper right corner. click on my questions.Just like this one - if someone answers your question for you, you will receive an e-mail telling you that you have received a new answer to your question.

Always some lyrics or pregnancy issues with the crazies up in here. grrfor you to answerI googled your question and the first result presented this answer:. . "I think there are different factors for different people and situations. Certainly laziness, ignorance of search engines, and wanting to hear a range of opinions occur sometimes. But another aspect is simply that it allows them to interact with others. Answerbag is a form of "social networking" website; talking to other people -- even virtually -- helps to reduce the sense of isolation we have sometimes. Its like asking "how are you doing" in a social setting; its not that the answer is all that crucial, its just the mechanics of social connection." [1]. . But I'm not at all giving you a hard time.  I wonder all the time about folks not just googling their question or checking Wikipedia.. . I think the main reason is laziness.  People don't want to have to plow through the search results to find the answer themselves, they'd rather wait around for someone else to do the work and get 10 YA points for it.  That's a shame, because the asker would learn a lot more if he or she did the research him- or herself.  They'd probably even come up with new questions, the answers to most of which could also be googled, or found on Wikipedia.  That's doubly a shame since lots of these easy questions are obviously from homework assignments.  These kids are trying to avoid work, not trying to learn.. . So laziness and just not knowing how to properly search for the data they want.  I'm sure that you've noticed that most questions here are poorly worded, ungrammatical, and contain spelling mistakes--all things which may indicate laziness, apathy towards the subject, and a possible failure to really know what they're looking for.. . So, you've asked a very good question. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account.. . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in:. . * Yahoo! Mail. * Yahoo! Address Book. * Yahoo! HotJobs. * GeoCities. * Yahoo! Briefcase. * My Yahoo!. * Yahoo! Groups. * Finance Portfolio. * Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password. . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account.. . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . Login to Yahoo mail or Yahoo answers.. Click on "My account". Select "change password"How do I change my password?. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-13.html.. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . - Click the "Change Password" link. . - Enter your current password in the first box. . - Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . - Confirm your new password in the third box. . - Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.Login to  Yahoo answers.. Click on "My account". Select "change password" that's alljust type your email address then check

Hold down the Ctrl key on your keyboard and click the message to highlight and select it for deletion without opening it, then click delete. You can hold down the Ctrl key and select as many as you want at without opening them. If you want to select several at one time you can hold down the Shift key, click the first message and the last message and all messages in between will be selected.The email should be safe even if its viewed in the lower pane. Just as long as you don't open any attachments, you should be OK. The lower pane is like a preview of the email.Easy .. I do it all the time particularly if there is any suspicious email that I had received.. When you click n the check mail, you may have a number of items come up.. To the left of each and every item, there will be a little square where you can click an X into.. for those you want to delete.. place an X in those squares and then click delete

Skin and features are better in Yahoo Beta mail, at least for me.. . Tab-browsing, and hotkeys can be used in Yahoo Beta mail as compared to the regular mail. For example, you can read more than one mail in a single window if you are using Internet Explorer. Hotkeys such as 'r' for reply and 'n' for compose can ease your effort of moving the mouse (thought I don't use them).It's more organized and more upgraded pretty much. It's cool.

Send it in parts: The only way you can do that is if you have a scanner. If you do, you can then you divide the papers/file and scan as different documents then, you can send them seperately in an e-mail.You can do that. Do the following.. 1. Zip the file using winzip . 2. Split the zipped file into smaller size (To split the file, open your zipped file in winzip then goto the menu Action>Split). 3. Attatch these smaller size files and send. 4. The recepient needs to save all these files in a directory and just unzip the file which have a .zip extension(all other files comes with a .z01,.z02,.z03,... extension) .He will get the entire file.

you got that one right :)Voting initally lasts 2 days. If the vote is in a tie after that, or there are no votes, voting is then extended in 12 hour increments until there is either one vote, or a one answer has more votes than the other answers.
To switch from Beta back to original Yahoo! Mail:. . Either:. At the top left of your screen, directly under your Welcome <username> sign next to the Yahoo! Mail logo, there are three small blue links: “Log out” “Your Account” “Switch Back”. Click “Switch Back”.. . -or-. Log out or close the Beta Mail, reopen Beta Mail. . IMMEDIATELY when you see the “bouncing ball guy”, click the RED X (STOP) at the top of your screen. This prevents the log on from going any further.. . Directly under the "bouncing guy" is a link that says “Trouble Logging In?”. Click it. You will have several options that might help with your problem. . . If not:. . The last option is :. Switch back to original Yahoo! Mail . by opting out of Yahoo! Mail Beta. Select that to switch back to regular mail.. . This is a tricky solution, though. You have to be REAL QUICK on clicking that RED X or the log on process will continue to the error point and may not let you click the "Trouble" link. It took me three tries to get it, myself (but then, I'm old and slow -- lol!).. . Good luck!use your system restore, if you don't have it reboot your pc and start tapping the f8 key this will take you to safe mode where you can roll back a day or too,calling your pc maker for tech support might be easier tell them you lost  or deleted a program and need a walk through on how to rollback. BEWARE OF ANYTHING THAT IS BETA !

I hope that u use Yahoo Mail.. If u r using yahoo mail, go to the Mail Options that is seen in the right corner of ur screen in yahoo's welcome screen.. On choosing that, next choose Signature option.. In the signature option u can store ur name and address with the fontcolor, fontsize, font as u wish.. After writing that u may choose whether this signature has to added to all outgoing mails or not.. Then, choose Save so that ur changes are saved.. After that whenever u compose a new mail, there u can find a check box asking whether the signature can be added or not.. U may also use html tags in ur signatures.. . A similar option may be available in other mail providers alsoType it inAssuming your using Yahoo mail. . Go to mail > options>create signature. . The sig will be displayed on every email that you send outGo to your mail options and look for "SIGNATURE.". . You can add info in there and every email sent out by you will have whatever you put in your signature.create a signature with whatever you want to say on it, then include it on all your emails, but i would not suggest adding your address to all your emails.
y do you want top delete it y dont you just not use it anymore then it will become inactive after a while no need to delete it.You could close your account @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/changing_users/edit-23.html.. . Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account. . . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in: . . - Yahoo! Mail . - Yahoo! Address Book . - Yahoo! HotJobs . - GeoCities . - Yahoo! Briefcase . - My Yahoo! . - Yahoo! Groups . - Finance Portfolio . - Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password. . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account. . . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . If you are subscribed to any premium services, we recommend that you first cancel those premium services before you delete your account. If you do not delete your Premium Services before deleting your Account, you will continue to be billed for your premium services. To cancel your current subscriptions, visit Yahoo! Billing Information for your account, choose the "My Services" tab, and click the "Cancel" link for each subscription. . . To remove your entire account, please visit our Account Deletion page. You will be asked to sign in to or verify your password for the account you wish to delete. Please be sure to read the next page carefully, as important information about your account is included. You can then confirm the deletion of your account. . . If you're having trouble signing in, you can get password help on the password problems page.. . Please complete the deletion process only if you are certain you would like to remove your entire Yahoo! account and any features you have personalized within the account. After the deletion process is initiated, your Yahoo! account can never be recovered.Why bother? Just leave it and foprget about it. You can ONLY configure Yahoo! email to your Microsoft Outlook or any other client like Eudora, IF you have a PAID Yahoo! account.. . If you are only subscribed to a FREE Yahoo! Webmail, then you can't.. . You can convert your FREE Yahoo! account by PAYING for it.you can only configure your yahoo e-mail if you upgrade to one of the paid yahoo services.  The least expensive is 9.99 per year Yahoo! PLUS, then from there it will give you the pop and smtp servers for your use, just remember if you choose to change it, port 25 is blocked for SMTP you should change it to 587.. . Good Luckhere is a quick little write up about the steps required in setting up pop access for yahoo mail.. . you also have to enable the pop part from yahoo. . go to your amil page and click on "options" then " POP Access and Forwarding" and click the box for "Web and POP Access"

I hope I understand your question, but I think the answer is really easy.. . Do you know how when you want to sign out of Yahoo Mail, there is a link, "Sign Out", at the top of the page which you click. Also, right next to sign out is "my account". Well, now that you are using Yahoo Mail Beta and want to switch back in Yahoo Mail Beta right next to the My Account link, which is right next to the Sign Out link (see above), is another link, which says "Switch Back". Click on that link and you will be switched back to the original Yahoo Mail.. . -lshevcheClick SWITCH BACK. Top and center of your Mail page.go into your mail. then click the switch back button. It's just a little animated person you can have on your yahoo homepage...like when you go to check your e-mail it will show up. You get to pick it. I picked mine to kinda look like me...but you don't have to. Mine is what I'm using for this..the little picture you can make to represent yourselfIt is a cartoon picture that you create for yourself. Like what I am using in my little picture box.A Yahoo! Avatar is a representation of yourself -- or what you'd like to be or want others to see of you. It can be anything. You create one here:. http://avatars.yahoo.com. Then you can choose to show it here on Answers and on Messenger, in Games, and in other parts of Yahoo!. Note that if you have Mail Beta, it doesn't show up on your Mail page. Try creating one. They're fun and the options for clothes, accessories, backgrounds, etc. are updated every week.
Yu need to have 250 points, so you need to gain another 123 points. You can earn points by answering questions, choosing best answers to questions and voting for best answers to unresolved questions.You get points every time you answer a question. You also get more points if your answer is picked as "best answer". Check out the Yahoo Answers rules and guidelines. It will answer all your questions.Answer your limit each day. Vote your limit each day.Try to get as many best answers as you can. Try to avoid asking questions till you rack up some points. Save those points, youll gain more and more with time on here. . . And try not to get reported, thatll keep from losing points for no good reason. There are alot of ppl here reporting others for no reason, so you take a risk everytime you ask or answer.You need 250 points to get to level 2.. The points give to you more answers, questions, voting for the Best Answers, depends on the level you have, Go to this link from Yahoo! Answers to know all about limits and systems in this site:. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. Level 1 from 1 - 249 points. You need 250 - 999 points to get to level 2. You need 1,000 - 2,499 points to get to level 3. You need 2,500 - 4,999 points to get to level 4. You need 5,000 - 9,999 points to get to level 5. You need 10,000 - 24,999 points to get to level 6. You need 25000+ points to get to level 7. . ============= Limits per day on Yahoo! Answers:. At level 1 You can ask 5 questions and answer 20 question and vote 20.. At level 2 You can ask 10 questions and answer 40 question and vote 40 + from this level and above you can rate questions and answers for unlimited number.. At level 3 You can ask 15 questions and answer 60 question and vote 60.. At level 4 You can ask 20 questions and answer 80 question and vote 80.. At level 5 You can ask and answer unlimited of questions and vote 80.. At level 6,7 You can ask and answer unlimited of questions and vote 100.. -----------------------. Points Table:. - Answer a question (2 points). - Ask a question (-5 points). - If your answer picked as best answer (10 points). - Choose a best answer for your question (3 points). - Vote for a best answer (1 point). - If your answer in violation (-10 points). - No Best Answer was selected by voters on your question (5 points returned). - Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote (1 point). - Deleting an answer (-2 points). ============. P.S You can rate questions and answers once you reach level 2 and above (and ratings not give you any points).. And remember i'm at level 7 and really there is no prizes!!!. . Good Luck.ask questions, answer questions and get rated as the best answer.

Click on Messenger in the Menu Bar. Then click on My Contact Details. Then put in what you want to be shown.if you're after quick fix... login to Yahoo! Messenger. click on Messenger. select My Contact Details. at the top is Name:. there are 3 fields that you need to complete to stop Yahoo! Messenger accessing the default Details stored in your Yahoo! Account information, these are.... First (Name). Last (Name). Nickname. . put your ID in your First and Last Name fields in your My Contact Details. eg in mine i have. first name: bourbon. last name: bee. ID: bourbon bee. . take a little care if you remove the first and last name fields from you My Contact details, we've found that doing so can cause the information to be extracted from your Account Information.. e.g if under My Contact Details if you fill in first name but don't fill in your last, you may find your last name is extracted from your Account details by default in most cases . . e.g . Account details. first name: Jack. last name: Jones. . My Contact details. first name: JJ. last name: [not filled out]. . your requests may go out with your yahoo ID but your contact details may read as JJ (from your My Contact Details) Jones (from your Account Details)  . . we have an article at http://www.wackyb.co.nz/Yahoo!_Messenger_version_8_Account_Information/ if you want some more information then also check out our article http://www.wackyb.co.nz/Yahoo!_First_and_Last_Name_Showing/  regarding our experience and findings. . . the only sure fire way to kill it off completely is too edit your account information (the form you filled out when you signed up for your yahoo id) . http://edit.yahoo.com/config/eval_profile. . Once there.... 1.Ignore the first instance of your Names, scroll down the page until you see Address / Contact Information, click Edit.... 2. now at the top of the page should be Your Name, edit both fields. 3. hit Finished, if prompted, then confirm your password, you will be redirected back to your Yahoo! Account Information page where you can see the changes, if you're happy with the results, click Finish again, then exit out of your browser and log back into Yahoo! Messenger.

The fix.. 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. . The reason...... you probably signed up for a Yahoo! Messenger Account using your First/Last name.  They will show in the IM window when you send an IM or receive an IM from another user, unless you change it.    . . That does not mean the other person you are chatting with can see your First/Last name. Your Contact Details must be sent to them. If you have not sent your Contact Details to the other person you are IMing with, they will see your Yahoo! Account Name (or Nickname) and not your First/Last Name. . . If you have previously sent your Contact Details to the other person, they will need to delete you from their list and re-add you in order for you name to change on their list.. . For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/changename. http://www.chatauthority.com/editcontactinfoClick on Messenger in the menu bar and then on My Contact Details. Put your ID in the nickname box and save.

Yahoo! Messenger stores your last 5 custom status entries so you can simply create as many as required to bump it off your list or you can download and use Andy's Clear/Edit Messenger status history utility. . . Andy created the Clear/Edit Messenger status history utility because your status messages are stored in your registry and unless you have extensive experience and time on your hands it's not recommended that you delve into that area to remove your current entries. His utility will will let your remove / edit your previous Yahoo Messenger status messages or you can either clear all or just select which ones to remove, you can also edit existing ones (for like if you do a typo etc) or create new ones. you can download it from our repository page.... http://www.wackyb.co.nz/option,com_remository/Itemid,3894/func,fileinfo/id,5/ . or check out his forum thread.... http://www.wackyb.co.nz/vb/showthread.php?t=353As you add new ones, the older ones will be deleted [automatically]. There's no other delete option.

(m). . A reference to imaginary small type in a policy contract supposedly containing exclusions, reductions, exemptions, and limitations of coverage. Most state laws include specifications for the minimum type size that can be used in a policy, and they also provide that exclusions cannot be printed in type smaller than that used to print the benefitsSmall print (also known as fine print in the United States) refers to the practice of including necessary legal terms, warnings, disclaimers or other phrases in small writing on commercial or contractual documents. Small print is usually included at the end or bottom of a document, in a smaller type size (as well as generally being in capital letters to make reading more difficult).Fine print is pretty much everything either written in small print at the bottom of all contracts or what you have to 'read between the line' and get a more rounded understanding of what you're reading before signing. A lot of contracts word things in such a way that they can be takin to mean more than one thing.

Because bobbing for melons is bad for the teeth.Hypothermia rocks....apples are somehow creepy.  but it is weird.By A.D. 43, Romans had conquered the majority of Celtic territory. In the course of the four hundred years that they ruled the Celtic lands, two festivals of Roman origin were combined with the traditional Celtic celebration of Samhain.. . The first was Feralia, a day in late October when the Romans traditionally commemorated the passing of the dead. The second was a day to honor Pomona, the Roman goddess of fruit and trees. The symbol of Pomona is the apple and the incorporation of this celebration into Samhain probably explains the tradition of "bobbing" for apples that is practiced today on Halloween.History. The custom originated among the Celts as part of their celebrations of the Samhain season, celebrations that grew into modern-day Halloween. The original custom generally took place during large gatherings of people. Apples were associated with love or fertility goddesses; the first person to catch an apple would be the next one to marry -- a tradition that echoes in the modern "throwing of the bouquet" at weddings.

360° is a free site so it can't be reomved from your computer. All you can do is go through and make everything Private so that others can't see your info. Or delete all of your info on the page.You can't delete a 360,follow directions below to make it private>Select the "Settings" option at the upper right of your 360 page and change all of you settings to 'Private'. This hides the majority of your content, if someone stumbles onto your page.. . Perform option #1 and then select the first "Display Me As" option on the Settings page. Now your profile doesn't link to your 360 page. Also, UNcheck the "Activate Simple URL" setting. This way people cannot guess your 360 page by sticking your yahoo id onto the end of 360.yahoo.com. . Perform options #1 and #2 and then delete your friends by selecting the "My Friends" link in the upper right of your 360 page. Select "Edit Settings" on a friend's name, then select "Remove <friend> from your Friends Page". Finally, delete all of your content, blogs, links to pictures, lists, reviews, etc. This pretty much makes your 360 inaccessible and/or unusable by anyone who happens to get thereGo to the page  and delete it.

You must "cease and desist", at once!Options: . . 1) Do not use Yahoo! Mail for 2 months and it will automatically delete itself.. . 2) Click on "My Account" at the top of the page and choose "Edit/Create Public Profiles" and then choose to delete your current profile. You can only delete your current profile if you have another username. Example: You created another profile and you don't want your old one so you delete it.. . I hope that this information helps!Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account.. . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in:. . * Yahoo! Mail. * Yahoo! Address Book. * Yahoo! HotJobs. * GeoCities. * Yahoo! Briefcase. * My Yahoo!. * Yahoo! Groups. * Finance Portfolio. * Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password. . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account.. . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . You could close your account @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/changing_users/edit-23.html&#92;.Go to.. My Acount.. at top of this page.  (blue letters). E

Its probably jsut showing the name that is on your account. To have it show your ID, click on Messenger in the menu bar and then click on My Contact Details. Put your ID in the nickname box or first name box and save it.The fix.. 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. . The reason...... you probably signed up for a Yahoo! Messenger Account using your First/Last name.  They will show in the IM window when you send an IM or receive an IM from another user, unless you change it.    . . That does not mean the other person you are chatting with can see your First/Last name. Your Contact Details must be sent to them. If you have not sent your Contact Details to the other person you are IMing with, they will see your Yahoo! Account Name (or Nickname) and not your First/Last Name. . . If you have previously sent your Contact Details to the other person, they will need to delete you from their list and re-add you in order for you name to change on their list.. . For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/changename. http://www.chatauthority.com/editcontactinfo

You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.you need to click 'lost password' and then you will be asked your security question. if you cant remember the answer to that its highly unlikely that you will get into your account. there will be nothing more you can do.

There are a couple ways to do it. First, from Internet Explorer, go to Tools / Internet Options / General. From that tab, you can clear your history with the Clear History button. You can also delete cookies.. . But you have to understand that this doesn't completely erase your tracks. There are still temp files, tons of files in the /Temporary Internet Files/ path, etc. You may have to purchase a third party product like.... . http://watersaffl.evderaser.hop.clickbank.net?tid=YAHOOANS. . ... to purge all that stuff. Good luck!

1) Go to compose message.. 2) Above the To field there is an option to add bcc. 3) Add the recipients you desire to remain hidden in the new bcc field. 4) Send message!You can achieve this by using the blind copy option, which is marked as "BCC". Just click that option, and a new blank field under the To: and Cc: fields will appear. Put any email addresses in the Bcc field that you want to remain 'invisible'.Go to compose message.. Above the To field there is an option to add bcc. click on BCC. Type any mail id or ur id(but every body can c this).. Type Other mail ID's in "BCC" which u want to hide.. . . Then the receivers can see only ur ID means the id which u typed in "to" block

Hope this is of some help.The only legal way to Send and Receive Yahoo! mail accounts using Outlook Express is through signing up for Yahoo! mail plus features or any other service higher up in hierarchy.. . Click here for Yahoo! mail plus: http://mailplus.mail.yahoo.com/. . For Yahoo! email hierarchy above Yahoo! mail plus click here: http://smallbusiness.yahoo.com/email/. . But before you sign up for those services, you may want to compare services offered by other companies.. . But coming back to your question in the simplest way: sign up for Yahoo! mail plus.. . If you didn't receive a violation notice, the questions may have been removed either if they expired with no answers or if they went to a vote and No Best Answer was selected. The No Best Answer option results in all the answers and the question itself being deleted. If you receive a good answer to your question, however, this is easy to prevent by selecting the best answer yourself within four days after asking your question.maybe your computer did it after 3 daysIDK...yahoo answers keep deleting mine and its getting annoying!!!!!!! nothing vulgar or inappropriate was in mine either!!!someone probably reported you for no particular reasonYahoo servers are running out of disk space. When you click the + sign on your answer toolbar, go down to "save to watchlist" and when you click on your watchlist, it'll be there. This allows you to monitor the progress of specific questions as the rest of them get burried deeper within your answer history, thus becoming harder to access.yea your watch list, is basically if you want to monitor answers to a particular question you can put it on your watch list.when you are interested in a topic, you can monitor the answers when you add it to your watchlist.. . =)your watchlist is place to put questions that you would like to watch for interesting answers. just click on any question and the + sign on the action bar to add that question to your watch list.. . you can remove them whenever you want.

make it smalleryou can use Adobe Photoshop to change the size to a smaller size and then reduce the color in it as well.Crop it, don't simply set it to a different size by scaling.  When you crop, you actually use up fewer pixels; scaling just reduces the area it takes up on a display, but it will still take as long to transmit.  Cropping, since it uses fewer pixels, will transmit faster.there are programs that do it, or have a friend do itYou need a graphics program or photo editing software.  Most digital cameras come with some sort of software.  Open the picture and reduce the size and re-save it.  Voila!Download a program called "Irfan View 3.98" at http://www.tucows.com/preview/194967. . Hope this works for you! Kimmie

the mail program that will autmatically open up on your computer if you click a link to email a person.. . typically it is microsoft outlook.Your default mail client is the one you have selected as default when you click Tools > Internet Options > Programs tab > it's the one listed under E-mail. It's the one that opens when you click on a mailto link, or when you click Send Page.A default mail client is usually the one your internet provider gives you.The one you picked to get your email from
The folder has to be empty before it can be deleted.  You must have some files still there.Only empty folders can be deleted. In order to delete a folder, you must first empty it of all messages. . To delete messages in a folder: . . . Open the folder, which contains the message to be transferred. . Place a check in the box to the left of the message you would like to delete. To select all messages, just click the "Check All" link at the bottom of the page. . Click the "Delete" button to have all selected messages transferred into the trash folder. . To permanently remove the contents of the trash, click the "Empty" link next to the trash folder in the left navigation bar. Next, you will see a prompt asking if you're sure you want to delete all messages. Click "Yes" to delete or "No" to return to the previous page. . Please Note: Once messages are emptied from the trash folder, they are permanently deleted from the Yahoo! Mail server and cannot be recovered. . . Once you have emptied a folder, you can delete it by doing the following: . . . Click the "Folders" link on the left navigation bar. . On the Folders screen, find the folder you would like to delete and click the "Delete" link located to the right of the folder name. . The name of the folder will then disappear from the list of folders. . Please note: You can't remove or rename the permanent folders in your account. These folders include inbox, sent, draft, and trash.You need to go to manage folders first then click on the folder you want to delete and then hit delete

Open the photo in Microsoft Paint; then go to File > Save As.  In the drop-down file-type selection, choose .jpg, and save the file - you can use the same name, since the file extensions are different, so you won't blow away the original.Here's what you do.. . Find where your picture is located.  Don't open it.  Instead, place your mouse pointer over the file and right click on it.  You'll be given the option to Edit it.  Click on Edit.. . The Edit option will automatically open it with Paint.. . Once in Paint, go to File and Save As.... . On the name already assigned to it (In .bmp), simply highlight the text and change it to .jpeg.. . Save.FILE>SAVE ASit depends on the photo editor you are using. most programs will let you do a "Save as"  and just change the file name from photo.bmp to photo.jpg or photo .jpegI don't know but it is .jpg instead of .jpeg. It means looking at a business from all angles. It is looking at it from the inside, outside, upside and downside. It means looking at all aspects of a business. It means looking at customer bases, financial statements, employee opinions, customer opinions, community perspectives and more.Stand in the room you are in right now. Focus on one thing in the room. Now slowly turn around, in place, and look at every single thing in the room. Everything. Keep turning until you are again facing that original focal point. You have just done a 360 degree turn, a circle, if you will. . . Same with a business that has a 360 degree perspective. They presumably have taken the time to view issues from every angle available. Check your trash! If that is gone, it is gone permanently.u can go to where it says "Trash". duh....jkTRASH IS RIGHTyou can go to your recycle bin and retrieve it from there.Assuming you are using Yahoo! mail.. . If you had the mail in the trash and deleted it, the mail is gone forever.  If you deleted the mail from your in-box, it may still be in the trash file.. . Do not leave mail in trash if there is any chance you may need that message again; Yahoo! can and will delete messages in the trash at any time.  Set up a new folder to hold until you are sure it is never going to be needed again.

Sorry, but this is not possible.  You can get another domain.If you mean you want to transfer your personal domain name registration from Yahoo to, say Godaddy, then it's possible. However, certain conditions need to be met.. . First, your domain name must be eligible for transfer. It's beyond its first 60-days of registration, administrative contact email addy on record is yours, domain name is unlocked, and you obtain the so-called authorization code/EPP code/key from Yahoo or their upstream provider Melbourne IT.. . Next, you start the request with the gaining registrar. Know their policies and procedures, and complete and confirm the transfer with them.. . Last, confirm the transfer with Yahoo. If you have more than one message in the Deleted file, click "Empty deleted items folder"you hit the delete buttonYou could close your account @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/changing_users/edit-23.html.. . Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account. . . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in: . . - Yahoo! Mail . - Yahoo! Address Book . - Yahoo! HotJobs . - GeoCities . - Yahoo! Briefcase . - My Yahoo! . - Yahoo! Groups . - Finance Portfolio . - Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password. . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account. . . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . If you are subscribed to any premium services, we recommend that you first cancel those premium services before you delete your account. If you do not delete your Premium Services before deleting your Account, you will continue to be billed for your premium services. To cancel your current subscriptions, visit Yahoo! Billing Information for your account, choose the "My Services" tab, and click the "Cancel" link for each subscription. . . To remove your entire account, please visit our Account Deletion page. You will be asked to sign in to or verify your password for the account you wish to delete. Please be sure to read the next page carefully, as important information about your account is included. You can then confirm the deletion of your account. . . If you're having trouble signing in, you can get password help on the password problems page.. . Please complete the deletion process only if you are certain you would like to remove your entire Yahoo! account and any features you have personalized within the account. After the deletion process is initiated, your Yahoo! account can never be recovered.It's easy to Cancel Yahoo email but before you cancel your yahoo email account you should be aware of a few possible problems that may arise when you do.. . . 1. You may have given the email account to contacts and friends and they may still send email to this account. See getting found section of find email address for details on changing email addresses.. . 2. The email address may already be listed in various email directories, and people searching for you may find it there.. . 3. If you change your mind you may not be able to get your old email address back.. . 4. In the case of Yahoo to cancel the email account you have to cancel the Yahoo account. This means that you loose access to other services like Yahoo groups. (see below).. . 5. Cancelling the email account doesn't necessarily cancel billing. If you have a premium Yahoo email account cancel the billing first.. . 6. You have email old email messages that you may need to keep. Unless you have access to yahoo using POP3 (currently a premium service) there is no easy way of extracting your email messages from yahoo and importing them into another email account/program like Outlook Express. If you do have POP3 access then see this article: Connecting Microsoft Outlook Express to a Yahoo email Mailbox. . Therefore before delete or cancel you yahoo email account or any email account ensure that.. . 1. You cancel any premium services first before you cancel the account. You can do this by going to Yahoo billing. . 2. Everyone is informed that you are no longer available at this address and give them your new address.. . 3. Export any contacts that you will need to use in the future. See this article: exporting and importing yahoo contacts.. . 4. Export old emails that you may need in the future. See the article exporting email messages from yahoo email.. . 5.That you delete yourself from the directories, in the case of Yahoo-People search.. . 6. You definitely don't need it anymore.. . Here is how to do it...... . 1. Login to your yahoo profile by going to the yahoo home page and selecting sign in in the personal assistant box.. . 2. You will be prompted to login. If you have forgotten you Yahoo Id or password you can click the link on this page to have it sent to you.. . 3. Once logged in select the account info link in the personal assistant box.. . 4. You will probably be asked for your password again, before seeing a screen showing you account details.. . 5. Click help in the top corner (missing in screen shot) and you will see the help screen .. . At the bottom you will see the link- close my yahoo account. Click this link and follow the instructions
It's probably to prevent automatic web crawlers from finding the e-mail addresses and spamming them. With that extra space the spammers software will not recognize it as a valid URL.If you are refering to the spaces in emails you recieve, mostly ads and spam, Yahoo isn't the one doing it. Senders do it to try to bypass spamblocker software to get their spam to you. Same reason so many purposefully mispell words in the subject line and text. So spam fiilters searching for those words won't find them.

To turn this setting on: . . From the Tools menu, choose "Accounts." . Select the "Mail" tab. . Double-click the account labeled "pop.mail.yahoo.co.uk." . Select the "Servers" tab. . Make sure that you use exactly the same case in Outlook Express as you can see it on the website.. . For example, don't use MyAccount@yahoo.co.uk when it's myaccount@yahoo.co.uk on the web.

You've got several ways to send mail to your Address Book contacts. The easiest is Address AutoComplete.. . Address AutoComplete. Open Yahoo! Mail and click "Compose". Type a few letters of a name (first, last or nickname) or email address in the "To:", "Cc:" or "Bcc:" fields. AutoComplete shows you a list of complete email address choices that match what you've typed. Just click the contact you want from the list, and Mail fills it in for you. It's quick! . . Using Your Address Book. Start a message right out of your address book. Here's how: . . Click "Addresses" to open your address book. . To email an individual contact: . Find the contact you want: click the section of the alphabet it's in, or search with "Search Contacts", or look in a category. When you find who you're looking for, click their email address. This opens a Compose window addressed to them. . To email multiple contacts: . As you locate the contacts you want, check the boxes next to their names or next to the names of lists. When you've checked all the boxes you want, click the "Send Email" button above your list of contacts. This opens a screen confirming the recipients you've selected. If it's got all the people you want, click "Compose" to get going with your message to all these contacts. . . Using the Pop-Up Address Book Window. The Pop-Up Address Book is handy when you've already started composing an email. Here's how to use it: . . Click any of the "To," "Cc," or "Bcc" links at the top of the Compose window to open the pop-up address book. Do not click on the "Addresses" tab on the upper left of the page or you'll lose any text you typed. . In the pop-up window, locate your intended recipients and check the appropriate boxes (To:, Cc:, or Bcc:) to the left of their names. . To send the message to all of the members of one or more of your distribution lists, click the "List" link and check the boxes next to the appropriate lists. . When you're done selecting recipients, click the "Add Checked Contacts" button to return to the Compose Mail window. The recipients' email addresses should appear in the To:, Cc:, and Bcc: fields. . Finish composing your message. . . Using Nicknames. If you've entered contact nicknames in your address book, start typing a nickname in the "To:" field. Address AutoComplete shows you a list of complete email address choices that match what you've typed. Just click the contact you want from the list, and Mail fills it in for you. It's quick!You can type the emails addresses directly into the To: field of a new email and separate the different email addresses by a comma (,) or semicolon (;).. . If you have the contacts in your address book, the instant you type the semicolon or comma, a list popups so you can choose the person you want to send this to.. . Clicking the [To:] button on a new email gives you a list of people from your contact list that you can just check off.

What's "wrongfully"...? . . & it is not "deleted" anyway.  If you left it untouched for 30 days... you simply won't have access to it anymore---of course no one else will either.  So your mailbox will just "lay" there "in la-la land" never to be accessed by anyone again.  Your password won't do you any good....it's been blocked.  . It's the same with Hotmail---but have you looked at the SIZE of Hotmail's allowed 'storage'.  ? it's very SMALL.   I've forgotten more than I want to know about...it's been so long.  . . These are 'web-servers' babe---not ISPs (Internet Service Providers); and webservers don't keep your storage for you to access again later. . All I'm sure of is that my IncrediMail account kept locking me out because my default-server (Hotmail) was full (IncrediMail is neither a web-server NOR is it an ISP) so I had to continue to delete everything in Hotmail to keep it below the maximum, so I'd always have access to my mail in IncrediMail (the mail would be in Hotmail---but without all the graphics.  . . So, I don't think 'wrongfully' would be a fair assessment----it's either 30 days untouched, or 30 days at maximum storage, will 'shut you out'.  . & THAT's the name of THAT tune.. . As I said to someone else..."open a new one"...and this time ----stay in touch with it.Forget it and get another one. Yahoo does not "undelete".

If you don't care about using an album, then in the "All My Photos" you can click on the "Sort by:" drop-down menu and select "Sort by: Name."  If your photos are titled the way your camera produced them (e.g. DSCF301, DSCF302, etc.), this will effectively put the photos in order from oldest to newest.  You can also click the "Sort by: Reverse Sort" option to effectively change the photos to display newest to oldest.  However, the "Sort by:" option is not available in individual albums, and so for sorting photos in an album you will just need manually rearrange them.

Put their email addresses in the BCC (called Blind Courtesy Copy)  field. People who receive that email will see only their address in that field and not the addresses of other recipients.. . In Yahoo! Mail, in order to display the BCC field, click the Show BCC link at the right of the To: field.When you go to your contact list you can choose to send to people as a bcc, which is a "blind contact". That person will only see their name but not others that you sent the same e-mail to.After entering one address (only) on the Addressee line, put all of the other addresses on the "BCC" line [which means "Blind Carbon Copy" in old-speak.  If the BCC line does not appear on your email window, you can opt to place it there by clicking on the link which prompts for that.You need to use BCC (Blind CC) outlook / outlook express can both do this but you may need to switch it on - off by default I think.. . HELP on outlook will guide you if you search on bcc
You need 250 points needed to get to Level 2.  So far, you've only answered 1 question, and you've asked several - each question cost 5 pts.. . At any time, you can click on "My Q&A" (upper right).  It will show you how many points you need to get to the next level (as well as some other info).  Then, if you select the blue question mark next to your points, you can view the entire point system (how points awarded, how many needed for each level, and how many q&a is allowed for each of the 7 levels).. . To gain the points, try to do the following:. - Answer as many q's as you can (limit of 20 per day at Level 1) - see above link which will tell you all the daily quotas.  2 pts each.. - Answer well (if yours is selected as best answer, you get 10 points plus 1 point for every thumbs up you get up to a max of 50). - Vote on undecided questions (Go to "Vote" column).  1 pt each.. . Also, it cost 5 points to ask a question.  (But, you can get 3 pts back if you select a "best answer" so it's a net loss of 2 pts).. . Good luck and have fun!. . http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system;_ylt=ArpdGGGizcm2YRkr3D3_kTgezKIXKeep answering questions.. There is no way to block it - BUT if you have uploaded personal photos or personalized your page with specific uploaded stuff, then THOSE things will not be copied if someone does the "make this theme mine" thing. ONLY the font and module colors will copy.Supposing you're talking about a musical theme.... You can make a CD copy and send it to yourself by mail. Nat e-mail, real traditional mail. When it comes to you, don't open it and keep it safe. If one day somebody steals your theme, the date on the envelope that contains the CD with your theme will be all the proof you need in court.. But remember, it needs to arrive sealed and with a postal stamp on it to the hands of the judge.. Another way to be sure is to publish it. A disk that has been published is also protected from stealing.. And finally you can visit you local IFPA. You can become a member, it's very simple, and after that, you can send them anything you create and they'll keep an archive of all your themes so nobody can steal anything and get away with it.I don't get what you mean by theme.then choose a theme you don't want and then after they're done copying your theme change it to the theme you want.. . History stays with you. It can not be deleted. If you want to start at Zero. Ask questions until it zeros out.You can only delete open questions and answers to open questions. View your questions, hover your mouse cursor over the pencil and choose the option to delete it.  View your answer, and click the delete link underneath it.  You can continue to ask questions and loose 5 points for each one, although you did start out with 100 points.You would have to go back and delete all of your answers, which will cost you points. If you want to start back at zero, you will have to start a new Yahoo account.I don't believe there's a way to delete your history.. . The only way I know of to get back to zero is to ask enough questions to get yourself down to nothing.. . Or, just start a new account... that's the simplest way.

Posting a question costs five points. This may discourage some users from asking purely frivolous questions while encouraging others to use the search or look at the similar questions that automatically pop up when asking a question.. . However, we give you 100 points to get started, and you earn three points when you select the best answer to your question. To earn more points and higher daily limits, answer other users' questions or vote on undecided questions.Everyone loses 5 points for asking questions. You can regain 3 points for choosing a best answer to your question.It costs 5 points for every question you ask.

If you're trying to use yahoo mail through outlook, try using this, that'll do the job:. . E-Mail Stationery in Yahoo Mail with Outlook Express. . You can configure Yahoo Mail so that Outlook Express can be used to send and receive messages on your Yahoo Mail account. When you do this you are still also able to access your Yahoo Mail account online (via your web browser.). . Accessing a Yahoo Mail account through Outlook Express has a number of advantages:. . You can keep a large amount of e-mail without overflowing the storage available to you at Yahoo.. . You can read your messages "offline". I.e. you can read them while your computer is not connected to the Internet.. . E-Mail stationery will work. Most e-mail stationery uses "scripting", which is not supported by Yahoo Mail online (when you use Yahoo Mail in your web browser.) When you view the same messages in Outlook Express instead, you can see them as intended.. . If you already access your Yahoo Mail account this way, and you are not seeing received stationery correctly in Outlook Express, please click on one of the following links for more information about your version of Outlook Express:. . Outlook Express 5 and 5.5. . Outlook Express 6. . To set up your Yahoo Mail account for use in Outlook Express:. . Go to your Yahoo Mail account online in your web browser.. . Click Options. . Click Pop Access & Forwarding. . To Sign Up, you'll have to agree to accept e-mails of special offers from Yahoo. Select the categories of offers you are willing to receive, then click Finished.. . Use the defaults on the next screen ("Web and POP Access", and "HTML Messages") and click Submit.. . Now you will be at a page which is titled "Pop Configuration". You might want to bookmark this page and/or print it, in case you ever reinstall Outlook Express. Near the bottom of this page is a link titled "Configuring Microsoft Outlook Express". Click that link and follow the instructions there to finish the setup.. . After you finish the above setup you will be able to pick up and send Yahoo Mail messages using Outlook Express.Was it just today? If it was it may be a fault on the server - I have mine set up properly but I couldn't send using SMPT either. You can check it by clicking on tools,  accounts, properties and then advanced and the port should be 25.SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is the standard protocol used by email clients to send email. You need to configure your outgoing mail sever to send your email. . . The server's name usually follows the standard format of mail.(your Internet Service Provider name).com. . . Note: The incoming and outgoing server names are usually the same.

Well, you can go download a photoshop, paintshop, any type of photo editing program, and then it has a resize function.  ;]all computers with microsoft home/office come with the Paint option. All you do is right click on the picture, click "edit "then the paint program opens. Then you click on "image" from the menu and scroll down to "stretch/skew" and increase the percentage for the horizonal and vertical (same numerical amounts) if you want to reduce the size and dont forget to save the new image. Keep reducing the percentage amount until you reach the desired size.
you can change your pass by going into your account. just beside the sign out it has been written my account go there then u can find how to change your passworddepends which company u r usingYou can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could find change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.

Have you tried tools, internet options and making sure that bellsouth is your home?Welll, that's because you have Yahoo as the homepage for your browser.  To change it, go to Tools, Internet Options, General tab, then change your homepage there, click Apply.  Norton AV has  homepage protection that blocks all changes to the homepage, so if you have something like that, you may have to shut it off first, then change your homepage, then turn it back on.

Yahoo! Subscriptions is a free subscription service available to Yahoo! Mail users. Among your newsletter choices are Yahoo! Daily Wire and Yahoo! Weekly Picks. These services deliver information about new and noteworthy web sites, daily top Net events, and links to full coverage of the latest news stories. We also offer special-interest newsletters from partner sites.. . To subscribe to any of the available newsletters, check the box next to it, then hit the "Change Subscriptions" button, and the newsletters will start showing up in your Yahoo! Mail inbox. Yahoo! takes your privacy seriously and doesn't give out your email address or any of your personally identifiable information to the newsletter providers.. . To change your subscriptions choices, just click on "Subscriptions" in the left navigation bar and make your changes by checking and unchecking the boxes. To unsubscribe completely, simply leave all of the boxes unchecked. Changes may take 24 hours be updated.From what I've heard on here, if you don't check your mail for 90 days, they automatically dump you.  I'm sure there's a simple way, but... there's none easier...simply do nothing - for at least 90 days!

if you write an address that starts with http:// in your answers it will be automatically transformed in a link when you post your answerGo to the website you want to recommend, highlight the address in the address bar at the top and press Ctrl and C to copy it. Then when you write your answer you can press Ctrl and V to paste it in, it will automatically come out as a link.. Hope this helps!Cut and paste the URL

go to. Tools. Internet Options. then on the small pop up. look for delete history and click . . get rid of the cookies on the same screenTools > Internet Options > Content > AutoComplete > Clear Forms. This will clear out ALL your autocompleted forms, such as search windows, form fill-ins, etc. You can also reset your Auto-Complete options here.. . Or, to delete just a single (or a few) searches, just have them highlighted in the drop-down list and hit DELETE -- they will vanish! If you hold down the key, the whole drop-down list of searches will delete.. . If you are using the Yahoo! Toolbar, I believe there is a drop-down box at the end of the search window that has the option to CLEAR SEARCHES on it.. . There is a setting for Windows that prompts if you want to save your password upon initial login.  After that, when you revisit the site, Windows remembers your login and opens the page directly.  To check for this, click on Tools, Internet Options, click on the Contents tab.  Click on AutoComplete button.  Here you can select whatever options your want.. . If you delete your your temp internet files and cookies, it will prompt once again for password (since passwords are save in cookies)Maybe the messenger did it before. You can choose not to sign in so they'll do just that, or choose to sign in so you can keep it activated.

That isd all the info i can give at this time.Popup blockers will only stop web based popups. They can help somewhat, but if you are getting excessive popups, and popups even when you are offline, it means you have trojan downloaders on your machine that are calling out to deliver the pop up ads. . . Try a full cleaning and dis-infection routine. . . This is the one I use (it will take some time).. . 1. Scan for virus and remove (free online scan) with BitDefender. . http://www.bitdefender.com/site/home/. . 2. Scan for trojans and remove (free online scan) with Ewido. . http://www.ewido.net/en/. . 3. Scan for ad/spyware and remove (free download) with Spybot Search & Destroy. . http://www.safer-networking.org/en/spybotsd/index.html. . . If you are using an older version of Windows (pre XP-SP2) you may also be getting "Messenger Service" popups which are caused by Microsoft leaving the almost never used Windows Messenger Service enabled by default. This was corrected in Windows XP- Service Pack 2.. . Understand that the Windows Messenger Service is completely different from, and not in any way related to, "MSN Messenger", "Windows Live Messenger" "yahoo Messenger", or any other well-known instant messaging system. Therefore, disabling the Windows Messenger service will have no effect upon your use of any other instant messaging applications. They will continue to work without trouble. .  . . To disable this service in older versions of Windows use the free, Shoot The Messenger from:. http://www.grc.com/stm/ShootTheMessenger.htm. . Good luck.

"Blog" is short for "weblog".  It's a personal space on the internet that a person frequently visits and updates.  They can post pictures, thoughts, links, quizes, polls, etc.  It's usually hosted by a webhosting company like Yahoo or Blogger.A weblog is usually defined as a personal or noncommercial web site that uses a dated log format (usually with the most recent addition at the top of the page) and contains links to other web sites along with commentary about those sites. A weblog is updated frequently and sometimes groups links by specific subjects, such as politics, news, pop culture, or computer issues.Blog is short form of Web Log.  It is a kind of online diary, where  you can post your any information and share with others.. . Like Yahoo! 360 provide space for it.A blog is actually a web logg........it's like a diary of a persons personal thoughts/links one  of the most famous blogs was " Salam Pax "  or  "Where is Raed?" or The Baghdad Blogger" a political blog from someone who was in Iraq as the war was breaking out .anyone can keep a blogg.......it;s like a cyber "Dear Diary"its a web log. that is, a site to go to when you want to have discussions about various topics such as a political blog, a car blog, a what do you know blog. it is mainly a way of getting to meet different people without having to meet them in person. or in a chat room. they come and go as they like.a blog is clog in your p.c.

Click on My Account which is under your ID. Verify password and you will see where it says Change Password.I'm using LOGINizer to create and change all my personal passwords.I like it. Very simple indeed. Check it out: http://www.Loginizer.comYou could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-13.html.. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . - Click the "Change Password" link. . - Enter your current password in the first box. . - Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . - Confirm your new password in the third box. . - Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.

You can add up to 6 additional names (called alias names) on one account, giving you 7 chat names. . . To add alias names to a current Yahoo! ID, on Yahoo! Messenger from the Messenger menu, click on My Profiles. click on Create/Edit My Profiles. Below your Yahoo ID will be the Create New Public Profile button. Follow the prompts (similar to when you made your original Yahoo! ID). . . ______________________________. . To edit your name in an IM box.... . 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/changenamesorry... . but i don't think i can help... . because i'm just a new user of yahoo... . but thanks for the 2 points..You can have up to 6 different Yahoo profiles...click the Login menu in Yahoo Messenger window and choose My Profiles. Then, click the Create/Edit My Profiles button....save.. You can also have 2 Yahoo ID's.... Sign in to Yahoo Mail, Click on Options on the top right.. Under the Mail Management header, Click on Mail Addresses.. Now in the next screen, Click on Get Started link under Extra Email Address header....Choose whatever address you want and click on Check availabilty. If its available, you’ll be taken to an Image verification and then you will have another email address to your Yahoo Id.

Stating someone's name directly in the question, basically aiming the question to one or a few small select group of people. Large genres like ethnicities are a different story, but people may report that for being racially discriminative if they feel it was out of bad taste to ask it. So use each of those specifics with caution.Asking a question which encourages others to participate in a conversation with you, 'what are you having for dinner?' 'what should I wear tomorrow?' questions that invite others to 'talk' with you rather than offer an answer to a question..  Asking if anyone wants to IM you, or wants to chat with you, all of these are seen as a violation of the no chatting and personal communications guideline

This question has come up before.. . The consensus seems to be that you can only delete your question when it is "open".. . When it has become resolved, or closed to answers, you cannot delete the question.. . If you don't mind losing points, you could try asking someone else to  report your question as a violation.  Then Yahoo might remove it, but you'd lose ten points.You can't i'm afraid. Once on they are there to stay.Onyl questions still open to answers may be deleted! . . Clicking on your 'username'. Select "questions" on the tabs. Click on the question you want to delete. Under you actual question is a bar with a pencil butt on the extreme right of the bar. Hover over the pencil to get a drop down menu. . . Choose the bottom option "delete". . Bingo. . Question is gone!. . Your ONLY question shows up as "In voting"! . I reckon Yahoo has nicked it for all time??sorry, i dont think you can delete questions once theyve been resolved.good 1 . i was wondering that alsoYou can only delete your question if it hasn't been resolved. If it has then forget about it. Otherwise, put your cursor over the pencil icon on the toolbar under your question. And a list will come down w/options to edit your question. Go a few down and you'll have the option to delete your question. Hope that helped mate! Cheers!sorry you cant delete them
