From Yahoo Help:. . What if my question doesn’t receive any answers?. . Questions have a 4-day open period. If your question doesn’t receive any answers within this time frame, it will expire and be deleted. However, before the question expires, you have the option to extend the open period to 8 days.. . To do this, go to the question, click Edit (pencil icon) in the action bar below the question, and select Extend Expiration.. . If nobody answers your question after 8 days, you can ask your question again or search Yahoo! Answers to see if someone else received an answer to a similar question.The action bar is beneath your question. It's where you see how many thumbs up and thumbs down your question has received, others can flag your question, you can mail your question to someone, and a pencil icon. Hover your mouse cursor over the pencil and click the option "Extend expiration".

I would actually use WinZip to zip the file instead of converting it to a PDF.  You can download WinZip if your computer doesn't already have it.  Just Google it and it'll lead you to the website.  WinZip shrinks large files and allows them to be easily emailed and whatnot and since PDF's are really hard to adapt and change if someone doesn't have Adobe, keeping the file in the Word format is a lot easier in the long run.If you have the full blown Acrobat, you can reduce the file size under File, reduce file size.. . This issue may occur if one or more of the Jscript registry key settings are incorrect. This behavior may also occur if the Jscript.dll file is missing or damaged.. . Method 1: Reregister Jscript.dll and Vbscript.dll. . 1. Click Start, and then click Run.. . 2. In the Open box, type regsvr32 jscript.dll, and then click OK.. . 3. Click OK.. . 4. Click Start, and then click Run.. . 5. In the Open box, type regsvr32 vbscript.dll, and then click OK.. . 6. Click OK.. . . If either of the files do not register as expected, or if you receive an error message, the system file may be missing or damaged. To extract the missing file in Microsoft Windows XP, follow these steps:. . 1. Click Start, and then click Run.. . 2. In the Open box, type msconfig, and then click OK.. . 3. Click Expand File.. . 4. In the File to restore box, type the name of the file that you want to restore.. . 5. In the Restore from box, type the path of the Windows XP .cab file where you want to restore the file, or. click Browse From to locate the Windows XP .cab file.. . Note The Windows XP .cab files are stored in the I386 folder on the Windows XP CD.. . 6. In the Save file in box, type the path where you want to extract the new file, or click Browse To to locate the folder that you want.. . 7. Click Expand.. . 8. In the System Configuration Utility dialog box, click OK. If you are prompted to restart the computer, click Restart.. . Open a dialog box that previously experienced the issue that is described in the "Symptoms" section of this article. If the issue recurs, go to the next method.. . Method 2: Edit the registry. . Warning If you use Registry Editor incorrectly, you may cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall your operating system. Microsoft cannot guarantee that you can solve problems that result from using Registry Editor incorrectly. Use Registry Editor at your own risk.1. Click Start, and then click Run.. . 1. In the Open box, type regedit, and then click OK.. . 2. Locate the following registry key:. . HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE&#92;SOFTWARE&#92;CL... procServer32. . The (Default) value data should contain the following value:. . C:&#92;WINDOWS&#92;SYSTEM32&#92;JSCRIPT.DL.... . If it does not, double-click Default, type C:&#92;WINDOWS&#92;SYSTEM32&#92;JSCRIPT.DL... in the Value data box, and then click OK.. . 3. The ThreadingModel value data should contain the following value:. . Both. . If it does not, double-click ThreadingModel, and then type Both in the Value data box.. . 4. Locate the following registry key:. . HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE&#92;SOFTWARE&#92;CL... procServer32. . 5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 to edit this key, and then go to step 7.. . 6. Locate the following registry key:. . HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE&#92;SOFTWARE&#92;CL... procServer32. . 7. Repeat steps 3 and 4 to edit this key, and then go to step 9.. . 8. Exit Registry Editor.I find that you have to go 2 save or otherwise you've losed it, try that it's what i do and i can go back , and read them againg and again. smile, it works.

It stands for "really simple syndication" and its used on pages that are updated regularly.  If you have a program called a Rss Reader, you won't have to check that website to see if its updated with new info - your reader will do that for you.  Then you just give a glance at your 'reader' to see if any of the pages you've subscribed to have any new information on them.. . MY YAHOO is a way to use RSS - you subscribe to any page that has an rss feed and then when you go to your my Yahoo page, it tells you which of those have new information and which are just the same old stuff.RSS is Really Simple Synidcation or Rich Site Summary.  There are two ways to use it, as  smart book marks, like in FireFox, or you can use an RSS news reader.  It's just another way to get data to you.  It's kind of like a news feed.Your browser is so old!. . How old is it?. . Current browsers support rss, it's like a synopsis of the site that gets updated automatically by the server , just by bookmarking it! . . the computer language is the feed!
The fix.. 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. . The reason...... you probably signed up for a Yahoo! Messenger Account using your First/Last name.  They will show in the IM window when you send an IM or receive an IM from another user, unless you change it.    . . That does not mean the other person you are chatting with can see your First/Last name. Your Contact Details must be sent to them. If you have not sent your Contact Details to the other person you are IMing with, they will see your Yahoo! Account Name (or Nickname) and not your First/Last Name. . . If you have previously sent your Contact Details to the other person, they will need to delete you from their list and re-add you in order for you name to change on their list.. . For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/changename. http://www.chatauthority.com/editcontactinfogo to profiles  click edit then change it BEST ANSWERYou can click on Messenger in the menu bar and then click My Contact Details. Put in a nickname or a name that you want people to see and save it.

Good luckAfter logging on to Y! Mail Beta, open up any message in your inbox. Click on Print. The window pops up to display the printable message. You will then determine how many copies you want made (depending on the printer being used on your computer), and you can print out your email from there. That's the way you have your message printed without the annoying ads.

To sign up for Yahoo!'s personalized services, just follow the instructions for new users on the sign-in page of any of Yahoo!'s personalized services. . . During registration, you'll be asked to choose a Yahoo! ID and pick a password. . . Please Note: Your Yahoo! ID cannot contain special characters or spaces. After you've signed up, you can use this same ID and password for all of Yahoo!'s services.
If you log on and click on your points or level #. (They are to the left side) There is a table that explains the point system. But basically it takes 5 points to ask a question, and you receive 2 points when you answer a question and 10 points when your answer is rated as the best answer. So, you have to answer questions to ask questions. But once you have reaches a certain amount of points and you have reached a certain level, you can ask as many questions as you want and you don't need the points anymore.Points encourage participation. The more points you have, the more questions you can ask and answer every day.some tips on how to move up the levels as quick as possible..... . if you ask a question you lose five points but if you select the best answer you get three back. so make sure you select a best answer yourself. . . if it goes to a vote you just lose the five points. . . also when you give an answer you earn 2 pts and if its picked as the best answer you get 10pts. its in your best interest to give an interesting answer if you want to get a best answer. also if your answer is selected as best answer and has thumbs up you get points for each thumbs up ( up to 50 ),. . dont answer with answers such as 'no', 'yes', 'ok', 'i dont know' ' you cant' 'thanks for the 2 points' 'hmm' are not answers and people will report you for them. its in the community guidelines whats acceptable and what isnt. you also lose 10pts if you your question or answer is removed for abuse.. . voting on an answer will get you 1 pt.. . hang in there, we were all at your level once and know how you feel. good luck and have fun.. . http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system.phpcan you pick mine as the best ans so i can get 10 points?   . they matter to me hehein my opinion, many of the yahoo answer users feels good when they were chosen as the best answer. i don't know why, but it's a natural feeling.Stroking the ego. .          I AMThe points earn you more priveleges and time on the website.  There is a certain amount of prestige at reaching higher levels.  And, it's kind of like running on a track team:  you are competing against yourself, previous records that have been broken, etc.. . I???mia??†you lose 5 points for asking, 2 points per answer and  point for voting to resolve a question.  So the more help you give by answering then you'll get more points and voting as well to progress to higher levels.  The highest level is 7.yahoo had this brilliant idea to have a site where people could ask questions and get them answered.  But the problem is, if everybody just asked questions, nobody would ever get an answer!  So, in order to be able to ask a question, you have to earn enough points to ask it by answering other peoples' horribly difficult questions.  For example, if I really needed points to ask how long to fry an egg for, I would have to answer questions for other people in order to earn points to ask the question.  The only problem with this is that people don't actually answer the question and put something stupid to just get points.  Hope that helped!Go to your Q & A page. Click on the ? in front of the words (Total Points).....itll tell you everything you need to know about the points system.The points are worth nothing, they just help you gain a level.  High leve people are here more often.. . You get more point if you have a best answer.  . . If you pick my answer...I get 2 points for just answering you , . . 10 points if you pick my answer as the best.  . . then if i get a thumb up I get one point per tumbs up.. . It is fun and adicting.  Yahoo, give you nothing for adding to there information bases.When you get to level 2 you can rate questions.. .  POINTS:. -5 points for askin a question. +2 for answering one. +10 for getting a best answer. . LEVELS:. level 2: 250 points. level 3: 1,000 points. and so on.... . ANSWERS:. level 1: 20. level 2: 40. level 3: 60. level 4: 80. level 5: 100. level 6: 120. level 7: 140
Because you must have just reached the points level to qualify for Level 2, but by asking a question and losing 5 points, it's automatically sent you back below that level.  Hurry up and choose a best answer and you'll get 3 back, then just answer a question, or vote for a couple of answers that are 'In Voting' and you'll go back up to Level 2 again. (Or you should do!!).  Have fun!Your total points probably went down into the level one range.  Vote on some answers to get your points back up.points have gone downI must of takeng you down below the level two point mark e.g.. . Level 2 =100 points. you spend 5 points. . 100-5=95. . 95 points=levle 1Well, you went down to level one because you asked a question; asking a question will cost you 5 points, so in order to get back to level 2, you have to vote for a best answer, or answer questions, hope you get to level two.Ur points hav gone down.Try answering and rating questionsIf you had between 250 and 254 points when you asked the question, you would have got down to between 245 and 249 points afterwards. Your points will reflect the level you're on.they take away points and you haven't got enough for the next level

While your helping yourself and others learn you can also give to one in need, I think vista frist staring points and how it on the web.You get points for answering questions and the more you answer the higher level you get toPoints encourage participation. The more points you acquire, the more questions you can ask and answer. At different levels, the number of questions you can ask and answer increases. You can currently ask 5 and answer 20 questions a day, but once you get 250 points and are on level 2, this increases to 10 questions and 40 answers daily.At the beginning you have 100 points. If you ask any questions it costs you 5 points. & if you answer any question you gain 2 points. But if the answer is good than u may get more then 2points. as ur points increaces ur level increaces.

The email addresses in your address book will pop up in a separate window. Select one or more email addresses, click OK, and it will fill them in for you.After you click on "Compose", a box will open up with a "From Line", a "To Line" and a "Subject Line". The fix.. 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. . The reason...... you probably signed up for a Yahoo! Messenger Account using your First/Last name.  They will show in the IM window when you send an IM or receive an IM from another user, unless you change it.    . . That does not mean the other person you are chatting with can see your First/Last name. Your Contact Details must be sent to them. If you have not sent your Contact Details to the other person you are IMing with, they will see your Yahoo! Account Name (or Nickname) and not your First/Last Name. . . If you have previously sent your Contact Details to the other person, they will need to delete you from their list and re-add you in order for you name to change on their list.. . Take out your last name or just put in your first name and save.

Tools > Internet Options > Content > AutoComplete > Clear Forms. This will clear out ALL your autocompleted forms, such as search windows, form fill-ins, etc. You can also reset your Auto-Complete options here.. . Or, to delete just a single (or a few) searches, just have them highlighted in the drop-down list and hit DELETE -- they will vanish! If you hold down the key, the whole drop-down list of searches will delete.. . If you are using the Yahoo! Toolbar, I believe there is a drop-down box at the end of the search window that has the option to CLEAR SEARCHES on it.. . Clearing your history only clears out the PAGE locations that you have recently visited.Click on the pencil icon, in the drop down menu click on the 'Clear Recent Searches'.Try highlighting each one, one by one and hitting the delete key.. On Internet Explorer 7 click the gold star on the left of the toolbar, or press Alt + c on your keyboard to get your Favorites, and if you want the Menu Bar with File, Edit, View, Favorites, Tools, and Help to show, click Tools (an icon that looks like a gear) on the bottom right of the toolbar, a menu pops up, click Menu Bar, or right click a vacant space on the toolbar, a menu pops up, click Menu Bar. . . If you only need the Menu Bar with File, Edit, View, Favorites, Tools, and Help to appear temporarily just press the Alt key on your keyboard. This way your toolbar doesn't take up as much of your screen. If you want it to stay permanently, right click on a vacant space on the toolbar and click Menu Bar.. . I suggest you take the Internet Explorer 7 Tour.. http://www.microsoft.com/windows/ie/ie7/tour/fre/default.mspx. . These links can also be helpful.. http://www.microsoft.com/windows/ie/community/columns/ie7_toolbar.mspx. http://www.uwec.edu/help/internet.htmAt least two other questioners here asked about missing favorites after "upgrading" IE7.  Many others just asked how to downgrade to IE6.. . My advice:. . Uninstall IE7.. Then forget about IE.. . Install Firefox 2.0. . Customize your Firefox browser with add-ons and bring back the enjoyment of surfing the web. Think you need IE? Install "IE tabs" add-on.. . (You'll even be given the option to import your IE favorites.). . Good LuckIf you just loaded IE7, there is a gold star icon and a green plus sign over a gold star icon next to your destination tab. The gold star lets you see your favorites and history. The plus sign and gold star icon save your favoritesYou lost them all.

Need more info to help you with this one.When you reply ("Reply")  you can only add your own new message to the existing text.  If you want to edit text in the message you received, instead of hitting "Reply," hit "Forward."  When you "Forward," you can edit text.  Don't forget in your "Forward" to fill in the "Send to" box with the e-mail address of the person to whom you are sending the edited text.

it depends on what you are using for e-mail.  If your using Outlook or outlook express you wnat to right click and hit delete.  If you are using a web based e-mail (like yahoo, not the bata version, or hotmail) click the checkbox next to the e-mail and click the delete button (at the top or bottom of the page).  Hope this helps!if you are talking about an account you have to loginClick the empty button next to the word Spam, bulk, or trash. And it will delete everything without you having to even look at it.just switch back to the old versionYahoo! Mail offers two ways to delete individual messages: . . While viewing the contents of your inbox or another folder, click on the checkbox to the left of the message you would like to delete and click the "Delete" button at either the top or bottom of the list of messages. . If you're reading a message, you can click the "Delete" button at either the top or the bottom of the message. . If you're trying to delete several messages at once, this is the fastest way to do so: . . . Click the "Mail Options" link on the top right navigation bar and choose "General Preferences." . Find the Number of Messages (displayed at one time) heading and increase the value to 200 (the maximum). . Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click the "Save" button. . Return to the folder which contains the messages you would like to delete. . Click the "Check All" link (located beneath the list of messages or on the check box located to the right of the "sender" heading,) Clicking this link will select the first 200 messages in the folder (or all of the messages, if the folder contains less than 200). . Click the "Delete" button to delete the selected messages. . Repeat the above step for each screen full of messages in the folder, until all of the unwanted messages have been moved to the trash folder. . Aside from this method, there is no specific way to delete a particular folder's entire contents at once. When you delete messages in Yahoo! Mail, they're transferred to your trash folder. If you delete a message by mistake, you can find it in the trash and move it to your inbox or another folder in order to recover it. Please note that messages in your trash folder do not count against your quota. However messages in your trash folder can be deleted at any time without warning. . . To permanently remove the contents of the trash, click the "Empty" link next to the trash folder in the left navigation bar. Next, you will see a prompt asking if you're sure you want to delete all messages. Click "Yes" to delete or "No" to return to the previous page. . . Please Note: Once messages are emptied from the trash folder, they are permanently deleted from the Yahoo! Mail server and cannot be recovered.Right click on the email and then you should be able to go down and Delete should be one of the options.. . Or, single click on the title of the email and then press the Del key (below Insert and near Home/End). That should delete the email!

Go into your contact list and click Add List. Once you do that you will see a line below that reads Add Contact to List. Type in the letter A and you will see everyone on your contact list whose names or email addresses start with that letter. Continue with every letter of the alphabet if you would like and then give  your list a name such as friends and  then click save on the top right corner and that's it. Once you have a email you want to send to a bunch of people, you will have the group saved as friends on your contact list. All you have to do is start typing friends and it will forward that email to everyone on that list.Open the email and click the Forward button. Then just type their email addresses in the TO field and separate the addresses by a comma.

You can then click on clear forms and this will clear those entries. To enable Audibles, go to the top of the main Messenger window and click on "Messenger" and then "Preferences.". . A window will appeared called "Yahoo! Messenger Preferences." Click on where it says "Messages.". . Find the area labeled "Miscellaneous" and check the box next to where it says "Enable Audibles" and where it says "Always play audio when I send or receive Audibles.". . Yahoo changed the sounds in YM8. You can replace the new sounds with the old ones.. This site explains how to replace the olds sounds.. http://www.whiskeybentandhellbound.com/.... . . Are you using window blinds or alien guise or some other window enhancement program? e.g. programs that add extra buttons like transparency and keep always on top or change the look of the windows in anyway (not including standard XP themes). if so disable it and yahoo should work... Do a search on http://www.wackyb.com for window blinds. To delete address bar history as it also helps, follow this path. Tools> internet options> general > clear history > set the number of days to zero> ok.. . This is sometimes a flash issue, make sure you have download and installed flash from Internet explorer (not any other browser). http://www.adobe.com/shockwave/download/.... . http://www.wackyb.co.nz/yahoo!Still having problems try Common Issues/Tips & Tricks here:
Can you explain a little more?, so we can help you.. . =0). Good luckThere are several reasons why you might be getting an "Invalid Password" error message: . . Set your CAPS LOCK key correctly. Passwords are case sensitive (meaning that "PASSWORD," "PaSsWoRd," and "password" are not equivalent), so be sure to keep this in mind when entering your password. . Wait up to 24 hours. If you recently requested a new password or changed your password, this will allow your account to update. . Sign in with the correct Yahoo! ID. Make sure that you are using the correct Yahoo! ID when signing in to your account. If you have forgotten your Yahoo! ID, you can search for your ID online. . Delete your cookie files. A cookie is a small piece of information stored by your browser that helps identify you. If your cookie is not being accepted correctly, you will be logged out of your account as soon as you move to a different page. This may be blocking your current ability to log in or stay logged in.. To delete your cookies, close all browser windows, find the "cookies" directory, and delete the cookie files inside. As always, make sure that you have selected the proper files before deleting. . Clear your browser's cache. At times it's necessary to clear your browser's cache. The cache is the memory your browser uses to store content of the web pages that you visit. Storing that content lets your browser load those same pages more quickly the next time you visit them. . If you're still having problems, please request a new password. After you receive your new password, you can change it.. . For more information regarding Yahoo! IDs and passwords, please read this help section.
sorry, dont knowUnfortunately chat rooms are currently unsupported on Yahoo! Messenger for Mac v2.5.3 or v3.0 beta1.  This feature will likely be included in the final release.
On Internet Explorer 7 click the gold star on the left of the toolbar, or press Ctrl + i or Alt + c on your keyboard, and also if the Menu Bar with File, Edit, View, Favorites, Tools, and Help isn't showing, click Tools (an icon that looks like a gear) on the bottom right of the toolbar, a menu pops up, click Menu Bar, or right click a vacant space on the toolbar, a menu pops up, click Menu Bar. . . If you only need the Menu Bar with File, Edit, View, Favorites, Tools, and Help to appear temporarily just press the Alt key on your keyboard. This way your toolbar doesn't take up as much of your screen. If you want it to stay permanently, right click on a vacant space on the toolbar and click Menu Bar.Bottom left side of your toolbars are 2 little yellow stars. Those are now your shortcuts to Favorite. With the + sign you can add to favorites

You start at Home, then choose a Category, choose a question to read and then click on Answer This Question. Type your reply and then preview and submit...can't be much easier.  Good luck    ;)What can't you figure out? What to click, or what to say?. . You can start at Home.. . If you see a question you want to answer, click it.. . If you want to see only questions within a specific category of interest to you, click that category. Then click a question you want to answer.. . Read the answers that are already there. (I open a lot of questions in their own windows, giving others time to answer; that way, if someone else has answered, I don't bother.). . If you have something to say that hasn't already been said, scroll up to where you see the Answer This Question button.. . Click it.. . Type your answer in the empty field. Spell check. If you have a source (such as a book or website, or want to describe the experience you have that supports your answer, add it to the Source field).. . Click Preview. Read the question and answer to make sure you've given an accurate and complete answer that's grammatically correct and intelligible.. . Click Submit.. . As for what to say, it depends on the question. If you don't have some special area of knowledge (you aren't a science nerd, for example), go to Family/Relationships to give people advice, or to Polls and Surveys to give your opinion (in that category, you don't have to read the other answers first, as it's a survey, not looking for a correct answer or for help).. . Do not open any spam messages or you'll have many more.. Otherwise it works like slow-mail. if you want to know that the other person has received your message you need the other to confirm.. Hope is not old-fashioned unresponded love e-mails ;)there is no way of knowing if your mail has got received or not. this happens only with e greetings where the sender is informed when his/her greeting has been viewed. u will just have to wait for response from the other end to know if mail has reached or not.. if the address u have typed & receiver's in box is free then usually mail would be delivered otherwise u will get amail failure notification from yahoo.

If you check your recent activity it will list the last six sets of points that you receive (best answers, answering questions, asking questions, voting for best answers, logging in).  When you log in you see the new points on the recent activity that you didn't receive while you weren't on the site. If you've sent them to Trash, and it's been over a week, they're gone.  Less then a week, they might still be there.  You'll have to look in the Trash folder to find out.. . If you want to take emails out of your Inbox, but not discard them, set up a folder to put them in.  They will stay in there until you decide to send them to Trash.retrieve from where? if you trashed them in yahoo mail..then they are gone...you cannot retrieve them because they were on yahoo's email server (computer) and not your computer. . if they are in your INBOX..click on sender and it will group all email from one person in ABC orderIf you mean FIND emails from a certain person, then do a search in the box in your email by the name of the person and all of the mails sent and recieved with the persons name in it will display (if you have not deleted any).

Tools > Internet Options > Content > AutoComplete > Clear Forms. This will clear out ALL your autocompleted forms, such as search windows, form fill-ins, etc. You can also reset your Auto-Complete options here.. . Or, to delete just a single (or a few) searches, just have them highlighted in the drop-down list and hit DELETE -- they will vanish! If you hold down the key, the whole drop-down list of searches will delete.. . If you are using the Yahoo! Toolbar, I believe there is a drop-down box at the end of the search window that has the option to CLEAR SEARCHES on it.. . Clearing your history only clears out the PAGE locations that you have recently visited.This is not what they are talking about.  I get it to and i am sick of it. Unfortunately, your adress may have been sold by someone you did business with on the internet (always check privacy policies before you give out personal information).  Or a more likely, your email adress was in an email that ended up in a computer that had been infected with a program that harvested email adresses, and sent them back to the spammer.  I know that's what generated most of my spam.  This is why anti-virus programs, firewalls and programs like Spybot-Search & Destroy are so important, to keep your computer clean.They buy the lists from companies you might have given your e-mail address to.   Some on-line merchants sell their customer lists to other companies.   Nasty, but it happens.

Tools-internet options-clear history..MICROSOFT INTERNET EXPLORER. Click Tools in the menu bar, click INTERNET OPTIONS, click GENERAL, click CLEAR SEARCH HISTORY, click YES, click OK.. To prevent INTERNET EXPLORER from saving your searches in the future, you can do the following.. Click TOOLS, click INTERNET OPTIONS, click CONTENT at the top, CLICK AUTOCOMPLETE, uncheck the forms box, click OK.. . MY WEB SEARCH. Click MYWEB SEARCH, click CLEA HISTORY OF RECENT SEARCH TERMS

Delete from where? If you need to delete from your own system go to Tools > Internet Options > Delete History/Browsing History on your toolbar. Otherwise make sure you have an effective anti-spy feature installed and update & scan regularly.To clear the yahoo search bar, go to the pencil near the search bar and a drop down box appears.. you will see clear history. that will clear everything.Yahoo Search (web search):. In Internet Explorer, go to Tools > Internet Options >Click the "Content" tab > Click "Autocomplete" > Click "Clear forms" (or, you can uncheck the box near "Forms," so your search history isn't saved automatically.

IP means Internet Protocol. If you have dynamic IP it changes when the computer log  on to the Internet., Static IP always is the same address.Its a unique set of numbers that Identify your computer on a network (aka, the internet).  Its broken into fours sets of numbers.  Set 1 is the country, set 2 is the state, set 3 is the county, and set fours is your unique nuber assigend to that network.  Or something like that.

Points encourage participation. The more points you have, the more questions you can ask and answer.You get points for visiting the site, answering questions, voting for best answers, choosing a best answer for your own question, having your own question voted as best answer.. . Points are so people can see how involved you are in yahoo questions, see your "best answer percentage" to see how good your answers are.  The number of points you have determines how many times you can vote, ask, answer, rate and comment in a day.. . When you ask a question you spend points on it.  This point system encourages people to vote, rate, choose best answers, give good answers by rewarding people with privileges if they have many points and penalizing them by not awarding privileges  if they have few points.. . For details check out the "Points and Levels" page: http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system.phpGood Question!. The answer has received too many thumbs down. You can change the setting at the top of the column to show all.2 or more people gave it a thumbs down i believeYOU DON'T HAVE THE "VIEW ALL" SET AT THE TOP OF THE QUESTION / ANSWER SECTION.its the new yahoo answers rating enhancements that have just been implemented.. . your default setting is set to -2. which means any answers will two or more thumbs down will be hidden from you. yahoo is assuming these answers are bad answers which other users have given a thumbs down too.. . you can change that by just clicking on rating status at each question. once you set what rating filter you want it will stay that way until you change it again.. . hope this helps you a bit. check the blog out for all the new features.. . http://blog.360.yahoo.com/y_answrs_teamIt means that 2 or more answers have gotten a thumbs down and theyre hidden. You can set that the way you want to by clicking on the SHOW box beneath the question. I have mine set to show all answers.Other users have given those answers more than two thumbs up, and Yahoo! thinks that the rest of us don't want to read something that someone doesn't really rate. If you want to view all answers, just click the appropriate choice from the drop down menu above the answers.That it has been voted thumbs down you can click the show -2 and change it to show lower rated answersIf any answer receives  -2, it gets hidden

If the message is in the form of a post like forums and myspace, the 'delete' button is made handy in every post. This really comes down how the site is set up. Unfortunately theres no standard for post-type sites. For instance, on xanga, you'd have to delete your account to kill a message and for some reason this worked for my friend and not me. On Youtube, your posts are permanent. You could try killing your account, but again, it depends on how the site was made. On ebay, you'd have to get confirmation from the reciever to amend a comment.. PS. The guy above me is right about the 'sent' folder. If your goal is to keep a copy for yourself, then it should be in there as long as this feature exists and the feature is turned on.

You will have to verify password and then you will see where it says Change Password.You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.Go to "My Account" [at the top of every Yahoo page; near 'Sign out']. It'll take you to your account page to change your password.

Whats this got to do with Cookies. What specifically is happening?I have to accept cookies in order to use Yahoo! Mail  . Yes, you must accept cookies in order to use Yahoo! Mail successfully. . Yahoo! Mail uses a cookie to identify you. This cookie is a small piece of information stored by your browser which allows you to remain logged in to your account as you move from page to page. It's set when you log in to your Yahoo! Mail account and expires automatically after eight hours. If your cookie hasn't expired (or been disabled by clicking the "Exit" link), pointing your browser to http://mail.yahoo.com will log you in automatically. . . If you're prompted to accept a cookie after logging in to Yahoo! Mail, it's important that you accept. Declining the cookie may cause your login session to immediately expire or other functional problems that would prevent full access to your account. If your browser is configured to reject all cookies automatically, you won't be able to log in to Yahoo! Mail. Instead, you'll see a page entitled, "An Error Occurred Setting Your User Cookie." . . To configure your browser to accept cookies, follow the instructions below for your browser and version. . . To enable cookies on Internet Explorer 6.x on a PC: . . Open Internet Explorer . Select the "Tools" menu and then click "Internet Options" . Select the "Privacy" Tab . Move the slider up or down depending upon the desired level of security you would like . You may also click the "Advanced" button and select how you would like cookies handled from the options provided. . To enable cookies on Internet Explorer 5.x on a PC: . . Open Internet Explorer . Select the "Tools" menu and then click "Internet Options" . Select the "Security" Tab then click the button labeled "Custom Level" . Scroll down to "Cookies" and Make sure that the box next to "Accept cookies" is checked . To enable cookies on Internet Explorer 4.x on a PC: . . Open Internet Explorer . Select the "View" menu and then click "Internet Options" . Select the "Advanced" Tab . Scroll down to "Security" and then "Cookies" . Make sure that the box next to "Accept cookies" is checked . To enable cookies on Netscape 4.x on a PC: . . Open Netscape . Select the "Edit" menu and click "Preferences" . Scroll down to "Advanced" . Make sure that the box next to "Accept cookies" is checked . To enable cookies on Internet Explorer 5.x on a MAC: . . Open Internet Explorer . Click "Edit" and select the "Preferences" option . Under "Receiving Files", select "Cookies" . Next to "When receiving cookies:" select the level of cookie acceptance. . Click "OK" to finish . To enable cookies on Netscape 4.x on a MAC: . . Open Netscape . Select the "Edit" menu and then click "Preferences" . Scroll down to "Advanced" . Make sure that the box next to "Accept cookies" is checked. . Other. If you're running a browser other than those listed above and would like more information on whether your browser supports cookies, please refer to your browser's help file or to this page.okay the thing is beside cookie and changing your window to a big sizes. It has to do with bugs in the system. So when you see that bouncing ball underth it is ...having logging in problems ....hit that and go back the orginal mail until the bugs are out.
Under your question there is a plus sign.  Right next to the plus sign there should be a pencil.  When you hold your cursor over the pencil, you should get the option to delete your question.You can delete questions that are open. However questions once resolved cannot be deleted. To delete your open questions, move your mouse over the plus sign below 'Answer this question' button and click on delete.. . Your question will be deleted.u click the plus sign and over there u will see the delete thingUnder you question there is a plus sign and you click on that and im sure you will know the rest but  one thing... you cant delete already resolved questions :P have fun! :PYou can only delete those questions of your's which are in the open category. The questions which are resolved can't be deleted. (unless yahoo deletes them). Click on your avatar, scroll down the next page, on the left hand side, click MY QUESTIONS and select the question that you want to delete. Once the question opens, go to the plus sign , under your question, there you will see an option to delete the question, click on it.You can only delete questions that are still accepting answers. Once you have resolved it by choosing the best answer, or it has gone into voting, you can't delete it. View your question, hover your mouse cursor over the pencil icon and choose the option to delete your question.

Some idiot reports it.Usually if it violates the Yahoo answers rules it is removed.I would think because it has already asked?The reason for removal of any question is they violate the Answers Community Guidelines or the Yahoo Terms of Service. It is important to read and understand them.  If you haven't read them, please use these links and read them:. . http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/. . http://answers.yahoo.com/info/community_guidelines;_ylt=Aq0HJWWqxU.cf5BAiU6O6rc_zKIX. . There are people on Answers that derive pleasure from reporting questions and answers even though they do not violate the CG's or YTOS.  The Abuse reporting system is so overwhelmed that almost any report is automatically processed without review of its validity. This gets many people multiple violations resulting in their Answers Account being suspended. This abuse can also get their complete Yahoo Account deactivated resulting in the loss of  the email account, websites and other services. . . By reading and understanding the CG's and YTOS you will be better equiped to appeal any bogus violations you might receive.You have probably violatedm the TOS (Terms of Service). I asure you, you'll understand better and you'll get better answer in your posted question...I think I just learned something. SpamGuard Plus uses sophisticated algorithms to learn what you consider as spam by analyzing the content of the messages you report as spam or not spam. These algorithms need a certain amount of content before they can predict what you consider spam. Therefore you might have to report the same type of messages several times before it's directed to the right folder.question not clear

Yahoo! Mail is committed to eliminating spam and offers several tools to help you keep spam out of your inbox. Yahoo! has consolidated several of these tools under the "This is Spam" link next to the From: address in every message. . The most effective way to prevent spam from entering your inbox is to use SpamGuard. Help increase SpamGuard's effectiveness by sending examples of spam to Yahoo! to review. Yahoo! will use the messages you send using the "Spam" button to constantly improve the SpamGuard technology. . Yahoo! Mail offers you the ability to create filters for your account. You can create filters to deliver emails to a special folder or to the Trash that:. . . contain specific words or phrases . are from a sender's domain . containing other characteristics you find in spam . . Yahoo! Mail allows you to prevent future email from a specific email address from being delivered to you at all. Note that many spammers frequently change their email address to avoid this technique. . You can choose how long you want to keep messages in your Bulk Mail Folder. You can choose to drop all messages in your Bulk Mail Folder or keep messages for 1 week, 2 weeks or 1 month. The default is one month. . To edit this feature: . . Click "Mail Options" . Click "Spam Protection" . Here you will have the following two choices: . . . "Immediately delete these messages upon receipt". . "Save these messages in the Bulk folder" and select the desired timeframe from the drop down menu. . Important: Occasionally, valid email messages may be perceived as spam and delivered to the Bulk folder. Please note that if you select this option, you will not have an opportunity to review the messages in your Bulk folder before they are deleted. . . . Click "Save Changes" . Outside of the specific tools that Yahoo! Mail offers: . . Never respond to unsolicited email (i.e., spam). To the individuals who send spam, one response or "hit" among thousands of mailings is enough to justify the practice. &#92; . . Never respond to the spam email's instructions to reply with the word "remove" unless you trust the company sending the email. This is a ploy to get you to react to the email and will alert the sender that your email address is open and available to receive mail, which greatly increases its value. If you reply, your address may be placed on more lists, resulting in more spam. . . Never click on a URL or web site address listed within a spam email. This could alert the site to the validity of your email address, potentially resulting in more spam. . . Never sign up with sites that promise to remove your name from spam lists. . Although some of these sites may be legitimate, more often than not, they are address collectors. The legitimate sites are ignored (or exploited) by the spammers, and the address collection sites are owned by spammers. In both cases, your address is recorded and valued more highly because you have just identified that your address is active.if there are unwanted mails then put it as spam which would reduce ur problemperhaps you can install the yahoo anti-spam softwares some of them are even free for download.. check in yahoo website ...you get an antispam software for free... install it and sit back and enjoy browsing without any spams....!!!!!!!!You can block the address if they're coming from the same place.  Mark items that are junk in your inbox as spam.  Bulk is supposed to be where junk goes, so you could just empty it without looking at the contents.1- download anti-spam software from yahoo & instal it. 2- block and keep the unwanted messages in spam. 3- simply delet such messages in mass

Idle means you arent using the computer at all and you didnt set an away mesage. If your friend walks away for a certain amount of time, generally 20 minutes, there status will automatically be set to the Idle status. Generally its like auto away when your computer isnt being used at all.Means he is on line but doing nothing with yahoo messenger-Yahoo chat -yahoo emailing or other activity on Yahoo.Yahoo shows it since how many minutes he/she remains idle.SIMPLY PUT , IT'S LIKE WHEN YOU STOP YOUR CAR AND JUST PUT IT ON PARK , IT'S STILL RUNING BUT NOT MOVING THAT'S IDLEING.(IT'S STILL RUNING BUT NOT MOVING .)still, without action, motionlessit mean your friend is signed in but currently away from computer.same idea as screensaverI'm pretty sure in that instance it means that they have not been chatting/talking online for however long the clock says.  In other words, their chat profile has been idle for 5 minutes...inactive, busy... if you're on the computer it means you were doing something and pretty much not anymore... yahoo messenger for example... if u were talking online and now are not and have walked away you're idle now. not using it anymore...idle mean you are signed on but you have left the computer for that amount of time shown & when it is not idle no more that person is back.motionless

This hides the majority of your content, if someone stumbles onto your page.. . Perform option #1 and then select the first "Display Me As" option on the Settings page. Now your profile doesn't link to your 360 page. Also, UNcheck the "Activate Simple URL" setting. This way people cannot guess your 360 page by sticking your yahoo id onto the end of 360.yahoo.com. . Perform options #1 and #2 and then delete your friends by selecting the "My Friends" link in the upper right of your 360 page. Select "Edit Settings" on a friend's name, then select "Remove <friend> from your Friends Page". Finally, delete all of your content, blogs, links to pictures, lists, reviews, etc. This pretty much makes your 360 inaccessible and/or unusable by anyone who happens to get thereYou can't delete it. You will, in either case, have to send another friend request to them.Was it on a website or a computer-program, such as an e-mail program? Could you add some detail please?. . If its a computer-program, you might get it back by restoring your system registry, where all the windows and program settings are stored, to an earlier date and time. Go to Start Menu, Help and Support Center, then click on the 'Undo changes to your computer with System Restore' link and then restore your system to a date and time before you deleted the contact.. . You might also look in your Recycle Bin for deleted e-mails containing the contact details. Also, if you know the person's name, you could search all the files on your hard-disk in Windows Explorer, looking for files containing their name. Some of these may be old cached emails with their email address.Look inside your recycle bin, then recover it again

I believe that we go through several stages in our personal development.... . DEPENDENCE (as a Small child who cannot feasibly look after themselves). . CO-DEPENDENCE (when we are beginning to make our way into the out-side world.. we still rely on others (parents/teachers/family/friends, but are beginning to create a sense of self - although it is still largely based on what we get from those others, which includes how they see us). . INDEPENDENCE (when we finally break free of needing to be this or that for anyone else and develop into something resembling our true nature). . INTERDEPENDENCE (when we - as a fully-formed logical individual become fully self-actualised and realise that we are all one, and that we need each other- and that it is pretty cool to do so because we really just want to). . Interdependence is very different from dependence or co-dependence, as each individual is seen as being their own person, but connected to all others in all kinds of different ways. . . The BS song (hmmm.... an interesting conjunction) is, I feel an attempt to write a love song from the point of view of someone calling to the lonely.... but may, in fact, be from the point of view of someone attempting to deal with aspects of the Independance stage. . . Each of these stages has pitfalls for the unwarey - remaining dependant is clearly not good for one... hanging onto your mothers coat-tails when you are 35 is clearly wasting a life.... . . But many adult relationships never fully form because one or more of the participants is still stuck in the dependent or co-dependent phase (they still rely on the idea of 'another' to make them feel fulfilled - or to notice that they are alive). . Clearly if one gets stuck in INdependence then one is forever going to be denying the fun and psychological advancement that comes from truely giving of yourself to another. . . The song speaks of all those "lucky" people who need people, and even mentions that we are children hiding their adult side..... "We're children needing other children. And yet letting our grown-up pride. Hide all the need inside. Acting more like children than children". . So the song mentions the fact that some development is needed in order to really create an honest, lasting and fulfilling relationship.. To my mind, however, the song does not go far enough. . . It is reminding people to go beyond the independence stage, but is not really setting that up as a pre-requisite for building trust or creating an equal partnership. It still could be a call for co-dependant relationships as it is not asking for two individuals to come together, but is still giving that old 'you are only half a person until you latch onto someone else' kinda message. . "With one person. One very special person. A feeling deep in your soul. Says you are half now you're whole". . Not so clever, really.no man is an island.accept me of course I'm one of the cook islands.Is that a line or is it a song and by who? I'm curious now.  but if that's the line of the song then i would say everyone needs people for friends, love ones, companionship and someone just to talk to, it also could mean that the singer was once alone and understands how it feels to be alone.I think its about not being lonely. Cause some people are loners and dont mix or integrate with other people therefore they must lead very lonely lives. It will take all the sites you've visited off the drop down box. You might also want to "Delete Files". Be sure to check the box that says "remove offline content." go to mail box, at the top right corner,click options,then click "block address".Yahoo! Mail is committed to eliminating spam and offers several tools to help you keep spam out of your inbox. Yahoo! has consolidated several of these tools under the "This is Spam" link next to the From: address in every message. . The most effective way to prevent spam from entering your inbox is to use SpamGuard. Help increase SpamGuard's effectiveness by sending examples of spam to Yahoo! to review. Yahoo! will use the messages you send using the "Spam" button to constantly improve the SpamGuard technology. . Yahoo! Mail offers you the ability to create filters for your account. You can create filters to deliver emails to a special folder or to the Trash that:. . . contain specific words or phrases . are from a sender's domain . containing other characteristics you find in spam . . Yahoo! Mail allows you to prevent future email from a specific email address from being delivered to you at all. Note that many spammers frequently change their email address to avoid this technique. . You can choose how long you want to keep messages in your Bulk Mail Folder. You can choose to drop all messages in your Bulk Mail Folder or keep messages for 1 week, 2 weeks or 1 month. The default is one month. . To edit this feature: . . Click "Mail Options" . Click "Spam Protection" . Here you will have the following two choices: . . . "Immediately delete these messages upon receipt". . "Save these messages in the Bulk folder" and select the desired timeframe from the drop down menu. . Important: Occasionally, valid email messages may be perceived as spam and delivered to the Bulk folder. Please note that if you select this option, you will not have an opportunity to review the messages in your Bulk folder before they are deleted. . . . Click "Save Changes" . Outside of the specific tools that Yahoo! Mail offers: . . Never respond to unsolicited email (i.e., spam). To the individuals who send spam, one response or "hit" among thousands of mailings is enough to justify the practice. &#92; . . Never respond to the spam email's instructions to reply with the word "remove" unless you trust the company sending the email. This is a ploy to get you to react to the email and will alert the sender that your email address is open and available to receive mail, which greatly increases its value. If you reply, your address may be placed on more lists, resulting in more spam. . . Never click on a URL or web site address listed within a spam email. This could alert the site to the validity of your email address, potentially resulting in more spam. . . Never sign up with sites that promise to remove your name from spam lists. . Although some of these sites may be legitimate, more often than not, they are address collectors. The legitimate sites are ignored (or exploited) by the spammers, and the address collection sites are owned by spammers. In both cases, your address is recorded and valued more highly because you have just identified that your address is active.Use an email client (like Yahoo! for example) that filters out spam.  That is about the most you can do.Click on Options and then on Spam Protection. Set it to automaticly delete Spam on arrival.
first go to your page and choose compose blog entry, then type whatever text you want to say..go down to bottom of page- IMPORTANT! check the box that says view html- in another window find the youtube vid you want- right click on the embed code- choose copy, then in your "compose blog entry" either before or after your typed text, click and choose paste- make sure the show html box is still clicked on- then choose preview or save1) Copy the "Emblem" HTML code (on right side of video).. 2) Go to "My Blog" in Y!360.. 3) Click "Compose Blog Entry".. 4) Place checkmark in box "View HTML Source" (important!).. 5) Paste in the coding.. 6) Add text to your blog entry (important also).. 7) After done click "Preview" and do a lookover.. 8) Finally click "Post This Entry".

Click on My Account which is under your ID. Verify Password and then you will see where it says Change Password.You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-13.html.. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . - Click the "Change Password" link. . - Enter your current password in the first box. . - Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . - Confirm your new password in the third box. . - Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.How do I change my password?. . You could change your password http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/index.html. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . - Click the "Change Password" link. . - Enter your current password in the first box. . - Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . - Confirm your new password in the third box. . - Click the "Save" button.. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *.

You can't delete a 360,follow directions below to make it private>Select the "Settings" option at the upper right of your 360 page and change all of you settings to 'Private'. This hides the majority of your content, if someone stumbles onto your page.. . Perform option #1 and then select the first "Display Me As" option on the Settings page. Now your profile doesn't link to your 360 page. Also, UNcheck the "Activate Simple URL" setting. This way people cannot guess your 360 page by sticking your yahoo id onto the end of 360.yahoo.com. . Perform options #1 and #2 and then delete your friends by selecting the "My Friends" link in the upper right of your 360 page. Select "Edit Settings" on a friend's name, then select "Remove <friend> from your Friends Page". Finally, delete all of your content, blogs, links to pictures, lists, reviews, etc. This pretty much makes your 360 inaccessible and/or unusable by anyone who happens to get thereYou can't delete your 360 profile but you can hide it from everyone so that no one can see it and it's unsearchable.. . Click on your settings tab in 360 (on the extreme top right) and then make your name, your address and everything else that would normally be revealed private. You can also get rid of the simple URL. After that, you profile is invisible and unsearchable.

Questions that have been resolved.it means you supposedly got your answerIt means that you have choosen a best answer for the question that you have asked.it means- asked - answered - best answer chosen - closed to voting or new answersA best answer has been choosen for the question. People can still go back and put comments though.Resolved questions are questions that have had a best answer chosen to either by the person who asked the question, or has been the answer with the most votes when it has gone to voting. They are still on the site for the rest of us to look through if we ask similiar questions.The question has run its course through the answering phase and the point awarding phase, so it is completely resolved

Under each question will be a blue button that says "Answer this question". Click it. On the next page, type your answer in the "Your answer" box. Hit the "Preview" button to preview your button. Then hit the "Submit" button to submit your answer. You will be returned to the question and will see your answer at the bottom of the page.

Yahoo Mail. . log in to your Yahoo Mail. click on "My account". enter your password. click "Edit/Create Profiles" on the right hand column . click the appropriate "Delete the Profile". click "Confirm Delete" on the next screen. enter your password to confirm delete action. . 2. Yahoo Messenger. . launch your Yahoo Messenger. hit "Alt+M+R" to open "My Profiles". click "Create/Edit my Profiles". click the appropriate "Delete the Profile". click "Confirm Delete" on the next screen. enter your password to confirm delete action. on your YM, click "Done". . 3. Account inactivity [failure to log in under that account] for 60 days deactivates that account, with option to reactivate upon Yahoo notification.profile deletion is not a simple task.you should first of all have a good knowledge in hardware otherwise it  can lead to the deletion of whole system.better consult a programmergo ot account infoemation and delete ur profile !Y would you want to do this?

Automatic. Watch yer avatar.yeah, they go on instantly.Yes, your voting points should be acknowledged by a "shining" star and the 1 point message right away. Don't know for sure how long it takes for them to hit your cumulative score -- never paid attention to that -- but there may be a delay. Make sure you are VOTING (for Best Answer) and not just RATING (thumbs up/thumbs down) -- the first gets points, the second doesn't.They are supposed to be credited immediately but sometimes there are glitches that prevent that from happening.We're meant to earn a point for every vote we cast. We don't get points for voting for no best answers. However, since the end of last week, points don't seem to be registering for voting. There seem to be a number of bugs on the site, so hopefully the Answers team are trying to work on resolving them all - but it may take a while to do so.

(Try putting your nickname or "_" on the spaces because you can't go for a completely blank name).. Click Finished.. Log-off Yahoo Messenger and then sign in again.. There you go! You've changed your display name!To edit your name on emails being sent.... . 1). Log into your Yahoo! Email account. 2). Upper right corner, click on Options. 3). Click General Preferences under Management. . 4). Name and Email Section change the From name: (This name will appear on the From line of outgoing mail.) Enter the name as you would like it to appear.. 5). Click Save.. . For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/editcontactinfoOn here? Go to your Q&A page and click on Edit My Info and then you can change it.

go to control panel and click on add/remove programs. threr should be a list of programs on your computer that you can remove. and just remove/uninstall BT yahoo messenger.AddRemove programs, you must be logged on as Administrator or have Administrator Rights to actually do this correctly. By default EVERYONE is an Administrator on WinXP, but look at Microsoft site and they say, DO NOT RUN your computer as an Administrator. So does every other OS, it just makes sence. . Surefire way is to make a backup of your OS and all Files and Folders, then Remove, reboot, see if its still there, (probablly is) then you have to go Safe Mode and /erase or whatever the MS-DOS command is, but be very carefull there, it is like hacking the registry, this is ill advised unless you have a Stable Backup that you know works. . A Stable Backup is NOT a restore disk, it is a Backupof all system files to a CD-RW, HDD or somesuch thing. Read about How to backup and print it out. . Computers will fail, OSs will crash, Viruses will infect a machine, the only real defence or protection is a Stable Backup. . Read more at langa.com

Don't use a freebie email service. Upgrade or use the one that comes with your ISP.If you are using Free Web Mail or a Free Mail Client, you cannot remove the sponsored links at the bottom of your mail.. . These companies earn from the "sponsorship" and thus can offer free service or free software.. . If you really a no sponsored link on your email, you need to have a paid email subscription or a paid email client software.Those emails are subsidizing your free email account.  If you're using a Yahoo! email account, you can upgrade to Yahoo! Mail Plus which gives you ad-free email and other additional features for a fee.

Hope that helpGo to this site and click the delete account page,right under the red stuff.I would have linked you all the way but don't want to accidentally delete my own.How do I close my account?. . Yahoo! members can remove their own accounts and account information from Yahoo!. Please follow the instructions below to initiate the deletion of your account. . . By terminating your account, you will lose access to your Yahoo! ID, Yahoo! Mail, and profile names. We will also delete your account data and settings across the Yahoo! network. This includes any contents in: . . Yahoo! Mail . Yahoo! Address Book . Yahoo! HotJobs . GeoCities . Yahoo! Briefcase . My Yahoo! . Yahoo! Groups . Finance Portfolio . Any other area of Yahoo! that can only be accessed with your Yahoo! ID and password . Please be sure you want to delete your entire account as you will not be able to reactivate it after the account has been deleted. You are always welcome to sign up again for a new account. . . Terminating your Yahoo! account does not alter or delete your Yahoo! People Search listing, which you need to edit or delete yourself. . . If you are subscribed to any premium services, we recommend that you first cancel those premium services before you delete your account. If you do not delete your Premium Services before deleting your Account, you will continue to be billed for your premium services. To cancel your current subscriptions, visit Yahoo! Billing Information for your account, choose the "My Services" tab, and click the "Cancel" link for each subscription. . . To remove your entire account, please visit our Account Deletion page. (https://edit.india.yahoo.com/config/delete_user)You will be asked to sign in to or verify your password for the account you wish to delete. Please be sure to read the next page carefully, as important information about your account is included. You can then confirm the deletion of your account. . . If you're having trouble signing in, you can get password help on the password problems page.. . Please complete the deletion process only if you are certain you would like to remove your entire Yahoo! account and any features you have personalized within the account. After the deletion process is initiated, your Yahoo! account can never be recovered.

your threshold is selected on any question  page it shows . a rated above    -2  on it change that and you change your threshold . by the way its above the first answerIt means that 2 or more answers have gotten a thumbs down. You can change that by clicking on the SHOW box and set it the way you want it. I have mine set to show all answers.Users who are level 2 and above can rate answers by giving them thumbs up and thumbs down. When a answer receives 2 or more thumbs down, Yahoo! has decided that other users don't want to read something that someone doesn't really rate. If you want to view all answers, just click the appropriate choice from the drop down menu above the answers.

The dreaded little red square is an indicator of a couple things. It can mean the picture is no longer at that location (you know that is not the problem). It can mean the picture is to big (file size) to view (prolly not the problem). It can mean the picture is in a format that can not be displayed in the application you are in (this would be my bet).hello, Picasa automatically resizes and attaches pictures to email messages, it's free if you want to have a go, it makes it very easy. http://www.sleekbytes.com/picasa-google.htm. . Also get Hello, it's a plugin for Picasa http://www.worldstart.com/tips/tips.php/295 and you have the best setup for sharing photos online.

I don't see the problem. You just click on a question that is IN VOTING. Then read the question and scroll down through the answers. When you find the one you think is correct (if it is a factual question) or the one whose opinion you agree with (if it is an opinion question), then just click on VOTE FOR THIS AS BEST ANSWER.. . If you hate all the answers and don't feel comfortable voting for any then just click on NO BEST ANSWER.. . That is all there is to it. I don't see why you are confused.All you have to do is go to the undecided answers and check the one you want with a thumbs up.  That's all to it, it worked for me.Click on Vote, Click on a question, Click Vote for an answer you like.You can give a question and answer a thumbs up or thumbs down (rating).  I believe this equates to a vote.. . Once the time to answer has expired and the asker does not pick a best answer, the decision goes to others in the form of a vote button.  There will be a Vote As Best Answer link at the bottom of each answer, and a No Best Answer link at the very bottom of the list.  You simply click the link by the answer you think is best.Check the thumbs up or thumbs down icon. Or you can go to Resolved questions and choose the best answer to the question asked.First...you must qualify for being able to vote.   You qualify by writing a specified number of answers to questions.. . Everytime you answer a question you collect 2 points.  Until you answer enough questions, you can click on the thumbs up or down and will get no response.

In here, you can find your friend's address and delete it from the list.

Don't unsubscribe. In many cases the "unsubscription" procedure simply signs you up for more.. . Just delete them. You recycle junk mail when it comes through the front door, so do the same with your inbox.. . If you can, change your email address and NEVER post it on any website. (Addresses posted on websites get 'harvested' and sent daft messages.)If youve properly unsubscribed, they should stop. You can also send an email to the company and ask to be taken off their list.What emails are you asking about?. . Unsubscribe from what?. . You've posted this question in the category about Yahoo Answers -- the only emails you get from YA are for Best Answers, for reporting abuse, and for being removed for abuse.. . Or are you talking about spam, that is, illegitimate unwanted emails?. . If so, don't do the "unsubscribe" thing, as all that does is tell the spammer that they reached a working address.. . You can't stop spam once you start getting it. Just delete it and move on.

How do I change my password?. . If you would like to change your Yahoo! password, just sign in to your Yahoo! account with your current password and click the Account Info or My Account link at the top of the page. You will be asked to re-enter your current password for verification. Then: . . Click the "Change Password" link. . Enter your current password in the first box. . Enter your new password (as you would like it to be) in the second box. . Confirm your new password in the third box. . Click the "Save" button. . Your Yahoo! password will always apply to your entire Yahoo! account. This means that it will be valid not only for Yahoo! Mail, but also for Yahoo! Messenger, Yahoo! Chat, My Yahoo!, Yahoo! Finance, and all of Yahoo!'s other personalized services. . . Please Note: To better protect your account, make sure that your password is memorable for you but difficult for others to guess. Never use the same password that you have used in the past, and do not share your password with anyone. For security purposes, your new password must be a minimum of six characters long. A good password contains a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters (remember that your password is case sensitive), numbers, and special characters such as +, ?, and *. . . For additional information on choosing a strong password, please visit the Yahoo! Security Center.You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.if its on yahoo, sign in the go back to homepage.see where its says"hi (your name)?" click on that and it will take you to your info where u can change password.Once you sign in to yahoo, on your every yahoo page, at the top of the page, you will see a link MY ACCOUNT (given in BLUE colour), click on it, verify the password and on the next page, you will see CHANGE PASSWORD in the red colour click on it and you will be guided through the process of cahnging your password.

what do you mean by saying header border pic ? you mean banner ?Ask Yahoo about itWhen you are signed in to yahoo and visiting your 360 MY PAGE, there is CUSTOM EDIT / CHANGE THEME. For background, you can fill most with a large 1000x600 and tile so repeats the length of page. You can find an interesting banner like MARVEL COMICS wallpaper and split the horizontal comic action into a top and bottom banner. 1000x300 for bottom and 1000x210 for top. You want to create your banners in jpg. format. In photoshop, choose OPTIMIZE for WEB when assigning jpg to your finished product. This should be small enough to meet the yahoo protocol.. . Consider the banner and image is going to be blocked by modules. If you notice on the themes made by yahoo for 360, an interesting graphic lies above the center line or horizon and the lower is color and texture. You want your primary graphic kept close to top of banner.. . As you scroll past the background change options, you see all the elements of modules and borders and profile background, etc. It takes several tries to get the COLOR tweaks blending well with your new background. I have a BLOG ROLL with two real handy links easily tagged 360 COLOR TIPS. On is an excellent review of one websites color schemes at a time. All the hexidecimal colors can easily be copy/pasted into your custom edit.. Source(s):. . http://blog.360.yahoo.com/bluedecker_97.... . It's really up to your email provider. Yahoo! 360° (a.k.a Yahoo! Days) is a personal communication portal similar to orkut and MySpace, currently in beta testing. It integrates features of social networking, blogging, and photo sharing sites.. . A user may create a personal web site, share their photos from Yahoo! Photos, maintain a blog, a list of local reviews, profile information, and see which friends are currently online.It's a social network, similar to MySpace, etc.. You can blog, upload pictures/albums, display your interests, and/or connect to other Y! 360 users. It can also serve as an in-depth personal profile for Yahoo.

Here are a few things that are helping people in the meantime:. http://wap.oa.yahoo.com/. For different areas of Yahoo!. . For those who can't get in at all try this as it seems to be working for a few.. http://myyahoo.com. Login on My Yahoo! page. Select the link at top right to go to Yahoo!'s Home Page.. Mouse over the Mail Icon under where it says (Hi, your Yahoo! id).. You should get a drop down menu with your latest emails displayed.. Select an email and click it. You then get to a new page about Shortcuts, but just select the button for Mail and it should take you to your Mail page.. It wasn't getting redirected to the shortcuts page on some servers and not going to the mail page.. . This is working for some:On the Options page, in the "Management" column, click on "General Preferences". . Find the "Composing E-mails" section, "Mode:", and choose "Compose messages as plain text". . Scroll to the bottom and click the "Save" button. . Now try it. Can you Compose, Reply to a message or . Click the "Options" link in the upper right of your Mail page. . Forward? . . This is working for some also:. Make sure your screen resolution is 1024 by 768 pixels. Right click on your desktop, click Properties, click the "Settings" tab, left click and hold on the screen resolution bar and drag it all the way to the right, click Apply and . click OK.. Yes.  You can get a new email address with another provider, or another email address with the same provider.  You can set up automatic forwarding from your current address to your new address so that you won't miss out on any messages sent to your current address.. . If you shared your current provider (the name after the @ in your email address) then it might be easier to help you.No, if you want a different email address, you need to sign up for a new one.

a watch list a list of questions that you are particullary interested in.Underneath the question, hover your mouse cursor over the plus sign to reveal a menu. Click the option to add the question to your watch list.. . Click the link to your My Q&A page. Scroll down to the bottom of the page where you see three tabs - My answers, My questions, and my watchlist. Click the watchlist tab, and then the link to the profile to access it.on EBay? What?Click on a question. Under the question, near where it says to answer question, there is a plus sign. that will expand a window where you have options. On your profile, you can click on the tab to view your watchlist questions.The watchlist can be used to keep "tabs" on a question that you did not want to answer but want to see the results;. a question you may have reported for abuse and to confirm that it has been deleted.. to be able to find another Y!A participant quickly.. . To add to watchlist  go to your PLUS sign icon and click the ADD TO WATCHLIST icon.
