When asking a question like that you need to specify what program you're using or website you're visiting (and what browser you're using to visit it), what version of the program, and what operating system. The fix.. 1). Log into Yahoo! Messenger.. 2). Click on Messenger.. 3). Click on My Contact Details.. ~If you want to have your First Name only, delete your Last name.. ~If you want to use the Nickname field, delete your First and Last name and enter the name you would like to see in the IM box in the Nickname field.. ~If you want only your Account ID to show, leave all fields blank.. 4). Always click Apply and OK when making any changes.. . The reason...... you probably signed up for a Yahoo! Messenger Account using your First/Last name.  They will show in the IM window when you send an IM or receive an IM from another user, unless you change it.    . . That does not mean the other person you are chatting with can see your First/Last name. Your Contact Details must be sent to them. If you have not sent your Contact Details to the other person you are IMing with, they will see your Yahoo! Account Name (or Nickname) and not your First/Last Name. . . If you have previously sent your Contact Details to the other person, they will need to delete you from their list and re-add you in order for you name to change on their list.. . For addition explanation and information go to http://www.chatauthority.com/changename. http://www.chatauthority.com/editcontactinfo. . You may also need to edit Account Information..... . Click on My Account on any Yahoo! Page you have just signed into (at the top of the page under your Yahoo! ID).  Sign in and go down to the Address/Contact Information Section.  Click on Edit.  First and Last name fields MUST be filled in but you can change them to anything you would like.  Click Finish.Click on Messenger in the menu bar and then on My Contact Details. Put whatever you want to be shown in one of the boxes.The answer is 42

What Laura and Joey said.... . But if you can't remember their user name, check your message archives until you recognize them or a conversation.  You must have the Messenger Arcive function activated to do this. . . You can also check your email address contacts in Yahoo Messenger.  They are not automatically deleted when you delete a user name.  In Messenger, go to "Contacts" at the top and scroll to "Show Address Book"  Your deleted friend could still be in there.. After you locate the name, just go through the "add contact" procedure again.. . .Click the Contacts menu and select Add a Contact. If you know their Messenger ID, you can add it. Hope u know!You can get a new password, a Yahoo! ID reminder, or both. Visit the Sign-in Problems page and supply some basic verification information, such as your birthday and the ZIP or postal code you provided when you registered.. . Make sure to provide the same information you gave during registration or when you last updated your account. Without the correct verification information, you will not be able to obtain a new password.. . You could change your password @ http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/edit/id_password/edit-20.html.

No, it means it wasn't sent.  Your email program tried everything it could do to send it, but wasn't able to do soAll it means is that yahoo could not send the e-mail to the person you meant to receive it. This could be for several reasons.(i.e wrong e-mail address (check your typing) or that yahoo's mail system was down or something). Best to keep trying. I hope it wasn't an emergency e-mail! To avoid this problem its best to keep a copy in draft format so you can go back and look at it and attempt to send it again.It means that the person you sent it to either does not exist (you made an error in the address) or their server is rejecting their emails (either because their mailbox is full or because the server is down). Try it again in an hour or so.. . good luck!It did not arrive, maybe you did not get the address right. Try again and check the address carefullyNo, it did'nt arrive where it was sent to, in other words it died. So in future take more care of your emails and feed them properly.

It's an online journal/diary where you can 'blog' about topics that interests you (it can be pretty much anything including your political views, hobbies, etc., etc). . You can create one at http://360.yahoo.com (you need to be 18 years or old; just sign in with your Yahoo ID). . your wit them FOREEVER  HOEYou can delete all of your stuff and make it private, but you can't completely cancel a 360 page unless you completely delete your Yahoo ID as well.Just delete everything on the page and click save. You cant get rid of the page. You can also make sure its set on Private.Unfortunately, you cannot delete a Yahoo! 360 account. It's linked to your primary Yahoo! ID. If you want to keep your Yahoo! ID for things like Mail, IM, Answers, etc. then you'll need to hide your 360.. There are a few different ways to do this,. 1) Select the "Settings" option at the upper right of your 360 page and change all of you settings to 'Private'. This hides the majority of your content, if someone stumbles onto your page.. 2) Perform option #1 and then select the first "Display Me As" option on the Settings page. Now your profile doesn't link to your 360 page. Also, UNcheck the "Activate Simple URL" setting and the "Friend Search" setting. This way people cannot guess your 360 page by sticking your yahoo id onto the end of 360.yahoo.com or searching for you by name or email address.. 3) Perform options #1 and #2 and then delete your friends by selecting the "My Friends" link in the upper right of your 360 page. Select "Edit Settings" on a friend's name, then select "Remove <friend> from your Friends Page". Finally, delete all of your content, blogs, links to pictures, lists, reviews, etc. This pretty much makes your 360 inaccessible and/or unusable by anyone who happens to get there.

Many shoe stores do not even know what these are.  They are just a thin strip that you put in your footware above your heel (where the dent is) to stop your heel from slipping.

If you're using internet explorer go to . Tools->Internet Options. And under the "general" tab the first box is for homepage. Simply change http://www.yahoo.com to another address and click ok. . Using Firefox. Again go to. Tools ->Options. And it's the second box under the "main" tab. Simply substitute a new address.. . Those are the only two browsers I've used, but I'd imagine it'd be similar in others as well.i think you go to the web site that you want as your home page and there should be an option that lets you make it your home pagego to Tools/Internet Options in your Internet Explorer (menu on top left of your screen) and in the Home Page box write the address of the page you want to be the first to open when you open Explorer and click OKIf you are using internet explorer:. Then, click on "Internet Options" from the drop-down menu that appears. There will be a field for your home page in Internet Options. Delete http/www.yahoo.com or whatever it says, then type in the new address that you are going to use as your homepage.In your Internet Explorer menu, click Tools>Internet Options.  On the General Tab, there is a section for your home page.  Enter another URL (web address) in that section in place of the yahoo URL.  Once you have put in a correct URL for the page you want as your home page, click OK. Nothing happens and you don't recieve any prize when recieving points. They're just there to let others, and yourself, know what kind of progress you are making. Everyone wants to see if you're good at answering questions or not.The points are mostly just an incentive for people to start answering questions, and also to vote on other answers, and finally, to rate other people's answers.. . Other than that, the points don't do anything. You do get some extra 'attention' at higher levels, but that may or may not be a good thing. There are no secret special prizes, at least none that any of us at Level 7 have heard of.. . Mostly, just enjoy the site, ask and answer questions. If you like, keep track of your points as you move up in levels. After awhile, you'll be more interested in responding to people's questions with quality answers.. . Here's the link where you can see what the different levels are and how to earn points. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. . When you open your yahoo acct. at the top of the page under your name it says "MY ACCOUNT" click this; this will pull up your acct page where you can fill in only the info you want shared with others.  On the right hand side there will be under "Public Information" a choice to "Edit/Create Profile" that is the option you want. Now go in and have some fun.  You will be able to add a photo of you or something you like; put links in to some of your favorite webpages; whatever.  Its a simple fill in the blank type of form.Yahoo! offers the ability to make profiles through Yahoo! Member Directory or Yahoo! 360.  . . For Yahoo! Member Directory:. . -Go to 'http://members.yahoo.com and sign in. -Click on 'View My Profiles'. -Click on 'Create New Public' profile. -Complete profile form and click 'Create'. -If creating more than one, on the 'View My Profiles' page, make sure to set the default profile that others will see. . For Yahoo! 360, just go to http://360.yahoo.com. . To set your 360 as your default profile:. . - Go to http://360.yahoo.com/. - Click on "Settings" in the upper right of the page.. - Scroll down to the "Yahoo! Display Identity" section.. - Select either the second or third "Display me as" option.. - Save your new settings.. . Then everyone should go straight to your 360 page. Be sure to mark as private or friends only anything that you don't want everyone to see. . . When your 360 page is your profile, then your old profiles won't be accessible at all.. . If you do want to use your old profiles:. - Go to http://360.yahoo.com/. - Click on "Settings" at the top of the page. - Scroll down to the Yahoo! Identity Display section. - For each Yahoo! ID, choose the first "Display me as" option. - Save your changes. . Then they should revert back to your old profile so they can be edited. However, there's really no need to do this if you're going to make 360 your profile for those usernames again.Go into options. But if you have a yahoo account, you basically have one.Which profile do you mean? Do you want a 360 one? Here is the  link to get one of those below.. . http://360.yahoo.com/. . Here is the link to get a yahoo account below. http://www.yahoo.com/. . Just hit the sign up button, and then you can start to create one. I hope this helps!
Create another Yahoo ID and answer your limit on that one if you're that addicted to answering questions already.  Or just have fun asking (using up your points) and  rating best answers or voting for best answers.LOL ah ha i can. that happened to me the other day i was really pissed off so i made another email address. i found away to beat the ManS#%T HAPPENSHaving limits at the lower levels, and even the higher levels, helps to limit abuse. It also gives people a little time to learn the proper way to interact on the site. You can see that some people waste all of their answers with comments like "thanks for 2 pts" or "UR Stoopid" or "idk". If everyone could ask and answer more questions at the lower levels, then this junk would just overrun the system. . . That's why you earn more responsibility as you move up in points. The thought is that once you start contributing to the site on a consistent basis and have taken the time to move up in levels, then you are given more responsibility in the form of being able to ask and answer more questions. . . Once you get to level 5, then you've probably spent a lot of time on the site and know how to behave, so you have earned the right to answer an unlimited amount of questions.. . Also, there are probably some well-meaning people that just don't quite 'get it' during their early days on the site. They could unknowingly rack up enough violation notices for unintentionally bad behavior that their account would get suspended. The limit on points also reduces this likelihood.. . So, if you're done with your quota of answers for the day, then spend some time voting for some best answers on the questions that are unresolved, then spend some time rating best answers (thumbs up or down) on questions that are already resolved. If you answer AND vote AND rate as much as you're allowed everyday, then you'll make it to the next level more quickly and be able to answer more questions per day.Oh I remember that happening,we have all been there.:)level 1's can only answer 20 a dayjust wait til tomorrow.Why don't you have a DNA test done?. . my yahoo email has been messing up all week i think its this new page they are doing i keep having to refresh mine about 10 times before it will work and sometimes i have to restart my computer. you can send error reports to yahoo there should be an option for it in you mail box. good luck!You did not state what the displayed error is, so I can only guess. However, browser-based applications -- such as Y! Mail -- rely on browsers to display and utilize their functions. Thus, look first to the browser for basic trouble-shooting. For example, try any or all of the ideas below, making sure to try your email again after each attempt.. . - Check your pop-up blocker (or blockers, if you have multiple) to see if any of them are preventing your composition box from displaying.. - Check your browser's security settings to see if somehow the Y! site was blocked or partially blocked.. - Restart the PC. - Delete your browser's cookies and clear its cache.. - Think about whether you installed any software just prior to when you experienced the functionality loss, including but not limited to... -- browser security updates. -- new chat software. -- new games. -- new business applications. -- downloaded shareware. . Once you have given this a good go-through, if you still have problems, the problem may reside on Yahoo!'s side.  At that point, check the discussion groups to see if anyone else is experiencing the same problem.  And, remember to post exactly what the error is, to give folks a decent chance at answering.. . :)
p / pay. e / every . p / penny . si/ to IsraelYour right what is the meaning of Pepsi, it tastes like dirt.The meaning of Pepsi is the sensation it invokes inside of you. For most people it is a cool, refreshing, tingling sensation. That's what Pepsi means to many - refreshment.Bradham coined the name Pepsi from the condition dyspepsia (stomachache or indigestion). It was made of carbonated water, sugar, vanilla, rare oils, and kola nuts. Whether the original recipe included the enzyme pepsin is disputed.If you asking about PEPSI-COLA:. Pepsi-Cola was first made in  North Carolina, Un.States in 1890 by the pharmacist Caleb Bradham. In 1898 , "Brad's drink" was renamed "Pepsi-Cola" . As Pepsi was made  to cure stomach pains, Bradham coined the name Pepsi from the condition dyspepsia (stomachache or indigestion)!!!!!!!!!!!!whats the meaning of marketing?God's gift to soda lovers everywhere!!!

If your question is not understandable people will have a difficult time giving you quality answers. Also, add details to your question to give as much information as you can. This will tailor the answers to your specific query. Finally, placement is key. If you have a question about FIFA World Cup soccer it would not be wise to place it in the Pets category. Proper placement of a question insures prominence with people who are knowledgeable about that subject. Hope this helps!. Follow this path. Go to ur email page> options> Block address > list of blocked addresses> find the address which u want to unblock> select that> remove> save. It will solve ur problem.Go to the OPTIONS setting & click , find BLOCKED ADDRESSES & click , hilight & delite the name you want !!!When you look at the mail message, you can see the options. There is one choice wich is "Not Spam". Click that, and I think that it'll know that is isn't spam anymore.They have more than likely been added to your Blocked Addresses List.  To unblock them and to stop receiving all unwanted email, do the following:. . Log into your Email, go to Options (upper right hand side). Go through all your settings and don't forget to save them too. . . Under Spam Protection, make sure your Spam Guard is turned ON. Option to immediately delete all Spam messages. This will force all new email to redirect to your Inbox. Option to Block messages that you mark as Spam. If you plan on keeping your . Bulk folder, also option messages you mark as Not-Spam to be moved to your Inbox. Always Option to Block all Images until you can look them over first. This prevents spammers from knowing you opened their email. Save Changes. . . Under Blocked Addresses, type in spammer.com, this will stop all Spam that has been reported to Yahoo from ever entering your email. I recommend you remove everything on your list first. This will give you a fresh start after you type in the "spammer.com". . . Under General Preferences, Folders/Search Results, Special Folders, option to redirect incoming unsolicited email to the Bulk Folder. Save. . . If you get email from someone you don't know, NEVER open it (it may contain viruses) and report it as SPAM. This will automatically block it from your email account. When you do open an email that is Spam, you have alerted the sender that your account is Active. . . This should slow down the Junk Mail considerably. I only get maybe one or two Spam emails a Month. . . Good Luck!

See the three links below for your info. I found this information by doing a simple search of the Y! Answers database. You did not need to waste your points.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear pages you have visited on Internet Explorer address bar, click Tools, Internet Options, under General tab click Clear History, you can also set the number of days to keep pages in history, click Apply and then click OK. You may also want to click the Content tab and click Auto Complete and check or uncheck your Auto Complete settings to your preference.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . . To clear searches on Google toolbar, click "Google" on the left of the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Search History. To stop saving searches click options, click search tab and check or uncheck to configure your search box.click on tools (toolbar up at the top). click "internet options". click on "clear history". . That would be to clear it all.. To just clear certain things.... Open internet explorer (the e). Click on the history icon in internet explorer.  You can open it even if you've signed on with others like aol or sbc global. . right click on what you want gone, and hit delete

I suggest a fresh install of Yahoo! Messenger.  First, a fresh install will ensure you have the latest build of Yahoo! Messenger.  Also, a reinstall will write over any Messenger files that may have become corrupt and causing this My Yahoo! contact issue.  There are two versions of Yahoo! Messenger available.  Yahoo! just launched Yahoo! Messenger version 8.0, which includes plug-ins, integration of Yahoo! 360, Soundtrack, and Soundboard.  For version 8, just go to http://messenger.yahoo.com, click on the ‘Get it Now’ button, and follow the installation process.  If you are not ready for the beta, just click on the ‘Get version 7.5’ link located directly under the ‘Get it Now’ button to get the current version, version 7.5.maybe it thinks you are your own friend.  :-)

You know, for over three weeks I put a good amount of time on YA every day answering questions, rating questions, etc..., trying to fulfill my 'points addiction'...  I then came to the sudden realization that it is precisely this ridiculous competition for 'points' that have made this site as deplorable as it is.. . You have discovered early on what it took me almost a month to find:  Your own incentive for participating on YA will  provide more noble rewards for you than any pointless 'points'  could possibly do.. . You will reach level three, then level four, and so on and so on.... And, given your view of 'points' thus far,... you probably won't even know it when you do...;-)My incentive was to be able to answer more questions! :-). The points are well, as you say, ultimately pointless, but they do help you to earn more responsibility on the site.. . 600 points isn't too far away ... at Level 2 you can,. . -Vote for 40 best answers per day. -Rate 40 best answers per day. -Answer 40 questions per day. . That's 160 points per day that you can control.  If you answer/rate/vote your limit each day, then you can be at Level 3 in less than 4 days!bragging rights and knowing you are helping some people :)Its not really,but if you give good answers you can be getting points from people rating them while your not even on,  You hit a point where it starts to snowball up.Doesn't mean very much except the higher level you are, the more you can post in a day.  That isn't always a good thing.  I spend too much time on this.is really not important it just feels goodnot reallY, But I am competitiveI don't know, but I must do it.Yea she is pretty I saw her first.your pretty.I believe most of the contributors are correct.  To be able to ask requires you to answer.  It creates a responsive, cooperative community.  There are concerns.  One of which is, with some answers the point IS the point. And because of this, the asker can't get a decent answer when they need one.  I agree with you, some of the comments are a blast.  Some are inventive, creative.  And some . . . . hit the nail on the head so hard it hurts.    I have been guilty of not answering the question, but in most cases, it has been to express my amazement with the response.  I have since learned that I can use comments for that purpose, which by the way can earn points. Then you also receive points for best answer.  You can add those to the list an earlier person posted.  So receiving 600 points could take even less time to accumulate.  Not all people think the same, which is good. Medium Text is normal so try that first and see  if you like that.If you are talking about the font size on the screen, you can adjust that by holding down the "Ctrl" key and dialing the wheel on your mouse. you put it on a hoist in gear (engine OFF!), then turn the rear wheel. count the rotations of the drive shaft for one full turn of the wheel. that number, for example, 9 turns of the drive shaft for one turn of the wheel, gives you the ratio of the gears in the rear end, 9:1.Like they said earlier - buy the $15 manual - and the ID plate is located on the rear end. You can also run the numbers on the engine.I think you you should go to an auto body shop and ask someone about it!There should be a ID plate welding to the casing, giving you the model and ratio of the assemblyyou didnt ask for a gear ratio did you? and why go to a body shop?  You can get a haynes manual for your truck at the parts store for about $12 or look on ebay. It will list what options your truck will have  and how to identify you rear end. Unfortunately, you cannot delete a Yahoo! 360 account. It's linked to your primary Yahoo! ID.  If you want to keep your Yahoo! ID for things like Mail, IM, Answers, etc. then you'll need to hide your 360.. . There are a few different ways to do this,. . 1) Select the "Settings" option at the upper right of your 360 page and change all of you settings to 'Private'.  This hides the majority of your content, if someone stumbles onto your page.. . 2) Perform option #1 and then select the first "Display Me As" option on the Settings page. Now your profile doesn't link to your 360 page. Also, UNcheck the "Activate Simple URL" setting and the "Friend Search" setting.  This way people cannot guess your 360 page by sticking your yahoo id onto the end of 360.yahoo.com or searching for you by name or email address.. . 3) Perform options #1 and #2 and then delete your friends by selecting the "My Friends" link in the upper right of your 360 page. Select "Edit Settings" on a friend's name, then select "Remove <friend> from your Friends Page".   Finally, delete all of your content, blogs, links to pictures, lists, reviews, etc.  This pretty much makes your 360 inaccessible and/or unusable by anyone who happens to get there.It is not a valid option at the mean time to delete your 360 blog once you signed up to this service.. Try to remove all the information and details instead.If, however, you want to keep your Yahoo! 360 account but not have it go to 360 when you go to http://profiles.yahoo.com/____ (where the blank is your Yahoo! ID) then you should check out this other answer:. . http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=1006012511402

I don't think all people are meant to be outgoing, that's just not who they are.. . Their self esteem would be better if they realized who they are now is OK.This is a really hard question that many people would love to know the answer to, so you are not alone. I think it is different depending on your personality. You can start in the things you like to do and feel comfortable doing and work on being happy with yourself in those things. Then set new challenges for your self maybe to learn something new or try a new sport. Confidence sometimes comes from doing very well at things and being happy with the person you are. I also had trouble with this when I was younger. So, I started playing sports and challenging myself to talk to people, to go places that I would usually say no because I was too shy. Being outgoing is just branching out and showing your beautiful self to the world.let me tell you some real GOOD advice. if someone doesn't like you for who you are then they are not worth having as a friend or potential mate. you shouldn't have to change for anyone! if you want to better yourself thats perfectly fine but you don't want to try and impress some guy when in reality he is really not worth it. its ok to be shy and some people find that very attractive. there is nothing wrong with wanting to be more outgoing but do it in little steps. for example go to a mall and go up to guys and just ask what time it is. do it to several people everyday or ask for directions even if you know how to get there. by doing this you will actually become more comfortable talking to people. it might sound silly but it will work in time. ask open ended questions as well. instead of asking do you like candy? answer would be yes. ask so whats your favorite type of candy? " i like kit kats" then you could be like me 2 i really like the blah blah, well i hope this helps some what. another tip of advice would be to start to respect yourself and like yourself more. if you don't the way you look or whatever then you shouldnt be in a relationship just yet. when you start to respect yourself and care for yourself then you will have room for someone else. remember that everyone will not like you because people in general are judgemental.try to forget that and brush it off. if you don't think highly of yourself then who will? certainly not your next potential mate. take care and good luck!Start believing in your self; by starting with little things. for example: think to your self i'm worth while, or i can do this.. . Try new things, like fishing, or standing up for what you believe in, no matter if your alone.. . Talk to your friends if you need help with something, even if you think is stupid. If they are your true friends they will help, not laugh.. . Hope this helps..It just takes practice.  Start by getting around a few friends you feel comfortable with and be outgoing with them.  They will help to be your support group.. . The best thing you can do is to build your self-esteem.  You need to believe that you're a good person and that nobody else's opinion matters.  Create your own identity that you're proud of.. . Read books these books: . * Psycho Cybernetics. * How to win friends and influence people. . Psycho Cybernetics is not to be confused with Dianetics or Scientology.  It's a great book that teaches you how to change yourself, the way you think, and to overcome challenges.  It helped me a great deal!

pull up ur messenger and right click ( i know u already did that) but all the way at the bottom of it is the delete option. Or highlight persons name and go to contacts (on messenger) and click delete that way.Find the person's name/ID in your messenger list, right click, then hit delete (at the bottom of the list).   If you don't see delete, you can left click on the person's name/ID in your list, click on Contacts at the very top, then click on delete.  A gray box will appear asking if you're sure.  You probably want to check the "delete from address book, too" box.  Then hit yes.  Then go to your Ignore list and add his ID there.

It might have something to do with the "toast" window that comes up in the bottom right corner of the screen. You can turn this off in Preferences, Alerts & Sounds. in the Messenger menu.I suggest a fresh install of Yahoo! Messenger.  First, a fresh install will ensure you have the latest build of Yahoo! Messenger.  Also, a reinstall will write over any Messenger files that may have become corrupt and causing this screen flash issue.  Just go to http://messenger.yahoo.com, click on the 'Get it Now' button, and follow the installation process.. . You can turn off the feature in preferences as a workaround to prevent the flashing.  However, if you prefer these alerts, try the reinstall.to tell you you got an email or im
You can change your email address by editing your address and adding another. You can't hide it, however. It's not a feature.As stated in the above response, only the Owners and Moderators can view the entire email addresses. . . And there is a Management Tool that allows addresses to be hidden, but the Group Owner/and selected managers are the only ones who can make that change. . . However, most do not use this feature because Members who do decide to hide their address will not be able to use the Polls features and are not able to post messages via email. And, once the Owner has selected this option, they may not change it later.The full address shows when it is your own email address.  The other members only see the truncated address for your address, but they see their own address spelled out in full.Watch "hallowman" the investiable man.

Answers, as you can see that those affected by the login issue were able to come on here and ask questions, many Yahoo! sites/products were affected.  However, because I have premium (paid) Yahoo! services (i.e. Yahoo! Voice, Yahoo! Mail Plus), I was able to chat online (and call) the Yahoo! support team and just learned the problem is now solved.  We can now all login to Yahoo! websites and Yahoo! Messenger.hi there.  here's an easy way to figure out the problem:. . 1) login via the web messenger: http://messenger.yahoo.com/webmsgr/fmsgr.php. . 2) if that works, your account is fine, and it's a temporary solution when you can't log in.  . . 3) if you don't use voice, and don't plan to, you can go back to the old one here: http://www.download.com/Yahoo-Messenger/3000-2150_4-10429465.html. . 4) if you can't login via the web messenger, then something's wrong with your account and you should contact customer care.. . good luck!. . hope this helps.  if so, please resolve your question and vote for a best answer...that way it helps us answerers from duplicating efforts.  thank you!even i am not able to login to messenger. i thinkl there r some problems from yahoo side/.

When you registered for a Yahoo! ID, you were asked for your date of birth (DOB).  Therefore, if you change your profile age to show 18 or above, that will not change your registration information.  Your profile is just the information you want to show to others that view it.It goes by your birthday from when you signed up, not by your profile age.  You can't change your birthday because well, it normally doesn't change...it uses your date of birth

To answer your question. You need to go to the options tab, then the signature section. Then use the tab that switches the signature format over to html. you will know because you will seee << >>br  all over the place. Now you have to take your logo and host the image somewhere. What this means is go to a website like photobucket.com or vidilife.com. sign up, its free and they don't spam. upload your logo and then choose, "get code" this will give you the needed code to display the image at the bottom of all of your emails in your signature. copy and paste this code into the signature section of Yahoo and then play with the size a little by sending it to yourself and then checking out what it looks like.You must enable HTML format, and create stationary. If the recipient is reading it in plain text, it will be a jumbled mess and the image will not show.
To work your way up to the 7th levelIt is to make you ask questions, or give answers!  I'm in Level 3 working toward Level 4.  It's just something to do! I wondered the same thing my self!The points make to you more answers,questions,voting and rating questions and answers, depends on level you have, go to this link from Yahoo Answers to know all about limits and systems in this site:. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. Level 1 from 1 - 249 points. You need 250 - 999 points to get to level 2. You need 1,000 - 2,499 points to get to level 3. You need 2,500 - 4,999 points to get to level 4. You need 5,000 - 9,999 points to get to level 5. You need 10,000 - 24,999 points to get to level 6. You need 25000+ points to get to level 7. . =============. At level 1 You can ask 5 questions and answer 20 question and vote, rate 20.. At level 2 You can ask 10 questions and answer 40 question and vote, rate 40.. At level 3 You can ask 15 questions and answer 60 question and vote, rate 60.. At level 4 You can ask 20 questions and answer 80 question and vote, rate 80.. At level 5,6,7 You can ask and answer unlimited of questions and vote, rate 100.. -----------------------. Points Table:. - Answer a question give you 2 points. - Ask a question reduce from you 5 points. - If you answer picked as best answer get 10 points. - Choose an best answer from your question get 3 points.. - Rate answer 1 point. - Vote answer 1 point. - If your answer in violation reduce from you 2 points. - Deleting an answer Reduce 2 points. - Receive a "thumbs-up" rating on a best answer that you wrote 1 point.. ============. Please follow this path to delete the search bar history. Tools > internet options> content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history in the search bar uncheck the box of forms. It will solve ur problem.i know exactly what you mean. that drives me nuts and i've always wondered how to erase them. sorry i don't have an answer for you. good luck. =DThis works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . . To clear searches on Google toolbar, click "Google" on the left of the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Search History. To stop saving searches click options, click search tab and check or uncheck to configure your search box.I dunno if this works, but u could try it... In ur Internet Explorer taskbar, click on Tools, then Internet Options, & there, click on clear History.Some of this stuff you will have to do regularly but This is what I do..If you have Internet Explorer as your browser. . Click Tools at the top of your screen,a menu will drop down,click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history.also under "general" click "delete cookies" and "delete files" them "clear history" put days at "0" then click on "settings" click "view files" click on top of page "edit" then click on "select all" then click on file click on "delete" close window makse sure you click on "apply" and "ok". . If you just want to clear the searches on Yahoo Home Page or any other Yahoo page,double click the search box,this will make a menu drop down with your searches,put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it,hit the delete button on your keyboard.If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar,click the pencil icon beside the search box,a menu will drop down,click Clear Recent Searches.If you want to stop saving recent searches,click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History",or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . To clear your history from Mozilla Firefox:. 1. Go to the "Tools" menu. 2. Select "Options" > "Privacy" > "History." 3. Click on "Clear." To completely disable the history function, set "Remember visited pages for the last X days" to zero ("0"). 4. Click "OK" to exit. . or Firebox * Either press Ctrl+Shift+Del or Click Tools=>Clear Private Data.. * To pemanently stop saving data that you entered in search and form fields :. Goto to Tools=>options=>Privacy=>Saved... uncheck the "Save Information As I enter in Form and Search Fields". your search or form entries will not appear anymore.. . Google Toolbar :To clear your search history from the drop-down text box on the Google Toolbar:1. Click on the 'Google' logo to access the drop-down menu.. 2. Select the 'Clear Search History' option. This will clear all the previous searches from the drop-down box.. All you recent searches on the toolbar will be cleared. . To delete the search tool in the start menu, Go to Start >> Run >> Type in REGEDIT. . Navigate to the HKEY_CURRENT_USER &#92; Software &#92; Microsoft&#92;Search Assitant&#92;ACMru. . Your actual search list is kept there. Delete the actual text used for your searches, nothing else

Does it make it so you can't use the features in any way, or is just an annoying message?If you are connected to the Internet (as it appears because you can login to Yahoo! Answers) but you cannot access Yahoo! Messenger, review the help page titled "Why can't I connect with Yahoo! Messenger?" located at http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/messenger/messenger75/messenger/messenger-11.html.  Just review the suggestions/instructions from that page.  If the problem continues after following the instructions on that page, click on the 'Contact Customer Care' button located at the bottom of the help page, fill out the form that loads, and click 'Send' to escalate this issue to the Yahoo! Messenger customer care team.

Yahoo! does not offer the way to 'change' your actual user ID. However, you can change the display name to be a nick name. Just go to the 'Messenger' drop down field, select 'My Contact Details', enter the desired name in the 'Nick Name' field, and click 'Save and Close.'I don't think you can because i triedYou go into your account settings and change it there. Let me correct Lollipoppett:. . A free Yahoo! Mail account will get deactivated for inactivity/dormancy after 4 months of disuse.  If you are signing into Yahoo! sites but NOT Mail, this clock will continue to run until 4 months.  After 4 months, it gets deleted and you will need to reactivate it.  Any mail lost cannot be recovered.. . If you are certain you have been actively checking your mail, verify that you haven't violated any Yahoo! Terms of Service (TOS).  Your account may be deactivated at any time if you violate TOS.  I won't go into detail on this, because you know if you have been doing bad things or not.. . The important thing is, if you are certain you have been using your account and you haven't violated the TOS, contact Yahoo! Customer Care to investigate for a possible bug.. . Good luck!Normally that only happens if the account has been inactive for more than 90 days.. . I'd set up a new account contact your customers and go into that account every day to check. If you haven't signed into the account for more than 90 days yahpoo in their wisdom deactivate it.

In order for your contacts to see an 'away message', you will have to set your status accordingly.  Just go to the 'Messenger' drop down field, select 'My Status' and select the status you want showed to your contacts when they instant message you.  Note that this will only show up when you are onlline and this status is set.  This will not appear to your contacts if you are offline.dont think there is one

Please follow this path. Tools > internet options > content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history, please uncheck the box of form. U will get ur problem solved.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . . To clear searches on Google toolbar, click "Google" on the left of the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Search History. To stop saving searches click options, click search tab and check or uncheck to configure your search box.. . To clear pages you have visited on Internet Explorer address bar, click Tools, Internet Options, under General tab click Clear History, you can also set the number of days to keep pages in history, click Apply and then click OK. You may also want to click the Content tab and click Auto Complete and check or uncheck your Auto Complete settings to your preference.Has someone been naughty?on internet explorer,. . Tools --> Internet Options . Then delete cookies and clear history.  apply -->OK

Yahoo! Messenger does not offer the ability to send an instant message from Yahoo! Mail.  The only option for sending an instant message other than downloading Yahoo! Messenger is to use Web Messenger.  From the Messenger homepage, http://messenger.yahoo.com, scroll down to the bottom of the paeg, and click on the 'Launch Web Messenger' link.I don't know about other emails, but I am using G-mail (Google mail) and if you don't have an account there, get it now, it's the right time for you to enjoy the great preferences, fast and reliable Internet electronic mailing!!! ;) Good luck!I don't think you can

I had this same question some time ago.  The Yahoo! Messenger customer care team sent me to this help page:. . Q: How do I select/create a status message?. . A: To select a status message:. . Click the status chooser at the top of the Yahoo! Messenger and select one of the following: . Available . Busy . Stepped Out . Be Right Back . Not at My Desk . On the Phone . To create your own custom status message:. . Click the status chooser at the top of the Yahoo! Messenger and select "New Status Message." . Type your custom status message (such as "back in 5 minutes") and then click the "OK" button. . Click on the "Show Busy Icon" box if you want the busy icon displayed. . Your custom status message will appear after your Yahoo! ID. . Note: Old custom status messages will be deleted as you create new ones.when u log out it automatically erases itYou don't.. They get automatically overrided by your new status messages.

Please follow this path. Tools > internet options > content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history, please uncheck the box of form. U will get ur problem solved.See the three links below. I found this information by doing a simple search of Y! Answers that took me less than a minute. You did not need to waste your points.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear pages you have visited on Internet Explorer address bar, click Tools, Internet Options, under General tab click Clear History, you can also set the number of days to keep pages in history, click Apply and then click OK. You may also want to click the Content tab and click Auto Complete and check or uncheck your Auto Complete settings to your preference.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . . To clear searches on Google toolbar, click "Google" on the left of the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Search History. To stop saving searches click options, click search tab and check or uncheck to configure your search box.that or you could clear the internet history/cache/cookiescontrol panel...internet options....click on content tab, here you will find the place where u can turn off auto-complete, have a nice day, you owe me something, lol
Go to My accounts. Why would you need to change it anyway.Here's the information on the 'Customize Your Avatars' help page: http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/avatar/avatar-06.html. . How do I customize / edit my Yahoo! Avatar?. You can customize your avatar's appearance by changing its face, eyes, hairstyle, clothing and extras.. .     *.       Appearance.       You can customize your avatar by clicking on the "Appearance" tab on the My Avatar page. This is where you choose your avatar's face, eyes, and hairstyle.. .       Face and Eyes.       Click on "Face and Eyes" to choose the face and eye color for your avatar. Click on the color palette next to the picture to change the color of your eyes.  Once you've followed the instructions below, make sure you hit 'save.'. .       Hairstyles. .       Click on "Hairstyles" to choose the hairstyle you want. You can change your hair color by clicking on the color palette next to the hairstyle.. .     *.       Apparel. .       You can dress your avatar by picking items from the "Apparel" tab. Clicking on the item a second time will remove that item from your "What I'm trying on" list.. .       Some apparel items will cause the position of your avatar's arms and legs to change slightly, depending on the style of clothing.. .       Full Outfits. .       By clicking on a full outfit, you can dress your avatar in a coordinated outfit with one click. A full outfit will replace any top and bottom previously worn by your avatar.. .       Tops. .       By clicking on a top, you can dress the upper half of your avatar.. .       Bottoms. .       By clicking on a bottom, you can dress the lower half of your avatar.. .       If you previously picked a full outfit, choosing a new top or bottom will deselect the full outfit and show the new top or bottom with the bottom or top previously saved before you picked a full outfit.. .     *.       Extras and Backgrounds. .       You can further customize your avatar by choosing extras such as accessories, hats, sports items, pets, and backgrounds.. .       To add these extras, click on the link for the appropriate item in the "Extras" tab. To add an extra to the avatar, click on the item. To remove an extra, click on the item a second time or uncheck the item's checkbox in the "What I'm trying on" list.. .       Once you have customized your avatar, you must save the changes.go to MY ACCOUNTS. by the use of feed u can directy share information of yr other blog or yahoo answer or another web to  yahoo 360. for other information chat with me. i cant give u full info hear. bye. take careIf you've seen orange RSS or XML buttons on websites, those are for feeds. We'll use your Yahoo! Answers feed as an example. There is a small link in the bottom right of your Q&A page that says RSS. Here's the link: http://answers.yahoo.com/rss/userq?kid=c8d0c701fc1d8a650e26bed8f3798fc1aa. . Paste it into your Yahoo! 360 page where it asks you to. After your page is updated, it should display the name of the feed (Questions from you) and a list of items (well, this question). If you asked another question, then the next time it updated your second question would start showing on Yahoo! 360 as well.. . Usually, the feeds on 360 are for users who have blogs on other websites. They can just use the RSS feeds from those sites to display the links to the blog entries on their 360 page. Here's my 360 page as another example. I have a couple of other feeds listed so you can see what they look like.. http://360.yahoo.com/chavezjrfan. . I hope this helps.

go to download.com  search for a program called no ads.  Download, and Install it.  When you get a pop up, open the program. there will be 2 boxes.  The top box will have the address where the popup is from.  Next, under the top box, it will have a button that says add.  Select the site in the top box by clicking on it one time, click add.  It will then appear in the bottom box.  The bottom box holds all of the pop ups that you add to it.  It takes a little bit to take advantage of the program.  So whenever you get a pop up, leave it on the screen, open the No Ads program, click the link in the top box, click add, and the pop up will disappear.  If the same pop up tries to come up, the No ads program will automatically kill it.  The No Ads program runs in the background.what kind of pop up blocker you got ???depends on pop up blocker you have.

Go to control panel, then sound, then alerts and change it from there...Messenger > Preferences > Alerts & Sounds. . You can use the Browse button to select any .wav file anywhere on your PC (by default it shows those supplied by Yahoo, but you could, for example, create your own of the mailman putting up the flag on your mailbox or of letters dropping through your door!)

You can't set Yahoo account in Outlook because Yahoo not offer POP3 Mail service at free Yahoo accounts... . You have to use Internet Explorer...I'm assuming you are already subscribed to Yahoo! Mail Plus.  If not, you will need to do so.  POP access is not available for free Yahoo! Mail accounts (except Canada).. . Here's where you can sign up for $19.99 a year.  It's worth it.. .    http://mailplus.mail.yahoo.com. . The settings are as follows:. .    POP server:  pop.mail.yahoo.com.    PORT:  110.    SMTP server:  smtp.mail.yahoo.com.    PORT:  25 or 587. .    ACCOUNT/LOGIN:  your Yahoo! ID.    PASSWORD:  your case sensitive password. . You will need to enable SMTP authentication in order to send outgoing messages!  Each POP mail client has a slightly different term for this, but basically it's the same thing.  The mail client submits your login and password in base64 encoded clear text.  Without this, you will NOT be able to send emails via SMTP.. . VERY IMPORTANT NOTE:  Mail Plus is only available to U.S. customers with a .com account.  If you are from outside the U.S. but have a .com account, you can still use it as long as your preferred content setting in "My Account" shows "Yahoo! U.S." (or "United States - English" or "English - U.S." depending on what you currently have configured for your language setting).Open up to mail main page- go into options (top right)then pop access and forwarding. Just follow the instructionsyes ... use "Tools" in the main menu of Outlook Express then go to "Accounts", after that ADD your Yahoo account info.. . Good LuckI dont think its possible, dude.You need to have a POP or IMAP mail server in-order to configure it in Outlook. Yahoo don't offer pop or imap access in the free edition, you need to purchase the Yahoo! Mail Plus if you need POP access. It will cost you $35 per year.

The reason would be to induce us to answer and not just ask.  You get two points for every question you answer and 10 points if your answer is chosen as best answer.  Since you start out with 100 points, you must do some answering (and/or voting) or after you ask 20 questions (which cost you 5 points each) you would no longer be able to ask questions. when you start typing an email, it starts out in drafts.. if its not saved on your email application then it maybe on the server for some time then it delete's itselfDepending on the email provider, letters that are not saved to your local hard drive are automatically deleted after a determined amount of time.  This conserves space on their servers.  If your document isn't visible anymore I'd say they zapped it.. . Items placed in the trash folder are either deleted immediately when you end the session or within a short span of time... like a couple of weeks.in saved messages

The problem you are experiencing is a known issue with the Launchcast plugin. I believe it will be fixed and released soon.. . In the meantime, you can get around the problem by setting your skin to the Classic skin. You can do this from Messenger->Change SkinI've found that closing the Yahoo! Music plug-in, then re-opening fixes it. Click the arrow in the right corner of the plug-in, then click "Close". Now click the big "Plug Ins" button, click the "My Plug-ins" tab, find Yahoo! Music in the list, and click "Start".

That made my day!Not a damn thingTheir credits you earn by answering and spend by askiong a question.The points are mostly just an incentive for people to start answering questions, and also to vote on other answers, and finally, to rate other people's answers.  As you increase your points and levels you are able to perform more of the standard activity - ask, answer, rate, vote and comment.. . Other than that, the points don't do anything. You do get some extra 'attention' at higher levels, but that may or may not be a good thing. There are no secret special prizes, at least none that any of us at Level 7 have heard of.. . Mostly, just enjoy the site, ask and answer questions. If you like, keep track of your points as you move up in levels. After awhile, you'll be more interested in responding to people's questions with quality answers.. . Here's the link where you can see what the different levels are and how to earn points. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. . I think it is to keep people from flooding the system with pointless or duplicate questions. It's not like it means anything in real life.I think they deduct points when you ask a question so that you would ask a question only if it's worth it, or a good question. It makes you think about your question more.. . If they gave you points for asking questions, people would ask stupid questions all the time (and some do anyway!) just to get points.. . I think they also want to make sure that you answer someone else's questions in order to get points, and that makes you participate more actively in the community. . . They do give you points for choosing a best answer though, so it sort of makes up for it.The idea was that in order to ask questions, you had to build up points by answering questions asked by others.  They start you off with enough points to ask 20 questions, but if you want to ask more, you have to start giving back to the Yahoo Answers community by answering others' questions.

when a user hit submit, and the question appears for users, there would be a chance that another 10-20 users reading it at the same time. So if you hit the submit button for your answer, there would be a great chance that another 3-5 users has submitted 1 or 2 seconds before you. that is why you see the new 6 answers once you post yours.yea dats true. idk why it does that.This has always happened at times. There are people constantly answering the newest questions so they're likely to be answering at the same time that you are. Theirs just get submitted barely before yours does so they only show up after you answered.

if you have a Yahoo! e-mail address, when you check your e-mail, click on options (which should be on the top right of the page), then go to block addresses and enter in the addresses you want to block. Depending on the source, you can block an entire domain. You should also be able to mark the unwanted mail as SPAM and the message should be deleted, and the address of the sender automatically blocked.use your filter or block the email and tht will block thm in future. (depends what server etc your using)yup, TOOLS, Options...use the BLOCK SENDER option, or CREATE RULE FROM THIS MESSAGE...with this you can specify which words in the subject line will cause the mail to be deleted before it even arrives in you mail box.....usual words to highlight are like viagra, Free, penis enlargement, drugs, loans...all the usual spam bollox,You could block a certain e-mail address at the "Options" and "Block Addresses" then add the e-mail address(es) that you want to block. Hope that helps...If its yahoo, copy the email address by selecting it and pressing control c, go to options, click on block email addresses and paste the address in to it, and yahoo will block it from then on.

As far as I'm aware, the Mail Beta blocks anything in an email message which sends a request to an outside server, that is, something that is not already on the email, like linked images until you give it permission to load them. In this way, there is little way for spammers to know if their spam reached your inbox, as many use what are known as web beacons, content that a message loads which lets the sender know the message was opened by seeing if it was opened on the server.disable the reading pane so whenever you select something, thats all thats happening.  I personally dont care about it because everything goes in my bulkmail then I have it to automatically delete everything older than a month.

Open ur address book. check the box of the email u want to delete, click delete, yahoo will ask for confirmation, confirm it and the email ID will be deleted.right click on that address, delete will be on there. click it and it will be deletedyahoo, u can deleat easilyIf you are using the Yahoo! Mail Beta, then simply select the contact from the list by clicking on it (or shift + click to select multiple contacts) and then click on the delete button on the top left hand portion of the page (it has a garbage can icon on it.). . If you are using the classic Yahoo! Mail product, then click on the checkbox next to the contact(s) to be deleted, and click the delete button on the top left portion of the page.

People tend to ask the same questions and never find the answer, or know how to find what they are looking for on the Internet since it is so vast. To find something, one must be extremely specific and know what they are looking for, or they'll end up going to plenty of pages filled with adware. Yahoo probably saw this trend and decided to try and make itself more popular by creating Yahoo Answers so that more people would use it, and by word of mouth, spread this around while helping out people at the same time. From personal experience, I was clueless on helping my friend with her problem and couldn't find anything on the web that would help except pages upon pages that require memberships, but when I asked the question here, I got answers I were looking for.Someone thought of it, presented to the Yahoo leadership, it was approved and instituted. That usually the way it works in business.someone got really boared one day.... lolYahoo Users Ask alot of questions so hence they had to make "Yahoo Answers" for the person who got a question

Make sure that the smileys are turned on:. At the top of the messenger screen, click Messenger, then Preferences.  In the left-hand column of the preferences box, click Messages.  In the "miscellaneous" section, there is a check-box to enable them.Click Messenger > Preferences > Messages > Enable emoticons. . Hope that helps, have a nice day.
From the Yahoo Mail screen, click on Options, then under Management, click on General Preferences. Scroll down until you see Message Actions, there is an AutoComplete section there. Make sure that "Use Address AutoComplete (default)" is selected. If it is selected already, choose the other one, save, then reselect Use Address AutoComplete (default) and save again.Tools>Internet Options> Content tab> Auto Complete section and click Settings button> Check boxes for Auto Complete in the area you want.It is to make your composing go a little quicker. It will come up with suggestions. It uses the nickname and the actual address.

Your using a computer....ask it!! ^_^ lolAerial roots are roots that are formed in and exposed to air. They are found in diverse plant species, including epiphytes also known as air plants, which includes the orchids, tropical coastal swamp trees such as mangroves and the resourceful banyan tree, and vines like irritating poison ivy.. . Please follow this path. Tools > internet options> content> auto complete> clear forms. To stop the generation of history in the search bar, uncheck the box of forms. U can solve ur problem this way.Internet Explorer. Go to tools>Internet options. Delete cookies, delete files, delete history, set delete history to 1 day. Click the content tab, and go to AutoComplete option, then select clear forms.. . Yahoo. Click the pencil and click clear history. Click the pencil again and click toolbar options. Uncheck remember recent searches and check IE clears history on close. If you don't have these options download the latest Yahoo toolbar or delete it by clicking start->settings->control panel-> add/remove programs.. . Firefox. Go to tools>options>privacy. Delete cache and cookies. It's also under "clear private data" in newer versions with the quick key (ctrl+shift+delete).. Google. Click the google button and click clear searches. Click the google button again and go to options, then click the search tab.. The blog entries stay in order by date as you post them.  Unless you delete and re-post every time you add another entry it will not stay at the topThere's no way to do this, but highlighting the entry as mentioned above is a good idea. You may also want to consider putting the link in your blast, which will always display at the top of the page.Unfortunately you can’t.  The blog preview on your “Top Page” and the first blog on your “Blog” page is always your latest entry.  . . If you don’t use the “highlighted posts” feature, I’d suggest highlighting those posts that you want attention draw to.. . Just in case you don't know how:  go to edit a blog entry, below the entry you'll see "show options".  click on "highlight this blog entry".

By the time you realize that the points really don't matter that much, you're hooked.well in my opinion there are some real folks out there that are looking for some help & to seek some kind of advice from others & theres some fakes out there are just looking for points with dumb answers simple as that.To be the one with the most points.your mother is a pointnothing. haha. but its fun why do u think i answerd this question. for u or for the points??????????The points are mostly just an incentive for people to start answering questions, and also to vote on other answers, and finally, to rate other people's answers.  As you increase your points and levels you are able to perform more of the standard activity - ask, answer, rate, vote and comment.. . Other than that, the points don't do anything. You do get some extra 'attention' at higher levels, but that may or may not be a good thing. There are no secret special prizes, at least none that any of us at Level 7 have heard of.. . Mostly, just enjoy the site, ask and answer questions. If you like, keep track of your points as you move up in levels. After awhile, you'll be more interested in responding to people's questions with quality answers.. . Here's the link where you can see what the different levels are and how to earn points. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. . Change the preferences on your yahoo messenger to not log in upon start up.  To do this, sign in to yahoo messenger, click Messenger, Preferences, then General.  At the top of this page, it says, "When I start up my computer:"  Uncheck this box and it will no longer automatically sign you in when you turn on your computer.when it does that log off from the toolbar and it should show your screen name and your password. below that it should show 3 boxes. one says remember me. the other says log in as invisible and the other should say log in automaticly. click the checks out of all of them then back on.

You only get to have a max of 5.you can find a copy of your status message in your registry. but to play with your registry is a serious matter. so dont try to mess it up and always make a backup copy before doing anything else.. . go to start&#92;run. . then type "regedit". . then search for the key below:. . HKEY_CURRENT_USER&#92;Software&#92;Yahoo&#92;Pager&#92;Profiles&#92;" your yahoo id%"&#92;Custom Msgs&#92;. . on the right panel, you will see all the custom messages you made. select the one you want to remove and right click to modify. then erase the text only, or replace it with anything you want.. . after that, exit regedit. . again, you have been warned. DON'T PLAY WITH YOUR REGISTRY!!!If the status message you want to delete is the last one you just made, all you should have to do is go to *new status message* create a new one and it will overwrite the previous one

Questions that are in "Resolved" or "In Voting" status cannot be deleted (except by the Answers team).  They become part of the permanent database of questions and answers.. . Askers can delete their questions that are still open.. . Answerers can delete their answers on questions that are still open.no.

"how do I make my penis longer?" "does size really matter?" "i'm a nice guy, why don't girls like me?" "i'm ugly but i'm nice, why will no one date me?" etc.  The guys that are so weak and insecure that it just makes you want to gag.. . I had to rant about those types of guys.  Sorry.  :-P. . But really, to overcome your insecurities, you just have to get over them.  It totally depends on what you're insecure about, though, how you get over it.  If you're insecure about your looks, get over it.  People like people who like themselves.  Cheesy, but true.  People don't like people who are constantly worried about how they look. Regarding the answer above, that works on your end, but the person receiving the message may see something different.  For instance, when I add a user, I update his/her contact details to show first and last name.  So when they IM me, it shows me their first and last name, not their ID.click on messenger, at the top of yahoo messenger, and then click my contact details, and put in a nickname for yourself, and click save&close.

I never did know why, but when it gets in my folder, I just delete it. To me, it's consider junk and spam.becuz ur mailing system dosnt recognize that email from that unrecognized person....open the bulk foldered email and click not spamyahoo spam guard thinks its ,  spam . if you want them to come to your n box , edit your spam setting .What is the Bulk folder?. . When SpamGuard is on, messages that trip its "spam alarm" are automatically directed to the Bulk folder - which reduces the amount of spam you receive in your Inbox.. . Messages will be removed from your Bulk folder periodically. You may choose to delete messages from your Bulk folder after 1 month, 2 weeks, 1 week, or immediately. Messages in your Bulk folder do not count toward your mail storage quota.. . The Bulk folder doesn't generate spam, and you won't receive any additional mail as a result of this folder. The system only diverts from your Inbox incoming messages that appear to be spam.. . Why are messages I want occasionally directed to my Bulk folder?. . Yahoo! makes a concerted effort to deliver solicited commercial and personal email directly to your Inbox. If you believe that a message delivered to your Bulk folder is more appropriately delivered to your Inbox, please select the message(s) and click the "Not spam" button above your messages.. . . This came directly from the Yahoo Mail/Yahoo Anti-Spam Resource Center.  The Bulk folder was created to receive all those bulk mailings, to keep your Inbox clear of Junk mail.. . To determine if the issue is with your account, try accessing your mail from a different computer using a totally different ISP.  If the issue persists and it has been more than a day, then the issue is probably server related.  You will need to contact Yahoo! Customer Care for help.. . To contact Yahoo! Customer Care, go to the product help page for the specific Yahoo! product you need help with, and select the most closely appropriate help article.  If the details don't address your concern, click the "Contact Us" link to generate a web form message.which error u get?Did you do what the message suggested?  Restart your browser and try to login to mail again?. . If this does not work make sure that JavaScript and cookies are enabled in your browser settings.  Also try using the Firefox web browser (http://mozilla.org). . If you still have problems, contact Yahoo directly: http://add.yahoo.com/fast/help/us/mail/cgi_feedback

I do know that originally id didn't cost anything to ask a question but that they then raised it to two and then five points to try and prevent people from asking poor questions.. . The way it's set up now, you ask one question (-5 pts), answer one question (+2 pts) and select the best answer for your question (+3 pts) to break even. A postal code is the Canadian version of a Zip Code. We don't have Zip codes like 90210 in Canada, we have Postal Codes, like N2G 1B6postel code is identification of his country or city03310. what is your? and why do you want to know? and how do you know I gave you the actual code for where I live?hmmmmmm....curious...postal code or post code is another term for zip code. Countries like Canada or the UK use that terminology rather than zip code. Post codes are usually more precise. I know in the UK it actually pin points what street you live on.

Permanently offline is "sticky" in that it will remember that you want to always appear offline to that contact, even after you sign out and sign back in, or when you change your status between Invisible and Available.. . Offline is enabled only if you are Invisible. It allows you to selectively choose between online and offline on a per contact basis. However your choices here will only last until you next change your global status, or until you sign out.no they cant know if you are online or not, well depending if your setings on your yahoo profile is set to be visible they can see you online even tho if you are on stealth settings , other thing there are many programs that i can be use to see if you are online one of them is yahoo spy :D

It doesn't seem to be possible to remove the RSS feeds section from 360. Sorry!. . The only thing you can do is stop it from being seen by the public by clicking 'share feeds' in the feeds section, then selecting 'Just Me' in the 'Can be seen by' dropdown in the feeds page.how do I take off rss codeGo to your MY PAGE and then go to your feed section and click on SHARE FEEDS...and edit/change your URL.....that's it!. Hope that helpsHere's what you can do.... . - Go to your 360.. . - Click on "My Page" on the top.. . - Now the format of your page is changed, with white boxes appearing around stuff.. . - Scroll down to the RSS box (Feeds), and click on "Share Feeds".. . - Remove all URLs stored there (just delete that text), and Save changes.. . - If you want the feeds for yourself, and not want your friends or the public to see it, you can change it too on the same page itself.

If that one is named alphabetically after the first one, it will now be second in the list.. . To encourage participation and reward great answers, Yahoo! Answers has a system of points and levels. The number of points you get depends on the specific action you take. The points table below summarizes the point values for different actions. While you can't use points to buy or redeem anything, they do allow everyone to recognize how active and helpful you've been. i dont care and i dont know!!!!My Yahoo! does not offer the ability to add the avatar just yet.  Here is a help page that I found in the Yahoo! Avatars help section:. . Q: Where can I use Yahoo! Avatars?. . A: You can use avatars in many places on Yahoo!. We frequently add new features, so check the Yahoo! Avatars home page for the latest way to use your avatar.. Yahoo! Avatars are displayed in the Yahoo! Messenger List of versions 6.0 and higher. You can also display avatars in the IM window during a Messenger conversation. The avatar can represent your mood the same way you use emoticons in Messenger.. . Your avatar will also be displayed in your Yahoo! Mail account, and you can see your avatar in your profile on Yahoo! Games, Yahoo! Movies, Yahoo! Music Engine, Yahoo! Podcasts, Yahoo! Answers, and Yahoo! Trip Planner. Your avatar can be one of your profile photos on Yahoo! 360°. The Yahoo! Message Boards Beta can display your avatar next to your posts (not all message boards have this feature yet). You can use your avatar as a team logo on Yahoo! Fantasy Sports.. . Note: At this time, a Yahoo! Avatar can't be disabled for a specific alias. Your avatar will be displayed for your Yahoo! ID and all profiles associated with that ID everywhere avatars can be used on Yahoo!.My Q&A -> Edit My Info -> Use My Yahoo! crater lake is located in oregon it was formed by the collapse during the catastrophic eruption of approximately 50 cubic kilometers of magmaCrater Lake occupies the crater of a prehistoric volcano, Mount Mazama.  It was formed and is replenished by snow and rainwater.The lake partly fills a nearly 4000 ft (1220 m) deep caldera that was formed around 6900 years ago by the collapse of the volcano Mount Mazama.. . good luck

They won't be able to spam as much with the limits set if they don't already have a fairly well-used account.10  u got to get Tritona cruel jokeThe points are mostly just an incentive for people to start answering questions, and also to vote on other answers, and finally, to rate other people's answers.  As you increase your points and levels you are able to perform more of the standard activity - ask, answer, rate, vote and comment.. . Other than that, the points don't do anything. You do get some extra 'attention' at higher levels, but that may or may not be a good thing. There are no secret special prizes, at least none that any of us at Level 7 have heard of.. . Mostly, just enjoy the site, ask and answer questions. If you like, keep track of your points as you move up in levels. After awhile, you'll be more interested in responding to people's questions with quality answers.. . Here's the link where you can see what the different levels are and how to earn points. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. .
