I think God allowed them to die out eventually for some reason.Because dinosaurs lived before man was created.Dinosaurs lived on earth about 65 million years ago, we did notThe Bible's best description of a dinosaur-like animal is recorded in Job chapter 40. "Look at the behemoth, which I made along with you and which feeds on grass like an ox. What strength he has in his loins, what power in the muscles of his belly! His tail sways like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs are close-knit. His bones are tubes of bronze, his limbs like rods of iron. He ranks first among the works of God..."(Job 40:15-19) The book of Job is very old, probably written around 2,000 years before Jesus was born. Here God describes a great king of the land animals like some of the biggest dinosaurs, the Diplodocus and Apatosaurus. It was a gigantic plant-eater with great muscles and very strong bones. The long Diplodocus had leg bones so strong that he could have held three others on his back.. . Also, the leviathon sounds suspiciously like a dinosaur to me. Do me a favor and actually READ The Bible before you assert such things.who said the bible is the truth?then why do we have prove that there were dinosaursThe bible isn't real, fossils are. And their bones weren't discovered until long after the bible was written.  therefore, no one knew of their existence when the bible was written.different time zone. aas in bc, ad and so forthI don't think that the people writing the documents we have comprised into the Bible spent much time excavating.The bible at the beginning is set 6,000 years ago.  Since dinosaurs existed millions of years prior to this they are specifically excluded from the great book.WHAT REALLY HAPPENED TO THE DINOSAURS?. Ken Ham. Dinosaurs are used more than almost anything else to indoctrinate children and adults in the idea of millions of years of Earth history. However, the Bible gives us a framework for explaining dinosaurs in terms of thousands of years of history, and solving the mystery of when they lived and what happened to them. Some key texts are Genesis 1:24–25 and Job 40:15–24.. . Are Dinosaurs a Mystery?. Many think that the existence of dinosaurs and their demise is shrouded in such mystery that we may never know the truth about where they came from, when they lived, and what happened to them. However, dinosaurs are only a mystery if you accept the evolutionary story of their history.. . According to evolutionists: Dinosaurs first evolved around 235 million years ago1—long before man evolved. No human being ever lived with dinosaurs. Their history is recorded in the fossil layers on the Earth, which were deposited over millions of years. They were so successful as a group of animals that they eventually ‘ruled’ the Earth. However, around 65 million years ago something happened to change all of this—the dinosaurs disappeared. Most evolutionists believe some sort of cataclysmic event—such as an asteroid impact—killed them. But, many evolutionists claim that some dinosaurs evolved into birds, and thus they are not extinct, but are flying around us today!. . There is no mystery surrounding dinosaurs if you accept the Bible’s totally different account of dinosaur history.. . According to the Bible: Dinosaurs first existed around 6,000 years ago.  God made the dinosaurs, along with the other land animals, on Day Six of the Creation Week (Gen. 1:20–25, 31). Adam and Eve were also made on Day Six—so dinosaurs lived at the same time as people, not separated by eons of time. Dinosaurs could not have died out before people appeared, because dinosaurs had not previously existed, and death, bloodshed, disease and suffering are a result of Adam’s sin (Rom. 5:12, 14, 1 Cor. 15:21–22).  Representatives of all the kinds of air-breathing land animals, including the dinosaur kinds, went on board Noah’s Ark. All those left outside the Ark died in the cataclysmic circumstances of the Flood—many of their remains became fossils. After the Flood (around 4,500 years ago), the remnant of the land animals, including dinosaurs, came off the Ark and lived in the present world, along with people. Because of sin, the judgments of the Curse and the Flood have greatly changed the Earth. Post-Flood climatic change, lack of food, disease, and man’s activities caused many types of animals to become extinct. The dinosaurs, like many other creatures, died out. Why the big mystery about dinosaurs?. . Why Such Different Views?. How can there be such totally different explanations for dinosaurs? Whether one is an evolutionist, or accepts the Bible’s account of history, the evidence for dinosaurs is the same. All scientists have the same facts—they have the same world, the same fossils, the same living creatures, the same universe. If the ‘facts’ are the same, then how can the explanations be so different? The reason is that scientists have only the present—dinosaur fossils exist only in the present—but scientists are trying to connect the fossils in the present to the past. They ask, ‘What happened in history to bring dinosaurs into existence, wipe them out, and leave many of them fossilized?’. The science that addresses such issues is known as historical or origins science, and it differs from the operational science that gives us inexpensive food, space exploration, electricity, and the like. Origins science deals with the past, which is not accessible to direct experimentation, whereas operations science deals with how the world works in the here and now, which of course is open to repeatable experiments. Because of difficulties in reconstructing the past, those who study fossilsBecause the Bible was created by man who existed after the dinosaurs.The bible is not a historical text. It a set of guidelines on how to live your life. I think it's just symbolic, it's not meant to be taken literally.. . Abby. xxxdo you believe in the bible??? Follow this path. Go to ur email page> options> spam protection> make changes over there as per ur requirement> save. It will solve ur problem.I found this in the help pages:. . Q: What can I do to prevent spam?. . A: Yahoo! Mail is committed to eliminating spam and offers several tools to help you keep spam out of your inbox. Yahoo! has consolidated several of these tools under the "This is Spam" link next to the From: address in every message. . The most effective way to prevent spam from entering your inbox is to use SpamGuard. Help increase SpamGuard's effectiveness by sending examples of spam to Yahoo! to review. Yahoo! will use the messages you send using the "Spam" button to constantly improve the SpamGuard technology. . Yahoo! Mail offers you the ability to create filters for your account. You can create filters to deliver emails to a special folder or to the Trash that:. . . contain specific words or phrases . are from a sender's domain . containing other characteristics you find in spam . . Yahoo! Mail allows you to prevent future email from a specific email address from being delivered to you at all. Note that many spammers frequently change their email address to avoid this technique. . You can choose how long you want to keep messages in your Bulk Mail Folder. You can choose to drop all messages in your Bulk Mail Folder or keep messages for 1 week, 2 weeks or 1 month. The default is one month. . To edit this feature: . . Click "Mail Options" . Click "Spam Protection" . Here you will have the following two choices: . . . "Immediately delete these messages upon receipt". . "Save these messages in the Bulk folder" and select the desired timeframe from the drop down menu. . Important: Occasionally, valid email messages may be perceived as spam and delivered to the Bulk folder. Please note that if you select this option, you will not have an opportunity to review the messages in your Bulk folder before they are deleted. . . . Click "Save Changes" . Outside of the specific tools that Yahoo! Mail offers: . . Never respond to unsolicited email (i.e., spam). To the individuals who send spam, one response or "hit" among thousands of mailings is enough to justify the practice. &#92; . . Never respond to the spam email's instructions to reply with the word "remove" unless you trust the company sending the email. This is a ploy to get you to react to the email and will alert the sender that your email address is open and available to receive mail, which greatly increases its value. If you reply, your address may be placed on more lists, resulting in more spam. . . Never click on a URL or web site address listed within a spam email. This could alert the site to the validity of your email address, potentially resulting in more spam. . . Never sign up with sites that promise to remove your name from spam lists. . Although some of these sites may be legitimate, more often than not, they are address collectors. The legitimate sites are ignored (or exploited) by the spammers, and the address collection sites are owned by spammers. In both cases, your address is recorded and valued more highly because you have just identified that your address is active. . . This article is located at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/spam/spam-19.html

Answers:I could never top this excellent answer that I received for a similar question (from YahooGuru4u), so I quote it here verbatim. Of course, I ruled out the answer "42.". . "Darn you. You sucked me in with your question, then I get here and I see 42 is already taken. Now we really have to go on a trip and I'm without a towel. Well ok, let me see what I can come up with, shooting from the hip as it were. . . My best guess is that the meaning of life, the universe and everything is "MORE". The quest for more seems to be at the center of all living creatures. All organizations be they organic or manmade seem to be trying to get "more". The universe itself is expanding, so I am told. As for "everything" anything that should happen to get created instantly becomes part of everything, so even everything seems to crave more. Yes I think I'll stick with the answer "MORE". What? Wait, just a minute, my wife is yelling something from the kitchen...... . . (long pause).....Hello I'm back again. My wife says the answer is "LESS" She says life is always moving toward death which by it's very nature is less life. The universe is made up of a limited quantity of everything and it is being used up also, so you have less now than in the past, and as for "everything" Well since everything gets used, you must have less of everything now than there was in the beginning. . . So my wife and I will agree to disagree and say that the answer is:  More or Less, or possibly More and Less. I guess that's pretty much the same as 42 because 4 is more and 2 is less. I'm getting a pain just behind my left eye from all of this thinking. . . What!? Just a minute, my wife is yelling again!........ I'm back. She said I'd better get off this Yahoo Answers thing and come to the table if I want any dinner. I told her that I'll never have to come back to Yahoo Answers again because I just pretty much summed up life, the universe and everything. I'd better hurry if I want more to eat and less yelling. So long and thanks for all the fishes.". . Happy Answering,. ~Tia~. The person who asked the question can put the question to a vote after there are 2 or more answers, and after 24 hours. If they do not put the question up for a vote before it expires (after 7 days, and without having selected a best answer) it goes to a vote automatically.the best answer is voted on by answerersBecause the asker either can't decide among the answers and leaves it to the voters, the asker forgets to pick a best answer, or the asker just wants to let the voters choose for them.If the person who posted the question doesn't want to select the best answer, it can be opened for the public to vote on the best answer.Because the person who asked the question doesn't pick a best answer. They have the option to let everyone else vote for one.Because it needs to be voted on

It is a factor of many things, including the way the page was designed and the number, size, and kind of images on the page. A page with a lot of photos, for example, can take much longer to load than a page with nothing but text. But there are ways to optimize a web page so that it loads faster, but many amateur web designers don't know about them or don't know how to use them.Sssssssssssssome pages take longer to load then others,

Check out the scoring system page:. http://answers.yahoo.com/info/scoring_system. . The levels prevent spammers from immediate unlimited access to the site. They encourage users to rate, vote and write good answers (to try to get best answer) in order to get to the next level where they'll have fewer limits. The points indicate community standing to some extent, but aren't really the best indicator. Most people just enjoy seeing their points go up while they're participating. Some like the new outlet for their competitive natures.Gives you bragging rights.. . Mine is bigger than your's.To get more than the other guyLooks

Pep is energy, and they're supposed to get the crowd energized at the sports events.(m). . PEP SQUAD reviews from the nation's top critics and audiences. Also includes movie info, trailer, poster, photos, news, articles, and forum.

If people are discouraged from asking but encouraged to answer, that gives Y!A a higher answer-to-question ratio so you're more likely to get a good answer. It also helps prevent people from asking some lame questions and encourages users to use the search feature before asking a question that has already been asked and answered.I agree with Jane.  By taking away points for asking questions, we are encouraged to do other things to gain those points back.  For instance, you can rate answers and get a point back.  At first, I was confused also, but it does make sense.  This way, people are discouraged from asking all the "which is better?  the number 1 or 5?" type questions, while encouraged to engage in other Yahoo! Answers activities.Too encourage participation on Yahoo! Answers.Because it is a rule. Don't fight it.

To get to level 2, you need to have 250 points.  You need 105 points to get to level 2. There is no time limit on how long it takes you to get to level 2, although if tomorrow you provide 20 answers (2 points each, 40 points), 20 votes for best answers (1 point each, 20 points) and 20 best answers rates (1 point each, 20 points), and do so the next day as well, you'll get to level 2.  You can only earn a maximum of 80 points a day on level 1, unless you get best answers.Answer other people's questions that will get you 2 points a piece. I haven't exactly figured it out either, but I'm not really in it for the points.The points are mostly just an incentive for people to start answering questions, and also to vote on other answers, and finally, to rate other people's answers.. . Other than that, the points don't do anything. You do get some extra 'attention' at higher levels, but that may or may not be a good thing. There are no secret special prizes, at least none that any of us at Level 7 have heard of.. . Mostly, just enjoy the site, ask and answer questions. If you like, keep track of your points as you move up in levels. After awhile, you'll be more interested in responding to people's questions with quality answers.. . They do the cookie so you can preview the new layout for the Yahoo homepage...If you don't have the cookie you don't see the new homepage.... . I personally don't like the new homepage so I delete the cookies every time to make it go back to the old page...Most websites use cookies to remember who a user is. If you have to log in to a site, it needs some way to remember you - a good thing and not necessarily spying.. . About the MRU, though, are you sure that was from Yahoo! Answers? They're usually created by programs. Some programs are set to automatically create one if the previous one was deleted. MRUs help you find files you recently accessed in the Recent Documents part of your start menu. They're very convient.

visitors is how many people have viewed your page. page views total number of pages looked at . if i go to your 360 and look at 4 pages it will look like this. visitors 1. page views 4I know this one. Page views means the number of the pages you have visited and visitors mean how many people have visited your page.A Page view is a term used in web analytics, and may generally be defined as a request to load a single page of an Internet site. On the World Wide Web a page request would result from a web surfer clicking on a link on another HTML page pointing to the page in question. This should be contrasted with a hit, which refers to a request for a file from a web server. There may therefore be many hits per page view.. . These page views may be counted. For the owner of the site this information can be useful to see if any change in the to the page (such as the information or the way it is presented) results in more visits. If there are any advertisements on the page, the advertisers would also be interested in the number of page views to determine their expected revenue from the ads. For this reason it is a term is used widely for Internet based marketing and advertising.. "visitors" may imply a number of unique ip addresses accessing the web site.Wow. Interesting question. My guess is that page views are just when people stop in to look around. Maybe a visitor is someone who stops to leave a comment? That's the only logical explanation I can think of, really. Hope you find out for sure.. . By the way, cool background.One visitor can visit many pages.

I suggest a fresh install of Yahoo! Messenger.  First, a fresh install will ensure you have the latest build of Yahoo! Messenger.  Also, a reinstall will write over any Messenger files that may have become corrupt and causing this crashing issue.  There are two versions of Yahoo! Messenger available.  Yahoo! just launched Yahoo! Messenger version 8.0, which includes plug-ins, integration of Yahoo! 360, Soundtrack, and Soundboard.  For version 8, just go to http://messenger.yahoo.com, click on the ‘Get it Now’ button, and follow the installation process.  If you are not ready for the beta, just click on the ‘Get version 7.5’ link located directly under the ‘Get it Now’ button to get the current version, version 7.5.The messenger directory might be corrupt, try this:. http://search2.cc.scd.yahoo.com/cct_search.php?ui_mode=answer&prior_transaction_id=345569&action_code=5&highlight_info=16789078,12,23&turl=http%3A%2F%2Fhelp.yahoo.com%2Fl%2Fus%2Fyahoo%2Fmessenger%2Fmessenger75%2Fmessenger%2Fmessenger-04.html&answer_id=7492529#__highlight. . If that doesn't work, you probably want to contact yahoo: http://add.yahoo.com/fast/help/us/messenger/cgi_feedback. . Or get live online support by going to http://voice.yahoo.com/voice_help.php and clicking on the 'Live Chat help' link on the right side of the page.alright this happened with me too. on my pc it happened because i had downloaded the alienware desktop theme . even though they were cool it switched off my yahoo so when i changed my theme back to windows theme it started working fine so chk if u have changed your theme
steal it backYou can change your password at the Account Manager Center. Log in to your account by clicking Mail, then typing in your Account Name and Password, then clicking Options on the top right corner, then clicking Account Information. Follow the on-screen directions to change your current password. If you think you can remember your answer then you can get your account back by emailing Yahoo Account Security at account-security-help @ cc.yahoo-inc.com (I put two spaces around the @ so the address would show in full) ASAP. Let them know what happened to you and they will request you to answer 8 questions so they can verify the account is yours. If and only if you have all the answers to the 8 questions can they then give you back your account. . . Do you have a scroll button on your mouse?  if so try pressing the Control Key on your Keyboard and scrolling up.I don't think Yahoo! changed anything. The settings on your computer could have been changed by an outside server. This is easy to do if you have any file-sharing programs, such as: Kazza, LimeWire, etc.. You might try from your status bar menu, under "View" find "Text Size" & adjust the size of your text.. Otherwise, if your operating system is XP (& maybe others), you might want to "Restore Your Sysyem".. From your start menu, click "Control Panel" Then click: "Performance & Maintenence". In the upper left corner find "File Types" and under that, click "Restore System".  Then follow the instructions to back-date your system to a day when you didn't have the problem.  That should take care of it.spyware. has happened to me before. if you have XP, use system restore to take comp back to before this happened. get yourself a spyware remover program such as adaware se.you have not been here for a while thenGo to View on the toll bar, under text size change the settings to suit ur wish ...The font size changed sometimes on my computer too.I don't know how.

Please follow this path to solve ur problem. Tools> internet options> content> auto complete> clear forms. To stop the generation of history, uncheck the box of forms. It will solve ur problem.I assume you want to clear your search history.. . This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection.

Answers, as you can see that those affected by the login issue were able to come on here and ask questions, many Yahoo! sites/products were affected.  However, because I have premium (paid) Yahoo! services (i.e. Yahoo! Voice, Yahoo! Mail Plus), I was able to chat online (and call) the Yahoo! support team and just learned the problem is now solved.  We can now all login to Yahoo! websites and Yahoo! Please follow this path. Tools > internet options > content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history, please uncheck the box of form. U will get ur problem solved.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection.For IE it's actually the Tools menu >> Internet Options >> Content tab >> AutoComplete >> Clear forms. . Be sure to uncheck the box to prevent future searches from being saved.. . If you're not using IE, see http://www.jimmyr.com/searchhistory.phpDELETING SEARCH HISTORY. . Interenet Explorer --. . EASY and Quick -- You should do this often. .   - TOOLS / INTERNET OPTIONS. .   - On the GENERAL Tab, click the 'Clear History' Button in the 'History' section. .   - Hint 1:  While you're there, you might want to look at the second section entitled 'Temporary . . Internet Files'.  I routinely click on 'Delete Cookies' ... more on Cookies later.. .   - Hint 2:  You might want to click the 'Delete Files' button too -- Ensure that you delete all . . Off-Line Content.  Note that the more stored web-pages you have the longer this will take.  If it . . takes a few minutes to do, you should have done this a long time ago.. .   - Hint 3:  Do this every month or so, depending on how much surfing you do or if you find yourself . . on a page of dubious content. .   - Hint 4:  Click the settings button and set "Check for newer versions of stored pages:" to "Every . . visit to the page".  Not doing this will essentially read the page from your hard drive instead of . . the website and you will not see the latest changes.. .   - Hint 5:  The amount of disk space to use for stored pages should be relatively small -- figure . . less than 10% of your total drive space (i.e. 10% of a 40GB drive is about 4GB or 4,096MB).  Just a . . rule of thumb, but that's still a LOT of web pages.  I spend lots of time on the internet surfing . . all over the place -- Mine is set at 300MB and I have almost a terabyte of disk space.. .  - On the CONTENT Tab, click the AUTO COMPLETE button.  Click the "Clear Forms" button.  This will . . delete the stuff that you've previously typed into various web-pages.. . GOOGLE AND OTHERS . . This is a great source:. . http://www.searchenginewatch.com/sereport/article.php/2165181. . . COOKIES and OFF-LINE CONTENT. . Cookies are small files left on your computer by web-pages to record little things.  They are not . . all bad.  When you key in your zip code on Yahoo Weather on the home page and say "Save this" -- it . . does -- in a little Cookie File.  This way, the next time you visit the site, it 'remembers' your . . zip code.  Fantastic !. . Banking sites remember your passwords, your account numbers ... Great ?  Would you like a copy of . . your bank account number posted on the internet ?  It can be arranged !. . The point is not to be too afraid, but to be responsible.  It's far easier to retype your zip code . . later than to have all of this junk building up on your computer.. . ONCE A MONTH OR SO INTERNET HISTORY TO DO LIST --. . 1. Delete your history, delete your cookies.  Delete your off-line content.. 2. Empty your Recycle Bin. 3. Run Disk Defragmenter ( Start / Programs / Accesories / System Tools / Disk Defragmenter). . This will take a while.  You should close EVERYTHING down and leave the computer alone for the 5-30 . . minutes this takes.  It's a good thing to do before you go to bed or before you leave for work.. . You should perform the above steps approximately monthly or more frequently.. . VIRUS STUFF AND SEARCH HISTORIES / COOKIES. . Never, ever update your anti-virus definitions before you clear out your computer as per above.. . It's also a very good thing NOT to rely too much on automatic updates ... Sometimes, again, about . . once a month or so, you'll want to MANUALLY update your virus defintions.  If something isn't right, . . you'll have at least an opportunity to see that it isn't.  Too many times, people believe that their . . defintions are being kept current, when it's simply been bombing/crashing in the middle of the night . . and exiting without doing anything.  This is so simple that I still can't believe people don't know . . this:  As a former hacker, what do you honestly think the very first thing I'm would do to your . . computer was ?  Duh, Disable your auto-updating !!!. . SPYWARE / ADWon internet explorer,. . Tools --> Internet Options . Then delete cookies and clear history. apply -->OK

So if you message them, they probably won't answer back since they've been away from the computer a long time.ITS MEANS U ARE AWAY FROM UR COMPUTER AND THE MOUSE HAVEN'T EVEN MOVED..idle- means idling...heh. . sorry, I couldn't resist.  When you or someone you know is listed as Idle it means they have not done anything involving their messenger in some time.  (ie a car idling, motor running but not going anywhere and in park). . If an ID on messenger is listed as idle, it means they have not done anything Yahoo related with that ID in some specified time.  It could mean simply they are lagged by internet problems....or it could be as serious as a slight electrical hum.  (enought to power their systems but not enough to power the monitor) whatever the case is, it means they are not using that ID at the moment.. . If it is your ID or account, you can either ignore it, or change your preferences in messenger to a different amount of time or even off completely.Just means there has been no activity in the applicationit means that they arent at the computer or havent been on for a whileit means the are away from the computerthat they have not responded or attempted to respond for an amount of time, you can set when idle is displayed on your mess. tooIf you don't move your mouse and did not type any key in the key board and you are on line in Yahoo messenger will set to status as Idle. The default time is 15 Min's.it means that that person's mouse hasn't movedwhen your screen saver comes up

Please follow this path to delete the search bar history. Tools > internet options> content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history in the search bar uncheck the box of forms. It will solve ur problem.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection. . . To clear searches on Google toolbar, click "Google" on the left of the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Search History. To stop saving searches click options, click search tab and check or uncheck to configure your search box.. . To clear pages you have visited on Internet Explorer address bar, click Tools, Internet Options, under General tab click Clear History, you can also set the number of days to keep pages in history, click Apply and then click OK. You may also want to click the Content tab and click Auto Complete and check or uncheck your Auto Complete settings to your preference.That's a good question.  Many people have answered it quite well.  Here's a listing that will give you directions for different operating systems, browsers, and for the different areas where history is stored,. http://answers.yahoo.com/search/search_result;_ylt=AoEItcCoEi8dDbk.hqbd4eHsy6IX?p=clear+web+searchgo to the top of your browser tools-browser options-clear

Just click on "Bulk." This will also allow you to edit your folder.The Bulk folder is your Spam folder.. . To stop receiving unwanted email, do the following:. . Log into your Email, go to Options (upper right hand side). Go through all your settings and don't forget to save them too. . . Under Spam Protection, make sure your Spam Guard is turned ON. Option to immediately delete all Spam messages. This will force all new email to redirect to your Inbox. Option to Block messages that you mark as Spam. If you plan on keeping your . Bulk folder, also option messages you mark as Not-Spam to be moved to your Inbox. Always Option to Block all Images until you can look them over first. This prevents spammers from knowing you opened their email. Save Changes. . . Under Blocked Addresses, type in spammer.com, this will stop all Spam that has been reported to Yahoo from ever entering your email. I recommend you remove everything on your list first. This will give you a fresh start after you type in the "spammer.com". . . Under General Preferences, Folders/Search Results, Special Folders, option to redirect incoming unsolicited email to the Bulk Folder. Save. . . If you get email from someone you don't know, NEVER open it (it may contain viruses) and report it as SPAM. This will automatically block it from your email account. When you do open an email that is Spam, you have alerted the sender that your account is Active. . . This should slow down the Junk Mail considerably. I only get maybe one or two Spam emails a Month. . . Good Luck!

EASY and Quick -- You should do this often. .   - TOOLS / INTERNET OPTIONS. .   - On the GENERAL Tab, click the 'Clear History' Button in the 'History' section. .   - Hint 1:  While you're there, you might want to look at the second section entitled 'Temporary . . Internet Files'.  I routinely click on 'Delete Cookies' ... more on Cookies later.. .   - Hint 2:  You might want to click the 'Delete Files' button too -- Ensure that you delete all . . Off-Line Content.  Note that the more stored web-pages you have the longer this will take.  If it . . takes a few minutes to do, you should have done this a long time ago.. .   - Hint 3:  Do this every month or so, depending on how much surfing you do or if you find yourself . . on a page of dubious content. .   - Hint 4:  Click the settings button and set "Check for newer versions of stored pages:" to "Every . . visit to the page".  Not doing this will essentially read the page from your hard drive instead of . . the website and you will not see the latest changes.. .   - Hint 5:  The amount of disk space to use for stored pages should be relatively small -- figure . . less than 10% of your total drive space (i.e. 10% of a 40GB drive is about 4GB or 4,096MB).  Just a . . rule of thumb, but that's still a LOT of web pages.  I spend lots of time on the internet surfing . . all over the place -- Mine is set at 300MB and I have almost a terabyte of disk space.. .  - On the CONTENT Tab, click the AUTO COMPLETE button.  Click the "Clear Forms" button.  This will . . delete the stuff that you've previously typed into various web-pages.. . GOOGLE AND OTHERS . . This is a great source:. . 	http://www.searchenginewatch.com/sereport/article.php/2165181. . . COOKIES and OFF-LINE CONTENT. . Cookies are small files left on your computer by web-pages to record little things.  They are not . . all bad.  When you key in your zip code on Yahoo Weather on the home page and say "Save this" -- it . . does -- in a little Cookie File.  This way, the next time you visit the site, it 'remembers' your . . zip code.  Fantastic !. . Banking sites remember your passwords, your account numbers ... Great ?  Would you like a copy of . . your bank account number posted on the internet ?  It can be arranged !. . The point is not to be too afraid, but to be responsible.  It's far easier to retype your zip code . . later than to have all of this junk building up on your computer.. . ONCE A MONTH OR SO INTERNET HISTORY TO DO LIST --. . 1. Delete your history, delete your cookies.  Delete your off-line content.. 2. Empty your Recycle Bin. 3. Run Disk Defragmenter ( Start / Programs / Accesories / System Tools / Disk Defragmenter). . This will take a while.  You should close EVERYTHING down and leave the computer alone for the 5-30 . . minutes this takes.  It's a good thing to do before you go to bed or before you leave for work.. . You should perform the above steps approximately monthly or more frequently.. . VIRUS STUFF AND SEARCH HISTORIES / COOKIES. . Never, ever update your anti-virus definitions before you clear out your computer as per above.. . It's also a very good thing NOT to rely too much on automatic updates ... Sometimes, again, about . . once a month or so, you'll want to MANUALLY update your virus defintions.  If something isn't right, . . you'll have at least an opportunity to see that it isn't.  Too many times, people believe that their . . defintions are being kept current, when it's simply been bombing/crashing in the middle of the night . . and exiting without doing anything.  This is so simple that I still can't believe people don't know . . this:  As a former hacker, what do you honestly think the very first thing I'm would do to your . . computer was ?  Duh, Disable your auto-updating !!!. . Go to tools>Internet options. Delete cookies, delete files, delete history, set delete history to 1 day. Click the content tab, and go to AutoComplete option, then select clear forms.. . Yahoo. Click the pencil and click clear history. Click the pencil again and click toolbar options. Uncheck remember recent searches and check IE clears history on close. If you don't have these options download the latest Yahoo toolbar or delete it by clicking start->settings->control panel-> add/remove programs.. . Firefox. Go to tools>options>privacy. Delete cache and cookies. It's also under "clear private data" in newer versions with the quick key (ctrl+shift+delete).. Google. Click the google button and click clear searches. Click the google button again and go to options, then click the search tab.. Check out this link below, it's very informative.. http://www.jimmyr.com/searchhistory.php....This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection.Very simple.  This question has been asked before.  Go to the left side of your Yahoo! Toolbar where the search block is.  Find the little pencil button and click on it.  Then click on "Clear Search History", and congratulations, all your searches are erased from memory!  Hope that helped!If you have Firefox go to tools and then click clear history.

I've never called someone's computer.nothing much the screen just pops up and states you have a call do you choose to accept or deny and it depends on the company that you are usingit answers.For PC2PC calls with Messenger, your buddy will receive a pop-up window indicating that there is an incoming call from you.  They have the option of answering or declining the call.  For Phone2 PC calls, they also receive a pop-up window indicating your incoming call from your phone number (as long as your number is not blocked).  If you call someones PC and they are offline, you will connect to their voicemail as long as their voicemail box is not full.

I don't know.hail stones are just frozen water.. An  ice layer forms when the hailstone collects small, really cooled liquid water drops that freeze rapidly on impact, thereby trapping air bubbles within the ice and giving it a "milky" texture. When larger cooled water drops impact on a hailstone, the freezing is slower, allowing the air bubbles to escape, and thus forming clear ice.When rain forms and starts to fall strong updrafts of air push the rain up to higher and colder altitudes.  The rain freezes and begins to fall as small ice crystals.  The updrafts keep cycling the small ice balls back up into the cold air and the small ice ball gets a little bigger each time until it is too heavy for the updraft to push it back up.  It then falls to the ground as hail even if the ground temperature is very warm.

From yahoo? It may be because you have your spam guard on and if Yahoo is not in your address book,the mail will  be delivered to the bulk folder.If you're referring to the e-mails that are obviously spam but appear to be addressed to someone else, you're not alone.  With all the recent spam laws, some people have decided they can profit by making the e-mail appear to have been sent to someone else.  Then, if you do manage to track them down via ISP, their defense can be that it wasn't sent to you....it was delivered by mistake.  Whatever you do, don't try to click on the links to unsubscribe unless it is a reputable company.  Many of these types of messages are sent to random e-mail addresses, and if they learn you actually received it, be prepared for an onslaught of messages from different addresses but with the same text.

You have to wait until the 14-day expiration...then the check box will appear for you to delete it. You will also have to send a new invitation to the correct address...as there is no way to correct the one already sent :)You cannot delete an invititation during the first 14 days (until it is an 'outstanding' invite.  To learn how to delete an invite after 14 days, go to the help page titled "How do I delete an expired invitation?" located at http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/360/friends/friends-11.html. . . Now, if a person has 'accepted' your invite and you no longer want that person as a connection, there is a help page titled "How do I remove a friend as a connection?" located at http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/360/friends/friends-05.html.sorry you can'twait for 14 days, then go to the invitation and you will see a red statment showing that it is expired. then click on the button and delete.I had the same problem and it wouldn't let me delete it until a certain time period. There are some places that employ children like paper routes, but, that is becoming something of a thing of the past. Otherwise, there are child labor laws in effect in every state of the union that prohibit children being employed. Still, we hear of isolated incidences where "sweat shops" have been raided and children we're found working for pennies and being held against their will.  There are some cultures around the world which think nothing of a child working. It is commonplace. They work to help  support the family. That mostly happens when the family is not financially capable of sending their child/children to school. Not ever child on the face of this planet has the privilege to have a typical childhood as many of us have.  You can help by supporting global organizations whose main objective is to aid those uneducated/impoverished families to allow their children, the next generation a chance to overcome.Move to MalaysiaSorry, you aren't old enoughWork in a sweatshop.. When IM appears, click on ignore and check the box on the next pop up, click ok. It will block the sender.Okay, when you open your Yahoo IM go under the "Messenger" tab and click "Preferences"; from here go to the "Ignore List" now you can add any IDs you wish to block...in fact they give you two choices (1) ignore anyone who is not on your buddy/messenger list, preapproved ~OR~ (2) you can add people one at a time as needed, kind of like you do for junk mail on your email program.. Good Luck!This question is in the Yahoo! Messenger help pages:. . Q: How do I ignore someone?. . A: When you ignore a contact, you always appear offline to the contact. They cannot view your status or send you an IM.. . You must delete the contact from your Messenger List in order to ignore them.. . To ignore a contact:. . Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Preferences." . Click the "Ignore List" category. . Select the option labeled "Ignore only the people below." . Click the "Add" button. . Enter the Yahoo ID of the contact you want to ignore. . Click the "Ignore" button. . Click "OK" at the bottom of the window. . You can ignore up to 100 contacts.. . Note: To remove a contact from your Ignore List, select the ID and click the "Remove" button.. . To ignore someone who is not on your Messenger List:. . Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Preferences." . Click the "Ignore List" category. . Select the option labeled "Ignore anyone who is not on my Messenger List." . Click "OK" at the bottom of the window.Follow these steps:. C++ is important since it is one of the, if not the most flexible language.  It allows a programmer to use libraries written in most any other language, write or extend libraries including inline assembly language functions, and still have the ability to write fully object oriented code that deals with composition, inheritance and polymorhism.  The C language has been in use longer without the object oriented features, but C++ can and often does make use of any existing code base in C, since C++ is a superset of C.  C++ can also create object oriented interface wrappers for C code to update existing code easily into the new paradigm.  I hope this helps you out.c++ is object oriented programming which provided u with the concept of polymorphism, encapsulation and inheritence.. these are not provided in c language. and i suggest u to surf the net which will explain u the importance of c++.

Please follow this path. Tools > internet options > content > auto complete > clear forms. To stop the generation of history, please uncheck the box of form. U will get ur problem solved.This works if you have Internet Explorer as your browser.. The record of search history which appears in the search box on Yahoo and Google pages is actually a feature controlled by your browser.. . Click Tools at the top of your screen, a menu will drop down, click on Internet Options, then click on the Content tab. . Under Personal information, click on the AutoComplete box. . On the AutoComplete Settings window click the Clear Forms box to delete your current history, or you can uncheck the Forms box to permanently stop the generation of the search history. When you are finished remember to click OK.. . If you just want to clear searches on Yahoo or Google Home Page or any other Yahoo or Google page, double click the search box, this will make a menu drop down with your searches, put your cursor on what you want to delete to highlight it, hit the delete button on your keyboard. If you want to delete everything just hold the delete button down until everything is deleted.. . To clear searches on Yahoo Toolbar, click the pencil icon beside the search box, a menu will drop down, click Clear Recent Searches. If you want to stop saving recent searches, click Toolbar Options and uncheck "Enable Search History", or check "Auto-clear Search History when quitting IE" to clear history when you close your Internet connection.DELETING SEARCH HISTORY. . Interenet Explorer --. . EASY and Quick -- You should do this often. .   - TOOLS / INTERNET OPTIONS. .   - On the GENERAL Tab, click the 'Clear History' Button in the 'History' section. .   - Hint 1:  While you're there, you might want to look at the second section entitled 'Temporary . . Internet Files'.  I routinely click on 'Delete Cookies' ... more on Cookies later.. .   - Hint 2:  You might want to click the 'Delete Files' button too -- Ensure that you delete all . . Off-Line Content.  Note that the more stored web-pages you have the longer this will take.  If it . . takes a few minutes to do, you should have done this a long time ago.. .   - Hint 3:  Do this every month or so, depending on how much surfing you do or if you find yourself . . on a page of dubious content. .   - Hint 4:  Click the settings button and set "Check for newer versions of stored pages:" to "Every . . visit to the page".  Not doing this will essentially read the page from your hard drive instead of . . the website and you will not see the latest changes.. .   - Hint 5:  The amount of disk space to use for stored pages should be relatively small -- figure . . less than 10% of your total drive space (i.e. 10% of a 40GB drive is about 4GB or 4,096MB).  Just a . . rule of thumb, but that's still a LOT of web pages.  I spend lots of time on the internet surfing . . all over the place -- Mine is set at 300MB and I have almost a terabyte of disk space.. .  - On the CONTENT Tab, click the AUTO COMPLETE button.  Click the "Clear Forms" button.  This will . . delete the stuff that you've previously typed into various web-pages.. . GOOGLE AND OTHERS . . This is a great source:. . http://www.searchenginewatch.com/sereport/article.php/2165181. . . COOKIES and OFF-LINE CONTENT. . Cookies are small files left on your computer by web-pages to record little things.  They are not . . all bad.  When you key in your zip code on Yahoo Weather on the home page and say "Save this" -- it . . does -- in a little Cookie File.  This way, the next time you visit the site, it 'remembers' your . . zip code.  Fantastic !. . Banking sites remember your passwords, your account numbers ... Great ?  Would you like a copy of . . your bank account number posted on the internet ?  It can be arranged !. . The point is not to be too afraid, but to be responsible.  It's far easier to retype your zip code . . later than to have all of this junk building up on your computer.. . ONCE A MONTH OR SO INTERNET HISTORY TO DO LIST --. . 1. Delete your history, delete your cookies.  Delete your off-line content.. 2. Empty your Recycle Bin. 3. Run Disk Defragmenter ( Start / Programs / Accesories / System Tools / Disk Defragmenter). . This will take a while.  You should close EVERYTHING down and leave the computer alone for the 5-30 . . minutes this takes.  It's a good thing to do before you go to bed or before you leave for work.. . You should perform the above steps approximately monthly or more frequently.. . VIRUS STUFF AND SEARCH HISTORIES / COOKIES. . Never, ever update your anti-virus definitions before you clear out your computer as per above.. . It's also a very good thing NOT to rely too much on automatic updates ... Sometimes, again, about . . once a month or so, you'll want to MANUALLY update your virus defintions.  If something isn't right, . . you'll have at least an opportunity to see that it isn't.  Too many times, people believe that their . . defintions are being kept current, when it's simply been bombing/crashing in the middle of the night . . and exiting without doing anything.  This is so simple that I still can't believe people don't know . . this:  As a former hacker, what do you honestly think the very first thing I'm would do to your . . computer was ?  Duh, Disable your auto-updating !!!. . SPYWARE / ADWon internet explorer,. . Tools --> Internet Options . Then delete cookies and clear history. apply -->OK

If you have enabled archiving, then you have a file on your computer that will have all your previous conversations including offline messages that you may have deleted.  There is a help page titled "How do I enable and view archives?" located at http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/messenger75/messenger/messenger-15.html.  Here is the information from that page:. . Q: How do I enable and view archives?. . A: You can automatically save a history of all your instant messages, alerts, conferences, and text messages.. . Click the "Messenger" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Preferences." . Click the "Archive" category. . You have three choices for archiving your messages. You can select one of the three options given, including selecting "No" to not save your messages. . You also have three choices for archiving your call history. You can select one of the three options given, including selecting "No" to not save your call history. . Click the "OK" button at the bottom of the window. . Note: Uncheck the "Enable Archiving" option to disable archiving.. . To view your archive:. . Click the "Contacts" menu in Yahoo! Messenger and select "Message Archive." . A new window called "Message Archive for your ID" will appear. . Select the archive folder you want to review. . Note: Archives (".dat" files located on your system) are encrypted and can only be viewed by the Yahoo! ID that created them. These archives are stored locally on your system, so the conversations held on that specific computer are only accessible from that computer. After archives are deleted, they cannot be retrieved.Go to internet explorer, file-click work offline, then open your history and open up the thing u closedon yahoo, you cant unless you have your archives turned onIf you had archiving turned on (default) you can view them by clicking click "Show recent messages" or press F3 in any open IM window.. . If you don't have archiving turned on, they're gone forever, lost in the dark void of the internet.

Once you send email, it leaves your computer and travels along the Superhighway, that is the World Wide Web.  Once it arrives at it'd destination, it parks itself in the persons "address."  You know longer have ANY control or observation of that Email.. It's like, someone left your house and went home... how do you know when they pull in their garage?  You don't.  They have to call you and let you know they made it home!. Same thing... . Now, there ARE email services out there (like where you can send special occasion cards) that will notify you that your card was picked up (so, if you send someone a card, they will get email telling them to go pick it up from a special site... and once they go pick it up... THEN you will be notified that the person picked up your card).... . So, the answer to your question, as I'm sure others have typed by now, is No.

Page visitors indicates the number of different users who visited your blog.. Page viewers indicates the number of hits that viewed your blog.. Page visitors save the IP address of each user, so it won't get calculated even if the user view your site 1000 times, while if he visited your site again the Page view will increase each time he view it.I have no input here, so I'm glad you asked this question because I didn't know either.Correct! You've had 219 individuals visit your Blog and all together they looked at 2,343 pages! It's called Visitor Stats (sorry, you don't count...lol).page view ar those that window shopped, and page view are those who really entered into your site and got more info than the window shoppers. Hope this makes sense.. Ciao

If you are looking for a particular conversation, right-click on the contacts name in your messenger list. You will see a menu with several options, then click on Message Archive. If you want to look at all of your archived messages, click on the contacts menu at the top of Messenger and select Message Archive. You may find that you need to reset your preferences to make sure that all future conversations are archived and not deleted.i think ur archive folder is jinxed. jk.. u better take care of the archive folder on ur pc. the reason might be that some of the files in the archive folder might have not been properly written. if u don't find a solution in my answer. try contacting yahoo user services. they usually have a solution to ur problems. but keep in mind. these people r hell time takers. so be patient and wait for their answersThere might be 50 folders but only 10 of them have archived conversations. Your question stays open for 7 days if you don't choose a best answer.  After that it will automatically go to a vote.. . Sometimes the asker cannot choose because there are too many good, similar answers--so they choose to let people vote on it.Sometimes...the person who asked the question never comes back to do anything with it, so after some time it will automatically be put to a vote.. . ISometimes the asker doesn't know what to pick. So they put it on vote. Well, you can download the newest version & just check or uncheck the voice I believe. Someone correct me if I'm wrong. I'm not aware of any security issues on the old versions thoughYou don't need to worry about the name. The "with voice" tag is simply marketing to try to get people to realize they can do voice calls with Yahoo! Messenger to compete with other voice programs like Skype and Gizmo.. . Just install the latest version from http://messenger.yahoo.com If you don't want to use the voice features, then don't. Everything else still works as it did in previous versions, and there are new features and bug fixes too!. . If you really do want an older version before they introduced the "with voice" tag, go to http://www.oldversion.com/you can use the new version, just turn the sound off. For Yahoo Messenger: Delete name from friends list....if you don't see the option pop up or check the box asking to delete from address book too?....do that manually......there is a tab there for address book right on your Messenger palette.. Go into preferences by clicking on "messenger" top left corner.Once in preferences look for Ignore list....2 options....choose anyone not on my friends list....this will block his pm you.Even though you delete him;your name is on his list and he can pm you.Chosing the above option will stop him from sending any instant messages. The next thing and last thing I post  is totally up to you.When chatting and you encounter him.....look in chatters box right click on his screen name choose ignore.This will only temporarily "ban" him....as you will not see what he is saying.For a more permanent solution;go back to ignore list in preferences....click on add.....fill in his screen name in the box.Look to bottom....click apply....then click ok.You will never see him again.. You can't with free Yahoo! Mail account. It's doesn't support pop3Yahoo! Mail does not offer the ability to import mail to your Yahoo! Mail account.  However, it appears that you wish to set up Outlook so that you can receive your Yahoo! Mail through Outlook 2003.  That is possible as it is a feature of the premium (paid) Yahoo! Mail service - Yahoo! Mail Plus - http://mailplus.yahoo.com.  Once you have signed up for Mail Plus, just go to the help page titled "Microsoft Outlook 2002 (XP) & 2003" in the POP Access and Forwarding section of the Mail help pages located at http://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/pop/pop-28.html.  Here is the information from that help page:. . Q: Microsoft Outlook 2002 (XP) & 2003. . A: Yahoo! Mail users can read their email in Outlook by subscribing to the Yahoo! Mail Plus service. This service allows you to use Outlook or another POP3 client to access and manage your Yahoo! Mail messages. . . If you are a Mail Plus user, then follow the directions outlined below: . To configure your POP settings for Microsoft Outlook 2002 (sometimes referred to as Outlook XP) and 2003, follow these steps: . . From the Tools menu, select "Email Accounts." You may have to click the arrows. . Select the radio button next to "Add a new email account" and click the "Next" button. . Select the radio button next to "POP3" and click the "Next" button. . Enter the following information: . User Information. . Your Name: Enter your name as you would like it to appear in the "From" field of your outgoing messages. . Email Address: Enter your full Yahoo! Mail address (for example, "user@yahoo.com").. Server Information. . Incoming mail server (POP3):. . . pop.mail.yahoo.com . . Outgoing mail server (SMTP):. . . smtp.mail.yahoo.com . . Login Information. User Name: Enter your Yahoo! ID (your email address without the "@yahoo.com"). . Password: Enter your Yahoo! password.. . Do not check the box next to "Log on using Secure Password Authentication (SPA)." . Click the "More Settings" box and select the "Outgoing Server" tab. . Check the box next to "My outgoing server (SMTP) requires authentication." . If you would like to keep a copy of your email messages on the Yahoo! Mail server, select the "Advanced" tab. Check the box next to "Leave a copy of messages on the server." . Click the "OK" button. . Click the "Next" button on the Email Account Wizard, then click "Finished." . Important: The Yahoo! Mail SMTP server requires authentication. To turn this setting on, follow these steps: . . . Click "Tools," then select "Email Accounts." . Select "View or change existing email accounts" and click "Next." . Select your Yahoo! Mail account and click the "Change" button on the right. . Click the "More Settings..." button in the bottom-right corner of the Email Accounts window. . In the Internet Email Settings window, click the "Outgoing Server" tab. Ensure that the box is checked next to "My outgoing server (SMTP) requires authentication." . Click the "Advanced" tab and ensure that you have not selected "This server requires a secure connection (SSL)" under the incoming (POP3) or outgoing (SMTP) port settings. . To control deletion of messages from the Yahoo! Mail Server, follow these steps: . . . From the Tools menu, choose "Email Accounts." . Select the radio button next to "Edit an existing account" and click the "Next" button. . Double-click the Yahoo! account. . Select the "Advanced" tab. . In the Delivery section at the bottom of the window, check "Leave a copy of messages on server" if you want to save your Yahoo! Mail messages on both the Yahoo! Mail server and on your local computer. If you want your messages to be deleted from the Yahoo! Mail server after you have receivehttp://help.yahoo.com/help/us/mail/pop/pop-28.htmlgoto www.microsoft.com or click HELP when you are in Outlook to look up the answer.I don't know exactly what setting you would use but just forward it or send it to yourself by pasting and dragging into an email separately if you have to. Your Yahoo! Mail address is not always your Yahoo! ID.  To check what your Yahoo! Mail address is, sign in to your Yahoo! Mail account and click the "Options" link.  There, you will see "Mail Addresses", which will indicate your email address.. . As for IDs, these are called profiles.  If you want to check your existing profiles, sign in at:. . http://profiles.yahoo.com. . And click the "View my profiles" link.Login to you yahoo mail and select the Options link on Right top corner then select Mail Options. In that menu you will see "Signature", click on that and add your own sign.

The green border is to show that the user is a top ten answer in that particular category. Here's the Yahoo! Products one for example:. . http://answers.yahoo.com/dir/;_ylt=AqFRHAHlBEX0rAYpR6EMLOwezKIX?link=list&sid=396546089. http://answers.yahoo.com/dir/stars?sid=396546089because they are one of the top ten answerers in that category.  At the top of every category you can check out who  the top answerers are.they are green with envy. . they are in the top tenchose me for best answer, thank uit means that guys with a green border are spending the whole day in hereIt denotes that you are special - a 'top ten' scorer http://answers.yahoo.com/dir/stars?sid=396546089. . Yahoo's idea of having the last laugh. Instead of giving them the green (aka money), yahoo highlighted them green to represent their value.  Way to go yahoo!

At the top of your Yahoo page you will see OPTION, click that. Under Mail Option / Spam / you will see Block Addresses. Just click on it and put in the address you want to block, it's easy.. Good LuckTo block a sender, first obtain their email address.  Next, try the following from within your Yahoo! Mail account:. . 1. Click the "Options" link.. 2. Click the "Block Addresses" link.. 3. Input the email address you wish to block.. 4. Click the "Block" button.. . NOTE: You can also block complete domains, such as aol.com, ebay.com, or yahoo.com, but be aware that doing so means you will not be able to receive any mail from users on those domains.go to options then go to spam  then report spam & enter her emailHow do I block mail from a specific sender?. Blocked addresses are email addresses that you do not want to receive any mail from. All incoming mail from these addresses will be automatically disposed of, without bouncing back to the sender. When you remove an address from your Blocked Addresses list, you will once again be able to receive mail from that address.. . If you receive a message from a sender and want to block that sender, please follow the directions below:. .    1. From your inbox, check the box next to the message.    2. Click the "Spam" button at the top of the page..    3. The message will be marked as spam and the sender's email address will be added to your Block List. . . If this option is not working, please ensure you have enabled this feature in your Spam Protection settings. To check the settings, click on "Mail Options" and then on "Spam Protection." On the Spam Protection page, please make sure "Add the sender's email address to my blocked addresses list" is checked and then click on the "Save Changes" button.. . To manually add an address to the list of blocked addresses:. .    1. Click "Mail Options" on the top-right navigation bar of your Yahoo! Mail page..    2. Click the "Block Addresses" link located in the first column on the left..    3. Enter the new address in the "Enter email address to block" field, and click "Block Address.".    4. The address will then appear on your list of blocked addresses . . In your free Yahoo! Mail account, you may block up to 100 email addresses. Need to block more than 100 addresses? Double that amount to 200 with Yahoo! Mail Plus.. . To remove ("unblock") an address:. .    1. From the Blocked Addresses list, check the box to the left of the address you wish to remove..    2. Click the "Delete Checked" button at the bottom of the Blocked Addresses list.Ignore her or Spam her

If you wish to delete YOUR mobile number off of Messenger, just go to the 'Messenger' drop down, select 'My Contact Details', and edit the number(s) from there.  When done, click on 'Save and Close.'. . If you wish to delete a mobile number of a friend/contact of yours, right click on their name, selct 'Contact Details', make the necessary edits, then click 'Save and Close.'Mobile ? messenger ? It will solve ur problemhere is the easy way: tools, internet options, content, autocomplete, clear formsThat's a good question.  Many people have answered it quite well.  Here's a listing that will give you directions for different operating systems, browsers, and for the different areas where history is stored,. http://answers.yahoo.com/search/search_result;_ylt=AoEItcCoEi8dDbk.hqbd4eHsy6IX?p=clear+web+searchClick TOOLS/ INTERNET OPTIONS.  Under CONTENT tab, down to PERSONAL INFORMATION: click AUTO COMPLETE.. . Choose in the next box the options you want to clear.  Click OK.. . That should do it.DELETING SEARCH HISTORY. . Interenet Explorer --. . EASY and Quick -- You should do this often. .   - TOOLS / INTERNET OPTIONS. .   - On the GENERAL Tab, click the 'Clear History' Button in the 'History' section. .   - Hint 1:  While you're there, you might want to look at the second section entitled 'Temporary . . Internet Files'.  I routinely click on 'Delete Cookies' ... more on Cookies later.. .   - Hint 2:  You might want to click the 'Delete Files' button too -- Ensure that you delete all . . Off-Line Content.  Note that the more stored web-pages you have the longer this will take.  If it . . takes a few minutes to do, you should have done this a long time ago.. .   - Hint 3:  Do this every month or so, depending on how much surfing you do or if you find yourself . . on a page of dubious content. .   - Hint 4:  Click the settings button and set "Check for newer versions of stored pages:" to "Every . . visit to the page".  Not doing this will essentially read the page from your hard drive instead of . . the website and you will not see the latest changes.. .   - Hint 5:  The amount of disk space to use for stored pages should be relatively small -- figure . . less than 10% of your total drive space (i.e. 10% of a 40GB drive is about 4GB or 4,096MB).  Just a . . rule of thumb, but that's still a LOT of web pages.  I spend lots of time on the internet surfing . . all over the place -- Mine is set at 300MB and I have almost a terabyte of disk space.. .  - On the CONTENT Tab, click the AUTO COMPLETE button.  Click the "Clear Forms" button.  This will . . delete the stuff that you've previously typed into various web-pages.. . GOOGLE AND OTHERS . . This is a great source:. . http://www.searchenginewatch.com/sereport/article.php/2165181. . . COOKIES and OFF-LINE CONTENT. . Cookies are small files left on your computer by web-pages to record little things.  They are not . . all bad.  When you key in your zip code on Yahoo Weather on the home page and say "Save this" -- it . . does -- in a little Cookie File.  This way, the next time you visit the site, it 'remembers' your . . zip code.  Fantastic !. . Banking sites remember your passwords, your account numbers ... Great ?  Would you like a copy of . . your bank account number posted on the internet ?  It can be arranged !. . The point is not to be too afraid, but to be responsible.  It's far easier to retype your zip code . . later than to have all of this junk building up on your computer.. . ONCE A MONTH OR SO INTERNET HISTORY TO DO LIST --. . 1. Delete your history, delete your cookies.  Delete your off-line content.. 2. Empty your Recycle Bin. 3. Run Disk Defragmenter ( Start / Programs / Accesories / System Tools / Disk Defragmenter). . This will take a while.  You should close EVERYTHING down and leave the computer alone for the 5-30 . . minutes this takes.  It's a good thing to do before you go to bed or before you leave for work.. . You should perform the above steps approximately monthly or more frequently.. . VIRUS STUFF AND SEARCH HISTORIES / COOKIES. . Never, ever update your anti-virus definitions before you clear out your computer as per above.. . It's also a very good thing NOT to rely too much on automatic updates ... Sometimes, again, about . . once a month or so, you'll want to MANUALLY update your virus defintions.  If something isn't right, . . you'll have at least an opportunity to see that it isn't.  Too many times, people believe that their . . defintions are being kept current, when it's simply been bombing/crashing in the middle of the night . . and exiting without doing anything.  This is so simple that I still can't believe people don't know . . this:  As a former hacker, what do you honestly think the very first thing I'm would do to your . . computer was ?  Duh, Disable your auto-updating !!!. . SPYWARE / ADWCrxpCleaner = http://www.ccleaner.com. http://www.robertenfemke.nl/~diskclean. . Turn off AutoComplete= Go to Tools/Internet Options/Content tab/Within the Personal Information area, select 'AutoComplete'/Click on 'Clear Forms'. . Also uncheck the 'Forms' box in the same window.. To do this go to Tools --> Internet options -->Delete History.. . If you are talking about the offline content that pops up in all the boxes as soon as you start typing something.  To do this go to Tools--> Internet Options --> Content Tab --> Click on Auto Complete. From here you can clear all the stored values and also set the options for future.. . Hope this is helpful.

A Yahoo! widget is a small program that runs outside your Web browser. Many interact with the Internet in different, interesting ways; there are weather widgets, sports widgets, clocks, blog readers, games, toys, and all sorts of other stuff.Widgets is something new yahoo put out it has weather and such on  it. The function of saving "onscreen web pages" is actually delegated to your browser and operating system.  For this reason, it has nothing to do with your Yahoo! Mail account.. . If you continue to have problems saving web pages as HTML files on your computer, you may want to seek out assistance with your browser vendor.  Yahoo! cannot help you with this area.I do not understand want you are trying to say here. but what i know is that all your message are saved in your mailbox, like received massage are saved in the INBOX folder (unless you choose otherwise) and sent mails in the SENT folder (unless you choose otherwise)you can save it in your folderI have Save Sent Items folder turned on in my Yahoo mail.  Any email that I send, a copy is saved there for me.  Incoming, I have folders created to save messages into, Online bills, Important Email, Log In Stuff, etc.

I agree with you >When this site first started, you didn't have to wait at all to choose a best answer. It was very annoying for many users because they'd be typing up an answer and then submit it only to find the question had already been resolved while they were typing.. . However, 24 hours does seem like more than enough time, especially since most answers come within the first couple of hours and a lot of askers don't bother coming back again after 24 hours to choose the best answer.. . Two hours still seems a little short for the time to keep a question open, but I can see twelve hours and possibly eight.. . The best place to suggest ideas like this, though, is in the Yahoo! Answers forum. There's a link in the upper right of this page. Other users can add their ideas there, and the team looks over everything for new ideas to implement. unless you're an expert hacker and you could delete it from the receivers computer there is no way to stop an email from being delivered once it has been sent. . . However if you mean pull up and look at the message you sent then all you have to do is go to the sent message folder of whatever email software you are using.If you want to recall an e.mail go to Sent and you will have the mail that u have sent. And if u dont get the mail then go to the settings and set it as the copy of mail sent. So, in this way u will get the copy of every mail sent.Yahoo! Mail doesn't have support for this. It's not required that email vendors support message recall, either. So even if Yahoo! did implement it, there's no guarantee that you would be able to recall a message if it was sent to a system that didn't support message recall.click on sent messages.You just click "sent"You don't.
